🦃 Neck Broth

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://pin.it/je4hgchompb4i6
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

5 pounds turkey necks

1 lemon juiced

4 Quarts Filtered water

Directions

1. Rinse parts under faucet and place in a large pot. Fill with water, enough to cover parts. The picture below has 5 quarts of water and uses about 8-10 lbs of parts. Add in 1 tbsp orange juice per quart of water. Cover and turn to medium heat.

2. When water is boiling, remove cover. Water should be boiling somewhat clearly in the

center of the pot.

3. Let simmer for a 2-4 hours until water boils down and water opacity is no longer

boiling clear.

4. Remove parts.

5. Strain remaining liquid and put in a container in the fridge overnight. A layer of fat will

develop.

6. Scrape off fat and discard.

7. Broth is now ready to use. It should be very gelatinous and have the consistency of

jello.

Photos

"Boiling Crab" Style Sous Vide Cajun Shrimp — Hijabs & Aprons

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.hijabsandaprons.com/food/sous-vide-cajun-shrimp
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Cajun Shrimp Seasoning

2 lemons, juiced

1 head of garlic, minced

1 stick of butter

1/4 cup of canola oil

2 lbs of tiger shrimp

Lemon wedges (optional)

Directions

1. Fill a big pot with warm/hot water (about 2-3 inches deep) and set up your sous vide to preheat the water to 135°F.

2. Heat up butter in a skillet. Once melted, add the oil.

3. Add the garlic! Once the garlic has bloomed, add the spices one at a time, mixing in between until incorporated. Once the spices have married together, turn off the stove and let the mixture cool down a bit.

4. Place the shrimp in a gallon size freezer ziploc bag followed with the fragrant sauce. Zip the bag closed almost all the way; leave about an inch or two open and squeeze the air out. Keep this 1-2 inches open! Letting the steam escape while the bag is submerged will naturally help create a vacuum at the bottom of the bag (where the food is).

5. Once your sous vide has pre-heated the water to the correct temperature (it should have by now unless your water was ice cold), gently lower the ziploc bag into the water. If necessary, use a giant spoon to gently press the shrimp so that they sit toward the bottom of the pot and that all of them are submerged. Then clamp the sealed middle or corner of the bag to the edge of the pot.

6. Set your sous vide to cook for 25-30 minutes.

7. This step is optional. When your shrimp is nearly done cooking, preheat your lightly greased cast iron pan so that you can serve your shrimp in it once they’re done.

8. Once the sous vide is done cooking your shrimp, take the shrimp out and open up the bag to inspect the shrimp and ensure you see no gray. Carefully pour the shrimp into the preheated cast iron pan, and serve!

Photos

"SPIKE" HERBAL SALT

Courses:
Categories: 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.food.com/recipe/homemade-quot-spike-quot-herbal-salt-509072
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1⁄3 cup sea salt

1⁄4 cup nutritional yeast flakes

2 tablespoons dried onion flakes

1 tablespoon broken dried lemon

1 tbsp powdered dried mushroom

1 teaspoon celery seed

1 tablespoon garlic granules

2 teaspoons kelp powder

1 teaspoon dried dill weed

1 teaspoon dried savory

1 teaspoon dried tarragon

1 teaspoon dried oregano

1 teaspoon dried basil

1 teaspoon dried marjoram

1 teaspoon dried rosemary

1 teaspoon dried thyme

1 teaspoon curry powder

1 teaspoon mustard powder

Directions

Pulverize in a DRY blender sea salt through celery seed.

Add in the rest of the ingredients and blend well.

Store in a sealed shaker jar. (If it doesn't have a lid, place plastic wrap over the top and secure with a rubber band.).

Photos

10 Minute Crispy Air Fryer Broccoli

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://gimmedelicious.com/air-fryer-broccoli/
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time: 2 mins
Cooking time: 8 mins

Ingredients

3-4 cups broccoli florets

2 tablespoons olive oil

1/4 teaspoon garlic powder

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon pepper

Directions

1. Add broccoli, olive oil, garlic powder, salt & pepper to a large bowl and toss to combine.

2. Transfer to air fryer and set to 375F for 8 minutes. Shake halfway through.

3. Once the timer goes off, remove and serve immediately.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 172
Total Fat: 15g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Sodium: 336mg
Total Carbohydrate: 10g
Dietary Fiber: 4g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 4g

Photos

100% Oat Batter Bread - No Flour

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.restlesschipotle.com/easy-oatmeal-batter-bread-without-flour/
Serving size: 10
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

4 cups old fashioned oats (or quick cooking oats. You may need more.)

1/4 cup flaxseed meal (or flaxseed, ground to a powder)

2 teaspoons sugar

1/2 teaspoon baking soda

1/2 teaspoon baking powder

pinch salt

1 cup milk ((original recipe called for buttermilk but I was out))

2 eggs

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 350F.

2. Spray a loaf pan with non-stick baking release spray - or butter it well.

3. Grind the oatmeal in a blender to a flour.

4. Measure about 3 cups of the oat flour into a bowl

5. Add the flaxseed meal, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.

6. Stir well to blend.

7. Set aside.

8. Whisk the eggs and milk together until smooth.

9. Pour the milk mixture into the oat mixture and beat by hand about 20 strokes.

10. Spoon into the loaf pan, smoothing top.

11. Let rest for 10 to 15 minutes.

12. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

13. Let cool completely before turning out of pan and slicing.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 165
Total Fat: 5g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 2mg
Sodium: 106mg
Total Carbohydrate: 25g
Dietary Fiber: 4g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 6g

Photos

1-Ingredient Flourless Buckwheat Bread {vegan, GF}

Courses: Snack
Categories: 08 🌾
Collections:
Source: https://www.powerhungry.com/2019/07/1-ingredient-buckwheat-bread/
Serving size: 1 loaf (14 slices)
Preparation time: 4 hours 15 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

2 and 1/2 cups (460 g) buckwheat groats, rinsed

water

(optional) fine sea salt

SEE NOTES!

1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

1 teaspoon ground ginger

½ teaspoon ground cloves

Directions

1. Place the rinsed buckwheat in a large glass bowl; fill with water, enough to cover buckwheat by 2 inches (5 cm). Loosely cover with a cloth napkin or towel. Soak in the refrigerator for a least 2 hours or up to 24 hours.

2. Drain buckwheat through a mesh strainer; set strainer over bowl and let continue to drain for a minute longer (the liquid will be gooey). DO NOT RINSE.

3. In a food processor or blender, place the drained buckwheat, 1 and 1/4 cups (310 mL) fresh water, and optional salt (I recommend 1/2 teaspoon). Process until blended but the batter still has some texture (see photo).

4. Pour buckwheat batter back into a large glass bowl and cover with a kitchen cloth. Either

Refrigerate: Store batter in refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours or

5. Ferment: Let the  batter stand in a cool dark place for at least 8 hours and up to 24 hours (it will rise slightly and get a bit bubby. It will also have a somewhat sour smell from the fermentation).

6. Preheat oven to 425F (218C). Spray or grease a 9×5-inch (22.5x 12.5 cm) loaf pan; pour in batter, being careful not to deflate any bubbles.

7. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes until browned (especially at edges) and completely firm/set at the center.

8. Cool completely in pan set on a cooling rack.

Notes

For a 6.5" springform loaf pan, use 1 cup of groats.

Use 1/2 cup water when you blend.

This is a dense, German-style loaf. It is especially good toasted, but I am also a fan of very thin slices topped with all kinds of sweet and savory spreads, vegetables and fruits. You cannot go wrong, it is delicious any way you slice it!

You can add in all kinds of extras, too. The first loaf I tasted, way back when, had chopped nuts and seeds added for extra crunch and nutrition. Herbs and spices are great too, as is the addition of 1 or 2 tablespoons of dark molasses (yum!).

½ teaspoon ground cinnamon

½ teaspoon ground ginger

¼ teaspoon ground cloves

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 slice (1/14 of loaf)
Calories: 107
Total Fat: 1.1g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 83.1mg
Total Carbohydrate: 22.9g
Dietary Fiber: 3.6g
Sugars: 0.7g
Protein: 4.3g

Photos

20-Minute Vegetarian White Bean Chili

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.kitchentreaty.com/20-minute-vegetarian-white-bean-chili/
Serving size: Serves 4-6
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

2 teaspoons olive oil

1/2 medium yellow onion, diced (about 1 cup)

1 teaspoon dried oregano

1/4 teaspoon sea salt + more to taste

1/8 teaspoon freshly ground white pepper + more to taste

3 medium cloves garlic, peeled and minced

2 teaspoons ground cumin

2 cups low-sodium vegetable broth*

1 (15-ounce) can cannellini beans, rinsed

2 (15-ounce) cans great northern beans, rinsed

1 (4-ounce) can diced green chiles

Juice of 1 medium lime

Fresh cilantro

Lime wedges to squeeze over the top

Sliced scallions

Diced onions

Grated cheese (if not vegan)

Diced avocado

Directions

1. Set a medium-to-large pot over low heat. Add the olive oil, onion, oregano, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Cook the onion, stirring occasionally, until soft and translucent, about 8 minutes.

2. Add the garlic and cumin. Cook, stirring frequently, for another minute.

3. Add the broth, beans, chiles, cloves, and cayenne. Stir to combine. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 3-5 more minutes until thickened a tiny bit.

4. Remove from heat. Run a potato masher or fork through 5-6 times just to smash a few of the beans and help thicken it all up. Squeeze the lime over the top and stir. Taste and add additional salt and pepper if desired.

5. Serve with assorted toppings if desired. I’m partial to this vegan cashew sour cream – yum!

Photos

3 Ingredient Healthy Oat Bread

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://kirbiecravings.com/3-ingredient-healthy-oat-bread/#recipe
Serving size: 12 slices
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

3 cups (276 grams) oat flour

2 tbsp (14 grams) baking powder (aluminum-free)

12 oz (1 ½ cups) plain whole milk yogurt

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and line an 8 x 4 inch baking loaf pan with parchment paper. If you don't have this size baking pan see notes for other options.

2. In a large mixing bowl add oat flour and baking powder. Whisk until baking powder is evenly incorporated into the flour. If desired, you can also mix in 1/2 tsp salt. This will not affect the bread texture but will add a little more flavor to the bread. If you are trying to make a sweet bread, don't add the salt.

3. Add in the yogurt. When adding in the yogurt, make sure to not drain out any of the liquid from the yogurt that may be at the top. You want to use that liquid in the bread. Use a spatula to slowly add the yogurt into the batter. Keep folding in the yogurt until it is evenly and completely incorporated. Your dough should be very thick and very sticky.

4. Scrape your dough into the prepared baking pan. Use the spatula to help evenly spread the dough across the pan. Dampen your fingers with a tiny bit of water and then lightly press on the surface of the bread to smooth out the dough. If desired, sprinkle about 1 tbsp of rolled oats across surface and gently press the oats slightly into the surface of the bread so that they stick when baking.

5. Bake bread for about 40-45 minutes. The bread should be lightly browned on top and when you press on the surface it should bounce back and not sink in. Let bread cool before cutting and serving. Bread can be toasted or eaten as is with your favorite spread.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 slice
Calories: 101
Total Fat: 2g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 4mg
Sodium: 173mg
Total Carbohydrate: 16g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 4g

Photos

3 Ingredient Instant Pot Strawberry Jam

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 10 🍒
Collections:
Source: https://thebellyrulesthemind.net/3-ingredient-instant-pot-strawberry-jam/
Serving size:
Preparation time: 1 hour
Cooking time: 1 min

Ingredients

4 cups quartered strawberries

1/2 cup date sugar

2 tbsp fresh lemon juice

Directions

1. Thoroughly wash the strawberries. Add the strawberries and sugar to the Instant Pot and stir. Allow them to marinate for an hour atleast, until the strawberries are juicy.

2. Add in fresh lemon juice and mix well.

3. Cover and lock the lip and pressure cook or use the manual button and adjust the timer to 1 minute. When the timer beeps, allow the pressure to naturally release until the float valve drops. This takes approximately 15 minutes. Then unlock the lid.

4. Using a potato masher or blender, blend the jam until the desired consistency.

5. Press the Saute button on the pot and boil for 5 minutes or until the jam reaches the desired gel state.

6. Skim off and discard any foam. Ladle into hot, sterilized glass containers or jars, leaving 1/2" headspace. Seal the containers or jars following the instructions that came with your canning jars)

7. Allow to the jam to cool and then serve. Store remaining mixture in airtight container with a tight fitting lid for upto a couple weeks in the refrigerator.

8. Keep a saucer in the in freezer before starting the jam.

9. Marinate the quartered strawberries and sugar for an hour in a bowl.

10. Tip the mixture in a preserving pan or sauce pan adding lemon juice to it.

11. Cook on low heat until the sugar completely dissolves.

12. Turn up the heat to start bubbling the jam and bring it to boil. The sugar must be completely dissolves before increasing the heat, otherwise it will be difficult for the jam to set.

13. Boil for about 5-10 minutes and turn of the heat.

14. Now spoon a little jam on one of the cold saucers. Leave for 30 seconds, then push with your finger. If the jam wrinkles and doesn't flood to fill the gap, then it is ready.

15. If not, turn back the heat on for a couple more minutes, and repeat the wrinkle test until ready.

Photos

3 Ingredient No Bake Chocolate Chip Cookies

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://kirbiecravings.com/3-ingredient-no-bake-chocolate-chip-cookies/
Serving size: 10 cookies
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/2 cup (128 g) creamy natural peanut butter (or cashew or almond butter) (unsweetened)

2 tbsp (1 oz) maple syrup

1/4 cup (40 g) semisweet chocolate chips

Directions

1. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. In a large mixing bowl add peanut butter and syrup. Use a spatula and mix the syrup into the peanut butter. Stir until the peanut butter becomes as thick as cookie dough and pulls away from the sides of the bowl and forms a dough. You can mix in the chocolate chips at this point, but if you want a prettier presentation, add them later.

3. Scoop 1 tbsp of dough and roll between palms until it forms a smooth round ball. Place onto baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough, spacing dough balls 1 inch apart. Press down on each ball with the palm of your hand to form a thick round disk (about 1/2 inch thick). If you did not add the chocolate chips yet, press several into the surface of each cookie now. You can eat the cookies right away. If your kitchen is a little warm, you can refrigerate the cookies for about 30 minutes so that they are slightly firmer.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 cookie
Calories: 106
Total Fat: 7g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Sodium: 1mg
Total Carbohydrate: 8g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 5g
Protein: 3g

Photos

3 Ingredient Oat & Flax Skillet Bread

Courses:
Categories: 08 🌾, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://powerhungry.com/2019/05/3-ingredient-oat-flax-skillet-bread-vegan-oil-free-gluten-free/
Serving size: 8 large wedges
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

2 cups (180 g) rolled oats

¼ cup (26 g) flaxseed meal

3 cups (750 mL) water

1 tablespoon baking powder

⅛ teaspoon fine sea salt

Directions

1. IN a medium to large bowl, combine the oats, flaxseed meal and water until blended. Let soak for at least 30 minutes or for up to 12 hours.

2. During the last 15 minutes of soaking, preheat the oven to 400F(200C). Place a 9- to 10-inch (22.5 to 25 cm) well-seasoned cast iron skillet in the oven to preheat, too (see notes for pan options).

3. Vigorously stir the oat mixture for 30 to 90 seconds (with a wooden spoon or rubber spatula) until the oats are mostly broken down (but batter is not entirely smooth). Stir in the baking powder and (optional) salt.

4. Spread batter into hot skillet, smoothing the top.

5. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes until golden brown, set at the center, and the top has some fine cracks on top. Transfer skillet to cooling rack and cool at least 10 minutes. Invert bread onto rack and cool completely. Cut into 8 wedges.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 wedge (1/8 of loaf)
Calories: 91
Total Fat: 2.8g
Saturated Fat: 0.1g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 182.9mg
Total Carbohydrate: 15g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 0.5g
Protein: 3.3g

Photos

30 Minute Homemade Fresh Mozzarella Cheese

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source: https://youtu.be/mAxy_oXKJig
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 gallon (3.71) whole milk

Citric Acid Water:

1.5 teaspoons (89) citric acid

1 cup (250ml) water

Rennet Water:

1/2 teaspoon (39) liquid rennet

1/4 cup (60ml) water

1 tablespoon (8g) kosher salt

Directions

IP 8 QT Liner on Induction Burner:

Whisk cold milk vigorously and add Milk and Citric Acid Water

Heat to 90° F, stirring occasionally using medium low setting.

Turn Induction Burner off

Stir in Rennet Water stirring for 25 seconds.

Cover and let sit for 5 minutes.

Cut curd into crosshatch

Heat to 105° F.

Turn off Induction Burner.

Let sit for 5 Minutes.

Remove curd to strainer for 15 seconds.

Place curd in bowl.

Take 4 cups of whey, season with salt and heat to 180° F. Rapidly cool remaining whey to room temperature.

Pour over curds and let curds warm to 135° F.

Stretch, using gloves, form in ball, let rest in room temperature whey.

Photos

30 Minute Mozzarella Recipe (no microwave)

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source: https://cheesemaking.com/products/30-minute-mozzarella-recipe-no-microwave
Serving size: 1 Pound
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 Gallons of Milk (Not UltraPasteurized)

1.5 tsp Citric Acid

CHOOSE ONE:

1/4 Rennet Tablet

1/4 tsp Single Strength Liquid Rennet

1 tsp Cheese Salt (sea salt is fine)

Directions

Choosing the Right Milk

Make sure the milk you use is not ultra pasteurized.

You can use homogenized or non-homogenized milk.

Farm fresh milk is a great option if you can find it locally.

Low fat milk will work, but the cheese will be drier and less flavorful.

Prepare Work Area

Do not prepare any other food while you are making cheese. Put all food products away.

Move all sponges, cloths and dirty towels away from your work surface, wipe your sink and stove with soap and water. Finally use your antibacterial cleaner to wipe down all surfaces.

Prepare Rennet

Crush 1/4 tablet of rennet and dissolve in 1/4 cup of cool non-chlorinated water, or add 1/4 tsp single strength liquid rennet to the water. Set your rennet mixture aside to use later.

Mix Citric Acid & Milk

Add 1 1/2 tsp. of citric acid to 1 cup cool water, pour this into your pot. Now, pour cold milk into your pot quickly, to mix well with the citric acid. This will bring the milk to the proper acidity to stretch well later.

Heat Milk & Water

Heat the milk slowly to 90°F. As you approach 90°F, you may notice your milk beginning to curdle slightly due to acidity and temp. Note: If you're having problems with milk forming a proper curd, you may need to increase this temp to 95°F or even 100°F. Fill a pot with water and begin heating it to 175°F, to be used in step 8.

Add Rennet

At 90°F, remove the pot from the burner and slowly add your rennet (which you prepared in step one) to the milk. Stir in a top to bottom motion for approx. 30 seconds, then stop. Cover the pot and leave undisturbed for 5 minutes. Check the curd after 5 minutes, it should look like custard, with a clear separation between the curds and whey. If the curd is too soft or the whey is milky, let it set longer, up to 30 more minutes.

Cut & Cook Curd

Cut the curds into a 1" checkerboard pattern. Place the pot back on the stove and heat to 105°F while slowly stirring the curds with your ladle (if you will be stretching the curds in a hot water bath, rather than using a microwave, heat to 110°F in this step). Take the pot off the burner and continue stirring slowly for 2-5 minutes. (More time will make a firmer cheese)

Transfer & Drain Curd

With a slotted spoon, scoop curd, from the pot, into a colander. Allow the whey to drain into another bowl. When done transferring the curd to the colander, pour whey back into the pot. Rest the colander with curd in the pot of whey, to keep the curd warm. Add a little salt to taste, about 1/4-1/2 tsp. The salt will work into the cheese in the following steps. You can fold the curd over on itself as it drains to increase the amount of whey running off. The more you work the curd at this point the drier the Mozzarella will be.

Heat & Stretch Curd

Begin by pouring some of the hot water, that has been simmering on the stove, into another bowl, adjust the temperature to about 175F. This will be too hot for your hands so have thick rubber gloves or use a spoon to work curd in the hot water. Cut or break the curd into 1-2 inch pieces and begin placing them into the hot water. Work the curd quickly by pressing them together and folding over in the hot water to facilitate even heating. As the curd begins to meld together pull it from the hot water and begin stretching it. If the curd does not stretch check and adjust your water temperature and re-submerdge the curd. At first it may be lumpy but as the curd stretches, it will become smooth. Stretch it out several times and fold it back on itself. If it begins to cool, you will notice it tear, place it back in the hot water to re-heat. When it forms a consolidated mass, stretches like taffy and develops a sheen it can be formed into a ball for the final cheese.

Enjoy & Chill

The Mozzarella is now finished, you can now enjoy your fresh mozzarella. To chill the mozzarella, you can make a brine with 2-3 tbs. of salt plus 2-3 tbsp of clear whey in a quart of very cold water. This will chill the cheese and help it hold it shape.

Photos

30 Minute Pea Soup

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://thefoodcharlatan.com/30-minute-pea-soup-from-a-bag-of-frozen-peas/
Serving size: 1
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 1/2 TBS dehydrated onion

2 1/4 TSP dehydrated celery

2 1/4 TSP dehydrated carrot

1/8 tsp granulated garlic

1 1/4 cup frozen peas

1 1/4 cups hot water

1/8 teaspoon thyme

1/4 teaspoons sea salt

2 tbsp quark

Directions

Rehydrate vegetables.

Add remaining ingredients (except quark) to saucepan and simmer. Drain and add rehydrated vegetables.

Blend, serve and top with quark.

Photos

5 Easy Homemade Soda Syrups

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.theflavorbender.com/5-easy-homemade-soda-syrups/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 ⅔ cup grapefruit juice (about 3-4 grapefruits)

Peeled zest of the grapefruits

7 oz/ 200g white sugar

½ cup 120 ml water

10 sage leaves with stalks

23 oz/ 650g pineapple peeled and cut (1 pineapple)

7 oz/ 200g white sugar

2 star anise

½ cup water

pinch of salt

18 oz / 500g peaches (seeds removed, cut to chunks)

4 sprigs of thyme

3.5 oz / 100 ml water

3.5 oz/ 100g white sugar

pinch of salt

1 lb strawberries (washed)

⅓ cup rose water

¼ cup water

3.4 oz/ 100g white sugar

pinch of salt

½ cup lime juice

Zest of the lime

2 lemongrass stalks

½ cup of water

8.5 oz / 240g white sugar

¼ tsp salt

Directions

1. Grapefruit and Sage

2. Place all the ingredients in a saucepan.

3. Heat over medium-heat until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture comes to a gentle boil.

4. Lower the heat and simmer for about 20 minutes, till the juice has a simple syrup-like consistency.

5. Pour the syrup through a sieve to remove the pulp, zest, and sage leaves. Squeeze as much of the syrup out as possible using the back of a spoon.

6. Pour this syrup into a sterilized heat proof glass bottle or a mason jar.

7. Pineapple and Star anise

8. Place all the ingredients in a saucepan and heat until the sugar dissolves. Bring it to a boil and then lower the heat to simmer until the pineapple softens.

9. Turn off the heat and let the star anise steep in the pineapple juices for about 30 minutes.

10. Remove the star anise and puree the pineapple.

11. Place the puree on a double layer of cheesecloth to strain the liquid. Gently squeeze to get all the liquid out, then discard the pulp.

12. Pour the pineapple syrup into a sterilized glass bottle or jar.

13. Peaches and Thyme

14. Place all the ingredients in a saucepan. Heat to dissolve the sugar. Cover with a lid and let the peaches “poach” in the liquid and soften for a few minutes. Simmer on low heat, uncovered for about 20-30 minutes till the liquid becomes syrupy.

15. Remove the thyme sprigs and puree the peaches.

16. Place the puree on a double layer of cheesecloth and strain the liquid out.

17. Gently squeeze the pulp to get as much liquid from the puree, and pour the syrup into a sterilized bottle or jar.

18. Strawberry and Rose

19. Place all the ingredients in a saucepan. Heat until the sugar is dissolved and the liquid is boiling.

20. Lower the heat and simmer for 15 minutes.

21. Puree the strawberries and pass the puree through a double cheesecloth. Squeeze gently to get as much liquid out as possible and discard the pulp.

22. Pour the syrup in a sterilized glass bottle or jar.

23. Lime and Lemongrass

24. Bruise the lemongrass stalks (by hitting the stalk along the length of it with the blunt side of a knife). Cut the stalk into 2-3 pieces.

25. Place all the ingredients in a saucepan and heat until the sugar dissolves.

26. Bring the liquid to a boil and lower the heat to simmer until it achieves a syrup-like consistency.

27. Pour the liquid through a fine sieve to remove the pulp, lemongrass and zest.

28. Pour syrup into a sterilized bottle or jar.

29. To Sterilize

30. Preheat oven to 250°F/ 120°C.

31. Place the lids on the syrup filled jars loosely (don’t screw them on tightly).

32. Place the bottles on a baking tray, making sure they don’t touch each other.

33. Place the baking tray in the preheated oven and keep the syrup filled jars in the oven for at least 30 minutes up to one hour.

34. While wearing oven mittens, take out the baking tray and carefully screw on the lids tightly on the bottles/jars, while they are still hot (PLEASE BE VERY CAUTIOUS AS THEY WILL BE VERY HOT).

35. Leave them to cool completely to room temperature and store in the fridge overnight.

36. Use the syrup with Seltzer water/club soda to make homemade sodas or mix them with spirits for cocktails, or use as a cordial to mix with water and ice for a refreshing drink.

Photos

5 Ingredient Peanut Butter Energy Bites

Courses: Snack
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://chefsavvy.com/5-ingredient-peanut-butter-energy-bites/
Serving size: 12 bites
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2/3 cup creamy peanut butter

1/2 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips

1 cup old fashioned oats

1/2 cup ground flax seeds

2 tablespoons agave

Directions

1. Combine all 5 ingredients in a medium bowl. Stir to combine. Place in the refrigerator for 15-30 minutes so they are easier to roll.

2. Roll into 12 bites and store in the fridge for up to a week.

A1 Steak Sauce (Copycat)

Courses:
Categories: 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://dinnerthendessert.com/a1-steak-sauce-copycat/
Serving size: 1 Servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1/2 cup water

1/4 cup golden raisins

1/2 cup aged balsamic substitute

1/4 cup vegan Worcestershire sauce

1/4 cup nightshade free ketchup

1/4 cup dijon mustard substitute

1/4 teaspoon white pepper

2 garlic cloves (cut in half)

2 tablespoons onion (chopped)

1/2 teaspoon celery seed

1/4 teaspoon sea salt

1 Lime (cut into 2 pieces)

Directions

1. Add the ingredients (except for the lime juice) into a small saucepan.

2. Squeeze the limes into the pan, then drop in the rinds.

3. On low heat, stirring occasionally, let it simmer for 15 minutes.

4. Careful to keep the heat low allowing for a very low gentle heat, not a hard boil.

5. To check doneness dip in a spoon and run your finger over the back, the line should stay clean.

6. Turn off the heat and strain out the garlic and lime pieces.

7. Let cool completely before serving.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 g
Calories: 437
Total Fat: 3g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 2549mg
Total Carbohydrate: 95g
Dietary Fiber: 5g
Sugars: 68g
Protein: 7g

Photos

Achari Chicken

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://indianambrosia.com/achari-chicken/
Serving size: Serves 4
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 chicken, bone-in and cut into medium sized pieces

1/4 cup mustard oil or vegetable oil

1 medium onion, chopped

3 tbsp ginger and garlic, minced

5 red tomatoes, pureed or 1 cup tomato puree

1 tsp fennel seeds

1/2 tsp mustard seeds

1/4 tsp nigella seeds

1/4 tsp fenugreek seeds

1 tbsp coriander seeds

3 dried red chillies

1 bay leaf

1 tsp Kashmiri chilli powder

1 tsp turmeric powder

Sea salt, to taste

1 sprig cilantro, for garnishing

Directions

1. Preparation 

2. Smoke the mustard oil if using.

3. Chop the onion finely.

4. Mince the ginger and garlic.

5. Puree the tomatoes.

6. Crush the coriander and fennel seeds coarsely in a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder.

7. Instant Pot Method

8. Turn on your instant pot to saute (normal), add the oil and let it heat up. Add the fenugreek seeds and when they turn dark brown (a few seconds), add the rest of the whole spices. Let them sizzle in the hot oil for 10 seconds.

9. Add the chopped onions and fry until they turn golden brown (5 minutes).

10. Tip in the ginger garlic paste, Kashmiri red chilli and turmeric powders. Saute for about 3 minutes adding splashes of water to prevent the masala from sticking to the pot.

11. Add the tomato puree, salt and chicken and cook until the masala is well roasted and the oil separates (10 minutes). Achari masala is done.

12. Cancel the saute mode and switch on the pressure cooking (manual in some models) mode. Secure the lid, seal the vent and set the timer to 4 minutes.

13. Once the timer beeps, release the pressure after 5 minutes. Chicken achari curry is ready. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with naan and onion rings.

14. Stove-top Method

15. Cook the chicken in a heavy bottomed deep pot like a wok or karahi , not a shallow pan.

16. Follow the steps until step 4, then cover the pot, lower the heat and simmer for half an hour to 45 minutes. If you find the gravy is getting dry, add a few splashes of water to keep it moist. The final dish has a thick, not thin gravy, but you still need a little water to cook the chicken.

17. Do keep the heat low after step 4 and cover the pot to seal in the flavor. The chicken will cook in its own juices and you will get a moist and succulent chicken curry in the end.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 507.4
Total Fat: 28.9g
Saturated Fat: 4.7g
Cholesterol: 192.5mg
Sodium: 1136.9mg
Total Carbohydrate: 12.7g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 4.7g
Protein: 53.4g

Photos

Horseradish

about 10-15 seconds, until thoroughly mixed.

2. Store in refrigerator.

Courses:

Source: https://grassfedsalsa.com/blog/nomato-sauce-aip-marinara/

AIP Nomato Sauce - Part II

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://grassfedsalsa.com/blog/nomato-sauce-aip-marinara/
Serving size: 4 cups
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil

1 bag cooked pureed onion

1 bag cooked pureed celery

1 bag cooked pureed carrots

1 bag cooked pureed beet

1 bag cooked pumpkin puree

1/4 cup red wine

1 1/2 tsp sea salt

1 tsp fennel seed

1/4 tsp granulated garlic

1 tsp ground Bay leaf

1 Tbsp nutritional yeast

1/4 cup fresh basil leaves

10 pitted kalamata olives

Directions

1. Put pureed vegetables, seasonings and wine stirring well...into pressure cooker.

2. Add optional flavor enhancers like lemon juice, basil leaves, olives, and nutritional yeast.

3. Cook on high for 4 minutes and allow natural pressure release

AIP Shrimp Cocktail with Tomato-Less Sauce Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://healingautoimmune.com/aip-shrimp-cocktail-tomato-less-sauce-recipe
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

2 Tablespoons (30 ml) of AIP Tomato-Less Ketchup

2 Tablespoons (30 ml) of coconut cream

salt

7 oz of shrimp (1/2 lb or 225 g), cooked and peeled

1 cup (68 g) of iceberg lettuce, shredded

lemon wedges, to serve

avocado slices, to garnish

curly parsley, to garnish

Directions

1. Combine the coconut cream and AIP Tomato-Less Ketchup. Season with salt. Add in the shrimp and mix well to coat.

2. Place shredded lettuce in a cocktail glass or bowl and add the shrimp on top. Give a generous squeeze of lemon over the shrimp.

3. Top with parsley and garnish with the avocado.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 132
Total Fat: 5g
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 0g
Protein: 20g

Photos

AIP Tomato-Less Ketchup Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://healingautoimmune.com/aip-tomato-less-ketchup-recipe
Serving size: 12 servings (2 tablespoons per serving)
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour

Ingredients

2 teaspoons of olive oil (10 ml)

1 large carrot (50 g), peeled and finely diced

2 beets (164 g), peeled and finely diced

1/2 tablespoon of red wine vinegar (8 ml)

2 teaspoons of honey (10 ml)

Salt

Directions

1. Heat the olive oil in a pan and add the carrots and beets. Cook over medium heat until slightly caramelized and softened.

2. Add 1 cup of water and bring to a boil. Turn heat down to low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour. The vegetables should be completely softened.

3. Remove from the heat and stir in the vinegar and honey. Season with salt to taste.

4. Allow to cool, then blend to a smooth sauce in a food processor. Store in a sealed container in the fridge for no longer than 4 days or freeze.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 16
Total Fat: 1g
Total Carbohydrate: 2g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 0g

Photos

Air Fryer Buffalo Cauliflower Wings Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://simplyvegetarian777.com/air-fryer-buffalo-cauliflower-wings-recipe/
Serving size: 3 people
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 small head / 12 oz /350 grams Cauliflower

1 large Egg

2 tbsp Water

1/2 cup Almond Flour (use more if needed)

1 tsp Garlic powder

1/2 tsp Paprika

1/4 tsp each of Salt & White Pepper (or to taste)

3 tbsp Butter

1/2 cup Frank's Hot Sauce

Directions

1. Preparing the Cauliflower

2. First of all wash the cauliflower in a Kitchen Colander and dry completely. Now core the cauliflower. Remove the hard stem and leaves from the bottom. Further cut it into medium bite size florets. Set them aside in a bowl.

3. Breading Cauliflower for Air-frying

4. Take a Mixing Bowl and beat the egg with 2 tbsp water lightly. In another Mixing Bowl, mix Almond Flour, Garlic Powder, Paprika, salt & pepper.

5. Now dip florets with Kitchen Tongs (one at a time) into egg mixture and then coat in the almond flour mix. Note - be careful while coating in almond flour since almond flour tends to clump fast. If you are using All Purpose flour then roll these in the APF mix. 

6. Now transfer these coated florets on a clean plate. And line the basket of Air fryer with the Air fryer Parchment Paper.

7. When ready to air fry, transfer these coated cauliflower florets in a single layer in the air fryer basket lined with parchment paper. Spray with oil on top. Air fry at 390*F for 12 minutes. Flip in between at about 7-8 minutes for even cooking.

8. Making Buffalo Sauce in a frying-pan

9. Meanwhile the cauliflower florets are cooking, prepare the Buffalo sauce. Combine butter and Frank's Hot Sauce in a Frying Pan over the heat. Cook till butter melts. It’s ready to be dipped.

10. Dipping the air-fried cauliflower bites in Buffalo Sauce & Air frying again

11. Once the cauliflower wings are cooked, toss them in the hot sauce. And place back in the air fryer. Air fry for 2-3 minutes more for the sauce to cook on top of it. It adds to the texture of the wings.

12. Serving Suggestion

13. Serve with ranch and some celery sticks & cherry tomatoes on the side.

14. Tips for Air Fryer Buffalo Cauliflower Wings

15. Make sure not to over-crowd the air fryer basket. If you crowd it, the cauliflower bites will turn out soggy. This is why you want to cook the cauliflower in small batches with space in between for even air-flow. Every air fryer model is different. The time can vary by 1-2 minutes depending upon the model. 

16. Can I make Cauliflower Wings in the Oven?

17. Yes you can. Bake these in the oven at 450*F for 15-20 minutes. Flip in between for even cooking. Dip in Buffalo Sauce and broil for 1-2 minutes. Serve hot with ranch and celery sticks on the side.

18. Can I make it in Instant Pot Air fryer Lid?

19. Yes! You will follow exactly the same instructions as mentioned above in normal air fryer recipe.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 2 people
Calories: 233
Total Fat: 22g
Saturated Fat: 8g
Cholesterol: 92mg
Sodium: 125mg
Total Carbohydrate: 5g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 6g

Photos

Air Fryer Garlic and Parm Green Bean Fries

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 08 🌾, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.adventuresofanurse.com/air-fryer-garlic-and-parm-green-bean-fries/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1 pound fresh green beans

1 cup Rice crumbs

1/2 cup Parmesan cheese

1 tbs garlic powder

2 eggs

1/2 cup brown rice flour

Directions

1. Rinse green beans

2. Coat in brown rice flour

3. Whisk eggs and dip green beans in eggs

4. Mix together parm cheese, rice crumbs and garlic powder

5. after dipping the beans in eggs Dip green beans in coating mix.

6. Place in air fryer on 390° F for 5 minutes or until golden brown.

7. Sprinkle with additional parm cheese

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 6
Calories: 98
Total Fat: 3g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 35mg
Sodium: 156mg
Total Carbohydrate: 14g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 5g

Air Fryer Indian Fry Bread

Courses:
Categories: 08 🌾
Collections:
Source: https://recipegoldmine.com/airfryer/air-fryer-indian-fry-bread.html
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 cups brown rice flour

3 teaspoons baking powder

1 tablespoon ghee

1 teaspoon sea salt

3/4 cup warm water

Directions

1. Measure dry ingredients into a deep mixing bowl. Add shortening and knead

2. with hands until dough is in small pea-size pieces. Add warm, not hot, water

3. and knead with hands until dough is smooth and leaves sides of bowl. Knead at

4. least 5 minutes.

5. Cover with a clean dish towel, and place in a warm place to rise for 30

6. minutes.

7. This is the secret for tender fry bread - kneading and resting.

8. Lightly coat bottom of air fryer basket with olive oil. Set air fryer to

360 degrees F and allow it to preheat for about 3 minutes.

10. Break off a golfball-size ball of dough and roll flat on a lightly floured

11. surface. Brush top of rolled out pieces of dough with olive oil. Place dough

12. pieces (2 or 3 at a time, so they aren't overlapping) into the basket of the

13. air fryer (oiled side down) and brush top of dough with oil. Cook for 3 to 4

14. minutes; then flip and cook about another 3 to 4 minutes (until puffy and golden

15. brown).

16. Repeat with remaining dough.

Photos

Air Fryer Keto Fried Chicken | Paleo, Gluten Free

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.thismomsmenu.com/air-fryer-keto-fried-chicken/
Serving size: 1 people
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

2 Bone-In, Skin-On Chicken Pieces

1 1/2 tablespoons brown rice Flour

1/8-1/4 teaspoon Sea Salt

1/4 teaspoon Garlic Powder

Olive Oil Spray

Directions

1. Sprinkle chicken with seasonings and dust with flour. Spritz with olive oil.

2. Cook at 370 degrees for 30 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F (75 degrees C), flipping the chicken halfway through the cooking time. 

5. Serve immediately

Air Fryer Onion Rings

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://thymeandjoy.com/air-fryer-onion-rings/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 large Yellow Onion

2 eggs

3/4 cup Almond Flour

1/4 cup Ground Flax Seed

1/4 tsp Garlic Powder

1/2 tsp Sea Salt

1/4 tsp Ground White Pepper

Spray Olive Oil

Directions

https://sousvideresources.com/2016/07/24/sous-vide-onion-rings-and-why/

Process your whole onion sous vide @183Fx1 hour, and shock cold in the bag.

1. Spray olive oil spray on the bottom of your air fryer basket and preheat to 400 degrees.

2. Take out 2 bowls. In one crack and scramble both eggs.

3. In the other, add almond flour, flax seed and spices and whisk together until fully combined.

4. Peel your onion and cut into rings that are about 1/2 inch thick and pull apart each ring. Discard the inside smaller rings or use them for something else. These could be made into onion rings if you don't mind the shape.

5. Dip each onion ring into egg coating it evenly and then press into flour mixture making sure it is all evenly coated. Place each ring onto a plate until you have a basket full before putting into air fryer.

6. Repeat above step until all onion rings are dredged and coated.

7. Next, spray your breaded onion rings with a light coat of olive oil or avocado oil spray to ensure they get a nice crispy brown color.

8. Using tongs, place in a single layer into air fryer basket. Do not over crowd the basket.  Onion rings may need to be cooked in several batches.

9. Air fry for 5-7 minutes @ 400° F and flip to cook another 5 minutes. Keep checking on them as they can burn quickly.

10. Once onion rings are cooked, serve immediately.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 3 rings
Calories: 77
Total Fat: 4g
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Air Fryer Pumpkin Seeds

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://pipingpotcurry.com/air-fryer-pumpkin-seeds/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 cup Pumpkin seeds

1 teaspoon Ghee or Butter (you can also use olive oil)

1/4 teaspoon Garlic powder

1/4 teaspoon Salt

1/8 teaspoon Black Pepper

Directions

1. Cleaning the pumpkin seeds

2. Remove all the seeds from the pumpkin. Separate the pulp from the seeds as much as you can.

3. Then put the seeds in a colander and rinse under running water to separate any remaining pieces of pulp.

4. Optionally, you can also boil the seeds for 10 minutes in salted water. It will help remove the pulp.

5. Lay the seeds out on a paper towel or clean kitchen towel to dry for 30 minutes. Press with paper towels to remove any extra water. 

6. Roasting the seeds

7. Before you get started on roasting the pumpkin seeds, make sure that they are completely dry.

8. Transfer the dried pumpkin seeds to a bowl. Add melted ghee/butter along with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well till all the seeds are well coated with the seasonings.

9. Spread the seeds in the fryer basket evenly. Cook at 360F for 10-15 minutes. Shake the basket half way through for even roasting.

10. After they are done, take out and check whether they are crisp to your liking. If not, air fry them for additional 3-5 minutes.

11. Let them cool, adjust the seasoning to your taste and enjoy the snack.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 99
Total Fat: 9g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Cholesterol: 3mg
Sodium: 156mg
Total Carbohydrate: 2g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 5g

Photos

Air Fryer Roasted Peanuts or Walnuts

Courses: Snack
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://katiestestkitchen.com/2018/10/24/air-fryer-peanuts/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Raw peanuts, shelled

Raw Walnuts, shelled

Raw Almonds, shelled

Directions

Lay one cup raw peanuts with skin in a single layer. Do not overcrowd!

Peanuts 375 F - 4 minutes.

Walnuts 375 F - 3 minutes.

For Peanut Butter:

Peanuts 375 F - 3 minutes.

Remove from Air Fryer pour into a colander. Allow peanuts to cool down.

Air Fryer Salmon Patties

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://recipesfromapantry.com/air-fryer-salmon-patties/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 8 mins

Ingredients

14 ounces (400g) fresh or canned salmon

3 tbsp cilantro ((coriander), chopped)

3 green onions ((spring onions), finely mined)

1 egg

sea salt

Directions

1. Preheat air fryer to 360°F/ 180°C.

2. Mince your fresh salmon or open salmon tins, drain and remove bones (you can leave in if you prefer; I actually like the bones). If using fresh salmon, remove bones and mince by hand.

3. Add all ingredients to a bowl and combine.

4. Form 6 patties, making sure they are the same size.

5. Add patties to the air fryer basket and lightly spray with no-calorie cooking spray.

6. Air Fry @ 360°F - 8 mins.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 104
Total Fat: 4g
Cholesterol: 82mg
Sodium: 263mg
Protein: 16g

Photos

Air Fryer-Easy Carrot French Fries

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://forktospoon.com/2018/03/air-fryer-healthy-carrot-french-fries.html
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

4 carrots

1 tablespoon olive oil

1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

sea salt

Directions

1. Set your Airfryer to 350 F. (preheat)

2. Peel and trim all of the vegetables. 

3. Cut into ½-inch sticks. 

4. Then in a bowl, add the carrots and olive oil, make sure that all of the carrots are coated.

5. Set the timer for cook for 5 minutes. After 5 minutes, flip the carrots with tongs, and set for another 5 minutes.

6. Remove from air fryer and plate, sprinkle salt and/or garlic powder on them

Alaskan Cod Fettuccine Alfredo

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections: TVDR Entrees
Source: https://www.fearlessdining.com/alaskan-cod-fettuccine-alfredo/#recipe
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 pound cod filets

1 gluten free pasta

1 1/2 cups oat milk

1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese

4 tablespoons clarified butter

2 tablespoons olive oil

2 cloves garlic

2 tablespoons fresh basil

Salt and pepper

Directions

1. Heat a large pot of water to boil.

2. When the water is boiling, add pasta and cook following the pasta directions.

3. In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat.

4. Add Alaskan cod and basil.

5. Cook 5 minutes on each side.

6. Drain juices and chop cod into large pieces with spatula.

7. In a large saucepan, heat heavy cream, minced garlic and butter.

8. Whisk often once it starts to boil gently.

9. Add parmesan cheese and keep whisking to stir out any lumps.

10. Add cooked pasta and cod to the sauce and toss to coat.

11. Serve warm.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 g
Calories: 404
Total Fat: 36g
Saturated Fat: 20g
Cholesterol: 138mg
Sodium: 196mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 17g

Photos

Alaskan Pollock Southwestern Salad with Avocado Dressing

Courses:
Categories:
Collections: Needs Work
Source: https://www.kimscravings.com/alaskan-pollock-southwestern-salad-avocado-dressing/
Serving size: 4 salads
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

4 Wild Alaskan Pollock Burgers

4-6 cups spring mix greens (coarsely chopped)

1 15 oz. can black beans, rinsed and drained

1 15 oz. can corn, drained (1 1/2 cups frozen corn that has been thawed will work)

2 medium tomatoes (cut into wedges)

1/2 large red onion (very thinly sliced)

Optional garnishes: avocado slices and finely chopped fresh cilantro

½ large peeled avocado

2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil

1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice

¼ teaspoon salt

¼ teaspoon pepper

1 garlic clove (chopped)

3 tablespoons water + more as needed for desired consistency

Directions

1. Cook Wild Alaskan Pollock Burgers in a skillet according to package instructions.

2. While burgers cook, prepare salad ingredients and divide into 4 servings.

3. To make the dressing, combine all ingredients in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth. Add an extra tablespoon or two of water, if needed to achieve desired consistency.

4. Top each prepared salad with sliced burger and dressing.

5. Serve salads immediately or store salad ingredients separate from burgers and dressing in a covered container in the fridge for several days. Enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 salad
Calories: 463
Total Fat: 23.4g
Saturated Fat: 3.5g
Cholesterol: 67.5mg
Sodium: 1.05mg
Total Carbohydrate: 48.1g
Dietary Fiber: 10.6g
Sugars: 9.9g
Protein: 26.8g

Photos

Alfredo Sauce Mix

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄, 12 ☕
Collections:
Source: Kirkconnell, Sarah. Freezer Bag Cooking: Adventure Ready Recipes . Bay Street Publishing. Kindle Edition.
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 cup dry almond milk

2 Tbsp Parmesan cheese

1/3 cup diced dried onion

1 tsp granulated garlic

1/4 tsp sea salt, if desired

Directions

Mix all the ingredients together and store in a tightly sealed bag or container. 

Use in place of commercial “Dry Alfredo Mix” when called for in recipes.  Depending on your taste you may want to add more salt.

This mix adds a nice perk of flavor sprinkling 1 to 2 Tablespoon of it into rice, mashed potatoes, couscous and soup mixes.

Photos

Almond Cheese

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cups blanched slivered almonds, soaked and drained

1/4 cup olive oil

2 cloves garlic, peeled

1 1/2 tsp sea salt

1/2 – 3/4 cup water

1/4 cup lemon juice (~ juice from 1 lemon)

Directions

Instructions

Put soaked almonds, olive oil, garlic, salt, and 1/2 cup of water* in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth and creamy, scraping down as you go. Add more water a little at a time if necessary.

Then add lemon juice and blend to incorporate. Taste and add salt or more lemon juice if desired.

If you know you want a thicker cheese, you can try starting with only 1/4 cup of water and only adding more if your machine needs it.

Photos

Almond Flour Biscuits

Courses:
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.wholesomeyum.com/recipes/paleo-almond-flour-biscuits-low-carb-gluten-free/
Serving size: 6 biscuits
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 cup Blanched almond flour

1/2 teaspoon baking soda

1 1/2 teaspoons Cream of tartar

1/4 teaspoon Sea salt

1 large Egg beaten

2 3/4 tablespoons ghee melted

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (177 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Mix dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Stir in wet ingredients.

3. Scoop tablespoonfuls of the dough onto the lined baking sheet (a cookie scoop is the fastest way). Form into rounded biscuit shapes (flatten slightly with your fingers).

4. Bake for about 15 minutes, until firm and golden. Cool on the baking sheet.

Notes

Original contained:

2/3 tsp baking soda

1 1/3 Cream of tartar

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 164
Total Fat: 15g
Saturated Fat: 4g
Cholesterol: 49mg
Sodium: 116mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 5g

Photos

Almond Milk Eggnog {dairy free}

Courses:
Categories: 04 🥚, 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.injennieskitchen.com/2016/12/almond-milk-eggnog-dairy-free/
Serving size: 4 to 6
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

4 large egg yolks (save the whites for a later use)

½ cup (100 grams) natural cane granulated sugar

½ vanilla bean, split in half

4 cups (1 liter) almond milk (I use this recipe)

Freshly grated nutmeg, to taste (a generous pinch for me)

Directions

1. Get the double boiler going: Fill a 3.5-quart pot one-third of the way up with water. Set it over high heat, cover and bring to a boil.

2. Meanwhile, add the egg yolks and sugar to a 2-quart metal or glass bowl that will fit securely on top of the pot. Whisk vigorously until well combined and the egg mixture drops in thick ribbons when you hold the whisk over the bowl.

3. Remove the lid from the pot, and reduce the boiling water to a gentle simmer (little bubbles popping to the surface). Place the bowl on top of the pot. Whisk vigorously for five minutes, until the mixture is thickened and the sugar is mostly melted.

4. Scrape the seeds from the vanilla bean, and add them to the egg-sugar mixture. Whisk to combine. Slowly whisk in 1 cup of the milk. Whisk vigorously to mix it well. Whisk in the remaining milk. Whisk in the nutmeg. Continue to cook the eggnog, whisking constantly, for 10 more minutes.

5. At this point you can serve the cooked eggnog warm. Alternatively, you can transfer it to a glass bottle. Let it cool for 30 minutes on the counter, then cover, and place the bottle in the fridge until thoroughly chilled, about 4 hours.

Photos

Almond Milk Ice Cream

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://chocolatecoveredkatie.com/2018/08/06/almond-milk-ice-cream-recipe/
Serving size: 4-6 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

2 cups almond milk, or milk of choice

1/2 cup peanut butter or almond butter

1/3 cup date sugar

1/4 tsp + 1/8 tsp sea salt

1 1/2 tsp pure vanilla extract

Directions

1. *If you don’t have an ice cream maker or high-speed blender, see these directions.

2. Whisk together all ingredients. If you have an ice cream maker, simply pour the mixture in and churn according to manufacturer’s instructions for your specific machine. Or if you have a high-speed blender such as a vitamix, pour the whisked ingredients into ice cube trays and freeze, then blend the frozen cubes until smooth, using the machine’s tamper to help it blend evenly. Either eat straight from the machine or freeze an hour for a firmer texture. Due to the lack of preservatives and filler ingredients, homemade ice cream is best the day it’s made – however you can technically freeze for up to a month and thaw before eating.

3. View Nutrition Facts

Photos

Almond Milk Kefir

Courses:
Categories: 10 🍒, 12 ☕
Collections:
Source: https://www.culturesforhealth.com/learn/milk-kefir/almond-milk-kefir/
Serving size: 8
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3.5 cups almond milk

4 teaspoons date sugar

1 package direct-set starter culture

Directions

Combine the milk, sugar, and direct-set culture in a quart jar.

Stir and cover with a permeable lid such as a coffee filter and a canning ring or rubber band.

Allow to culture at room temperature for 24-48 hours.

During the culturing period you may notice that the almond milk separates into a creamier layer and a liquid layer. Simply stir or swirl the two back together if necessary.

The milk kefir is cultured once it is tangy.

Store in the refrigerator for several days or consume immediately.

Photos

Almond milk sour cream (vegan)

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕, 10 🍒
Collections:
Source: https://plantepusherne.dk/almond-milk-sour-cream-vegan/
Serving size: 7,5 dl (3C) of almond milk that turns into 2,5 dl (1C) of almond sour cream
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

150 gr (just under 1 cup) almonds (blanched or not)

8,5 dl (3,5 C) of water for soaked almonds. For unsoaked almonds use 9 dl (3,75 C)

Pinch of sea salt

0,75 dl (1/4 C + 1 tbs) freshly squeezed lemon juice

Directions

1. Cover your almonds with water yesterday and today drain the soaking water into a meassuring jug. Add water so you have 8,5 dl (3,5 C) of water all in all.

2. Now blend the soaked almonds witth just under half of the water for a couple of minutes, add the rest of the water and blend it again shortly.

3. Pour the blended milk into a cloth lined colander placed on top of a bowl or a nut milk bag to strain the milk. You should get 7,5 dl (3 cups) of milk.

4. Place your dry almonds in the blender and add just under half of the water. Blend for several minutes. Let it sit for 30-60 minutes. This should soak the tiny almond grids.

5. Blend again for a couple of minutes and then add the rest of the water. Now blend it up shortly.

6. Pour the blended milk into a cloth lined colander placed on top of a bowl or a nut milk bag to strain the milk. You should get 7,5 dl (3 cups) of milk.

7. If taking milk from a bigger batch, remember to shake before you meassure it it so you don't risk working with just the thin, watery part.

8. Heat the almond milk untill very hot but NOT boiling. If it starts to boil you need to cool it since the heat will destroy the lemoon juice enzymes and make curdling less efficient (see Tips section). It should definetly be too hot to touch.

9. Pour the lemon juice in a bowl and mix in the salt. Pour the hot almond milk in while trying to distribute it evenly.

10. It should start to curdle almost instantly. GENTLY stir it with a spoon to distribute the lemon juice and allow for a more even curdling. EDIT: Now gently put the bowl in the refrigerator until chilled. This is what it will end up looking like:

11. Now we want to separate the whey from the curds that will become our sour cream. This is NOT to be handled roughly like when straining the pulp from the milk: In slow motion pour the curdled almond mass into a cloth lined colander or nut milk bag. (Handling it gently and slowly helps it stay curdled and allows for easier separation of the whey).

12. Hang it up to drip for a while and finally squeeze the remainder of the whey out. I like to let it drip into some sort of measuring equipment and when the whey reaches about the 5 dl (2 cups) mark, you can unwrap the curds.

13. It looks very messy at this stage, but nothing that a god 1-2 minutes with an immersion blender or a very small food processor won't fix. Blend untill completely smooth, adjust the taste with tiny amounts of sugar and salt to your liking - and enjoy!

14. or press it even harder and proceed to making an amazing almond milk cream cheese.

Photos

Almond Milk/Cream

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕, 12 ☕
Collections:
Source: https://detoxinista.com/how-to-make-homemade-almond-milk/
Serving size: 4 Cups
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 cup almonds. soaked in filtered water for 4-6 hours

4 cups filtered water*

* Almond milk is 1:4 and Almond Cream is 1:2

http://www.deliberatefare.com/recipes/almond-cream

Directions

1. Drain the soaked almonds and rinse them well. (Discard the soaking water.) Combine all of the almonds and fresh water in a blender, and blend the almond have broken down and the milk looks creamy.

2. Strain the almond milk through a nut-milk bag or cheese cloth, squeezing well to extract the extra liquid. You can save the remaining almond pulp for another recipe, or discard.

3. Store the almond milk in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days. (You can freeze leftovers, if needed, for up to 3 months, too!)

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 112
Total Fat: 9.8g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 12mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4.2g
Dietary Fiber: 4g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 4.2g

Photos

Almond Pulp Hummus

Courses: Snack
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://detoxinista.com/almond-pulp-hummus/
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/2 cup raw tahini

1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice

1 tablespoon ground cumin

2 cloves garlic (, minced)

1/2 teaspoon sea salt

1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil

1 scant cup wet almond pulp ((leftover from making 1 batch of almond milk; see below))

1/4 cup water

Directions

1. Combine the tahini, lemon juice, cumin, garlic, salt, and olive oil in a high speed blender and blend until smooth.

2. Add the almond pulp and water, then blend again until very smooth. For best flavor, place the hummus in the refrigerator for 2 hours before serving.

3. Store in a sealed container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 193
Total Fat: 18g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Sodium: 152mg
Total Carbohydrate: 5g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Protein: 4g

Photos

Amaranth Flour Tortillas

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.schaer.com/en-us/a/amaranth-flour
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

• 1 14 cups amaranth flour

• 1 teaspoon seasoning blend (your choice)

• 12 cup warm water

Directions

1. Whisk together the amaranth flour with your choice of seasoning in a bowl.

2. Stir in the water - add more, if needed, to create a

soft, moldable dough.

3. Form the dough into a ball then pinch off 6 golf ball sized pieces.

4. Roll the dough balls in additional amaranth flour to coat them then knead and pat into a circle about 1/8 inch thick and up to 6 inches across.

5. Repeat with the remaining dough balls until you have 6 tortillas.

6. Heat a nonstick skillet or electric griddle and cook the tortillas for a few minutes on each side until lightly brown and dry.

? Chat 7. Cool the tortillas on wire racks before using.

Photos

Amaranth Spice Cookies

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.schaer.com/en-us/a/amaranth-flour
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

• 1/3 cup olive oil

• 1 large egg

• 1/3 cup brown sugar

• 2/3 cup amaranth flour

• 1 teaspoon fresh lemon zest

• 1 teaspoon ground ginger

• 12 teaspoon ground nutmeg

• 12 teaspoon baking soda

• Pinch of salt

Pinch ground cloves

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment.

2. Whisk together the olive oil and egg in a medium bowl.

3. Add the brown sugar and whisk well then stir in the spices.

4. While whisking, add the amaranth flour a little at a time along with the baking soda and salt.

5. Drop the cookie dough onto the parchment-lined baking sheet using a tablespoon.

6. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until just browned on the edges.

7. Cool the cookies for 5 minutes then transfer to a

wire rack to cool completely.

Apple Cinnamon Breakfast Bars

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 07 🧈, 08 🌾, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.theleangreenbean.com/apple-cinnamon-breakfast-bars/
Serving size: makes 8-12 squares
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 22 mins

Ingredients

4 T ghee, melted

1/2 cup peanut butter or almond butter

1 tsp vanilla extract

3/4 cup almond milk

1/2 cup brown sugar

1 egg

2 tsp cinnamon

1.5 cups oats

1 cup brown rice flour

1 tsp baking soda

1.5 cup chopped apples

Directions

1. In a bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients and mix well.

2. Add remaining ingredients and stir until just combined.

3. Spoon into a greased 9x9 pan and bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes.

Photos

Apple Fries with Caramel Cream Dip

Courses: Snack
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.favfamilyrecipes.com/apple-fries-with-caramel-cream-dip/
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 20 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

4 to 5 tart apples (we used Pink Ladies)

1 cup buttermilk

1 cup sugar

1 cup Wondra flour

ghee or clarified butter

1/2 cup sugar

1/8 cup cinnamon

8 oz cream cheese

8 oz Cool Whip (or 1 cup whipping cream with 1/2 cup sugar- whipped until stiff)

1 cup caramel sauce (store bought or homemade (see above))

Directions

1. In a fry pan, or deep fryer heat vegetable oil for frying.

2. Mix together the buttermilk and sugar in a medium size bowl. Peel and slice apples and add them to the buttermilk mixture as you go to prevent browning.

3. In a shallow dish, put a layer of wonder flour. Pull the apples out of the buttermilk mix, one at a time and lightly coat all sides in the flour.

4. When oil is nice and hot, gently place coated apples into the oil so they are not touching, when the bottom side begins to turn golden, flip over and brown the second side. Quickly remove to a tray lined with paper towels to soak up excess grease and cool. Sprinkle immediately with cinnamon and sugar while they are hot.

5. For the dip:

6. Mix together the the cream cheese and cool whip until completely blended then stir in the caramel sauce. Place into a bowl for dipping and drizzle a little extra caramel sauce over the top.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 444
Total Fat: 12g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 37mg
Sodium: 220mg
Total Carbohydrate: 86g
Dietary Fiber: 6g
Sugars: 46g
Protein: 5g

Photos

Apple Pie Filling

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 10 🍒, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://cookingwithkarli.com/apple-pie-filling/#wprm-recipe-container-2918
Serving size: 4 cups approx.
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 1 min

Ingredients

6 apples (peeled and diced into 1 inch cubes)

1 tbsp lemon juice

1 cup Date sugar

1 tsp cinnamon

1/4 tsp sea salt

1 3/4 cup water

1/4 cup arrowroot

Directions

1. Toss the peeled and diced apples together with the lemon juice. Set aside.

2. Combine the brown sugar, sugar, cinnamon, salt and water either in a pot or the liner of your Instant Pot. 

3. Stir in the apples.

4. For the Instant Pot: Cook on manual HIGH for 1 minute, NPR for 4 minutes and then manually release the remaining pressure. Then turn the pot onto sauté.

5. For the stovetop: Simmer the mixture for 10-15 minutes or until fork tender.

6. Remove about 1/2 cup of liquid from the pot and whisk in 1/4 cup of cornstarch. 

7. Pour the cornstarch slurry into the pot with the apples and stir until the sauce has thickened.

8. Use right away, refrigerate for 5 days or freeze until needed!

Photos

Apple Pie Homemade Larabars

Courses: Snack
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://leitesculinaria.com/88638/recipes-homemade-larabars.html
Serving size: Makes 6 bars
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Mild olive oil, vegetable, or coconut oil, for the pan

1 cup dried apples

1/4 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates

1 cup warm water

1 cup raw pecans or walnuts

1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon

1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Directions

1. Rip off a large piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap, press it into a 9-by-5-inch loaf pan, and, if using plastic wrap, slick it with a little oil.

2. Combine the cherries, dates, and warm water in a small bowl. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes, until the fruit is soft. The exact timing will vary according to the dryness of the fruit. Drain the fruit and pat it dry with paper towels. (If the dried fruit you’re using is already super soft and moist, you can skip the soaking step.)

3. Meanwhile, place the almonds in a food processor and process until finely chopped but not paste-like.

4. Add the drained fruit, cinnamon, and salt (if using), to the food processor and pulse until the fruit is finely chopped and the larabar mixture begins to stick together and clump against the sides of the bowl and your processor starts hopping on the counter just a little. This could take up to 2 minutes.

5. Transfer the larabar mixture to the prepared loaf pan. (Alternatively, you can form the mixture into any size or shape you can imagine. Go a little crazy.) Place  a large piece of parchment paper or wrap slicked with oil atop the bar mixture and use it to spread and flatten the mixture evenly in the pan. (If you have a second loaf pan, you can nestle it inside the first and press the pan down to evenly flatten the mixture.) Leave the paper or wrap in place. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

6. Using the paper or wrap hanging over the edge of the pan, lift the bar mixture from the pan and transfer it to a cutting board. Discard the paper or wrap and cut the rectangle into 6 bars. Tightly wrap each bar in wrap. The bars will keep at room temperature for up to 3 days, in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks, or in the freezer for up to 3 months (let the frozen bar thaw for 1 hour before attempting to bite into it).

Notes

Cashew Cookie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw cashews, 3 tablespoons bittersweet or semisweet chocolate chips (optional), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Peanut Cookie Dough Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup

raw peanuts, 3 tablespoons bittersweet or semisweet chocolate chips (optional), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional). [Editor’s Note: The use of peanuts makes this version not acceptable on the whole30 plan.]

Pecan Pie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1/4 cup raw almonds, 3/4 cup raw pecans, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Gingerbread Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1/2 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup raw pecans, 3/4 teaspoon ground ginger, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves.

PB & J Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1/2 cup packed dried cherries, 3/4 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw or roasted peanuts, 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional). [Editor’s Note: The use of peanuts makes this version not acceptable on the whole30 plan.]

Cappuccino Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water,

1/2 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup raw cashews, 1 tablespoon roasted coffee beans, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Tropical Escape Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup dried, unsweetened pineapple, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw cashews, 1/4 cup dried, unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, and 1 tablespoon finely grated tangerine or orange zest (preferably organic).

Oatmeal Raisin Cookie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup raisins, 1 cup warm water, 3/4 cup raw cashews, 3/4 cup old-fashioned or quick-cooking rolled oats, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Blueberry Cobbler Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup packed dried blueberries, 1/4 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 3/4 cup raw walnuts or raw pecans, 1/2 cup old-fashioned rolled oats, 1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Carrot Cake Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1/2 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1/4 cup raisins, 1/4 cup dried, unsweetened pineapple, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw walnuts, 1/4

cup peeled, shredded carrots, 1/4 cup unsweetened flake or shredded coconut, 2 teaspoons coconut oil, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Apricot Ambrosia Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups dried apricots, 1 cup warm water, 2/3 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Key Lime Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw cashews, 1/3 cup unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 2 teaspoons finely grated lime zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Lemon Pie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1/2 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup raw cashews, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 219

Photos

Asian Ginger Dressing Recipe

Courses:
Categories: 07 🧈, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/49923/asian-ginger-dressing/
Serving size: 20
Preparation time: 9 mins
Cooking time: 1 min

Ingredients

3 cloves garlic, minced

2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger root

3/4 cup olive oil

2 teaspoons citric acid

1/2 cup tamari

3 tablespoons agave

1/2 cup water

Directions

1. In a 1 pint glass jar or larger, combine the garlic, ginger, olive oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, and water. Cover the jar with a tight fitting lid, and shake well. Remove lid, and heat jar in the microwave for 1 minute just to dissolve the honey. Let cool, and shake well before serving. Store covered in the refrigerator.

Asian Lemon Cauliflower

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections: Want To Try
Source: https://thebellyrulesthemind.net/instant-pot-vegan-orange-cauliflower/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

Sauce

2 tsp olive oil

2 cloves garlic- minced

1 tsp fresh ginger, minced

3/4 cup lemon juice

1 tsp sesame oil

½ cup brown sugar

¼ cup tamari

1 tbsp arrowroot

2 tbsp water

GARNISH

1 tsp sesame seed

1 scallions- thinly sliced -for garnish

1 cup water

1 cup almond flour

Sea Salt

Half head of cauliflower, cut into 1 1/2 inch ( 3 cm) florets

Directions

1. Wash and cut cauliflower into bite sized pieces.

2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and water.

3. One at a time, dip each cauliflower floret in the batter to coat, let the excess batter drip off.

4. Arrange the battered cauliflower on the prepared baking sheet, or in your air fryer making sure they aren’t touching one another.Air fry -375 degrees F for 15 minutes. Instant pot Airfryer lid - 375 Degrees F for 12 - 15 minutesBake-  Pre heated oven 400 degrees. bake it on middle rack for 20- 25 minutes ORANGE SAUCE  

5. Heat the olive  oil in a medium skillet or pan over medium heat, add garlic , ginger , red chili flakes and give it a stir.

6. Next goes the orange juice, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce. 

7. Cook for 1 minute on high  flame and let it come to a boil 

8. In a small bowl, whisk cornstarch with  water to form a paste.Add it to the orange sauce and whisk together.

9. Continue to cook for 2 -3 minutes, until the mixture begins to thicken.

10. Once the sauce is thickened, add in the sesame oil, and lower the heat .

11. Toss the cooked cauliflower florets in the sauce until well coated.

12. Serve the cauliflower over rice and garnish with the scallions and sesame seeds

13. Enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1
Calories: 389
Total Fat: 5g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 474mg
Total Carbohydrate: 78g
Dietary Fiber: 6g
Sugars: 27g
Protein: 10g

Photos

Asian Orange Cauliflower

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://thebellyrulesthemind.net/instant-pot-vegan-orange-cauliflower/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

2 tsp olive oil

2 cloves garlic- minced

1 tsp fresh ginger, minced

½ tsp red pepper flakes

½ cup orange juice

¼ cup distilled white vinegar

1 tsp sesame oil

½ cup brown sugar

¼ cup soy sauce (or tamari for gluten free)

1 tbsp cornstarch

2 tbsp water

GARNISH

1 tsp sesame seed

1 scallions- thinly sliced -for garnish

1 cup water

1 cup flour - gluten free or almond flour for keto version

salt to taste

Half head of cauliflower, cut into 1 1/2 inch ( 3 cm) florets

Directions

1. Wash and cut cauliflower into bite sized pieces.

2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt and water.

3. One at a time, dip each cauliflower floret in the batter to coat, let the excess batter drip off.

4. Arrange the battered cauliflower on the prepared baking sheet, or in your air fryer making sure they aren’t touching one another.Air fry -375 degrees F for 15 minutes. Instant pot Airfryer lid - 375 Degrees F for 12 - 15 minutesBake-  Pre heated oven 400 degrees. bake it on middle rack for 20- 25 minutes ORANGE SAUCE  

5. Heat the olive  oil in a medium skillet or pan over medium heat, add garlic , ginger , red chili flakes and give it a stir.

6. Next goes the orange juice, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce. 

7. Cook for 1 minute on high  flame and let it come to a boil 

8. In a small bowl, whisk cornstarch with  water to form a paste.Add it to the orange sauce and whisk together.

9. Continue to cook for 2 -3 minutes, until the mixture begins to thicken.

10. Once the sauce is thickened, add in the sesame oil, and lower the heat .

11. Toss the cooked cauliflower florets in the sauce until well coated.

12. Serve the cauliflower over rice and garnish with the scallions and sesame seeds

13. Enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1
Calories: 389
Total Fat: 5g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 474mg
Total Carbohydrate: 78g
Dietary Fiber: 6g
Sugars: 27g
Protein: 10g

Photos

Avocado Tuna Salad

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.platingsandpairings.com/10-minute-avocado-tuna-salad/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

4 pouches StarKist Selects E.V.O.O.® Yellowfin Tuna (2.6 ounces each)

2 medium avocados peeled (pitted & cubed)

1/2 English cucumber (cubed)

1/2 medium red onion (thinly sliced)

1/4 cup cilantro

2 Tablespoons extra virgin olive oil

1 lime (juiced)

1/2 teaspoon kosher salt

Directions

1. In a large bowl, combine tuna, avocado, cucumber, red onion and cilantro.

2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lime juice, salt, cumin, cayenne and black pepper.

3. Drizzle over salad and toss gently to combine. Serve immediately.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 313
Total Fat: 23g
Saturated Fat: 3g
Cholesterol: 31mg
Sodium: 510mg
Total Carbohydrate: 13g
Dietary Fiber: 8g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 19g
