Baked Cod with Garlic and Fennel

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 1
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Fish, Cod, 4 fillet ounce(s)

Lemon juice, 1 fresh tablespoon

Oil, Olive, 2 teaspoon

Garlic, 1 minced clove(s)

Fennel seed, 1/8 crushed teaspoon

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F. Combine the lemon

juice, oil, garlic, and fennel seeds in a small dish.

Add the cod fillet and turn to coat.

2. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until the fish is opaque

in the center and flakes easily when touched with

a fork.

Baked Eggs in Avocado

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://damndelicious.net/2016/10/05/baked-eggs-in-avocado/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

3 avocados, halved and seeded

6 large eggs

Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Lightly oil a baking sheet or coat with nonstick spray.

2. Using a spoon, scoop out about two tablespoons of avocado flesh, or more, as needed, creating a small well in the center of each avocado.

3. Gently crack 1 egg, and slide it into the well, keeping the yolk intact. Repeat with remaining eggs; season with salt and pepper, to taste.

4. Place into oven and bake until the egg whites have set but the yolks are still runny, about 15-18 minutes.

5. Serve immediately, garnished with chives, if desired.

Photos

Baked Horseradish Salmon

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://www.tasteofhome.com/recipes/baked-horseradish-salmon/
Serving size: 1 servings.
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 sockeye salmon fillet

3/4 teaspoon ghee, melted

3/4 teaspoon horseradish

1/2 teaspoon lemon juice

1/8 teaspoon garlic powder

Directions

1. Place frozen salmon skin side down in baking dish coated with EVOO. In a small bowl, combine the butter, horseradish, lemon juice, and garlic powder; spread over salmon.

2. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Nutrition

Amount per serving

Total Fat: 15g
Cholesterol: 75mg
Sodium: 108mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Protein: 23g

Baked Spaghetti

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.the-girl-who-ate-everything.com/baked-spaghetti/
Serving size: 10 servings
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 lb spaghetti

1 pound ground turkey

1 medium onion, chopped

2 cloves of garlic, minced

32 ounces marinara

1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt

1 teaspoon Italian seasonings

2 eggs

1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese

5 tablespoons butter, melted and slightly cooled

16 ounces ricotta cheese

3 cups shredded mozzarella cheese

Directions

1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain. Stir in spaghetti sauce, seasoned salt, and Italian seasonings.

2. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, Parmesan cheese and butter. Drain spaghetti and cool slightly; add spaghetti to the egg mixture and toss to coat.

3. Place half of the spaghetti mixture in a greased 9x13 baking dish. Top with half of the ricotta cheese, meat sauce and mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers.

4. Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.

Photos

Basic (No Tomato) Ostrich Stew

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.food.com/recipe/basic-no-tomato-beef-stew-51352
Serving size: 8
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 tablespoons brown rice flour

1 1⁄2 - 2 lbs. lean stewing ostrich

2 -3 tablespoons ghee

3 1⁄2 cups ostrich broth

1 medium onion, sliced

2 garlic cloves, minced

1⁄2 teaspoon dried basil, crushed

1⁄2 teaspoon dried thyme, crushed

2 1⁄4 cups peeled cubed rutabaga

2 cups carrots, sliced thickly

1 cup sliced celery

2 cups sliced green beans

sea salt

Directions

Place flour in a plastic bag, add a few pieces of beef at a time shaking well to coat.

Heat oil in a Dutch oven or large sauce pan.

Add meat and onions, brown meat well.

Add beef broth (and wine if using), garlic, basil and thyme.

Bring all to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 1 1/4- 1 1/2 hours (or until meat is tender).

Add potatoes, carrots and celery, cover pot, and simmer for about 20-30 minutes (or until potatoes are almost done).

Add green beans (or peas) and simmer 10-15 minutes more.

Add salt and pepper to taste.

Photos

Basic almond milk cream cheese

Courses:
Categories: 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://plantepusherne.dk/almond-milk-cream-cheese/
Serving size: 1,75 dl or 3/4 cup (175 grams))
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 batch (1,75 dl or 3/4 cup) of exta firmly pressed almond milk sour cream or use the soy milk sour cream and adjust for taste.

1/3 tsp sea salt

1/4 tsp onion powder

1/4 tsp dijon mustard

Freshly cracked white pepper

One or two pinches of garlic powder or a little minced garlic but be aware it can be very pungent when fresh

A pinch of sugar

Optional: Nutritional yeast, add 1-2 tsps

Directions

1. Okay, so follow the recipe for my almond milk sour cream and if possible, make the batch used for cream cheese a bit firmer by pressing even more whey from the sour cream.

2. And then stir in your spices. Note that every time you blend the sour cream/cream cheese it becomes a littel looser in consistency (it will firm up again when chilled). So if it's already refrigerated simply stir in the spices with a spoon untill salt and sugar is dissolved. If you JUST made the sour cream you can blend in the spices when smoothing the sour cream with the immersion blender.

3. Let it rest for a couple of hours or preferably overnight for the flavors to blend, almost melting in nicely. I rarely cry over a recipe but to be honest, tasting this after a night in the fridge (the cream cheese, not me) I almost shed a tear.

Photos

Basic Nomato Sauce

Courses: Entree
Categories: 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.food.com/recipe/basic-nomato-sauce-tomato-free-tomato-sauce-359835
Serving size: 1
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 carrots, peeled and diced

1/2 small beet, peeled and diced

1/2 large onion, diced

1 1/2 celery ribs, diced

1/2 bay leaf, whole

3/4 cup water

Directions

Put everything in a covered pot, bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer until veggies are soft.

Take out the bay leaf, blend well till smooth and use as you would tomato sauce, spicing appropriately for the dish you're using it in.

Instant Pot: 3 minutes NPR

Basic Rice Cream (Vegan)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://food52.com/recipes/22349-basic-rice-cream-vegan
Serving size: Makes plenty
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cups whole grain germinated brown rice

5 cups of cold water

Directions

1. Soak rice in 3 cups cold water over night.

2. After the soaking process, rinse off the rice

3. Put rice in a high power blender, adding the remaining 2 cups of fresh cold water

4. Start blending on high speed until super creamy and smooth Blend for about 3 to 5 minutes or longer if needed. You are looking for a thick pudding texture. Make sure you do not over blend or the rice cream will turn into a sticky glue like substance.Add a little more water if needed to loosen up mixture.Store in the refrigerator up to 1 week. Super easy.

Photos

Basic White Sauce (Béchamel)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.thespruceeats.com/basic-white-sauce-4172027
Serving size: 4 servings (1 cup)
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

2 tablespoons clarified butter

2 tablespoons sprouted flour

1/4 teaspoon sea salt

Dash freshly ground white pepper

1 cup non dairy milk

Directions

1. Melt the butter in a small, heavy saucepan over low heat.

2. Whisk the flour into the melted butter.

3. Add the salt and freshly ground white pepper.

4. Cook over low heat, stirring, for at least 2 minutes to minimize "flour" taste.

5. Slowly add 1 cup of milk, stirring constantly.

6. Continue cooking slowly until smooth and thickened.

Notes

Tips:

To make the standard béchamel sauce: Add the milk to the medium white sauce recipe alongside 1 small onion studded with 3 cloves, a bay leaf, and a grating of nutmeg.

Light stock, cream, or a combination may be used in place of the milk (see the variations below).

Add more flavor by seasoning with celery salt, nutmeg, a teaspoon of lemon juice, onion juice, or sherry, or a few tablespoons of chopped chives or parsley.

Variations

Thin White Sauce: Use 1 tablespoon of butter and 1 tablespoon of flour.

Medium White Sauce: Use 3 tablespoons of butter and 3 tablespoons of flour.

Heavy White Sauce: Use 4 tablespoons of butter and 4 tablespoons of flour.

Cheese Sauce for Vegetables: Add 1/2 to 1 cup of shredded cheese to the sauce as soon as you take it off the burner. Stir until the cheese has melted. Use this version in a casserole, drizzle it over vegetables, or toss it with pasta or rice.

Cheddar Sauce for Macaroni and Cheese: Double a recipe for medium white sauce; add 1/2 teaspoon of dry mustard powder along with the salt and pepper. Add 2 cups of shredded sharp cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Cook 2 cups of elbow macaroni following the package directions; drain well and combine with the cheese sauce.

Velouté Sauce: Instead of milk, this sauce is made with stock or broth. Use chicken, beef, fish stock, or use vegetable broth. Depending on the kind of stock or broth you use, this is a good sauce to serve with chicken, beef, fish, and seafood, or vegetables.

Photos

Beans and Smoked Turkey Soup

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: Facebook post
Serving size: 12
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 1 hour 15 mins

Ingredients

1 lb Great Northern beans

1 small yellow onion chopped

2 large carrots peeled and diced

3 cloves garlic minced

2 tbsp olive oil

1 bay leaf

1 lb smoked turkey diced

6 cups water

1 teaspoon chicken bouillon

Directions

Rinse beans and soak overnight. Drain beans. Sauté in the olive oil the onion and carrots until translucent. Add garlic and stir.

Turn the Instant Pot off. Mix the vegetables, seasonings, bouillon and water together. Put the lid on the pot and seal it.

Cook the soup on the beans setting. It will take about 25 minutes to build up the pressure and then it will cook for 30 minutes. The pot will then begin the

Beans for One

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: http://www.cooking-4-one.com/2019/01/26/beans-for-one/
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 6 hours

Ingredients

½ cup dried beans

1½ cups water (or broth or any combination desired)

¼ tsp salt

⅛ tsp black pepper

¼ tsp minced garlic

¼ tsp minced onions

other spices or seasonings desired

Directions

1. Set up the sous vide water bath to 190 degrees F.

2. Rinse and clean the beans to remove any dirt or pebbles.

3. Place the beans, spices, and liquid into a small canning jar.

4. Finger tighten the lid and swirl to combine the ingredients.

5. Place the jar into the water bath and cook for 6 hours.

6. Remove jar using tongs (it will be very hot!) and empty into a bowl to enjoy or strain for use in other recipes, if desired.

Photos

Beetroot Curry Recipe

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://bethyfood.wordpress.com/2015/03/09/beetroot-and-okra-a-tale-of-two-autumn-veggies/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 Beets

1 teaspoon Chilli Powder

1 teaspoon Ground Coriander

1 teaspoon Garam Masala

1 Cinnamon stick broken

1 Sprig of Curry Leaves

2 tablespoons Ghee

1 large Red Onion – finely chopped

2 Fresh Garlic Cloves, Minced

2 tablespoon Ginger – grated

1 teaspoon Date Sugar

3 teaspoons Lemon Juice

1 ¼ cup hemp Milk

Directions

Get a big ceramic/metal bowl

Put into the bowl all the ingredients included in the ‘Beetroot & Spice Mix’ section of ingredients

Stir it up a bit so the spices all cover the beetrooty bits

Put it aside for the minute

Put a medium/large sized saucepan onto your cooktop, pop in your ghee/oil and heat it up to medium

Add onion, fresh chopped chilli, garlic and ginger. Cook until translucent and soft – stirring occasionally so it doesn’t stick to the pan

Add beetroot & spice mix to the saucepan

Then add sugar and vinegar. Stir to combine

Add almond milk. STIR!

Bring to gentle bubbly simmer – then cook, lid OFF, for around 25-30 minutes – you are looking for the gravy to reduce and the beetroot to be soft enough to be able to cut easily, but for it to still have a bit of CRUNCH!

When the sauce has reduced enough – leaving a thickened saucy HEAVEN – give it a taste. Alter the sweet/vinegar balance if needed. Or, if required, add a little more sea salt. If the sauce, for some reason, becomes to dry while cooking – add some more almond milk.

Enjoy with Brown Rice, Okra Curry and Cucumber Raita!

Photos

Beets Sous Vide

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.vacmasterfresh.com/fresh-bites-blog/beets-sous-vide/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

• 2 large beets

• 2 teaspoons sea salt

• 2 tablespoons ghee

Directions

SV 185°F 45-90 MINUTES

1. Fill and preheat the VacMaster SV1 to 185°F/85°C.

2. Thoroughly wash the beets to remove all dirt and grit and trim away the tops.

3. Peel the beets and cube to about a 1/2-inch in size or whichever shape or size is appropriate to your recipe.

4. Using a VacMaster bag filler and appropriate sized VacMaster bag add the salt and butter.

5. Using a VacMaster chamber or suction machine vacuum seal the bag.

6. Gently place the bag in the water bath of the SV1 and cook for 45 minutes to 1 1/2 hours or until the beets are tender but still holding their shape.

7. Remove from the water bath and use as needed.

8. Alternatively, the beets can be immediately chilled in the bag in an ice water bath until cold then refrigerated for later use.

Notes

https://images.app.goo.gl/okT11niEi8urgBGJ7

Photos

Beluga Lentils

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.chefsteps.com/activities/no-fail-beluga-lentils
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

300 g Beluga lentils

600 g Filtered water

7 g Salt

41.27 g Black lentils

1 g sea salt

1/2 water

Directions

Equipment

Digital scale

Pint-sized mason jar (2)

Jar lifter

Preheat Joule to 185 °F / 85 °C

Add the lentils, water, and salt to your mason jars. Each jar gets 150 g lentils, 300 g water, and 3.5 g salt.

For those following along at home, that’s 1:2 parts lentils to water, and approximately 2 percent salt to the weight of the lentils.

Carefully add your jars to the water, and 90 minutes from now you’re going to have some sick lentils.

Notes

Equipment

Digital scale

Pint-sized mason jar (2)

Jar lifter

Best 5 Ingredient Fruit Cake

Courses: Dessert
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://thebellyrulesthemind.net/best-5-ingredient-fruit-cake/
Serving size: 6 inch
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 50 mins

Ingredients

2 cups Gluten Free Flour

1/2 cup Candied Fruit Mix

2 cups Orange Juice

1/2 cup unsalted mixed nuts (optional)

4 tsp baking powder

1 tsp fresh orange zest (optional)

2 cups water

1 tsp oil

Directions

1. Heat Instant Pot to “Saute. Add 2 cups of water and bring it to boil

2. In a mixing bowl combine the flour, baking powder, candied fruits, nuts, orange juice & orange zest. Mix well.

3. Grease the cake pan or springfoam pan with oil.

4. Pour the batter and evenly spread it.

5. Decorate using the cherries from the candied fruit mix and nuts.

6. Cover the cake pan with an aluminum foil, making sure you don't allow any moisture to go into the pan. At the same time do not cover it too tightly on the top. Make sure the nuts are not touching the aluminum foil and there is a gap on top.

7. Once the water in the inner pot starts bubbling, place the trivet inside with the handles on top. Place the cake pan.

8. Cake Mode / Manual / Pressure Cook - Normal Temperature for 50 minutes

9. Allow 10 minutes of natural pressure release.

10. Run a tooth pick test until the toothpick comes clean.

11. Open lid, use the trivet handles to remove the cake pan. Carefully open the foil and allow the cake to cool.

Photos

Best Buttermilk Blue Cheese Dressing Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.seriouseats.com/recipes/2017/06/buttermilk-blue-cheese-dressing-recipe.html
Serving size: Makes approximately 1.5 cups
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

2 ounces (60g) mild blue cheese

1/2 cup (120ml) mayonnaise

1/2 cup (120ml) sour cream

1/2 cup (120ml) buttermilk

1 tablespoon (15ml) fresh juice from 1 lemon

Freshly ground black pepper

Kosher salt (if needed)

Directions

1. In a medium bowl, mash blue cheese with a whisk. Whisk in mayonnaise, sour cream, buttermilk, and lemon juice until a smooth, slightly lumpy dressing forms. Season with pepper. (The blue cheese will likely make the dressing salty enough, but taste and add salt if necessary.) Serve.

Photos

Best Ever Airfryer Vegan Lentil Burgers

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.recipethis.com/best-ever-airfryer-vegan-lentil-burgers/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

100 g Black Beluga Lentils

1 Large Carrot (peeled and grated)

1 Large Onion (peeled and diced)

100 g bok choy

300 g Gluten Free Oats

1 Tbsp Garlic Puree

1 Tsp Cumin

Handful Fresh Basil (cleaned and chopped)

Sea Salt

Directions

1. Start by placing your gluten free oats and placing them in the blender. Blitz until it resembles flour.

2. Place the lentils in a saucepan. Cover with water until they are well covered. Cook on a medium heat for 45 minutes.

3. At the same time place the vegetables into your Instant Pot and steam them for 5 minutes using the steam function.

4. Drain the lentils and place them in a bowl with the steamed vegetables and the oats.

5. Add the seasoning and form into burgers.

6. Place the burgers in the Airfryer and cook for 30 minutes at 180c.

7. Serve with salad garnish and vegan mayonnaise.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 509
Total Fat: 8g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 229mg
Total Carbohydrate: 90g
Dietary Fiber: 15g
Sugars: 6g
Protein: 21g

Photos

Best Homemade Cocktail Sauce (Seafood Sauce)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.aspicyperspective.com/cocktail-sauce-recipe/
Serving size: 6 ounces
Preparation time: 3 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/2 cup ketchup

1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice

1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce

1-2 tablespoons prepared horseradish

1 clove garlic (minced)

3-4 dashes hot sauce (optional)

Directions

1. Mix the catsup, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic in a small bowl.

2. Add 1 tablespoon of horseradish. Taste and add more if desired. Then stir in a few dashes of hot sauce if you like your cocktail sauce with extra kick.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 27
Total Fat: 1g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 221mg
Total Carbohydrate: 7g
Dietary Fiber: 1g

Better-Than-Takeout Chicken Fried Rice

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 02 🐔, 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://recipes.instantpot.com/recipe/better-than-takeout-chicken-fried-rice/
Serving size: 6 - 8
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cups white rice (rinsed)

2 cups Water

3 tbsp toasted sesame oil

1 small onion (finely diced)

10 oz frozen peas and carrots mixture

6-8 oz diced cooked chicken (rotisserie works great)

1 tbsp ghee

4 eggs (lightly beaten)

2 tbsp tamari

1 tbsp sesame seeds

sea salt

Garnish with sliced green onion and additional sesame seeds (optional)

Directions

1. Add rinsed rice and water to the pot, then secure the lid, making sure the vent is closed.

2. Using the display panel select the MANUAL or PRESSURE COOK function*. Use the +/- keys and program the Instant Pot for 4 minutes.

3. When the time is up, let the pressure naturally release for 10 minutes, then quick-release the remaining pressure.

4. Fluff the rice with a fork, remove to a separate bowl and cover loosely with foil. Rinse the pot liner (just get any stuck rice grains out--you don’t need to wash it out completely).

5. Add toasted sesame oil to the Instant Pot. Using the display panel select CANCEL and then the SAUTE function.

6. When oil gets hot, add onion to the pot and saute 2 minutes.

7. Add peas, carrots, chicken and butter to the pot and cook and stir for another 2 minutes, scraping any brown bits from the bottom of the pot.

8. Push ingredients to the side of the pot and add beaten eggs. Cook, stirring constantly, until the egg begins to set, then fold into the vegetable and chicken mixture until egg is cooked through.

9. Turn the pot off by selecting CANCEL, then fold in the cooked rice, tamari and sesame seeds. Adjust seasonings to taste.

10. Serve warm with sliced green onions and additional sesame seeds for garnish (optional)

Photos

Black Bean Brownies

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://minimalistbaker.com/vegan-gluten-free-black-bean-brownies/
Serving size: 12 (brownies)
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 15-oz. can black beans ((well rinsed and drained // 1 can yields ~ 1 3/4 cups))

2 large eggs

3 Tbsp clarified butter

3/4 cup cocoa powder

1/4 tsp sea salt

1 tsp pure vanilla extract

1/2 heaping cup organic cane sugar

1 1/2 tsp baking powder

Crushed walnuts

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (176 C).

2. Lightly grease a 12-slot standard size muffin pan (not mini // adjust pan size if altering batch size). A standard 9" pan will also work. Make sure you've rinsed and thoroughly drained your black beans at this point.

3. Pulse dry ingredients until fine.

4. Add remaining ingredients (besides walnuts or other toppings) and puree - about 3 minutes - scraping down sides as needed. You want it pretty smooth.

5. If the batter appears too thick, add a Tbsp or two of water and pulse again. It should be slightly less thick than chocolate frosting but nowhere close to runny.

6. Evenly distribute the batter into the muffin tin and smooth the tops with a spoon or your finger.

7. Optional: Sprinkle with crushed walnuts, pecans or chocolate chips.

8. Bake for 20-26 minutes or until the tops are dry and the edges start to pull away from the sides. I found mine took about 25.

9. Remove from oven and let cool for 30 minutes before removing from pan. They will be tender, so remove gently with a fork. The insides are meant to be very fudgy, so don't be concerned if they seem too moist - that's the point. Plus, they're vegan so it doesn't really matter.

10. Store in an airtight container for up to a few days. Refrigerate to keep longer.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 brownies
Calories: 113
Total Fat: 4.7g
Saturated Fat: 3.3g
Sodium: 194mg
Total Carbohydrate: 18g
Dietary Fiber: 4.6g
Sugars: 9g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Black Eyed Peas

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 2 hours 5 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/4 cup black eyed peas

3/4 cup water for quick soak

3/4 cup water for cooking

1/3 cup frozen greens

Pink sea salt

Liquid smoke

Directions

Rinse and pick over dried peas. Place in pan with soaking pan and bring to boil for 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and let sit for an hour to an hour and a half.

Drain, add cooking water and bring to a boil. Reduce to simmer and leave lid tilted to allow steam to escape for an hour.

Towards end of cooking time, add greens and salt.

Photos

Black Eyed Peas

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 09 🥕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://toriavey.com/toris-kitchen/how-to-cook-dried-black-eyed-peas/
Serving size: 10 servings
Preparation time: 1 hour
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 lb dried black-eyed peas

20 cups water divided

sea salt (optional)

Directions

1. The method below uses a ratio of 10 cups of water per pound of dried black-eyed peas, if you plan to use a different amount, please adjust accordingly using this ratio.

2. Quick soaking your black-eyed peas isn't a must, but I recommend it for speeding up the cooking process. Place your dried peas in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat and allow the peas to soak for 1 hour. You may notice that the water level has decreased and the peas have grown in size, indicating that they have absorbed some of the water. This is a good sign!

3. After soaking, drain the peas and give them a good rinse.

4. Place the beans in a large pot and cover again with the same ratio of fresh water. It is important to use fresh water for boiling; the soaking water contains oligosaccharides, released from the beans during soaking, that can lead to digestive discomfort. Add salt to the cooking water if desired to give the beans more flavor (I use about 1 tablespoon salt for every 10 cups of water). Place on the stovetop and bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Simmer for 30 minutes, or until you reach desired tenderness. I recommend stirring the beans a few times throughout the cooking process so that the beans at the bottom of the pot don’t soften before the beans at the top.

5. Drain the peas in a colander. They are now cooked, prepared, and ready to use in recipes or however you'd like.

6. If you plan to freeze the beans, allow them to cool first. You can speed up this process by rinsing them with cold water. Then transfer them to a freezer safe container, I recommend resealable bags, and freeze until needed. I like to measure out 1 ¾ cups of beans in each bag, which is equivalent to the amount in a standard sized can. They will keep in the freezer for up to 6 months.

7. When ready to use your frozen black-eyed peas, remove them from the freezer and thaw. They can be reheated on the stovetop, added to soups and stews or used however you would use canned black-eyed peas.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 152
Sodium: 19mg
Total Carbohydrate: 27g
Dietary Fiber: 4g
Sugars: 3g
Protein: 10g

Photos

Black Eyed Peas and Spinach Stew-InstantPot

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://profusioncurry.com/black-eyed-peas-spinach-stew-gluten-free-vegan/
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

4 cups dry Black Eyed Peas (rinse, and soak in lukewarm water for 3-4 hours)

4 cups spinach or kale leaves

4 medium onion (finely chopped)

4 teaspoons of fenugreek seeds - soak it along or just add while cooking

4 tablespoons olive oil

4 teaspoons coriander powder

4 teaspoons cumin

4-8 bay leaves

2 teaspoons turmeric powder

Himalayan Pink sea salt -adjust per taste

4 tablespoons grated ginger

12-16 garlic cloves minced

4 tablespoons lemon juice

Chopped cilantro (onion and lemon wedges for garnish)

8 cups water (use 12 cups-16 cups if beans are un-soaked)

Directions

1. Instant Pot:

2. Set Instant Pot on medium on Sauté,. When it feels hot, add oil. Lift the main pan and slightly rotate around so oil coats the bottom of the pan evenly. It helps reduce the burn. When the oil is hot, add in the ginger and garlic and sauté for 30 seconds. Add onions and sauté for few minutes till onions are tender.

3. Add all the spices except turmeric , salt and sugar and mix well. Add pre-soaked black eyed peas and water. Mix well.

4. Add spinach and turmeric, mix well again. Cancel sauté function. Close the lid of Instant Pot. Press Bean mode set on High Pressure for 10 minutes. Allow NPR ..natural pressure release.

5. Open the lid. Add lemon juice. Give it a good stir so that all the ingredients are mixed well. Your healthy one pot meal is ready to enjoy !

Photos

Black Garlic From 'Bar Tartine' Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.seriouseats.com/recipes/2014/12/black-garlic-from-bar-tartine.html
Serving size: Left to your discretion
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Whole unpeeled garlic heads

Directions

1. If using a dehydrator, wrap the garlic heads in plastic wrap. This traps humidity and prevents the garlic from drying out. Then wrap the heads in several layers of aluminum foil. Hold at 130°F/55°C until the heads are soft and black, about 3 weeks.

2. If using a rice warmer or slow cooker, set it to the warm setting (not the cook setting), place the whole garlic heads in the unit, and leave on until the cloves are soft and black, about 2 weeks

3. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 6 months. Peel the cloves before using.

Photos

Blackened Tofu Steaks

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.mydarlingvegan.com/tofu-steaks/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

14 oz. extra-firm tofu, (pressed)

1/4 cup soy sauce

2 tbsp. olive oil

2 tbsp. vegan Worcestershire sauce

2 tsp. maple syrup

2 cloves garlic, (minced)

2 tbsp. rosemary, (minced)

1 tsp. freshly ground pepper

1/2 tsp salt

pinch of cayenne

Directions

1. To begin, whisk together the ingredients for the marinade in a shallow baking dish.  Cut the tofu into 3 even slices (about 3/4" thick) and cut each of those slices into half. Add the thickly cut slabs of tofu to the marinade, ensuring the tofu is fully submerged. Marinade the tofu for at least two hours. Reserve the marinade.

2. Once the tofu has marinated, add it to a preheated grill. You can either use an electric grill or outside grill. Grill the tofu for 6-8 minutes per side, until the tofu is slightly charred and cooked all the way through.

3. Brush the tofu with extra marinade and serve with steamed vegetables and potatoes.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 140
Total Fat: 9g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Sodium: 1177mg
Total Carbohydrate: 8g
Dietary Fiber: 4g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Black-Eyed Pea Hummus

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.myrecipes.com/recipe/black-eyed-pea-hummus
Serving size: 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 garlic cloves, peeled

1/2 cup fresh lemon juice (about 2 lemons)

1/3 cup tahini (sesame-seed paste)

1 teaspoon ground cumin

1/2 teaspoon sea salt

2 (15.8-ounce) cans black-eyed peas, drained

Fresh chives (optional)

Directions

1. Drop garlic through chute of food processor with processor on; process 3 seconds or until garlic is minced. Add lemon juice and next 5 ingredients (lemon juice through peas); process until smooth, scraping sides of bowl occasionally. Serve with pita wedges. Garnish with fresh chives, if desired.

Blueberry Cheesecake

Courses: Dessert
Categories:
Collections:
Source: Recipe Keeper
Serving size: Serves 6-8
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour

Ingredients

1 1/4 cups graham cracker crumbs / 8 digestive biscuit crumbs

1/4 cup/50g butter, melted

20 oz./600g cream cheese

2 tablespoons all-purpose flour

3/4 cup/175g caster sugar

2 eggs, plus 1 yolk

small pot soured cream

vanilla extract

1 cup / 300g fresh or frozen blueberries

icing sugar

Directions

1. Melt the butter and pour onto the cracker crumbs and mix well. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch spring form pan. Bake at 325°F until the crust is set, about 10-12 minutes. Allow to cool.

2. In a large bowl beat the cream cheese with the flour, caster sugar, eggs, soured cream and vanilla extract with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.

3. Pour the mixture into the pan and bake for 35-40 minutes until set. Remove from the oven and leave to cool.

4. Heat half the blueberries in a pan with 2 tablespoons icing sugar and stir gently until juicy. Squash the blueberries with a fork then continue to cook for a few minutes. Add the remaining blueberries, remove from the heat and allow to cool.

5. Pour the blueberries over the cheesecake just before serving.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 slice
Calories: 571
Total Fat: 41.5g
Saturated Fat: 24.7g
Cholesterol: 173mg
Sodium: 451mg
Total Carbohydrate: 42g
Dietary Fiber: 1.5g
Sugars: 27.1g
Protein: 10.1g

Photos

Blueberry Cobbler Homemade Larabars

Courses: Snack
Categories: 07 🧈, 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://leitesculinaria.com/88638/recipes-homemade-larabars.html
Serving size: Makes 6 bars
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Mild olive oil, vegetable, or coconut oil, for the pan

1 cup packed dried blueberries

1/4 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates

1 cup warm water

3/4 cup raw walnuts or raw pecans

1/2 cup old-fashioned rolled oats

1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest (preferably organic)

1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Directions

1. Rip off a large piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap, press it into a 9-by-5-inch loaf pan, and, if using plastic wrap, slick it with a little oil.

2. Combine the cherries, dates, and warm water in a small bowl. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes, until the fruit is soft. The exact timing will vary according to the dryness of the fruit. Drain the fruit and pat it dry with paper towels. (If the dried fruit you’re using is already super soft and moist, you can skip the soaking step.)

3. Meanwhile, place the almonds in a food processor and process until finely chopped but not paste-like.

4. Add the drained fruit, cinnamon, and salt (if using), to the food processor and pulse until the fruit is finely chopped and the larabar mixture begins to stick together and clump against the sides of the bowl and your processor starts hopping on the counter just a little. This could take up to 2 minutes.

5. Transfer the larabar mixture to the prepared loaf pan. (Alternatively, you can form the mixture into any size or shape you can imagine. Go a little crazy.) Place  a large piece of parchment paper or wrap slicked with oil atop the bar mixture and use it to spread and flatten the mixture evenly in the pan. (If you have a second loaf pan, you can nestle it inside the first and press the pan down to evenly flatten the mixture.) Leave the paper or wrap in place. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

6. Using the paper or wrap hanging over the edge of the pan, lift the bar mixture from the pan and transfer it to a cutting board. Discard the paper or wrap and cut the rectangle into 6 bars. Tightly wrap each bar in wrap. The bars will keep at room temperature for up to 3 days, in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks, or in the freezer for up to 3 months (let the frozen bar thaw for 1 hour before attempting to bite into it).

Notes

Carrot Cake Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1/2 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1/4 cup raisins, 1/4 cup dried, unsweetened pineapple, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw walnuts, 1/4

cup peeled, shredded carrots, 1/4 cup unsweetened flake or shredded coconut, 2 teaspoons coconut oil, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Apricot Ambrosia Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups dried apricots, 1 cup warm water, 2/3 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Key Lime Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw cashews, 1/3 cup unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 2 teaspoons finely grated lime zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Lemon Pie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1/2 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup raw cashews, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Cinnamon Roll Larabar

200 g Medjool dates (1 cup, tightly packed)

60 g walnuts (3/4 cup)

60 g almonds (3/4 cup)

55 g raisins (1/4 cup tightly packed)

2.5 tsp cinnamon

pinch salt

Cinnamon Roll Larabars

1 cup golden raisins

1/4 cup dates

1/2 cup almonds

1/2 cup walnuts

2 1/2 tsp cinnamon

1/8 tsp sea salt

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 219

Photos

Bone Broth

Courses:
Categories: 02 🐔, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.platingsandpairings.com/the-best-instant-pot-bone-broth/
Serving size: 6 people
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 2 hours

Ingredients

2 1/2 pounds assorted poultry meat bones

2 carrots (chopped medium)

2 celery stalks (chopped medium)

1 onion (halved, skin left on)

2 cloves garlic (skin left on)

Assortment of fresh herbs

1 Tablespoon lemon juice

Generous pinch of whole white peppercorns

1 teaspoon sea salt

8 cups of water (enough water to come to 1-inch below MAX fill line)

Chicken

Turkey

Ostrich

Emu

Directions

1. Place the bones in the Instant Pot, filling it about half full with bones. Add in the vegetables, herbs, apple cider vinegar, peppercorns and salt.

2. Fill the Instant Pot with water to 1-inch below the MAX fill line.

3. Make sure your sealing ring is in place on the lid. Lock the lid onto the Instant Pot and set the steam release knob to the "sealing" position.

4. Press the "manual" button and set your Instant Pot for high pressure for 120 minutes. (I find it easier to decrease the time because the timer resets at 120 after you decrease to zero.) It will take about 15-30 minutes for the Instant Pot to come to full pressure, then the display will show a countdown timer.

5. Once the two hours is up, allow the pressure to release naturally. It will take about 15-30 minutes, then the float valve will drop.

6. Strain the broth through cheesecloth or a strainer and cool. A good broth will usually have a layer of fat on the top, and will gelatinize when thoroughly cool. Remove the fat with a spoon and discard.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 48
Sodium: 413mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 2g

Photos

Directions

1. Cut 2, 3/4" cuts opposite each other into bologna.

2. Tuck slice into muffin cup.

3. Crack egg into cup.

4. Bake at 350° F for 16-18 minutes to set the egg.

Photos

Brine Fermented Pickles

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://simplebites.net/make-old-fashioned-brine-fermented-pickles-like-your-great-grandmother/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Salt for brine

Seasonal garden vegetables

pickling spices

leaves for crispness

Directions

1. Prepare a brine using the ratio of two tablespoons of salt to one quart of water. If it is over 85 degrees in your kitchen, use one extra tablespoon of salt. Stir well and set aside.

2. Chop vegetables into sticks or bite-sized pieces.

3. Gather flavorings – garlic, onions, fresh herbs, or your favorite pickling spices.

4. Add garlic, herbs, and spices to the bottom of your clean quart, half-gallon, or gallon jar.

5. Add one of the following to keep your vegetables crisp: grape, horseradish, oak, black tea (yes the kind you drink), or mesquite leaves. Read more on why at the Cultures for Health blog.

6. Place chopped vegetables atop flavorings, leaving at least 2 inches of headspace from the rim of the jar. Pour the brine over the vegetables so they are covered by at least one inch. Two to four inches is even better, but hard to achieve in quart jars.

7. Weight down your vegetables so they stay below the brine while fermenting. I have used small plates that will fit into the jar opening, inverted plastic jar lids, a large cabbage leaf, root vegetable slices, or glass weights made specifically for this purpose.

8. Cap the jar tightly and allow to sit at 65-85 degrees for around 10 days, or more, depending on your preference. The longer they ferment at room temperature, the sourer they become. Read more on how to tell when they are done HERE.

9. During the earliest stages of fermentation carbon dioxide is released. Check your jars once or twice a day to see if the lids are building up pressure. If you cannot press down on the canning lid as you normally would, very quickly and carefully “burp” your jar by slightly unscrewing the lid, allowing a bit of gas to escape, and screwing it back on quickly.

10. Once completed, move to cold storage – a root cellar, a basement, a cool garage, anywhere below 65 degrees, or yes – a refrigerator.

Photos

Broccoli Sous Vide

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://sousvideguy.com/can-sous-vide-broccoli/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 medium to large broccoli head

3 peeled garlic cloves

¼ cup (60 ml) of virgin olive oil

dried rosemary, to taste (optional)

sea salt, to taste

grated parmesan, to taste

Directions

Preheat your sous vide cooker to 194 °F / 90 °C. Portion out the broccoli, either cutting it lengthwise, or by trimming the florets and dicing the stem separately- the choice is yours. Season the broccoli with salt, pepper, dried rosemary (if you love the aroma of the Mediterranean herb) and virgin olive oil, and place in a plastic vacuum bag. Cook in a water bath for about 20 minutes. Once cooked, the broccoli should be shocked in an ice bath to stop the cooking process. Serve your sous vide broccoli garnished with grated parmesan, which will complement the soft texture of the green veggie and its lovely flavor.

Photos

Brown Butter Mushroom Soup Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://alldayidreamaboutfood.com/brown-butter-mushroom-soup/?fbclid=IwAR20aQ7DkraPiVN6PKrIOVauMsl2S6mYv68dPFwwltCE7qMVPj7Lhl-vhjk
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

6 tbsp butter ((113.5g))

2 tbsp fresh sage (chopped)

1 lb mushrooms (sliced)

4 cups vegetable or chicken broth

Salt and pepper to taste

1/2 cup heavy cream

Directions

1. In a large pot, heat butter over medium heat until it begins to brown and turns fragrant, 3 to 4 minutes. Add sage and cook one minute more.

2. Add mushrooms and stir to coat, then saute until mushrooms are tender and lightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes.

3. Stir in stock and bring to a simmer. Cook 4 to 5 minutes more.

4. Transfer to food processor or blender (in batches, if your processor is not large enough). Blend until smooth.

5. Return to pot and stir in cream. Serve immediately.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 cup
Calories: 198
Total Fat: 17.7g
Total Carbohydrate: 4.6g
Dietary Fiber: 0.6g
Protein: 4.6g

Photos

Brown Mushroom Gravy

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.daringgourmet.com/best-brown-mushroom-gravy-from-scratch/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

2 tablespoons ghee

1 red onion chopped

1 clove garlic (,minced)

16 ounces fresh mushrooms sliced

4 tablespoons unsalted ghee

4 tablespoons brown rice flour

2 cups strong chicken broth

1-2 teaspoons tamari

1/2 teaspoon sea salt plus more to taste

1/4 teaspoon dried thyme

1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper

Directions

1. Melt the ghee in a pan over medium-high heat and fry the onions until beginning to brown.  Add the garlic and cook another minute.

2. Add the mushrooms and cook 5-7 minutes or until golden and the liquid from the mushrooms has evaporated.

3. Add the butter and melt.  Add the flour, stir to combine and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring continually.

4. Add the broth, tamari, thyme, salt and pepper.  Whisk continually until the gravy is thickened.  Cover and simmer on low, stirring occasionally, for 5-10 minutes.  Add salt and pepper to taste.  If you prefer the gravy thinner add a little more water (or heavy cream if using)

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 151
Total Fat: 11g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 30mg
Sodium: 530mg
Total Carbohydrate: 8g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 4g

Photos

Brown Rice Crackers

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.littlehouseliving.com/make-your-own-crackers.html
Serving size: Yield – 4 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 cup Brown Rice Flour

1 Tablespoon clarified butter

1 teaspoon olive oil

1/3 cup water

1/2 teaspoon sea salt

clarified butter and salt for brush on tops of crackers

Directions

1. In a mixing bowl, mix together the flour, melted butter, oil, sugar, and salt. I use a fork to get the wet ingredients incorporated.

2. Start adding in water slowly, you will need around 1/3 cup of water total. Keep adding water and mixing the ingredients with your hands until it forms a nice dough. Don’t add too much water or you will have a soggy mess.

3. Once you’ve form a dough, place it on a greased baking sheet (I used a non-greased stoneware pan), and roll out.

4. Roll with a rolling pin until very thin, at least 1/8 inch or thinner, without tearing it.

5. Using a pizza cutter, score the crackers.

6. With a pastry brush, brush more melted butter over the tops of the crackers and sprinkle with salt.

7. Bake at 400 degrees for about 15 minutes or until crackers are crispy and slightly brown, let them cool before serving.

Photos

Brown Rice Dressing

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://confessionsofafitfoodie.com/instant-pot-brown-rice-sausage-stuffing-21-day-fix/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 cup brown rice

12 ounces organic turkey stock or broth

1 1/3 TBSP dehydrated onion

1 1/3 TBSP dehydrated celery

1 1/3 TBSP dehydrated carrot

1 1/3 TBSP dehydrated mushroom

4 tsp clarified butter

1 1/4 tsp poultry seasoning (SEE NOTES)

1 1/4 tsp sea salt

Directions

Use 2 cup Wide Mouth Mason Jars per serving.

Measure 3 ounces stock per 1/4 cup rice.

Add 1 Tablespoon plus 1 Teaspoon stock for dehydrated vegetables per serving.

Finger tight lids.

Sous Vide 194° F - 1 Hour

Notes

Per Serving:

3/8 Tsp dried thyme

1/4 Tsp dried sage

1/4 Tsp dried marjoram

1/8 Tsp dried rosemary

Photos

Brown Rice Flour Crepes

Courses: Entree
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 08 🌾, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.thismamacooks.com/2017/01/easy-gluten-free-crepes-rice-flour-recipe.html
Serving size: Makes 15 crepes
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

3 eggs, beaten

1 1/2 cups almond milk

1 1/2 tablespoons ghee

1 1/2 cups brown rice flour

3/4 teaspoon sea salt

Directions

1. Beat eggs in a medium-sized bowl. Add milk and melted butter. Stir to combine.

2. Add white rice flour and salt. Stir until thoroughly mixed and blend until smooth.

3. Heat a lightly greased, nonstick skillet over medium heat.

4. Pour 1/3 cup of batter into skillet and swirl to evenly distribute batter into a circle.Cook about 30 seconds per side until crepe begins to brown.

5. Flip and cook on other side for 30 seconds until crepe begins to brown. Remove crepe and keep warm in oven until served.

6. Repeat until batter is used up.

Photos

Directions

Buckwheat and Rice Flour Pancakes

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚, 08 🌾, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1/2 cup buckwheat flour

1/2 cup rice flour

2 teaspoons of baking powder

1 teaspoon cinnamon

1/2 teaspoons ground nutmeg

1/4 teaspoon ground cloves

1/2 teaspoon sea salt

1 tablespoon date sugar or molasses

2 teaspoons vanilla

1 1/2 cups hemp milk

1 egg

Directions

Whisk dry ingredients in a large/medium bowl.

Whisk wet ingredients in a small bowl.

Combine wet to dry and mix until well blended.

Use oil to coat desired pan and cook on medium heat.

When bubbles form in the pancake, flip and finish.

Photos

Buckwheat Mushroom Risotto

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: http://www.eatthriveglow.com/buckwheat-mushroom-risotto/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 35 mins

Ingredients

1 tbsp extra virgin coconut oil

1.5 cups roasted buckwheat groats

½ onion

6 cups mushrooms

2 cloves garlic

5 cups vegetable broth

1 tbsp + juice from half of a lime

¼ tsp salt (or to taste)

1 tbsp nutritional yeast

2 sprigs thyme

truffle oil (optional)

lime zest, parsley, green onion (garnish)

Directions

1. Dice the onions, mushrooms, and garlic and sauté over medium-low heat with 1 tbsp coconut oil.

2. When the onions become translucent and most of the water released from the mushrooms has been evaporated, add the buckwheat groats and toast until a fragrant, nutty aroma is released.

3. Add 1 cup broth, 1 tbsp of lime juice, salt, and thyme and simmer on low heat, stirring constantly, until most of the liquid has been absorbed. Add another cup of broth, stirring constantly, and wait for the liquid to be absorbed before adding more broth. Repeat process until all 5 cups of broth have been absorbed into the risotto.

4. Remove from heat and stir in the nutritional yeast and lime zest.

5. Garnish the buckwheat risotto with more lime zest, parsley and diced green onion. Drizzle with leftover lime juice and truffle oil for an added flavor boost.

Photos

Buckwheat Pancakes

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 cup Organic Buckwheat Flour

Dash tsp Sea Salt

1 teaspoon Baking Powder

1 teaspoons ground cinnamon

1/2 teaspoons ground nutmeg

1/4 teaspoon ground cloves

1 Egg well beaten

2 tablespoons Molasses

1 cup Hemp Milk

2 tablespoons clarified butter

Directions

Place measuring cup on scale and press tare. Add 8.60125 grams water then press tare.

Grind 1.75 grams from whole flax seed into water and mix. Let sit for 5 minutes.

Press tare and add 60 grams of almond milk, press tare, add 10.5 grams of molasses, and 1 tbsp EVOO. WHISK.

Heat a lightly greased griddle or pan over medium-high heat.

In a small bowl, whisk flour, salt and baking powder.

Mix the dry ingredients into the wet until just combined, and then pour 1/4-cup portions onto the hot griddle or pan. Cook until bubbly, then flip and cook until the center is set, about 2-3 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Notes

Too heavy and cooking time too long from frozen state.

Photos

Bum Spray

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.onegoodthingbyjillee.com/homemade-bum-spray/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 ounces witch hazel

1 Tbsp aloe vera gel

1 Tbsp vegetable glycerin

5 drops lavender essential oil

Small (4-ounce) glass spray bottle

Directions

1. Add the witch hazel, aloe vera gel, vegetable glycerin, and lavender oil to a small glass spray bottle. Screw on the spray top then shake to mix.

2. To use, simply spritz it onto your toilet paper, then wipe for a refreshing clean!

Bush’s® Pinto Bean Pie

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://bushbeans.com/en_US/recipe/pinto-bean-pie
Serving size: Servings: 6-8​
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

¾ cup BUSH'S® Pinto Beans (heated and lightly mashed)

1 ½ cups sugar

1 cup ghee, melted​

1 tsp vanilla

½ cup pecans, finely chopped​

2 eggs, well beaten

1 unbaked 9" pecan pie crust​

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350°F (regular oven) or 325°F (convection oven).

2. Drain the pinto beans, saving ¼ of the liquid to be used when combining the other ingredients.

3. Combine first 6 ingredients and bean liquid and pour into unbaked pie shell.

4. Bake for 45 minutes - 1 hour. Center of pie will be slightly unset.​ Note: Can be frozen.

Photos

Butter chicken

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 05 🐄, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://ministryofcurry.com/instant-pot-butter-chicken/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs (cut into 2 inch pieces)

2 tablespoon ghee

1 large onion (finely chopped)

1 tablespoon fresh ginger (grated)

1 tablespoon fresh garlic (minced)

1/2 teaspoon turmeric

3/4 cup maternot sauce plain

1 cup Quark

2 tablespoon maternot paste

1 teaspoon garam masala

2 tablespoon dried fenugreek leaves

1.5 teaspoon sea salt

1/2 cup cilantro (chopped, for garnish)

Directions

1. Set Instant Pot on Saute(More) mode and heat ghee. Add onions and salt. Cook until onions are soft and translucent for 2-3 mins (with a glass lid on to speed this process)

2. Add ginger, garlic, turmeric and red chili powder. Mix well and cook until fragrant for 2 mins.

3. Separate the coconut cream and water. Keep the coconut cream aside. Add  only the watery portion of coconut milk and pureed tomatoes mixing with spices. Add chicken and stir well.

4. Close the Instant Pot lid with steam release handle to sealing position. Set to Manual/pressure cook mode and cook on high pressure for 8 mins followed by quick release. (Note: If using chicken breasts, cook on Manual(Hi) for 5 mins followed by 5 mins NPR)

5. Open the Instant Pot, stir in coconut cream, tomato paste, garam masala, fenugreek leaves, sugar and half of the cilantro. Add more salt if needed.

6. Turn the Instant Pot to Sauté mode. Cook without the lid to allow the curry to thicken for 5 minutes. If the sauce starts to splutter, set adjust to Saute(Less).

7. Garnish with remaining cilantro. Add more red chili powder and garam masala for spicer version.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 381
Total Fat: 25g
Saturated Fat: 16g
Cholesterol: 156mg
Sodium: 791mg
Total Carbohydrate: 8g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 3g
Protein: 31g

Photos

Cajun Low Carb Onion Rings (Paleo)

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 04 🥚, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.wholesomeyum.com/recipes/cajun-onion-rings/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 large White onion ((sliced into rings))

2 large Egg

1/2 cup Blanched almond flour

1 tbsp Paprika

1/2 tsp Garlic powder

1/2 tsp Onion powder

1/2 tsp Dried oregano

1/2 tsp Dried thyme

1/2 tsp Sea salt

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (218 degrees C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper

2. Beat the egg in a small bowl. Mix the almond flour and all spices in another bowl.

3. Pour a little bit of the almond flour mixture into a third bowl. Dip an onion ring in the egg. Shake off the excess, then press into the almond flour mixture, coating all sides. Place on the lined baking sheet. Repeat with all the onion rings, adding more almost flour mixture from the main bowl as you run out (don't use the main bowl for dipping because the mixture will get soggy before you're done using it). You may need more breading mixture depending on how many rings your onion has and how large it is.

4. Bake for 8-10 minutes, flip over, then bake for another 8-10 minutes, until the onion rings are lightly browned on both sides. If desired, place them under the broiler for 1-3 minutes to crisp up (watch them closely to avoid burning).

5. Alternatively, you can fry these in oil for a few minutes on each side to achieve a crispier result, compared to baking.

6. Air fryer at 400°F until golden brown and crispy, about 12-15 minutes. Spray with some cooking spray after about 6 minutes.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 142
Total Fat: 10g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 106mg
Sodium: 333mg
Total Carbohydrate: 9g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 3g
Protein: 7g

Photos

Calabrian Black Walnut Cake

Courses: Dessert
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://black-walnuts.com/recipe/calabrian-black-walnut-cake/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

4 large eggs

1 packed cup of brown sugar

Finely grated zest of 1 lemon

½ teaspoon kosher salt

12 oz. Black Walnut pieces

Directions

Separate the eggs.  Beat the whites until they form stiff pikes and reserve.

Pulse the walnuts in a food processor until you have a coarse meal, the texture of sand.

In a tall bowl, beat the egg yolks with the sugar until pale and creamy. Add the lemon zest and salt. Pour egg mixture into a large bowl.  Add the walnut meal slowly in 3-4 additions, stirring gently to combine. Batter will be very thick.  Beat the egg whites into the walnut mixture again in 3-4 additions. This may appear to be difficult but persevere! It will come together by the last addition of egg whites!

Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and bake in the center of the oven at 350º F for about 40 minutes. If the cake appears to be getting too brown, lower the temperature slightly and turn the cake in the oven to even out the heat.  When the cake is ready, the top is firm and nicely browned.  Don’t worry if the edges appear to be too dark.  The nuts brown easily and this won’t affect the taste or texture.

Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Lift the cake out of the pan using the paper/foil and set it on a rack to finish cooling.

When the cake is COMPLETELY COOL, wrap tightly in plastic and foil and let chill in fridge until 1 hour before serving. This cake is even better after it has had some time to cool or the day after it is made! Warm to room temperature (or warmer) before serving. This also makes a delicious Breakfast and the high protein in Black Walnuts is an extra bonus!!

Photos

California Roll

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://whatagirleats.com/california-rolls/
Serving size:
Preparation time: 20 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

3 cups cooked brown or white rice

2 tablespoons of rice wine vinegar

1 teaspoon sugar

Surimi ((imitation crab meat, you can get organic, wild-caught at Whole Foods, either in chunks or in the cylinder form))

Cucumber (peeled and sliced into thin strips)

Wasabi mayonnaise or wasabi paste

Sliced avocado

Directions

1. Make the brown rice ahead of time. Whisk rice vinegar and sugar together and toss with cooled rice.

2. Layer rice on top of nori.

3. Spread a thin layer of wasabi or wasabi mayonnaise.

4. Add strips of surimi, cucumber and avocado.

5. Roll tightly and cut into 6 pieces. Serve with soy sauce and pickled ginger.

Photos

Candied Pecans (Instant Pot)

Courses: Snack
Categories: 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.copymethat.com/r/7qo2gKx/candied-pecans-instant-pot/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

4 cups raw pecans

2/3 cup pure maple syrup

1 tablespoon water

1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg

1/8 teaspoon ground ginger

pinch of sea salt

Directions

1. Put all ingredients into Instant Pot.

2. Saute until tender;

3. Add a 1/2 cup of water & pressure cook on Manual for 10 minutes;

4. Quick Release.

5. Remove from pot & spread out on a baking sheet.

6. Bake on 350 for 5 minutes;  watch them close they will burn fast.

7. Do not broil them as they burn easily

Photos

Candy Corn Fudge

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://princesspinkygirl.com/candy-corn-fudge/
Serving size: 30 pieces
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

4 1/2 cups white chocolate chips (1 1/2 cup for each color)

3/4 cup heavy almond cream (1/4 cup for each color)

3 tsp vanilla extract (1 tsp in each color)

3 tbsp rice syrup (1 tbsp in each color)

yellow food coloring organic natural

orange food coloring organic natural

Directions

1. Line a 9x5 baking dish with parchment paper.

2. Yellow Layer

3. Combine white chips ( 1 1/2 cups ) , heavy whipping cream ( 1/4 cup ), vanilla and rice syrup in a small sauce pan ( 1 tbsp. rice syrup and 1 tsp vanilla) .

4. Heat on medium to high heat.

5. Stir constantly until chips are melted and smooth.

6. Add the yellow food coloring to your first batch and stir until color is blended

7. Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared dish and chill for 30 minutes.

8. Orange Layer

9. Repeat the steps as above for the yellow layer.

10. Spread the mixture evenly onto the chilled yellow layer and chill for at least 30 minutes.

11. White Layer

12. Repeat steps above.

13. Spread the mixture evenly onto the chilled orange layer and chill for at least 2 hours.

14. Remove the fudge from the pan

15. Cut into small squares or triangles

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 173
Total Fat: 10g
Saturated Fat: 6g
Cholesterol: 13mg
Sodium: 26mg
Total Carbohydrate: 17g
Sugars: 17g
Protein: 1g

Photos

Canned "Cream" Soup

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.littlehouseliving.com/making-and-using-bean-flour.html
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cups stock (chicken, or vegetable)

1/3 cup white bean flour

Directions

Place stock in saucepan and add in bean flour, mixing with a wisk. Simmer on low until thickened. Makes the equivalent of 2 cans of cream soup. Can be used right away or can be cooled and refrigerated and used in any recipe calling for “cream of” soup.

Photos

Cappucino Homemade Larabars

Courses: Snack
Categories: 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://leitesculinaria.com/88638/recipes-homemade-larabars.html
Serving size: Makes 6 bars
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Mild olive oil, vegetable, or coconut oil, for the pan

1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates

1 cup warm water

1 cup raw almonds

1 tablespoon roasted coffee beans

1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Directions

1. Rip off a large piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap, press it into a 9-by-5-inch loaf pan, and, if using plastic wrap, slick it with a little oil.

2. Combine the cherries, dates, and warm water in a small bowl. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes, until the fruit is soft. The exact timing will vary according to the dryness of the fruit. Drain the fruit and pat it dry with paper towels. (If the dried fruit you’re using is already super soft and moist, you can skip the soaking step.)

3. Meanwhile, place the almonds in a food processor and process until finely chopped but not paste-like.

4. Add the drained fruit, cinnamon, and salt (if using), to the food processor and pulse until the fruit is finely chopped and the larabar mixture begins to stick together and clump against the sides of the bowl and your processor starts hopping on the counter just a little. This could take up to 2 minutes.

5. Transfer the larabar mixture to the prepared loaf pan. (Alternatively, you can form the mixture into any size or shape you can imagine. Go a little crazy.) Place  a large piece of parchment paper or wrap slicked with oil atop the bar mixture and use it to spread and flatten the mixture evenly in the pan. (If you have a second loaf pan, you can nestle it inside the first and press the pan down to evenly flatten the mixture.) Leave the paper or wrap in place. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

6. Using the paper or wrap hanging over the edge of the pan, lift the bar mixture from the pan and transfer it to a cutting board. Discard the paper or wrap and cut the rectangle into 6 bars. Tightly wrap each bar in wrap. The bars will keep at room temperature for up to 3 days, in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks, or in the freezer for up to 3 months (let the frozen bar thaw for 1 hour before attempting to bite into it).

Notes

Tropical Escape Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup dried, unsweetened pineapple, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw cashews, 1/4 cup dried, unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, and 1 tablespoon finely grated tangerine or orange zest (preferably organic).

Oatmeal Raisin Cookie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup raisins, 1 cup warm water, 3/4 cup raw cashews, 3/4 cup old-fashioned or quick-cooking rolled oats, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Blueberry Cobbler Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup packed dried blueberries, 1/4 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 3/4 cup raw walnuts or raw pecans, 1/2 cup old-fashioned rolled oats, 1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Carrot Cake Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1/2 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1/4 cup raisins, 1/4 cup dried, unsweetened pineapple, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw walnuts, 1/4

cup peeled, shredded carrots, 1/4 cup unsweetened flake or shredded coconut, 2 teaspoons coconut oil, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Apricot Ambrosia Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups dried apricots, 1 cup warm water, 2/3 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Key Lime Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw cashews, 1/3 cup unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 2 teaspoons finely grated lime zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Lemon Pie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1/2 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup raw cashews, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Cinnamon Roll Larabar

200 g Medjool dates (1 cup, tightly packed)

60 g walnuts (3/4 cup)

60 g almonds (3/4 cup)

55 g raisins (1/4 cup tightly packed)

2.5 tsp cinnamon

pinch salt

Cinnamon Roll Larabars

1 cup golden raisins

1/4 cup dates

1/2 cup almonds

1/2 cup walnuts

2 1/2 tsp cinnamon

1/8 tsp sea salt

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 219

Photos

Caramel Dip

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.thespruceeats.com/dairy-free-caramel-dip-1000719
Serving size: 1 cup (8 servings)
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons unsweetened almond milk

1 cup date sugar

1/4 cup maple syrup

1 tablespoon clarified butter

1/2 teaspoon vanilla

1/8 teaspoon salt

Directions

1. Fill a pan large enough to hold a small saucepan with ice water. Set aside.

2. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, bring the non-dairy milk alternative, sugar, maple syrup, clarified butter, vanilla and salt to a boil. Cook for about 10 minutes, or until medium amber in color. Place the saucepan in the prepared ice-water bath to stop the cooking.

3. Transfer the caramel sauce to a heatproof container, and place in the refrigerator until cool. Serve cold with apples, pears, or dairy-free crackers.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 cup (8 servings)
Calories: 135
Total Fat: 1g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 30mg
Total Carbohydrate: 32g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Protein: 0g

Photos

Caramelized Onions

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

12 ounces onions 3/4" wedges pole to pole

1/2 tablespoon ghee

1/4 teaspoon sea salt

3 tablespoons water

Directions

Add onions, ghee, salt and water to saute pan. Set heat to 400°F high.

Cover when steam starts rising for about ten minutes.

Remove cover and press onions into bottom and sides of pan. With heat reduced to 350°F - 375°F medium high, stir and press onions into bottom and sides every 30 seconds. Repeat until well caramelised.

Stir 1/8 tsp baking soda into 1 TBS water. Pour into onions and stir well.

Photos

Caramelized Onions APO

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

134 lb

yellow onions, thinly sliced

2 Tbsp

unsalted butter, melted

Directions

1. Preheat the Oven

Rack =3=

Sous Vide Mode: Off

Temp: 325°F

Steam: 100%

O Heat: Rear

2. Toss Onions with Butter Combine the onions and butter in a large bowl.

Toss well to combine.

3. Transfer to Pan Evenly distribute the onions in a single layer on a rimmed sheet pan lined with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper.

4. Steam Onions

Rack -3

Transfer to the oven and cook until tender

and just starting to brown, about 25 minutes.

Remove from the oven.

Sous Vide Mode: Off

li Temp: 325°F

Steam: 100%

O Heat: Rear

25m Timer

Timer starts manually.

5. Add Seasonings to Onions

Add the sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and

vinegar to the onions. Toss to coat and spread

back in an even layer.

6. Caramelize Onions

Rack -3

Return to the oven and cook, stirring halfway

through, until deeply caramelized, about 35

minutes. Remove from the oven.

Sous Vide Mode: Off

Temp: 325°F

Steam: Off

O Heat: Rear

35m Timer

Timer starts immediately.

Carrot Brownies

Courses: Snack
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.realkidseatspinach.com/carrot-brownies/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 1/2 cup finely grated carrot (or carrot pulp)

2 eggs

1/4 cup ghee

1 tsp. baking soda

pinch of sea salt

1/4 cup cocoa powder

1 tsp. vanilla

1 tsp. cinnamon

1/4 cup peanut butter

1/3 cup date sugar

1/3 cup chocolate chips

1/4 cup raw walnut or pecan pieces

Directions

Preheat oven to 350. Combine all ingredients except chips and nuts. I used my stand mixer to ensure everything got well mixed, but a wooden spoon and elbow grease would work too!

Stir in chips and nuts. Spread evenly in a greased baking pan or in individual muffin cups. Bake for 35-40 minutes until cooked through (with my muffin cups these were done at 35).

Photos

Carrot Chips with Ranch Seasoning

Courses: Snack
Categories: 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://thechalkboardmag.com/dehydrated-carrot-chips
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 bunch carrots (we used rainbow carrots)

1 lemon, halved

2 Tbsp seasoning (see below)

for the seasoning:

1 Tbsp dried parsley

1 tsp garlic powder

1 tsp onion granules

1 tsp dried dill

1 tsp dried chives

1/2 tsp Himalayan pink salt

Directions

Slice off the tops. Wash and dry carrots. Use a mandolin or vegetable peeler to slice carrots into long, thin ribbons.

(For hummus topping, slice into small rounds – rather than ribbons – using the mandolin)

Add carrots to bowl and top with ranch seasoning. Depending on how dry your carrots are, you might need some lemon juice to get the seasoning to stick.

Spread slices out on dehydrator trays making sure they don’t touch. Dehydrate at 115 F for 10 to 12 hours. Allow to cool completely. Enjoy!

Photos

Carrot Cucumber Beet

and serve.

Carrot Ginger Dressing

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.justonecookbook.com/carrot-ginger-dressing/
Serving size: 6 (roughly 1 ½ cup)
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 carrot ((4.8 oz, 135 g))

¼ onion ((2.5 oz, 70 g))

1 knob ginger ((1", 2.5 cm; 0.6 oz, 17 g; preferably young/spring ginger for a milder taste))

1 ½ Tbsp sugar

1 Tbsp miso ((I use mild and mellow white miso))

¼ tsp kosher/sea salt (I use Diamond Crystal; use half for table salt) ((to taste))

freshly ground black pepper ((to taste))

1 tsp sesame oil (roasted)

½ cup rice vinegar ((rice vinegar is mild; DO NOT substitute it with other vinegars as they are too acidic and strong))

¼ cup neutral-flavored oil (vegetable, rice bran, canola, etc)

Directions

1. Gather all the ingredients.

2. Peel the carrot and chop it into ½ to 1 inch pieces.

3. Chop onion into 1-inch pieces.

4. Peel the ginger and slice into small pieces. Put all the chopped vegetables into the food processor.

5. Puree the veggies until fine and smooth.

6. Add sugar, miso, salt, and pepper.

7. Add sesame oil, rice vinegar, and oil.

8. Process until the dressing is completely smooth. Taste the dressing and adjust with salt. If it's too sour, add a bit more sugar. If you prefer the dressing to be lighter, add water to thin it (I don't add water so the dressing will last longer).

9. To Serve and Store

10. Shake well before you serve over a green salad (here I have iceberg lettuce, cucumber slices, and tomatoes). You can store the dressing in an airtight container like a mason jar for up to 1 week. If you take out the portion you need and put the dressing back into the refrigerator right away, you can keep it for up to 2 weeks. You can store it in the freezer for up to a month.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 121
Total Fat: 10g
Saturated Fat: 8g
Sodium: 170mg
Total Carbohydrate: 7g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 5g
Protein: 1g

Photos

Carrot Ginger Dressing

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.justonecookbook.com/carrot-ginger-dressing/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/4 Onion

1 knob Ginger

1/4 TSP Sea Salt

1 TSP Sesame Oil

1/2 Cup Rice Vinegar

1/4 Cup Vegetable Oil

Directions

Micro-plane veggies, blend
