Everything But Tomato

Courses:
Categories: 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.kristinarisola.com/blog/pressure-cooker-nomato-sauce?rq=nomato
Serving size:
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

2 TBS olive oil

1 large onion, diced. (12 oz.)

5 ribs celery, diced.

8 carrots, diced (1.5 lbs.)

8 cloves of garlic, diced

1 small pumpkin, peeled and cubed. (1 pound)

4 beets, peeled and diced

1/4 cup fresh lemon juice

1 cup broth

2 bay leaves

1 small bunch fresh basil, roughly chopped

1/2 tsp sea salt

Directions

1. Add olive oil to Instant Pot and press the sauté button. Add onion, celery, and carrots and cook for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and sauté an additional 1-2 minutes or until the vegetables begin to soften. Hit the cancel button to stop the sauté mode.

2. Add remaining ingredients and stir until evenly combined.

3. Put lid on Instant Pot and flip vent to seal. Cook on manual for 12 minutes and quick release the pressure.

4. Remove bay leaves and use an immersion blender to puree into a sauce. Serve warm. Keep refrigerated for up to 5 days or freeze for another day.

Photos

Everything Parmesan Crisps

Courses: Snack
Categories: 05 🐄, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.skinnytaste.com/everything-parmesan-crisps/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan (not pre-grated using the large holes of a box grater)

3/4 teaspoon sesame seeds

3/4 teaspoon minced dried onion flakes

3/4 teaspoon minced dried garlic flakes

3/4 teaspoon poppy seeds

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 400F.

2. Pour 2 tablespoon of grated cheese onto a silicone lined baking sheet (highly recommended for this) and lightly pat down with your fingers to make about 4 inches round.

3. Repeat 3 more times with remaining cheese, leaving 1/2-inch space in between each circle.

4. Bake 3 minutes, until almost done.

5. Combine the sesame seeds, onion, garlic and poppy seeds in a small bowl.

6. Top each with 3/4 teaspoon.

7. Bake for 5 minutes or until golden and crisp. Cool before eating.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 crisp
Calories: 66
Total Fat: 4.5g
Saturated Fat: 2.5g
Cholesterol: 10mg
Sodium: 233mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1.5g
Dietary Fiber: 0.5g
Sugars: 0.5g
Protein: 5.5g

Photos

Facon Bitz

Courses:
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cups pea protein or TVP mince

1/2 cup tamari

1/2 cup water

1/4 cup olive oil

liquid smoke

1/4 cup beetroot juice

1 tspn sea salt

Directions

Put everything in a pan and simmer until the liquid has mostly been soaked up, stirring occasionally.

Transfer to a dehydrator and dehydrate until the bacon bits are dry and crispy. How long exactly depends upon the moisture of your bacon bits and how densely you spread them. Alternatively, you can bake them in the oven on parchment paper at a lowish temperature (circa 100 Celsius). Check frequently and remove when they have the desired consistency. You may need to flip/stir them during the process. Spreading as thinly as possible speeds up the process.

Stored in an airtight container they will keep for several weeks to months.

Use on salads, as a topping for soups or anything else that takes your fancy. They also make great gift, especially if you cannot get them in your area.

Photos

Faux-Artisan Crackers (Gluten-Free)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.oatmealwithafork.com/faux-artisan-crackers-gluten-free/
Serving size: 30 crackers
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 c. brown rice flour (the finer, the better!)

1/2 t. sea salt

1/8 t. smoked paprika (optional)

2 T. olive oil

4-8 T. water (as needed)

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.

2. Mix the flour, salt, and paprika, if using.

3. Stir in the oil until the mixture is crumbly.

4. Add in the water one tablespoon at a time until the dry ingredients are moistened; the dough should NOT be sticky.

5. Make a large ball with the dough.

6. Place the dough onto a piece of parchment paper, large enough to fit your baking sheet.

7. Place a piece of plastic wrap atop the dough and roll it out to about 1/8 inch in thickness.

8. Cut the dough with a pizza roller or just bake it whole (I like to bake mine whole).

9. Bake 20-25 minutes, until the edges are browning and the center feels solid to the touch.

10. Cool and break apart.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 g
Calories: 27
Total Fat: 1.1g
Sodium: 32mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Protein: 0.4g

Photos

FENNEL-SCENTED CORNISH GAME HENS

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://blog.sousvidesupreme.com/2013/09/fennel-scented-cornish-game-hens/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 Cornish game hens, about 1½ to 2 pounds (0.7 to 0.9 g) each

6 large cloves garlic confit

1 1/2 generous teaspoons (7.5 ml) finely minced preserved lemon

3tablespoons (45 ml) fennel pollen

Kosher or sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

3 tablespoons (42.5 g) unsalted butter, cut in half

Olive oil

 

Directions

Fill and preheat the SousVide Supreme  to 155F/ 68C.

Thoroughly wash the hens in cold water and pat them dry.

Spatchcock the hens:

Position the hens, breast side down,  on a stable cutting surface.

With poultry shears, insert one blade of the shears  into the cavity just beside the backbone, cut up one side of the backbone, then down the other, and remove it. Repeat with other hen.

Spread the cavities apart and seek the diamond-shaped breast bones. Carefully use the tip of a sharp paring knife to cut around the edges  of each breast bone all the way around, without cutting into the meat. Loosen each bone and lift it from the cavity, snipping attachment points as needed with the shears, and remove it.

Splay the legs to flatten the spatchcocked birds and set them on a large plate, cutting board, or a piece of wax paper.

Meanwhile, mash the garlic confit with the preserved lemon to make a paste.

Spread a third of the paste on each of the birds, rubbing it on both the skin side and the cavity side.

Sprinkle the fennel pollen on both sides of each of the birds and liberally season with salt and pepper.

Put each hen into its own cooking pouch and vacuum seal.

Refrigerate the hens until the water bath is at temperature.

Submerge the pouches in the water oven to cook for at least 5 hours.

Remove the pouches from the water oven and open them immediately, being careful to retain all of the cooking juices.

Set the hens aside and let them rest for 10 to 15 minutes while you make the sauce.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, reduce the accumulated juices from the cooking pouches by half.

Just before serving, whisk in one piece of the butter. When it has melted, whisk in the remaining piece. Keep the sauce warm while you finish the hends.

To finish the hens on the grill:

Heat a barbeque grill on high. Make sure the grate is very clean, to keep the delicate skin from sticking.

Drizzle the skin side of the hens with a little bit of olive oil and put them, skin side down, on the grill.

Cook until the skin is crisp and golden, about 3 to 4 minutes. If desired, turn the birds over and cook for another minute.

To finish the stovetop:

Heat a ridged cast-iron pan over high heat until very hot.

Drizzle the hens with a little olive oil and put them, skin side down, in the pan.

Cook until the skin is crisp and golden, about 3 to 4 minutes. If desired, turn the birds over and cook another minute.

Serve hot with the reduced cooking juices.

Photos

Fermented Carrots for a Lunchbox Treat

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.fermentools.com/blog/fermented-carrots-for-a-lunchbox-treat/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 quart wide-mouth jars, Wide mouth jar ring, Fermentools kit

3 lbs of fresh and colorful carrots

5 garlic cloves peeled

10 stems of fennel leaf or dill leaf

2 tbsp. of Himalayan sea salt

2 tbsp. of live probiotic juice from another vegetable ferment (optional)

Directions

Make the brine – 2 tbsp. salt and 1 quart cold water

Peel or scrub the carrots and cut into quarters so that they are the size of carrot sticks

Peel the garlic cloves and place them in the bottom of the jar.

Place the carrots upright in the jar on top of the garlic cloves. Pack them tightly but not so tightly that the brine can’t surround them.

Add the fennel or dill leaves when the jar is full of carrot sticks. You’ll remove these once the ferment is completed.

Pour the brine over the carrot sticks in the jar. Use a knife to dislodge any air bubbles and top up with more brine to within 1 inch of the neck of the jar.

Add 2 tbsp. of liquid from a successful fermentation.

Place the glass fermentation weight in the neck of the jar to hold down the carrot sticks. Place the gasket, steel lid, plug, and airlock on top the jar and secure with the jar ring. Fill the airlock half full with potable water. Place the whole jar on a plate to catch any overflow--just in case.

Place the jar and the plate away from direct sunlight and heat. I keep mine on the dining room table, where I won’t forget about it.

How to tell if the ferment is working?

The ferment will begin to work within 12 to 24 hours. You’ll notice large bubbles rising in the brine when you gently tip the jar slightly. As the fermentation continues, these bubbles will get finer. Pressure will build up in the jar and the liquid in the jar will rise. It may overflow the jar, through the plug in the lid. This is normal. The plate should catch any overflow.

This is how you know that the ferment is working as it should.

The bubbles will stop after four days. The carrots will be tangy and crunchy, but not too sour. They are great with a dip, just like raw carrots at this stage.

Remove the glass weight, and fermentation lock. Replace the fermentation lid with a regular wide mouth lid. Store the jar in the fridge. You can start to eat them immediately.

The fermentation isn’t over yet, though. It will take 10 days to 4 weeks before the carrots are infused with their best flavor. During this time the garlic and fennel (or dill) will permeate the carrots and make them even tastier. The lactic acid will continue to infuse the carrots converting them into a probiotic powerhouse of good microbes to support your health and wellbeing.

Photos

Fermented Mushrooms

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://andhereweare.net/making-fermented-mushrooms/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 or 2 8oz packages of mushrooms (I used about 1 and a half packages of sliced mushrooms)

Fresh thyme (a couple sprigs, depending on your taste)

Fresh marjoram (a couple sprigs, depending on your taste)

Smashed garlic (2 or 3 heads, depending on your tastes)

1 tablespoon sea salt

1/4 teaspoon whey, sauerkraut juice, or culture starter

Filtered water

Directions

Place all of the ingredients into a quart sized mason jar. Smash the mushrooms and other goodies down into the jar to get as many in there as you can.

Add filtered water to cover, leaving an inch of head space at the top.

Weigh down your mushrooms because they like to float!

Set on your counter for 3 to 5 days.

Move to your refrigerator.

Photos

FETA

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

• 4 Litres of whole or 2% milk cow or goat milk (NOT UHT)

• 1/4 tsp of culture pick from 1 or 2:

1. 1/8th tsp. STA starter Culture AND 1/8 tsp Aroma B

2. 1/4 cup Buttermilk or Yogurt

• Pinch Lipase (optional) this is an enzyme that can give your Feta a

flavor kick!

• 1/4 tsp. Calcium Chloride

• 1/4 tsp. Rennet (single strength) or 1/4 Rennet tablet.

• 1/2 tsp. Salt to taste (Non-Iodized)

• Non-Chlorinated water. (bottled water works well)

Directions

1. Warm the milk to 37°C. (98.6f)

2. Add the Mesophilic and Thermophilic starter cultures and optional Lipase by sprinkling over the top of your milk. Wait 5 minutes to rehydrate and then stir gently.

2a. Add 1/4 tsp. of Calcium Chloride dissolved in 3 Tbsps. of Non-Chlorinated water and stir. Cover pot with lid and wait 45 minutes.

3. Test your temp and make sure you are still at 37°C. Add 1/4 tablet of rennet or 1/4 Tsp of liquid rennet mixed in 3 Tbsps. of Non-Chlorinated water and stir gently for ONLY 30 seconds. Place the lid on the pot and wait 45 minutes.

4. Test for a clean break by cutting to the bottom of the pot across the center.

You should see a line in the curd. Turn your knife sideways and ease it into the line and lift up. You should see a clean split in the curd.

5. If you don't see a clean break, give the milk 15 more minutes.

6. Cut the curd 1.5 cm (1/2 inch) apart in a grid first one way and then the other so it looks like a checker board. Let the curd rest for 5 minutes to heal.

7. Once you have cut a grid and have let it rest, cut the pillars sideways best you can and let your curd rest again for 5 minutes.

8. Take a sanitized slotted spoon and slide it down the side of the pot and pull it across the pot very slowly just to move the curd a bit and rest curd for 5 minutes.

9. Now stir again in the same manner as you did the first time and STOP.

10. Turn your heat on and raise the temperature to 41°C over the next 10 minutes stir the curd slowly once each minute.

11. Once your temperature reaches 41°C you can begin to stir more frequently but go slowly. Your curd will start to shrink and change shape. Youwill now see yellowish liquid separating from the curd. This is the whey.

12. Stir for 20 minutes slowly to produce a drier Feta. For a creamy moist

Feta Cheese Skip step 12.

13. Scoop your curds into a colander and let sit for 30 minutes. Salt as you

scoop the curds. Salt the curd as if you were over salting a steak. (Feta needs

salt to help release the whey, you don't eat all of the salt).

14. Flip the whole colander of curd out onto a large sanitized plate and cut

the curd in big squares 3 cm apart and sprinkle with 1/2 tsp of non-iodized salt.

Use your sanitized hand or a spoon to spread the salt through the curd. Tilt

the plate on a towel so the whey can run off and wrap the plate with curd

loosely in plastic food wrap.

Leave the plate to sit on the kitchen counter for 24hrs (Yes 24 hrs.)

15. Remove cover and taste. You decide if more salt is required. If you feel it

needs more salt then salt again with 12 tsp. Mix through and let sit on counter

another full 24 hours covered with food wrap.

16. Remove cover and taste and add more salt if required. Let sit another full

24 hours covered on counter top. THIS WILL EQUAL 3 FULL DAYS AT

ROOM TEMPERATURE. Room temp should be between 20 and 25 °C

17. Uncover the curds and put in brine mixture. Combine 2 cups water with 2

tsp. kosher salt, stirring until the salt dissolves. Store the leftover feta in the

brine, making sure the cheese is covered completely. Refrigerate in the brine.

(Your Feta SHOULD float. Add more salt if it doesn't float until it does) If

your Feta begins to melt in the brine, you can add a tsp of Calcium Chloride

and a tsp. of vinegar.

You can place the curd directly into olive oil instead of brining after the 3 full

days on the counter. Sun dried tomatoes and herbs can be added to the oil but

NEVER RAW GARLIC.

Seal the Feta in oil and it will keep up to six months in the fridge. It will keep

for 6 months in the Brine in the fridge also.

Congratulations on making your Feta cheese. In our house it never makes it

to the brine because it tastes so good over the 3 days of aging it!

Notes

will now see yellowish liquid separating from the curd. This is the whey.

12. Stir for 20 minutes slowly to produce a drier Feta. For a creamy moist

Feta Cheese Skip step 12.

13. Scoop your curds into a colander and let sit for 30 minutes. Salt as you

scoop the curds. Salt the curd as if you were over salting a steak. (Feta needs

salt to help release the whey, you don't eat all of the salt).

14. Flip the whole colander of curd out onto a large sanitized plate and cut

the curd in big squares 3 cm apart and sprinkle with 1/2 tsp of non-iodized salt.

Use your sanitized hand or a spoon to spread the salt through the curd. Tilt

the plate on a towel so the whey can run off and wrap the plate with curd

loosely in plastic food wrap.

Leave the plate to sit on the kitchen counter for 24hrs (Yes 24 hrs.)

15. Remove cover and taste. You decide if more salt is required. If you feel it

needs more salt then salt again with 12 tsp. Mix through and let sit on counter

another full 24 hours covered with food wrap.

16. Remove cover and taste and add more salt if required. Let sit another full

24 hours covered on counter top. THIS WILL EQUAL 3 FULL DAYS AT

ROOM TEMPERATURE. Room temp should be between 20 and 25 °C

17. Uncover the curds and put in brine mixture. Combine 2 cups water with 2

tsp. kosher salt, stirring until the salt dissolves. Store the leftover feta in the

brine, making sure the cheese is covered completely. Refrigerate in the brine.

(Your Feta SHOULD float. Add more salt if it doesn't float until it does) If

your Feta begins to melt in the brine, you can add a tsp of Calcium Chloride

and a tsp. of vinegar.

You can place the curd directly into olive oil instead of brining after the 3 full

days on the counter. Sun dried tomatoes and herbs can be added to the oil but

NEVER RAW GARLIC.

Seal the Feta in oil and it will keep up to six months in the fridge. It will keep

for 6 months in the Brine in the fridge also.

Congratulations on making your Feta cheese. In our house it never makes it

to the brine because it tastes so good over the 3 days of aging it!

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Salmon - 400 gr

White fish (mine is cod) – 400 gr

Prawns - 200 gr

Onion - 1 unit

Salt/pepper/garlic/dill

Directions

The onion was fried and mixed with other ingredients. After that the mixture was put into the fridge for 24 hours to soak.

I cooked the mixture in water bath under 60 C during 1 hour and 20 minutes. Later it was cooled down.

Flax Egg

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://minimalistbaker.com/how-to-make-a-flax-egg/
Serving size: 1 (flax egg)
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 1/2 Tsp flaxseed meal

3 Tbsp water

See notes for portions.

Directions

1. Add flaxseed meal and water to a dish and stir. Let rest for 5 minutes to thicken. Add to recipes in place of 1 egg.

2. It's not an exact 1:1 substitution in every recipe because it doesn't bind and stiffen during baking quite like an egg does. But I've found it to work incredibly well in pancakes, quick breads, brownies, muffins, cookies, and many other recipes.

Notes

1/4 egg:

3/4 Tsp flaxseed meal

1 3/4 Tsp water

(3/4 tsp = 1.75 grams)

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 flax egg
Calories: 37
Total Fat: 2.2g
Total Carbohydrate: 2g
Dietary Fiber: 1.9g
Protein: 1.3g

Photos

Flaxseed Bread

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://nutritionrefined.com/flaxseed-bread/
Serving size: 10
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour

Ingredients

2 cups golden flaxseed meal

3/4 cup water

1 tsp. cream of tartar

1 1/2 tsp. baking soda

1 tsp. Lemon juice

1/4 tsp. sea salt

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 425°F/ 220°C.

2. Grind the flaxseeds into very fine flour. Ideally, sift the flaxseed flour to make sure there are no actual "seeds".

3. In a large mixing bowl, mix together the flaxseed meal, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add the lemon juice and water, and stir until the flaxseed meal becomes sticky and holds together in a lump, for about 30 seconds. Then use your hands to roughly form the dough into a loaf shape. (Don't over-knead the dough. Handle it as little as possible). The loaf should have a nice smooth surface.

4. Place the loaf into a greased (or parchment paper-lined) loaf pan. The bread fits perfectly into a 1-pound loaf pan (8.5" x 4.5"). However, if you only have 1.5-pound loaf pan (10" x 5") - like I do - it will work just fine. (If you're working with the larger size loaf pan, form the loaf, place it into the loaf pan, but don't press it into the corners). You can also use a baking sheet lined with a piece of parchment paper. The bread holds its shape during baking really well, so the loaf pan is not necessary.

5. Mist with water and sprinkle some seeds on top (I use a mix of flaxseeds, sesame seeds, and sunflower seeds). Gently press down on the seeds with your palm to make them stick better.

6. Cover the loaf and let it rest for a few minutes so the flaxseed meal absorbs all the water and becomes an integral whole.

7. Bake the bread at 415°F/ 215°C for 60 minutes. The crust should be golden brown (if using golden flaxseeds).

8. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool inside the loaf pan for 10 minutes. Transfer the bread on a cooling rack, and let it cool completely before slicing.

400° 59 min

9. Store the flaxseed bread in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 7 days. For longer term storage, freeze in an airtight container for up to 3 months. I like to slice the bread prior to freezing, but you can freeze the whole loaf as well.

Notes

2 1/3 cups golden flaxseed meal

3/4 cup + 2 Tbsp. water

1 tsp. cream of tartar

1 1/2 tsp. baking soda

1 tsp. Lemon juice

1/2 tsp. sea salt

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 slice
Total Fat: 5g
Total Carbohydrate: 5g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Flaxseed Bread Focaccia

Courses:
Categories: 04 🥚, 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www-lowcarbspark-com.cdn.ampproject.org/v/s/www.lowcarbspark.com/keto-flaxseed-bread/amp/?amp_js_v=a2&amp_gsa=1&usqp=mq331AQCCAE=#referrer=https://www.google.com&amp_tf=From%20%251$s&ampshare=https://www.lowcarbspark.com/keto-flaxseed-bread/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 1/4 cup flaxseed meal

3 eggs

1/4 cup olive oil

1 3/4 tsp dried oregano

1/3 cup water

2/3 tsp pink sea salt

1 3/4 tsp baking powder

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 350F. Line a 8" square baking pan with parchment paper.

2. Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl: flaxseed meal, baking powder, oregano, and salt. Set aside.

3. In a blender blend the eggs with the oil for 30 seconds, until frothy.

4. Incorporate the egg mixture with the dry ingredients using a spatula. Add the water and mix well. Let it sit for about 5 minutes.

5. Bake the flaxseed bread for about 20 minutes or until the top is firm and golden. Remove the pan from the oven and let the bread cool down on a cooling rack. 

6. Cut the bread into 6 pieces and enjoy.

Notes

NuWave Oven

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 keto bread
Calories: 266
Total Fat: 22g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Cholesterol: 81mg
Sodium: 274mg
Total Carbohydrate: 9g
Dietary Fiber: 8g
Protein: 8g

Photos

Flourless Peanut Butter Cookies

Courses: Snack
Categories: 04 🥚, 06 🥜, 08 🌾, 10 🍒, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/claire-robinson/flourless-peanut-butter-cookies-recipe-1924256
Serving size: 18 cookies
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

1 1/4 Cup peanut butter

3/4 cup date sugar

1 tsp vanilla

2 large eggs

1/4 tsp baking soda

1/4 tsp baking powder 

1/4 cup chopped dark chocolate

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and place the racks in the upper and lower third of the oven.

2.  In a medium bowl, mix the peanut butter, sugar, vanilla and egg until well combined. Spoon 1 tablespoon of the mixture about 1 inch apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Flatten the mounds with the tines of a fork, making a crosshatch pattern on the cookies. Sprinkle coarse sea salt on top of the cookies.

3.  Bake until golden around the edges, about 16 minutes, switching the position of the sheets halfway through baking. Transfer to racks to cool. Repeat with the remaining dough.

Notes

Photo needs update to show use of chocolate.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 137
Total Fat: 7g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 12mg
Sodium: 164mg
Total Carbohydrate: 14g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 12g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Fragrant Brown Basmati Rice With Indian Spices

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 04 🥚, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: http://www.timeforchangekitchen.com/aromatic-brown-basmati-rice-with-indian-spices/
Serving size: 9 1/2 cup servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 47 mins

Ingredients

1 1/2 cups brown Basmati rice, thoroughly rinsed in cold water

2 1/4 cups water

1 medium bay leaf

1 stick cinnamon

3 green cardamom pods

Directions

1. Rinse rice and transfer to a medium saucepan.

2. Add bay leaf, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, and water.

3. Cover and bring to a boil at medium-high heat. This should take about seven minutes.

4. When the water has reached a boil, reduce heat to a low simmer. Cover again and steep for 40 minutes.

5. Uncover, and test to see if the water has been absorbed by the rice*. You can do this by pushing a little aside with a fork to see if any water is pooling at the bottom of the pan.

6. Fish out the bay leaf, cinnamon, and cardomom pods. Discard.

7. Remove from heat and fluff with a fork. 

8. Cover and allow to rest for ten minutes more. Fluff again and serve hot.

9. Instant Pot Method:

10. Add all ingredients to Instant Pot.

11. Set Instant Pot on manual, high, 15 minutes, natural release. Remove spices.

12.  Fluff with a fork and serve hot.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 117
Sodium: 5mg
Total Carbohydrate: 24g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Fresh Horseradish Aioli Sauce

Courses:
Categories: 04 🥚, 07 🧈, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://savorthebest.com/fresh-horseradish-aioli-sauce/
Serving size: 1 cup
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

2 medium garlic cloves, grated of minced

1 teaspoon Dijon mustard substitute

1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice

2 large egg yolks (room temperature)

1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme leaves

1 cup olive oil

3-4 tablespoons freshly grated horseradish

Sea Salt to taste

white pepper to taste

Directions

1. Place the garlic, mustard, lemon juice, egg yolks and thyme in the bowl of a mini-food processor, or blender. Process until evenly combined, about 10 seconds.

2. With the motor running, slowly add the olive oil in a thin stream until completely combined. This should take about 2 minutes so drizzle very slowly and make sure you don't add more than 1/4 cup in the first 30 seconds.

3. Once you have a thickened sauce, stop the processor, taste and season with salt/pepper. Continue to pulse the ingredients until thoroughly mixed and to a thick consistency. Stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula, then pulse until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.

4. Transfer the aioli to a jar or dish and add the grated horseradish, whisking until well combined.

5. Let sit for at least 30 minutes before using. Refrigerate in a container with a tight fitting lid for up to one week.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 tablespoon
Calories: 80
Total Fat: 9.6g
Saturated Fat: 1.1g
Cholesterol: 12.7mg
Sodium: 27mg
Protein: 0.03g

Photos

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: Facebook
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 pounds dry pinto beans well rinsed

12 cups of water

2 tablespoons olive oil

1 tablespoon sea salt

1 tablespoon onion powder

1 teaspoon garlic powder

Directions

Combine all ingredients - pre-soaking beans is not necessary

Use bean/chili button for 45 minutes Natural pressure release for 30 minutes Quick release of all remaining pressure

Stir and enjoy!

Fudgy Black Bean Brownies

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.liveeatlearn.com/black-bean-fudge-brownies/
Serving size: 16 brownies
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

1 15-oz can black beans (rinsed and drained)

3 large eggs

3 Tbsp flavorless oil, like canola or sunflower (45 mL)

1 tsp vanilla (5 mL)

¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder (30 g)

⅔ cup sugar (120 g)

½ tsp baking powder

¼ tsp salt

½ tsp finely ground or instant coffee (optional)

½ cup semi-sweet chocolate chips (60 g)

Directions

1. Wets: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (176 C). Puree black beans in food processor into a rough paste. In a large bowl, mix together the bean puree, eggs, oil, and vanilla. 

2. Dries: In a separate bowl, combine cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, salt, and coffee (if using). Add the dry ingredients to the wets, then stir in chocolate chips.

3. Bake: Grease an 8x8 or 9x9 inch pan, then line with parchment paper. Pour in batter and bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the edges are visibly cooked and the center doesn't jiggle much when you shake the pan (a toothpick may still come out a little gooey, that's fine!)* Allow brownies to cool before cutting.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 brownie
Calories: 117
Total Fat: 5.3g
Saturated Fat: 1.5g
Cholesterol: 31mg
Sodium: 49mg
Total Carbohydrate: 16g
Dietary Fiber: 1.4g
Sugars: 11.4g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Fudgy Black Bean Brownies

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 04 🥚, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.liveeatlearn.com/black-bean-fudge-brownies/
Serving size: 16 brownies
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

1 15-oz can black beans (rinsed and drained)

3 large eggs

3 Tbsp oil (45 mL)

1 tsp vanilla (5 mL)

¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder (30 g)

⅔ cup sugar (120 g)

½ tsp baking powder

¼ tsp sea salt

½ cup semi-sweet chocolate chips (60 g)

Directions

1. Wets: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (176 C). Puree black beans in food processor into a rough paste. In a large bowl, mix together the bean puree, eggs, oil, and vanilla. 

2. Dries: In a separate bowl, combine cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, salt, and coffee (if using). Add the dry ingredients to the wets, then stir in chocolate chips.

3. Bake: Grease an 8x8 or 9x9 inch pan, then line with parchment paper. Pour in batter and bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the edges are visibly cooked and the center doesn't jiggle much when you shake the pan (a toothpick may still come out a little gooey, that's fine!)* Allow brownies to cool before cutting.

Fudgy Black Bean Brownies - Modified

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 04 🥚, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.liveeatlearn.com/black-bean-fudge-brownies/
Serving size: 16 brownies
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

1 15-oz can black beans (rinsed and drained)

3 large eggs

3 Tbsp clarified butter

1 tsp vanilla (5 mL)

¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder (30 g)

⅔ cup molasses

½ tsp baking powder

¼ tsp sea salt

½ cup semi-sweet chocolate chips (60 g)

Directions

1. Wets: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (176 C). Puree black beans in food processor into a rough paste. In a large bowl, mix together the bean puree, eggs, oil, and vanilla. 

2. Dries: In a separate bowl, combine cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, salt, and coffee (if using). Add the dry ingredients to the wets, then stir in chocolate chips.

3. Bake: Grease an 8x8 or 9x9 inch pan, then line with parchment paper. Pour in batter and bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the edges are visibly cooked and the center doesn't jiggle much when you shake the pan (a toothpick may still come out a little gooey, that's fine!)* Allow brownies to cool before cutting.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 brownie
Calories: 117
Total Fat: 5.3g
Saturated Fat: 1.5g
Cholesterol: 31mg
Sodium: 49mg
Total Carbohydrate: 16g
Dietary Fiber: 1.4g
Sugars: 11.4g
Protein: 3g

Garam Masala

Courses:

Source: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/01/homemade-garam-masala-spice-blend-recipe.html

Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1 tbsp ground cumin

3/4 to 1 tsp ground cinnamon

1/2 to 3/4 tsp ground cloves

1/2 tsp ground cardamom

1/4 tsp nutmeg

1. Mix all the ingredients and store in an airtight container for upto 2 months.Add 1 bay leaf, powdered for variation.

Garlic "Cheddar" Rutabega Mash

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.theunskilledcavewoman.com/garlic-cheddar-rutabega-mash-aip-paleo-with-low-fodmap-option/
Serving size: 2
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 lb Rutabega, peeled & cubed into ~1" pieces

1 quart Water, in medium stainless pot

2 Tb ghee

1/4 tsp Himalayan salt

1/4 tsp Nutmeg, ground

1 Tb Nutritional yeast

1/4 tsp Garlic powder

3 Tb hemp milk

Directions

Place prepared rutabaga pieces in pot of water.

Bring to boil, and allow to simmer moderately for 25 minutes, or until fork-tender.

Strain well, return to pot (off the heat).

Add ghee and desired seasonings, and mash well with a sturdy food-masher.

Add almond milk (or bone broth) and stir until incorporated.

Photos

Garlic and Butter Mushrooms

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://foodieandwine.com/garlic-butter-mushrooms/#wpurp-container-recipe-2537
Serving size: 3
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

3 tablespoons olive oil

1 pound 8 ounces Small Button Mushrooms

3 tablespoons clarified Butter

3 teaspoons Minced Garlic

0.19 teaspoon Dry Thyme

Fresh Parsley

Sea Salt

Directions

Sous vide 176°F 30 minutes

1. Turn the Instant Pot on to sauté. Once hot add the olive oil.

2. Add the mushrooms, cap side down and cook for about 5 minutes. Do not move the mushrooms until they have caramelized on the bottom.

3. Add the butter, garlic, thyme and a pinch of salt and toss to coat.

4. Place the top on the Instant Pot and set to cook at "High Pressure" for 12-15 minutes.

5. Let NR for 5 minutes before quick releasing.

6. OPTIONAL- add in another tsp of garlic and butter after cooking to amp up the flavors.

7. Transfer to a serving platter and spoon the butter and garlic sauce over the mushrooms.

8. Season with salt and parsley.

9. Enjoy immediately.

Photos

2. Serve the dip with raw vegetables or your favorite chips.

Garlic basil quark dip - Kilter blog

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://blog.kilter.in/garlic-basil-quark-dip-c167f36df809
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

500 grams full-fat, fresh curd

2 small cloves garlic, finely chopped

1 TBSP Italian Herbs

Sea salt, to taste

Directions

1. Use a clean kitchen clothtostrainthecurd.

2. Bring together the corners of the cloth and squeeze the curd gently.

3. Suspend over a bowl in the refrigerator for a few hours or overnight to let excess water drip.

4. Remove the strained curd into a bowl and use immediately or refrigerate until needed.

5. Mix together quark, garlic, chilli flakes, crushed peppercorns, basil and salt.

6. Make sure all the ingredients are incorporated well and the dip is smooth with no lumps.

7. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days.

8. per serving

9. Calories: 86 kcal

Photos

GARLIC CHEESE RISOTTO

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 08 🌾, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://blog.sousvidesupreme.com/2012/09/garlic-cheese-risotto/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

1 cup (90 g) Arborio rice

1 teaspoon(5 ml) extra virgin olive oil

2 tablespoons (30 ml) roasted minced garlic (jarred)

3 cups (720 ml) chicken or vegetable broth

1 sprig fresh rosemary, leaves only, minced

Salt and pepper to taste

1/3 cup grated Romano cheese

Directions

Fill and preheat the SousVide Supreme to 183F/83C.

Put all ingredients, except the cheese, into a zip-closure cooking pouch.

Use the displacement method (Archimedes Principle) to remove the air and zip the seal.

Submerge the pouch and cook for 45 minutes.

Open the pouch, fluff the rice with a fork, and transfer to a warm serving bowl.

Stir in the cheese and serve.

Photos

Garlic Herb Amaranth Crackers

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.schaer.com/en-us/a/amaranth-flour
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

• 1 cup amaranth flour

• 1 tablespoon fresh chopped rosemary

• 1 teaspoon fresh chopped thyme

• 12 teaspoon fresh chopped oregano

• 12 teaspoon baking powder

• 12 teaspoon salt

• 1 clove minced garlic

• 3 tablespoons olive oil

3 tablespoons water

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Combine the ingredients in a food processor and pulse until it forms a sandy mixture.

3. Turn the mixture out onto a piece of parchment and knead into a smooth dough, adding a little more flour if needed.

4. Flatten the dough and sandwich it between two pieces of parchment paper.

5. Roll the dough out to about 1/5-inch thick and cut it

into 2-inch crackers.

6. Prick the crackers with a fork and place them on the parchment-lined baking sheet.

7. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until the edges are golden

brown.

8. Transfer to a cooling rack to cool and store in an airtight container.

Photos

Garlic Herbed Baked Tempeh

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 25 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1/4 package tempeh

1 tbsp broth

1 tbsp lemon juice

1 clove garlic

1/2 tsp Italian herbs

Dash of sea salt

Directions

Steam tempeh for 10 minutes

Cool

Cut into triangles.

Combine combine remaining ingredients mix well. Toss in the tempeh and marinade for 1 hour.

Bake in NuWave oven for 20 minutes.

Garlic Herbed Grilled Tuna Steaks

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.tasteofhome.com/recipes/garlic-herbed-grilled-tuna-steaks/
Serving size: 4 servings.
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

2 tablespoons lemon juice

1 tablespoon olive oil

2 garlic cloves, minced

2 teaspoons minced fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme

4 tuna steaks (6 ounces each)

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon pepper

Directions

1. In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the lemon juice, oil, garlic and thyme. Add the tuna; seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for up to 30 minutes, turning occasionally.

2. Remove tuna from bag; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drain and discard marinade. Moisten a paper towel with cooking oil; using long-handled tongs, lightly coat the grill rack.

See photos for APO instructions

3. Grill tuna, covered, over medium-hot heat or broil 4 in. from the heat for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare or until slightly pink in the center.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 218
Total Fat: 5g
Cholesterol: 77mg
Sodium: 211mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Protein: 40g

Photos

Garlic Horseradish Mashed Cauliflower

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://eatup.kitchen/garlic-horseradish-mashed-cauliflower/
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 lb. Cauliflower

1 cup Water

1 Tbs Kosher Salt

2 Tbs Unsalted Clarified Butter

2 Tbs Grated Garlic

2 Tbs Horseradish

1/4 Cup Heavy Cream

Salt and Pepper to taste

Directions

1. Bring seasoned water to a boil in a large pot. Break down cauliflower in to smaller pieces, add to pot and cover with lid. Cook for 5-10 minutes until easily broken apart with a spoon. Transfer Cauliflower to a colander to drain.

2. Melt butter in pot over medium low heat. Add grated garlic and heat for 30 seconds to take away the rawness. Stir in horseradish then add the drained cauliflower. Begin mashing the cauliflower in the pot with a wooden spoon. 

3. Remove pot from heat and add heavy cream. Use spoon to incorporate cream and break down the cauliflower. Use potato masher or immersion blender to completely incorporate everything. As the mixture becomes more homogeneous switch to a balloon whisk to incorporate air and make it fluffy. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Photos

Garlic Instant Pot Chicken Thighs

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.tasteandtellblog.com/garlic-paprika-instant-pot-chicken-thighs/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

2 lbs boneless skinless chicken thighs

2 teaspoons smoked paprika

1 teaspoon salt

1/2 teaspoon pepper

3 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided

4 cloves garlic, minced

1 cup chicken broth

1/2 cup heavy cream

1 tablespoon cornstarch

1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese

2 cups fresh baby spinach

Salt and pepper to taste

2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley

Directions

1. Season both sides of the chicken thighs with the smoked paprika, salt and pepper.

2. Press sauté on the Instant Pot and melt 2 tablespoons of the butter. Working in batches, place the chicken thighs in the Instant Pot and cook until browned on both sides, about 3 minutes each side. Remove to a plate.

3. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter and let it melt. Add the garlic and stir until fragrant, about 30-45 seconds. Stir in the chicken broth.

4. Add the chicken back into the Instant Pot. Place the lid on the pot and lock. Select high pressure for 7 minutes.

5. Once the timer goes off, allow a natural release for 3 minutes, then quick release.  Remove the chicken thighs from the pot with a slotted spoon.

6. Press sauté on the instant pot.  Take 2 tablespoons of the heavy cream and whisk it with the cornstarch in a small bowl.  Whisk the remaining cream into the Instant Pot, followed by the cornstarch mixture. Cook, whisking often, until it has lightly thickened. Stir in the Parmesan cheese until melted, then stir in the spinach and allow it to cook until wilted. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Turn off the Instant Pot and add the chicken back into the mixture, allowing the sauce to coat the chicken.

7. Serve the chicken thighs on top of pasta, if desired. Sprinkle the chicken with parsley before serving.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 674
Total Fat: 42g
Saturated Fat: 23g
Cholesterol: 292mg
Sodium: 1723mg
Total Carbohydrate: 6g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 65g

Photos

Garlic Instant Pot Noodles

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.myforkinglife.com/garlic-instant-pot-noodles/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 6 mins

Ingredients

1 cup water

1 cup chicken broth

6 cloves garlic (minced)

2 Tbsp tamari

2 Tbsp brown sugar

1 Tbsp oyster sauce

1 tsp sesame oil

1 tsp chili paste (Sambal Oelek}

8 oz thin spaghetti noodles (broken in half)

Sesame seeds (topping)

Green onion (topping)

Directions

1. Combine water, chicken broth, garlic, soy sauce, brown sugar, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and chili paste in the Instant Pot. Whisk to fully incorporate. 

2. Place broken spaghetti noodles on top, making sure they are spread out in the pot and covered by the liquid.

3. Cover the Instant Pot and cook on High pressure for 6 minutes. Once timer goes off, do a quick release. 

4. Once all pressure is released, open the pot and stir the pasta noodles, allowing the noodles to separate and the sauce to thicken.

5. Serve and top with sesame seeds and green onions if desired. Enjoy :)

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 250

Photos

Garlic Margarita Pizza Egg Wrap!

Courses: Entree
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://cafedelites.com/garlic-margarita-pizza-egg-wrap/
Serving size: 1
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

WRAP:

1 whole egg

1/2 cup liquid egg whites

1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

1 teaspoon fresh chopped basil

Salt to season

FILLING:

1/4 cup grated low fat mozzarella cheese

Directions

1. Whisk 'wrap' ingredients in a bowl. Pour onto a medium sized nonstick pan sprayed with cooking spray. Wait until underside is golden. Carefully peel the egg wrap from the sides of the pan to unstick. With a spatula, flip gently. Place tomato slices and cheese onto egg and cover pan with lid to allow cheese to melt (takes about 1 minute). Once melted, remove wrap and fold over. Garnish with extra basil.

Photos

Garlic Naan Bread Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://thebellyrulesthemind.net/garlic-naan-recipe/
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 6 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

all purpose flour or maida 2 cups

salt ½ tsp

sugar 2 tsp

instant yeast 2 ¼ tsp

oil 3 tbsp

warm milk ¾ cup

butter for basting

garlic 2 tbsp, finely chopped

nigella seeds or black sesame seeds 1 tbsp

cilantro ¼ cup, chopped

Directions

1. You can either use a stand mixer with a dough attachment or with your hands.

2. Add flour, salt, sugar and yeast. Mix well.

3. Now add oil and milk to knead the dough. If using a stand mixer this process will take about 6 minutes on low speed. If kneading with hands knead about 8 minutes until the dough becomes soft and smooth.

4. You can either use an Instant Pot Yogurt mode to proof the dough or proof it at room temperature, if the weather is warm. I prefer to use the Instant Pot as it is the perfectly warm environment to cultivate rapid yeast growth.

5. Grease the pot and place the greased dough in the pot.

6. Cover the dough with a wet cloth to prevent the dough from drying out or forming a skin.

7. Place a lid on the pot. If using the Instant Pot, set the Instant Pot to Yogurt mode on Normal Heat for an hour.

8. When your dough is finished proofing ie: doubled in size removed the dough and punch the dough slightly to release the air.

9. Divide the dough into 8 equal parts and roll them into balls.

10. Take a dough ball and roll it  evenly into an oval shape that it 10 inches long and 6 inches wide. The idea is to stretch the dough.

11. Using a brush apply butter on the top surface of the rolled dough.

12. Sprinkle garlic, cilantro and sesame or onions seeds and lightly roll press them.

13. Heat a pan, once the pan is hot place the rolled dough on the pan with the sprinkles on the top.

14. Cook for a minute or two until you start seeing the bubbles.

15. Flip the side and cook again for a minute until you start seeing the bubbles again.

16. Brush the cooked naan with butter and keep it aside.

17. Repeat the procedure for the remaining dough.

18. Serve warm with a curry.

Photos

Garlic Sauteed Spinach

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 10 🍒, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/ina-garten/garlic-sauteed-spinach-recipe-1944598
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 6 mins
Cooking time: 4 mins

Ingredients

1 1/2 pounds baby spinach leaves

2 tablespoons good olive oil

2 tablespoons chopped garlic (6 cloves)

2 teaspoons sea salt

3/4 teaspoon freshly ground white pepper

1 tablespoon unsalted ghee

Lemon

Directions

1. Rinse the spinach well in cold water to make sure it's very clean. Spin it dry in a salad spinner, leaving just a little water clinging to the leaves.

2. In a very large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil and saute the garlic over medium heat for about 1 minute, but not until it's browned. Add all the spinach, the salt, and pepper to the pot, toss it with the garlic and oil, cover the pot, and cook it for 2 minutes. Uncover the pot, turn the heat on high, and cook the spinach for another minute, stirring with a wooden spoon, until all the spinach is wilted. Using a slotted spoon, lift the spinach to a serving bowl and top with the butter, a squeeze of lemon, and a sprinkling of sea or kosher salt. Serve hot.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 109
Total Fat: 6g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Cholesterol: 5mg
Sodium: 821mg
Total Carbohydrate: 13g
Dietary Fiber: 5.5g
Sugars: 0g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Garlicky Air Fryer Roasted Almonds

Courses: Snack
Categories: 09 🥕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.glueandglitter.com/air-fryer-roasted-almonds-garlic/
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 6 mins

Ingredients

1 tablespoon tamari

1 tablespoon garlic powder

1/4 teaspoon white pepper

2 cups raw almonds

Directions

1. In a large bowl, stir together all of the ingredients, except the almonds, until you have a thick paste. Stir in the almonds, making sure to coat them really well (and really evenly!).

2. Transfer the almonds to your air fryer basket, and cook at 320 for 6-8 minutes, shaking every 2 minutes to prevent sticking and so that they'll cook evenly.

3. Starting at minute 6, you'll want to check in every minute, tasting an almond for doneness. Your almonds are ready when they have hardened a bit but are still a little chewy in the center. They will get crunchier once they’re cooled. Trust me: I have burnt roasted nuts before, because I was waiting for them to get crunchy all the way through. Don’t be like me!

4. Let them cool to room temperature – about 10-15 minutes – then transfer to your storage container of choice.

5. Your Air Fryer Roasted Almonds will keep for 2-3 days in an airtight container at room temperature. And, I’ll be honest, I kept mine for a full week and lived to tell the tale. But officially, I am saying 2-3 days.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 132

Photos

Ghee

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Butter, unsalted

Directions

Put butter in inner liner.

Saute

Set your temperature to 240°F for about 25 minutes 

set your temperature to 275°F

Notes

https://www.jessicagavin.com/how-to-make-ghee/

To successfully make ghee, the process starts with simmering butter between 221 to 244°F to evaporate the water. The temperature is then elevated to above 266 °F so the lactose, casein and whey proteins experience the Maillard reaction. Browning the milk solids adds wonderfully toasted flavors that become infused with the butter oil. To prevent burning of the milk solids, the butter should not reach its smoke point of 350°F. You can use an instant-read thermometer for more accuracy to check the temperatures.

Photos

Ghee in the Nuwave Oven

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source: https://paleospirit.com/how-to-make-ghee-in-the-oven/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/2 pound of organic, pasture butter

Directions

1. Place butter in a Pyrex 4 cup measuring cup.

2. Set rack to one inch and place Pyrex with the butter in center.

3. Set temperature to 250° F, and time for 1:15 and start.

4. Set temperature to 270° F and time for 0:05 and start. Check for browning of milk solids. REPEAT if necessary.

5. Allow to cool slightly, about ten minutes.

6. Strain and store

Notes

https://www.jessicagavin.com/how-to-make-ghee/

To successfully make ghee, the process starts with simmering butter between 221 to 244°F to evaporate the water. The temperature is then elevated to above 266 °F so the lactose, casein and whey proteins experience the Maillard reaction. Browning the milk solids adds wonderfully toasted flavors that become infused with the butter oil. To prevent burning of the milk solids, the butter should not reach its smoke point of 350°F. You can use an instant-read thermometer for more accuracy to check the temperatures.

Photos

Ginger Oil

Ginger Turmeric Cauliflower

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: http://realfoodandlove.com/ginger-turmeric-cauliflower/
Serving size: 2 quarts
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 garlic cloves (peeled and smashed)

2- inch knob of fresh ginger (grated)

2- inch knob of fresh turmeric (grated)

Enough cauliflower florets to fill two quart-sized jars

Cabbage leaf (torn to fit or something else to keep cauliflower below brine)

2 % brine (I used 5 cups of brine total, but you may need more or less)

Directions

1. In the bottom of two quart-sized mason jars, evenly divide the garlic, ginger, and turmeric.

2. Fill both jars with enough cauliflower to below the "shoulder" of the jar.

3. Place the cabbage leaf on top and add enough brine to top the cauliflower by an inch.

4. Top with a tight lid, a coffee filter secured with a rubber band, or a fermenting lid.

5. Leave to ferment at room temp for at least three days or until the desired flavor is reached. I let mine ferment five days.

6. If using a tight lid, burp daily. If using a coffee filter, spray with vinegar daily to deter mold. If using a fermenting lid, sit back and enjoy the show. 🙂

7. Once your ideal flavor is reached, store cauliflower in the fridge for months.

Photos

Gingerbread Homemade Larabars

Courses: Snack
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://leitesculinaria.com/88638/recipes-homemade-larabars.html
Serving size: Makes 6 bars
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Mild olive oil, vegetable, or coconut oil, for the pan

1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates

1/2 cup raw almonds

1/2 cup raw pecans

3/4 teaspoon ground ginger

1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon,

1/8 teaspoon ground cloves.

Directions

1. Rip off a large piece of parchment paper or plastic wrap, press it into a 9-by-5-inch loaf pan, and, if using plastic wrap, slick it with a little oil.

2. Combine the cherries, dates, and warm water in a small bowl. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes, until the fruit is soft. The exact timing will vary according to the dryness of the fruit. Drain the fruit and pat it dry with paper towels. (If the dried fruit you’re using is already super soft and moist, you can skip the soaking step.)

3. Meanwhile, place the almonds in a food processor and process until finely chopped but not paste-like.

4. Add the drained fruit, cinnamon, and salt (if using), to the food processor and pulse until the fruit is finely chopped and the larabar mixture begins to stick together and clump against the sides of the bowl and your processor starts hopping on the counter just a little. This could take up to 2 minutes.

5. Transfer the larabar mixture to the prepared loaf pan. (Alternatively, you can form the mixture into any size or shape you can imagine. Go a little crazy.) Place  a large piece of parchment paper or wrap slicked with oil atop the bar mixture and use it to spread and flatten the mixture evenly in the pan. (If you have a second loaf pan, you can nestle it inside the first and press the pan down to evenly flatten the mixture.) Leave the paper or wrap in place. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

6. Using the paper or wrap hanging over the edge of the pan, lift the bar mixture from the pan and transfer it to a cutting board. Discard the paper or wrap and cut the rectangle into 6 bars. Tightly wrap each bar in wrap. The bars will keep at room temperature for up to 3 days, in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks, or in the freezer for up to 3 months (let the frozen bar thaw for 1 hour before attempting to bite into it).

Notes

Gingerbread Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1/2 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup raw pecans, 3/4 teaspoon ground ginger, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves.

PB & J Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1/2 cup packed dried cherries, 3/4 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw or roasted peanuts, 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional). [Editor’s Note: The use of peanuts makes this version not acceptable on the whole30 plan.]

Cappuccino Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water,

1/2 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup raw cashews, 1 tablespoon roasted coffee beans, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Tropical Escape Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup dried, unsweetened pineapple, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw cashews, 1/4 cup dried, unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, and 1 tablespoon finely grated tangerine or orange zest (preferably organic).

Oatmeal Raisin Cookie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup raisins, 1 cup warm water, 3/4 cup raw cashews, 3/4 cup old-fashioned or quick-cooking rolled oats, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Blueberry Cobbler Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup packed dried blueberries, 1/4 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 3/4 cup raw walnuts or raw pecans, 1/2 cup old-fashioned rolled oats, 1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Carrot Cake Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1/2 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1/4 cup raisins, 1/4 cup dried, unsweetened pineapple, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw walnuts, 1/4

cup peeled, shredded carrots, 1/4 cup unsweetened flake or shredded coconut, 2 teaspoons coconut oil, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Apricot Ambrosia Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups dried apricots, 1 cup warm water, 2/3 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Key Lime Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 cup packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1 cup raw cashews, 1/3 cup unsweetened flaked or shredded coconut, 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 2 teaspoons finely grated lime zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Lemon Pie Larabars

Prepare the bars according to the above recipe, substituting the following ingredients: 1 1/4 cups packed, pitted, soft whole dates, 1 cup warm water, 1/2 cup raw almonds, 1/2 cup raw cashews, 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest (preferably organic), and 1/8 teaspoon fine sea salt (optional).

Cinnamon Roll Larabar

200 g Medjool dates (1 cup, tightly packed)

60 g walnuts (3/4 cup)

60 g almonds (3/4 cup)

55 g raisins (1/4 cup tightly packed)

2.5 tsp cinnamon

pinch salt

Cinnamon Roll Larabars

1 cup golden raisins

1/4 cup dates

1/2 cup almonds

1/2 cup walnuts

2 1/2 tsp cinnamon

1/8 tsp sea salt

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 219

Photos

Gluten Free Cracker Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://wholelifestylenutrition.com/recipes/appetizers-snacks/gluten-free-cracker-recipe/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 cup white rice flour

1/3 cup of water

2 tbsp melted butter

1/2 tsp sea salt

tapioca flour for dusting

coarse sea salt and butter to top crackers (optional)

additional spices and herbs (optional)

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 325ºF.

2. In a food processor, place the white rice flour and 1/2 tsp sea salt. Pulse several times to mix.

3. Add in butter and pulse a few times.

4. Slowly add in water until a ball of dough forms. If the dough is too crumbly, add a bit more water, if it becomes too wet, knead in a little tapioca flour. It is an easy dough to work with.

5. On a floured surface (I did this right on a baking sheet), roll out dough very thin. The thinner the better. If dough starts to stick, dust with some tapioca flour to prevent sticking.

6. Cut the dough with a pizza cutter into 1 inch squares. With a fork, poke holes throughout the dough.

7. Brush with some more melted butter and coarse sea salt (this is optional, but I love a buttery and salty cracker).

8. Bake for 12-20 minutes (time varies depending on how thin the dough is).

9. Crackers are done when they become slightly golden.

Photos

Gluten Free Fish Sticks

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections: TVDR Entrees
Source: https://www.momables.com/allergy-friendly-homemade-fish-sticks/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

cup 1/2 cup gluten-free all-purpose flour

1/4 cup oat milk

2 tablespoons ground flax

1 cup gluten-free bread crumbs

1/4 cup Parmesan cheese or vegan Parmesan topping

1 teaspoon ground paprika

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/2 teaspoon pepper

1 pound cod fillets

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 425F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, and set aside.

2. Add flour to a plate and set aside. Pour the coconut milk into a shallow dish and set aside.

3. In a separate shallow dish, combine the flax meal, bread crumbs, Parmesan, paprika, salt, and pepper.

4. Using paper towels, pat dry each fillet of Cod before slicing into 1/2-inch thick strips.

5. To dredge, dip each fish piece into the flour, then the milk, and finally, the crumb mixture, coating both sides and pressing lightly to adhere.

6. Place the fish sticks onto the baking sheet, spacing them about an inch apart, and bake for 20 minutes, until golden brown, flipping once halfway through.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 6 fishsticks
Calories: 121
Total Fat: 3.7g
Saturated Fat: 2.9g
Cholesterol: 13.8mg
Sodium: 372.5mg
Total Carbohydrate: 12.9g
Dietary Fiber: 1.4g
Sugars: 0.1g
Protein: 6.8g

Photos

Gluten-Free Bread Made With 100% Non-Glutinous Rice Flour

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://cookpad.com/us/recipes/146046-gluten-free-bread-made-with-100-non-glutinous-rice-flour?via=email
Serving size: 1 serving
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

250 grams 100% non-glutinous rice flour

220 ml Water (warm water if the room temperature is cold)

3 grams Salt

15 grams Sugar

15 grams Honey or rice syrup

15 grams Skim milk powder

10 grams Cornstarch (or katakuriko)*

3 grams Dry yeast

* Or water chestnut starch

Directions

1. If your bread maker includes kneading blades for rice flour, please fit them into the machine now.

2. Place all of the ingredients except for the rice flour and yeast into the bread case.

3. Add the rice flour into the bread maker last and place the yeast into the designated chamber.

4. Set the course to "Rice Flour Bread" (and to a "Gluten-free" setting if you have it), and the colour to "Pale". Then press "Start".

5. About 15 minutes into the course, open up the bread maker and push any dough that has stuck to the sides back to the bottom of the bread case and incorporate it into the rest of the dough. (My bread maker performs this function automatically.)

6. Just before the bread is due to finish baking, take it out of the bread maker. Baking time may vary depending on the brand of bread maker so please adjust these times accordingly.

7. It's ready! If the bread dries out, it may go hard so please cover it with a damp cloth before leaving it to cool.

8. So that the bread doesn't dry out, please store it in a plastic bag or keep it wrapped in cling film. Please slice the bread only once it has fully cooled. If you slice it while it's still hot, you will ruin the texture.

9. If you can't scrape down any dough that gets stuck to the side of the bread maker you may end up with a bread covered in odd lumps. If that happens then please just cut the lumps away with a knife.

10. Store-bought rice flour mixes often contain thickening agents so I added cornstarch. I'm still trying to decide on the right amount, though.

Photos

Gluten-Free Buckwheat Scones

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://hormonesbalance.com/recipes/gluten-free-buckwheat-scones/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 tablespoon ground flaxseed meal

2 ½ tablespoons water

¼ cup raw honey

½ cup coconut oil, softened

4 tablespoons almond milk (or other nut milk of choice)

1 ½ cup buckwheat groats (or 1 ¾ cup buckwheat flour) - where to buy

1 teaspoon gluten-free baking powder

2 teaspoons lemon zest

1 teaspoon chopped fresh rosemary

Pinch of salt

Directions

1. Pre-heat oven to 350F (180C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silpat

2. Combine flaxseed meal with water to create a flax egg. Set aside.

3. Grind buckwheat groats in your blender ½ cup at a time, until you have 1 ¾ cup of buckwheat flour. (If you already have buckwheat flour, you can skip this step.)

4. In a large bowl, mix honey and coconut oil together, and then add in flax egg and almond milk and mix until combined.

5. In a medium bowl, combine buckwheat flour, baking powder, lemon zest, chopped rosemary and salt and mix well.

6. Add dry ingredients to the bowl with the wet ingredients and mix until you get a thick, homogeneous cookie dough.

7. Shape the dough into a small disc and place on the prepared baking sheet.

8. Slice dough into 6 pieces (like you would slice a pizza) and separate each piece slightly, leaving 2 inches of space between each piece.

9. Bake scones for 10 to 12 minutes, until the bottom of scones are golden brown.

10. Serve scones warm with coconut oil or ghee.

Photos

Gluten-Free Buckwheat Waffles

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://cookieandkate.com/gluten-free-buckwheat-waffles/
Serving size: 5 small waffles
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

1 cup buckwheat flour

1 tablespoon sugar (I used coconut sugar)

1 1/4 teaspoons baking powder

1 teaspoon baking soda

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon cinnamon

1 1/4 cups buttermilk, shaken (see notes to learn how to make your own with any kind of milk)

1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) melted butter or coconut oil

1 large egg

Topping suggestions: maple syrup, almond butter and/or fresh banana slices

Directions

1. Preheat your waffle iron. If desired, preheat oven to 200 degrees Fahrenheit to keep waffles warm until you’re ready to serve.

2. In a medium-sized mixing bowl, whisk together the buckwheat flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.

3. In a liquid measuring cup or another bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, melted butter and egg. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and stir them together until there are only a few small lumps remaining. Give it a few more stirs if you see any liquid that hasn’t fully incorporated. Commenter Monisha says her waffles turn out lighter and more crispy if she lets the batter rest for 5 to 10 minutes, so you might want to give that a try.

4. Pour batter onto the hot waffle iron plates, close the waffle iron and cook until the waffles are barely letting off steam and they are lightly crisp to the touch (this might take longer than your waffle iron suggests). Carefully lift waffle out of the waffle iron and serve immediately or place in the oven to keep warm. Avoid stacking the waffles or they will lose their crispness. Repeat with remaining batter as necessary. Serve with maple syrup, almond butter and/or sliced banana on top.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 603
Total Fat: 36.3g
Saturated Fat: 26.6g
Cholesterol: 109.8mg
Sodium: 1130.2mg
Total Carbohydrate: 57.7g
Dietary Fiber: 6.2g
Sugars: 15.1g
Protein: 15.6g

Photos

Gluten-Free Cauliflower Bread Recipe by Tasty

Courses:
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://tasty.co/recipe/gluten-free-cauliflower-bread
Serving size: 8 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Olive oil cooking spray

1 large head cauliflower

6 large eggs, separated

1 ½ cups almond flour

¼ cup grated parmesan cheese, optional

5 cloves garlic, minced

1 tablespoon baking powder

5 tablespoons clarified butter, melted

1 pinch Sea salt

1 teaspoon italian seasoning

white sesame seed, for garnish

fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish

fresh rosemary, chopped, for garnish

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease a 9x5-inch (23x13-cm) loaf pan with nonstick spray.

2. Cut the cauliflower into florets and add to a food processor. Pulse until the cauliflower reaches a “rice”-like consistency. You should have 3-4 cups. (900 g)

3. Transfer the riced cauliflower to a large microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 4 minutes to steam the cauliflower and release its liquid. Let sit until cool enough to handle.

4. Transfer the riced cauliflower to a bowl lined with cheesecloth or a tea towel. Tightly wrap the cauliflower and squeeze out all of the liquid, until it is dry and crumbles between your fingers. Set aside.

5. Separate the yolks and whites of the eggs into two large bowls. Beat the whites with an electric hand mixer until stiff peaks form.

6. Add about ¼ of the beaten whites to the bowl of yolks. Then, add the almond flour, Parmesan, if using, garlic, baking powder, butter, and salt. Gently mix with a rubber spatula until combined.

7. Add the remaining egg whites, dried cauliflower, and Italian seasoning. Gently fold the ingredients together until just combined. Do not overmix, as this will break down the egg whites.

8. Transfer the mixture to the prepared loaf pan and sprinkle the top with sesame seeds, parsley, and rosemary.

9. Bake for @ 350°F 45-50 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown.

10. Let cool, then slice and serve as desired.

11. Nutrition Calories: 1844 Fat: 158 grams Carbs: 73 grams Fiber: 32 grams Sugars: 20 grams Protein: 60 grams

12. Enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 285
Total Fat: 23g
Total Carbohydrate: 9g
Dietary Fiber: 4g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 12g

Photos

Grain-Free Fudgy Brownies

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://detoxinista.com/grain-free-fudgy-brownies/
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1/4 cup ghee melted

1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce

1 cup organic date sugar

1 teaspoon vanilla extract

2 large eggs

1/4 teaspoon baking soda

1/2 cup cocoa powder

1/4 teaspoon sea salt

1/2 cup ground almond pulp*

Directions

1. Preheat your oven to 350F, and line an 8"x8" glass dish with parchment paper. Combine all of the ingredients in a large mixing bowl, and stir well to combine into a thick batter.

2. Pour the batter into the parchment-lined dish, and bake at 350F for 20-25 minutes, until the edges are pulling away from the sides of the pan and the center is firm.

3. Allow to cool completely before slicing and serving.

4. These brownies are so rich and fudgy, you may find that they are difficult to slice without some of the fudgy middles sticking to the knife. I recommend chilling the brownies in the fridge or freezer to make the cutting process go more smoothly, then allow to thaw to room temperature, if you like.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 205
Total Fat: 7g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 47mg
Sodium: 133mg
Total Carbohydrate: 29g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 25g
Protein: 10g

Photos

Greek Salad

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.cookingclassy.com/greek-salad/
Serving size: 5 servings
Preparation time: 20 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 medium english cucumber

1/2 small red onion

3/4 cup Castelvetrano olives, (drained and sliced)

1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese

1 medium avocado diced

Directions

1. Add all of the dressing ingredients to a small mixing bowl and whisk well to blend, season with salt to taste and store in refrigerator until ready to use.

2. Add tomatoes, cucumber, onion, bell pepper, olives, avocado and feta to a salad bowl. 

3. Drizzle dressing over top and gently toss to evenly coat. Add dressing within a few minutes of serving for best results.

4. Recipe Source: inspired by Simply Recipes

Nutrition

Dietary Fiber: 1g

Greek Turkey and Rice Skillet

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.budgetbytes.com/greek-turkey-rice-skillet/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 Tbsp olive oil

2 cloves garlic, minced

19 oz. Ground turkey, 97% lean

1 tsp dried oregano

1/4 tsp sea salt

1 cup long grain brown rice, uncooked

1/4 lb frozen cut leaf spinach

1/3 cup pimento

1/2 cup green olives, sliced

1.5 cups chicken broth

handful fresh parsley

1 fresh lemon

1 oz feta

Directions

1. Add the olive oil and garlic to a large deep skillet and sauté over medium heat for 1-2 minutes, or until the garlic is fragrant. Add the ground turkey, oregano, and salt to the skillet. Continue to sauté until the turkey is cooked through (about 5 minutes).

2. While the turkey is cooking, slice the olives and pimentos. Once the turkey is cooked through, add the rice, frozen spinach (no need to thaw first), olives, and pimentos to the skillet. 

3. Add the chicken broth and stir until everything is very well combined. Place a lid on the skillet, turn the heat up to medium high, and allow it to come up to a boil. Once it reaches a boil, turn the heat down to low or medium low, and allow it to gently simmer for 15 minutes. Use the lowest level of heat that maintains a steady simmer in the skillet.

4. After 15 minutes, give the skillet a brief stir, replace the lid quickly, turn off the heat, and allow it to sit for an additional 10 minutes.

5. While the skillet is resting, zest half of the lemon and slice it into wedges. Roughly chop the parsley. Give the skillet a final fluff and stir, then top with lemon zest, parsley, and crumbled feta. Serve with lemon wedges to squeeze over top.

Photos

Green Juice Pulp Crackers

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.cleaneatingkitchen.com/green-juice-pulp-crackers-dehydrated/
Serving size: 12
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 12 hours

Ingredients

Pulp from 1 bunch of juiced kale leaves and stems and 1 bunch of parsley (about 1 1/2 cups of pulp total)

1/4 cup flax meal

1/4 cup chia seeds

1 tablespoon tamari

1/4 cup nutritional yeast

1/4 cup water

Directions

1. Combine ingredients in a food processor and whirl until combined.

2. Pour mixture onto a dehydrator sheet or baking sheet and flatten as much as possible using a spatula. Then, use a knife to score batter into crackers.

3. Dehydrate on 120 degrees for 12 hours and flip. Dehydrator for another 12 hours (24 hours total) or until completely dry and crispy.

4. If using an oven, use the minimum temperature setting with the convention fan on and keep a close eye on them so they don’t burn. I did have not tried making them in an oven so I cannot recommend how long it will take to cook them (let me know if you try it this way!).

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 57
Total Fat: 1.5g
Saturated Fat: 0.2g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 78.6mg
Total Carbohydrate: 3.4g
Dietary Fiber: 3.6g
Sugars: 0.2g
Protein: 3.4g

Photos

Ground Meat Stew with Crock Pot Option

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://lowcarbyum.com/easy-hamburger-stew-recipe/
Serving size: 10 people
Preparation time: 20 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

2 tablespoons olive oil

2 pounds ground turkey or ostrich

1 small onion (chopped)

3 cloves garlic (minced)

32 ounces chicken, turkey or ostrich bone broth

15 ounce pumpkin puree (canned or fresh)

10 ounces radishes (chopped)

4 stalks celery (sliced)

1 1/2 tablespoons sea salt

1 teaspoon dried oregano

1 teaspoon dried basil

1 teaspoon parsley flakes

1/2 teaspoon marjoram

1/4 teaspoon sage

10 ounces spinach (chopped (fresh or frozen))

Directions

1. Stove-Top:

2. Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium heat. Add ground meat, onion, and garlic. Cook until meat has browned.

3. Add in broth, pumpkin, radishes, celery, and spices. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and let simmer covered for 20 minutes.

4. Add spinach and cook covered for another 10 minutes. Adjust seasonings as needed.

5. Crock Pot:

6. Brown ground meat with onion and garlic then transfer to the slow cooker if needed.

7. Add in broth, pumpkin, radishes, celery, and spices. Cook on low for 4-6 hours. Spinach can be added during the last 1-2 hours of cook time.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 cup
Calories: 301
Total Fat: 21g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 64mg
Sodium: 1190mg
Total Carbohydrate: 7g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 20g

Photos

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.food.com/recipe/ground-turkey-and-rice-soup-486780
Serving size: 12
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1⁄4 cups rice, uncooked

1 TBSP dehydrated celery

1 TBSP dehydrated onion

1 cube frozen chicken stock

1/4 cups water

1/4 teaspoon season salt

1 teaspoon cumin

Directions

Place cup of water in instant pot.

Place ingredients in container on trivet inside instant pot.

Set for 22 minutes on high. Allow 18 minutes natural pressure release.

Ground Turkey in Instant Pot

Courses:
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://amindfullmom.com/instant-pot-ground-beef/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 7 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1-2 pounds ground turkey

Directions

1. Cover bottom of pot with 1 cup water. Add in trivet and place frozen or fresh ground meat directly on trivet. 

2. Put the lid on the Pressure Cooker and turn valve to seal. 

3. Set to High Pressure for 20 minutes if frozen, 6 minutes if fresh. 

4. Once finished cooking, do a quick release and then with pot holders, carefully remove trivet from Instant Pot. 

5. Discard cooking liquid and grease and break up ground meat using a spatula into desired size. Use as desired.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 155
Total Fat: 5g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Cholesterol: 70mg
Sodium: 74mg
Protein: 24g

Photos

Ground Turkey Pasta

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://ifoodreal.com/ground-turkey-and-broccoli-pasta/
Serving size: 1 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

4 ounces ground turkey

1 tablespoon dehydrated onion

1 tablespoon dehydrated celery

1 tablespoon dehydrated Carrot

1/4 cup Dehydrated mushrooms

1/4 tablespoon olive oil, extra virgin

1/8 tsp garlic

1 tsp parsley

3/4 cup lentil pasta

3/4 cup water

1/4 teaspoon sea salt

1/2 cup California vegetables

Parmesan cheese, for serving

Directions

1. In a French press, add all dried items and California veggies, cover with hot water, set plunger to keep ingredients in hot water and set aside to rehydrate.

2. Saute ground turkey and cook for 5 minutes, breaking into pieces and stirring with spatula. Drain and measure water and adjust as needed. Add pasta, water, salt; stir and level with spatula.

3. Then cover and cook on low heat for 10-12 minutes, checking after 10 minutes. Brown rice and any gluten free pasta cooks faster than wheat.

4. When pasta is al dente (not too soft, so it doesn't become a mush), turn off heat. Stir, cover and let stand for 5 minutes.

5. Serve and top with Parmesan.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 1/2 cups
Calories: 340
Total Fat: 9.9g
Saturated Fat: 2.1g
Cholesterol: 52.2mg
Sodium: 461.8mg
Total Carbohydrate: 43.4g
Dietary Fiber: 7.1g
Sugars: 4.5g
Protein: 24.1g

Photos

Gyro Meat Turkey Sous Vide

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 pound ground turkey

2 tsp freeze dried garlic

1/2 tablespoon sea Salt

1/2 tablespoon Dry Oregano Powder

1/2 tablespoon White Pepper

1/2 tablespoon Onion

Directions

3:30hrs @ (150°F / 65.5°C)

Process all ingredients into a paste using Ninja Ultra

Using Madax Ham Maker, make a tight roll.

Sous vide for 3:30.

Sear

Alternatively, use small rectangular containers and press to 1/2" and sous vide for no more than 45 minutes.
