Indian Spiced Ghee

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.savorylotus.com/indian-spiced-ghee/#tasty-recipes-19274
Serving size: about 1 and 1/2 cups
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 1/2 cup ghee

2 tsp mustard seed

2 tsp cumin seed

4 tsp turmeric

2 tsp coriander powder

1/2 tsp cumin powder

1 tsp ginger powder

1/2 tsp cinnamon powder

3 tsp fennel seeds

5 whole cardamom pods crushed

Directions

1. Gently heat 1/4 cup ghee in a heavy bottom pan on LOW-MEDIUM.

2. Once melted, add mustard and cumin seeds and turn down heat to LOW. Allow to cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring once in a while.

3. Meanwhile place rest of spices in a small bowl.

4. Add spice mix to pot and continue to cook on LOW for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. The spices will become fragrant.

5. Pour in the rest of the ghee and allow to warm on LOW for 20 minutes, uncovered. Be sure that it is very LOW. The ghee should not bubble in any way. The low heat is just to help the spices infuse.

6. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 30 minutes.

7. Strain with a fine mesh strainer into a glass jar. Enjoy!

Photos

Indian Style Rice

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 08 🌾, 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/indian_style_rice/
Serving size: Serves 1
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1/4 cup long-grain basmati rice

2 cups water

1/2 teaspoon sea salt

a pinch of ground cloves

1/4 tsp ground cardamom

1/4 tsp ground cinnamon

1 Tbsp ghee

1/8 tsp ground mustard

1/8 tsp ground cumin

1/4 medium onion, chopped

1 chopped garlic clove

A pinch of turmeric

Directions

1. Rinse and soak rice: Place rice in a sieve and run cool water through it to rinse it until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in cool water for 30 minutes. Drain.

2. Boil rice with cloves, cardamom, cinnamon: Bring 8 cups of water and the salt to a boil in a large pot. Add the rice and stir. Add the cloves, cardamom and cinnamon and simmer for 10 minutes.

3. Taste the rice, and test if it is done to your taste; rice can take more or less time to cook depending on how old it is. If still too firm, cook a few minutes longer.

4. Drain rice and rinse with cold water, remove spices: When the rice is cooked to your liking, drain the rice into a colander and rinse with cold water to stop if from cooking.

5. Remove the cloves, cardamom and cinnamon and discard. Set the rice aside to drain.

6. Sauté mustard seeds, cumin, chili flakes, then onion: In a pan large enough to hold the rice, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the mustard and cumin seeds and the chili flakes.

7.

8. Cook until the mustard seeds start popping, then add the onion. Sauté until the onion begins to brown, about 5-7 minutes.

9. Add garlic, then rice and turmeric: Add the garlic and sauté another 2-3 minutes. Add the rice and mix well. Sprinkle the turmeric over the rice and mix well. Cook for another 3-4 minutes, stirring often.

Photos

Instant Hummus

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.trail.recipes/blog/dehydrating123-make-instant-hummus/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Any prepared Hummus

Directions

Spread the hummus paste on dehydrator trays covered with non-stick sheets or parchment paper.

Dehydrate at 130°F/ 55°C for about 2-4 hours or until completely dry and crumbly.

Let cool to room temperature, then grind dehydrated hummus into a powder.

Divide dehydrated hummus into individual portions (about 2 heaped tablespoons each) and pack them in medium-sized zip lock bags. Store in a dark, cool place.

On the trail:

(To rehydrate one portion)

Add 2-3 tablespoons of cold water and 1 tablespoon or 1 packet of xtra virgin olive oil into the bag with the powdered hummus. Close the bag and squeeze/knead it in your hands until well combined.

Enjoy with crackers, pita, tortilla or bagel.

Notes

Phyllis Hobson, author of Making and Using Dried Foods, says:

Well-dried foods will vary from a [residual] moisture content of 5 percent for leafy vegetables, such as spinach, to 25 percent for juicy acid fruits, such as apricots. Percent of moisture may be checked by weighing the product before and after drying. For example, a food weighs 16 ounces (400 g) before drying. After 8 hours of drying, the food weighs 8 ounces (200 g). In this case you have 50 percent reduction in weight by the removal of moisture. Continue drying until there is no further reduction of weight… Most fruit should have about 20 percent moisture content [left]when dried, while vegetables will have about 10 percent moisture.” [1]

Photos

Instant Pot (Pressure Cooker) Bone Broth

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://nomnompaleo.com/20120117quick-pressure-cooker-bone-broth
Serving size: 8 cups
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

2 medium leeks (cleaned and cut in half crosswise or 1 onion, peeled and quartered)

1 medium carrot (peeled and cut into three pieces)

2.5 pounds emu leg bones

8 cups water (enough to cover the bones but not more than 2/3rd the capacity of the pressure cooker)

Directions

1. Toss the leeks and carrots in the pressure cooker or Instant Pot (make sure it’s at least 6-quarts), and toss in your bones (frozen is fine). Then, cover with water (make sure you don’t fill more than two-thirds capacity!).

2. Add the vinegar (optional) fish sauce, and dried shiitake mushrooms (optional).

3. Then, cover and lock the lid, and program your Instant Pot to cook under high pressure for 30 to 50 minutes. (I let it go for 50 minutes if I’m cooking meaty shanks or oxtails). If I’m not in a rush, I set my Instant Pot on high pressure for 2 hours—the broth only gets better with more time.

4. If you're using a stovetop pressure cooker, place the pot on a burner set on high heat. Once the indicator pops up showing that the contents of the pot have reached high pressure, immediately decrease the temperature to the lowest possible setting to maintain high pressure (low is normally adequate). Set the timer for 30 minutes. When the timer goes off, turn off the burner and remove the pot from the heat.

5. When the broth is done cooking in the Instant Pot or stovetop pressure cooker, let the pressure release naturally (10-15 minutes).

6. Remove the lid, skim of the scum (if you desire), and strain the broth. Taste for seasoning and adjust if needed. You can keep it on the blander side if you will be cooking with it!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 20
Total Fat: 1g
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Protein: 1g

Photos

Instant Pot Adzuki Beans

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://adamantkitchen.com/instant-pot-adzuki-beans/
Serving size: 6 cups
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 pound Adzuki beans (about 2 cups)

4 cups water

Directions

1. Place adzuki beans in the instant pot and add water. (beans can be soaked or un-soaked, see note)

2. Seal the pressure cooker lid and set the vent to sealed.

3. Select high pressure and set the timer. See recipe notes for times.

4. When the instant pot has finished cooking, allow the pressure cooker to naturally depressurize for at least 10 minutes before releasing the remaining pressure and opening.

Photos

Instant Pot Almond Milk

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.sparklestosprinkles.com/instant-pot-almond-milk/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 4 mins

Ingredients

1 Cup Raw Almonds

1 Cup Water

4 Cups Filtered Water

Directions

1. Add 1 cup of water (tap okay) & almonds

2. Close your lid and set to sealing.

3. Set your pot to manual high pressure for 4 minutes. Once cooking cycle completes do a quick release.

4. Drain almonds and rinse under cool water while removing skins. They will peel off pretty easily while running under water.

5. Pour peeled almonds and 4 cups of spring water into a strong powered blender.

6. Blend for a full 4 minutes using the highest speed

7. Strain using a nut milk bag or cheesecloth. Give it a few real good squeezes at the end to ensure you are getting all of the milk.

Photos

Instant Pot Apple Cider Turkey Breast

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 12 ☕
Collections:
Source: https://mondayismeatloaf.com/instant-pot-apple-cider-turkey-breast/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 20 mins
Cooking time: 50 mins

Ingredients

1 turkey breast (thawed, about 3 pounds)

1 herb bouquet (thyme, rosemary, parsley, sage, chives, and basil)

1/2 gallon apple cider (can substitute with apple juice)

1/2 cup sea salt

1/2 cup sugar

10 garlic cloves (smashed )

2 lemons (quartered)

1 cup turkey broth (RECIPE)

1/2 onion (sliced)

1 celery stalk (sliced)

1 carrot (peeled and sliced)

3 tbsp arrowroot

3 tbsp water

Sea salt to taste

Directions

1. Combine apple cider, kosher salt, and dark brown sugar in a large pot on the stove. Heat until the salt and sugar dissolve then remove from heat.

2. Add brining ingredients to brining solution reserving half the herb bouquet.

3. Take the other half of the her bouqet and place inside the turkey cavity. Set the turkey breast into the brining solutions, cover, and leave in the refrigerator overnight or 24 hours. A full 24 hours is best.

4. Add the sliced onion, celery, and carrot along with the chicken broth to the Instant Pot. Add rack on top. Place turkey in Instant Pot and seal lid.

5. Cook on high (normal) pressure for 30 minutes then follow with a 10 minute natural pressure release. Allow the meat to rest for 10 minutes prior to slicing and deboning.

6. If desired, brown in oven on broil for 5-10 minutes.

7. To make a gravy combine the cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Turn the pressure cooker on to saute. Add the cornstarch slurry, and stir until thickened. You can add additional cornstarch slurry if you like. Salt and pepper the gravy to taste.

8. Serve immediately or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to one week.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 156
Total Fat: 2g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 70mg
Sodium: 420mg
Total Carbohydrate: 6g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 28g

Photos

Instant Pot Baked Oatmeal with Peanut Butter & Chocolate Chips

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://thefoodieeats.com/instant-pot-baked-oatmeal/
Serving size: 12
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour

Ingredients

2 Tbsp. butter (melted)

1/2 cup brown sugar

2 eggs

1/2 cup peanut butter

1 tsp. vanilla extract

1 cup milk

3 cups quick-cooking oats

2 tsp. baking powder

1/2 tsp. sea salt

1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips

Directions

1. Pour melted butter into a mixing bowl. Add brown sugar and mix. Then add eggs and whisk together. Next, add peanut butter and vanilla extract and mix again. For the last wet ingredient, pour in milk and mix until fully combined.

2. In a separate large mixing bowl, add all dry ingredients – oats, baking powder, and salt. Mix them to combine.

3. Pour wet ingredients into bowl with the dry and mix until fully incorporated. Finally, add chocolate chips and give one last mix.

4. Spray a 7-inch pan with nonstick cooking spray. Pour in batter and spread out evenly. Then cover with foil.

5. Add a 3-inch trivet to pot, along with 1 1/2 cups of water. Place pan on top of trivet, lock lid, and cook for 60 minutes at high pressure. 

6. Once cook time is complete, quick-release pressure. Remove pan, uncover, and allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 223
Total Fat: 12g
Saturated Fat: 4g
Cholesterol: 35mg
Sodium: 198mg
Total Carbohydrate: 23g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 14g
Protein: 6g

Photos

Instant Pot BBQ Chicken Wings recipe

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.crunchycreamysweet.com/instant-pot-bbq-chicken-wings-recipe/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

3 lbs chicken wings (cut, tips discarded)

3 tablespoons molasses

1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/2 cup water

1/2 cup BBQ sauce

Directions

1. Place trivet in the Instant Pot insert. Add 1 cup of water to the bottom of it.

2. In a small bowl, whisk together brown sugar, cayenne, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper. Set aside.

3. Trim chicken wings if needed (see note), sprinkle with spice mix and rub it in with your fingers. Arrange chicken wings on the trivet. Close the IP lid, set the valve to "sealing" position and make sure the IP is set to high pressure. Press "manual" setting and adjust timer to 5 minutes. The IP will beep after a few seconds and start coming to pressure. 

4. Once done, the pressure cooker will beep. Press "cancel/off" button. Let the IP release pressure naturally for 10 minutes. Then, flip the valve to "venting" position and release any remaining pressure. Carefully open the lid away from your face. Remove chicken wings and place on a plate or in bowl. 

5. Pour BBQ sauce over chicken wings. Toss gently to coat. 

6. To finish off in the oven: arrange chicken wings on aluminum foil lined baking sheet. Place under broiler and broil for 2 to 5 minutes or until the skin looks caramelized. Remove from oven, let cool and serve. 

7. To finish off on a grill: place sauce coated chicken wings on grill, over the fire, and cook until the sauce is caramelized, flipping over as needed. Remove, let cool and serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 506
Total Fat: 29g
Saturated Fat: 8g
Cholesterol: 141mg
Sodium: 968mg
Total Carbohydrate: 24g
Sugars: 20g
Protein: 34g

Photos

Instant Pot Bean and Bacon Soup

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://withtwospoons.com/instant-pot-bean-and-bacon-soup/
Serving size: 10 servings
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

1 Tablespoon olive oil

2 cups onion, chopped ((approximately 1 very large onion))

2 cups carrot, diced ((approximately 2-3 large carrots))

1/2 cups celery, diced ((approximately 1-2 ribs of celery))

1 tablespoon maternot paste

8 cups chicken stock

16 ounces turkey bacon, cooked and chopped into small pieces

1 pound dried great northern beans

2 bay leaves

1 sprig of thyme

1 teaspoon salt

Directions

1. Using the Sauté function on your Instant Pot, heat the olive oil.

2. Add onion, carrot, and celery. Sauté for 5 minutes.

3. Add maternot paste and stir.

4. Turn off Sauté function.

5. Add chicken stock, chopped bacon, dried beans, bay leaves, thyme, salt and pepper.

HIGH 35 NPR

6. Secure lid. Press the manual button, set to 35 minutes.

7. Allow to cook.  Keep in mind that it will likely take 15 minutes or so to come to pressure.

8. When finished cooking, allow natural pressure release.  This will add another 20-30 minutes to the cooking time.  (Total time in the Instant Pot approximately 80 minutes).

9. Ladle into bowls, season with additional salt as desired.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 439

Photos

Instant Pot Beans With Sausage

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.simplyhappyfoodie.com/instant-pot-red-beans-rice-sausage/
Serving size: 8 - 10
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 55 mins

Ingredients

2 TBSP Olive Oil

1 Large Yellow Onion ((2 cups diced))

3-4 stalks Celery, ((2 cups diced))

7 cloves Garlic, (pressed or minced)

3 Bay Leaves

1/2 tsp Sage, (dried)

1/2 tsp Basil, (dried)

1 Tbsp Cajun / Creole Seasoning ((such as Tony Chachere's, or my Cajun Spice Blend) or more to taste)

5 cups Chicken Broth, (low sodium)

1 lb Small white Beans sorted & rinsed)

1 1/2 lbs Turkey Kielbasa sliced in 3/4" rounds

1/4 cup Parsley, (chopped)

Directions

1. Turn the pressure cooker on to the Sauté setting. Add the bacon and cook, stirring occasionally, until it renders the fat. Remove the bacon and set aside (You won't be adding it in, you just want the fat). If using bacon fat, let it heat up and then proceed.

2. If you are using Andouille sausage, add it and brown on both sides. Then remove. If using kielbasa, don't brown it, add it with the beans.

3. Add the onions and celery. Cook for a couple of minutes, scraping the bottom of the pot to get the brown bits up (deglaze). You may need to add just a splash of the broth to help loosen it.

4. Add the garlic, bay leaves, sage, and basil. Cook, stirring frequently, until onion is translucent. 

5. Add seasoning, and stir.

6. Add the broth, beans, and sausage. Stir and put the lid on the pot and lock it in place. Set the steam release knob to the Sealing position.

7. Cancel the Sauté function and press the Beans button, or Pressure Cook/Manual, then press the + or - to choose 40 minutes (High Pressure).

8. When the cooking cycle has finished, let the pot sit undisturbed for 20 minutes (20 minute natural release). Then manually release the remaining pressure by turning the steam release knob to Venting.

9. When the pin in the lid drops down, you can open the lid. Carefully stir the beans with a long handled spoon (be aware of any possible steam pockets as they "burp" and can cause burns).

10. Taste a few of the beans to make sure they are tender. If not, close the lid and cook for 5 more minutes.

11. Mash some of the beans and stir to make a more creamy consistency. Taste and add more seasoning if desired. Stir in the chopped parsley.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 523

Photos

Instant Pot Beef Stroganoff

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://fitfoodiefinds.com/instant-pot-beef-stroganoff/?_gl=1*h0icxo*_ga*MWkydHZTcDFwY0pEU0F4T3RBYUZZYjhyWmltb2dpLV9PN3B2LVM2aEtCWWc5VFVBSVlIUVJHUGJlOGN4Y21GTA..
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 45 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour 15 mins

Ingredients

2-lb. beef chuck roast

1 teaspoon coarse sea salt, separated

1 teaspoon ground pepper, separated

2 teaspoons brown sugar

2 tablespoons olive oil, divided

1.33 cups beef broth, separated

8-oz. crimini mushrooms, sliced

1/4 teaspoon table salt

1 medium white onion, chopped and separated

3 cloves garlic, minced

1/4 cup dry red wine

1.5 tablespoons Worcestershire

12-oz. extra-wide egg noodles

3/4 cup 2% Greek Yogurt (option to use sour cream for a more classic beef stroganoff)

Directions

1. First, make the dry rub. Mix together coarse sea salt, ground pepper, and brown sugar in a small bowl.

2. Then, season the beef roast with the dry rub. Be sure that the rub covers the entire piece of meat including the sides. Let the meat sit for 15 minutes.

3. Next, turn on the Instant Pot’s ‘saute’ feature and add 1 tablespoon of olive oil. When olive oil is fragrant sear the beef roast for 2 minutes on each side or until browned.

4. Remove beef and deglaze the pot with 2 tablespoons of beef broth and then add another tablespoon of olive oil to the pot. Use a wooden utensil to scrape the brown bits from the bottom.

5. When olive oil is fragrant, add mushrooms and 1/4 teaspoon of salt to the pot and saute for 4-5 minutes or until browned. Remove mushrooms from pot and set aside for later.

6. Add 1/2 of the white onion (you will be adding the rest of the onion in later) and garlic to the pot and saute for 3 minutes.

7. Finally, add red wine, 1 cup of beef broth, and Worcestershire to the pot. Mix well and then return the beef roast back into the pot. Cover the Instant Pot and cook on high pressure for 75 minutes.

8. When the timer goes off, quick-release the pressure from the Instant Pot and remove the beef roast from the pot and place it on a baking sheet. The beef roast should be easy to pull apart with two forks. If it’s not, it needs to cook longer. Set beef aside.

9. Add the sauteed mushrooms, the remaining onion, and uncooked egg noodles to the pot. Mix well and place the top back on the Instant Pot and cook for an additional 2 minutes on high pressure.

10. Meanwhile, shred the beef using two forks. The beef should fall apart easily and shred with minimal effort.

11. When the timer goes off, quick release pressure one last time from the Instant Pot and remove the cover. Add the Greek yogurt and the remaining broth (~1/3 cup) to the pot, mix well and add the shredded beef back into the pot.

12. If needed, turn the sauté feature on to heat everything up for a couple of minutes. Eat immediately or turn the Instant Pot’s ‘warm’ setting to keep the beef stroganoff warm until ready to serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1/8
Calories: 393
Total Fat: 24g
Sodium: 558mg
Total Carbohydrate: 17g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 3g
Protein: 27g

Photos

Instant Pot Beets

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-beets/?utm_source=fbIPRO&utm_medium=lk
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

6 (1 3/4 lb, 784g) medium beets ((7.5” circumference))

1 cup (250ml) cold water

Directions

1. Prepare Beets: Rub and wash the beets under cold running tap water. If your beets come with greens & stems, trim them off and save them for another dish (stir-frying with garlic tastes great). Trim off & discard the roots.

2. Pressure Cook Beets: Pour 1 cup (250ml) cold tap water in the pressure cooker. Place a trivet or steamer basket in the Instant Pot, then place 6 medium beets (784g, 7.5” circumference) on the trivet. Close the lid and cook at High Pressure for 24 minutes (firm and a little crunchy) - 28 minutes (soft with some chew) + Quick Release (immediately release the pressure by turning the venting knob to venting position). Carefully open the lid.*Pro Tip 1: Adjust the cooking time according to your beets' size using the time chart below.Beets Pressure Cooking Time Chart:Pressure Cooking Method: High Pressure, then Quick ReleaseBeets Circumference: Texture Preference (Firm & a little crunchy - Soft with some chew)5 inches: 11 - 15 minutes5.5 inches: 14 - 18 minutes6 inches: 17 - 21 minutes6.5 inches: 18 - 23 minutes7 inches: 20 - 25 minutes7.5 inches: 24 - 28 minutes8 inches: 27 - 31 minutes8.5 inches: 30 - 34 minutes9 inches: 32 - 36 minutes

3. Peel and Serve: The skins are edible. To peel or not to peel is of personal preference. Cut beets into quarters (you can wear disposable gloves to handle the beets if you don't want beet-stained fingers). Season with salt if desired and serve hot or cold.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 56
Sodium: 101mg
Total Carbohydrate: 12g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 8g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Instant Pot Black Bean Soup

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/food-network-kitchen/instant-pot-black-bean-soup-3649853
Serving size: 8 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

7 Cups water

2 tablespoons vegetable oil

1 medium white onion, chopped

5 cloves garlic, thinly sliced

4 teaspoons chili powder

1 1/2 teaspoons ground cumin

1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano

2 1/2 cups dry black beans, picked over and non-beans removed

2 bay leaves

Kosher salt and freshly grated black pepper

Sliced avocado, cilantro leaves, chopped scallions, lime wedges and sour cream, for serving

Directions

1. Set the Instant Pot® (see Cook's Note) to normal saute. Add the oil and once shimmering, but not smoking, add the onion and cook, stirring, until translucent and soft, about 5 minutes.

2. Add the garlic, chili powder, cumin and oregano and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the beans, bay leaves and 7 cups water. Follow the manufacturer's guide for locking the lid and preparing to cook. Set to pressure cook on high for 1 hour.

3. After the pressure cook cycle is complete, follow the manufacturer's guide for quick release and wait until the quick release cycle is complete. Careful of any remaining steam, unlock and remove the lid and remove the bay leaves. Then remove 1 cup of the beans with a slotted spoon and set aside. Use an immersion blender to blend the black beans with 1 tablespoon salt until thick and creamy. Stir in the reserved whole beans and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with sliced avocado, cilantro leaves, chopped scallions, lime wedges and sour cream.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 240
Total Fat: 3.5g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 480mg
Total Carbohydrate: 40g
Dietary Fiber: 6g
Sugars: 6g
Protein: 12g

Photos

Instant Pot Black Beans

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-black-beans/
Serving size: 4 -6
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 1 hour 40 mins

Ingredients

1 pound (454g) black beans (, unsoaked)

1 (240g) onion (, chopped)

8 (27g) garlic cloves (, chopped)

6 cups (1.5L) unsalted chicken stock ((or 4 cups chicken stocks + 2 cups cold water))

1 teaspoon (2.7g) ground cumin

1 teaspoon (0.6g) oregano

3 (0.4g) bay leaves

1 tablespoon (15ml) olive oil

Cilantro (, chopped)

½ teaspoon coarse sea salt

Directions

1. Saute Onion in Instant Pot: Heat up Instant Pot using "Sauté More" function. Wait until it says "HOT" (~8 mins). Add 1 tbsp (15ml) olive oil in Instant Pot. Add in chopped onions, then saute for 3 minutes.

2. Add Spice & Garlic: Add in 1 tsp (2.7g) ground cumin, 1 tsp (0.6g) oregano, and 3 bay leaves. Saute for another minute. Add in minced garlic, then saute for 30 seconds.

3. Deglaze Instant Pot: Pour 1 cup (250ml) unsalted stock in Instant Pot, then deglaze by scrubbing all the flavorful brown bits off the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon. Give it a quick mix.

4. Pressure Cook Black Beans: Add in 1 lb (454g) black beans and ½ tsp coarse kosher salt. Pour in 5 ½ cups (1.25L) unsalted chicken stock, then give it a quick mix. With Venting Knob in Venting Position, close the lid, then turn Venting Knob to Sealing Position. Pressure Cook at High Pressure 50 minutes + Natural Release 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, release the remaining pressure by turning Venting Knob to Venting Position. When Floating Valve drops, open the lid carefully.*Pro Tip: Adding salt to the black beans will not make it tough.

5. Season Black Beans: Taste and season black beans with more salt (for reference, 3 - 4 large pinches of salt worked best based on our testings).

6. Serve Instant Pot Black Beans: You can serve the black beans as a yummy side dish, topping, filling, or a simple Black Beans Soup. *Pro Tip: If serving as a Black Beans Soup, boil the black beans in Instant Pot (use "Saute High" function for another 4 - 5 minutes. This will add some more body to the soup. Stir occasionally. Garnish your black beans with chopped cilantro, then serve. Enjoy!~ :)

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 183
Total Fat: 4g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 268mg
Total Carbohydrate: 26g
Dietary Fiber: 7g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 12g

Photos

Instant Pot Black Beans - AL

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-black-beans/
Serving size: 4 -6
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 1 hour 40 mins

Ingredients

1 pound (454g) black beans (, unsoaked)

6 cups (1.5L) chicken stock or water

1TBSP sea salt

For 15 oz can:

1/2 cup beans

Scant 2 cups liquid

Directions

Pressure Cook Black Beans:

Add in 1 lb (454g) black beans and ½ tsp sea salt. Pour in 6 cups unsalted chicken stock, then give it a quick mix.

With Venting Knob in Venting Position, close the lid, then turn Venting Knob to Sealing Position. Pressure Cook at

High Pressure 50 minutes + Natural Release 20 minutes.

After 20 minutes, release the remaining pressure by turning Venting Knob to Venting Position. When Floating Valve drops, open the lid carefully.*Pro Tip: Adding salt to the black beans will not make it tough.

Instant Pot Boiled Peanuts

Courses: Snack
Categories: 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://yellowglassdish.com/instant-pot-boiled-peanuts/
Serving size: 10
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour 20 mins

Ingredients

2 lb Raw or Green* peanuts

1/2 c Grey salt (or Kosher)

6 Cloves garlic pressed

Water to cover (about 3 qts)

1 Tbsp dried parsley

Directions

1. Rinse peanuts thoroughly.

2. Optional: soak overnight especially if they’re not green peanuts.

3. Place peanuts in the electric pressure cooker pot.

4. Add seasonings (spices are optional, garlic is a must).

5. Cover the peanuts with water (1” above peanutabout 3 qts for 2 lbs of peanuts.

6. Set electric pressure cooker to manual, high pressure, and cook for 80 minutes

7. Let the steam naturally release.

8. Serve warm (traditional roadside) or cool. Store peanuts in brine until ready to serve.

9. Strain the peanuts before eating. Don’t drink the brine.

10. Peanuts can be stored in the fridge for up to 8 days. Boiled peanuts can also be frozen.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 256

Photos

Instant Pot Bone Broth That Gels

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://40aprons.com/instant-pot-bone-broth-gels-whole30/
Serving size: 24 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 3 hours 20 mins

Ingredients

2.5 pounds emu marrow bones

filtered water

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350° Fahrenheit. Spread marrow bones out on a cooking sheet. Roast 20 minutes. Carefully turn bones over, then roast another 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.

2. Transfer roasted bones to Instant Pot. Pour a little water on the cooking sheet. Use a spatula or whisk to loosen browned bits leftover from bones, then pour water, fat, and browned bits into the Instant Pot.

3. Cook on Manual Low Pressure for 180 minutes, then natural release. Let cool to touch.

6. Place a mesh strainer over a large bowl and gently pour broth over strainer. Discard bones and veggies. Pour broth into glass jars with tight fitting lids, or into plastic freezer bags.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 8 ounces
Calories: 96
Total Fat: 8g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 41mg
Sodium: 84mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 6g

Photos

Instant Pot Bone Broth That Gels (Whole30, Anti-Inflammatory)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://40aprons.com/instant-pot-bone-broth-gels-whole30/
Serving size: 24 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 3 hours 35 mins

Ingredients

2.5 pounds emu marrow bones

1 carrot (sliced)

1 celery stalk (sliced)

2-4 garlic cloves (smashed)

white peppercorns (a few, to taste)

sea salt (Himalayan pink salt or Celtic sea salt recommended)

sprigs of fresh rosemary and/or thyme (several, to taste)

filtered water

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350° Fahrenheit. Spread marrow bones out on a cooking sheet. Roast 20 minutes. Carefully turn bones over, then roast another 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.

2. Transfer roasted bones to Instant Pot. Pour a little water on the cooking sheet. Use a spatula or whisk to loosen browned bits leftover from bones, then pour water, fat, and browned bits into the Instant Pot.

3. Add bones to the pot.

4. Place carrot, celery, garlic, a few peppercorns, fresh herbs, and plenty of sea salt in the Instant Pot. Pour filtered water until 2/3 full, then secure lid with valve in Sealing position.

5. Cook on Manual Low Pressure for 180 minutes, then natural release. Let cool to touch.

6. Place a mesh strainer over a large bowl and gently pour broth over strainer. Discard bones and veggies. Pour broth into glass jars with tight fitting lids, or into plastic freezer bags.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 8 ounces
Calories: 96
Total Fat: 8g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 41mg
Sodium: 84mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 6g

Photos

Instant Pot Bone Broth That Gels (Whole30, Anti-Inflammatory)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://40aprons.com/instant-pot-bone-broth-gels-whole30/
Serving size: 24 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 3 hours 35 mins

Ingredients

2.5 pounds beef marrow bones (usually "beef bones" at the store)

2.5 pounds necks or feet (beef or chicken)

1-2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar (optional)

1 carrot (sliced)

1 celery stalk (sliced)

2-4 garlic cloves (smashed)

black peppercorns (a few, to taste)

sea salt (Himalayan pink salt or Celtic sea salt recommended)

sprigs of fresh rosemary and/or thyme (several, to taste)

filtered water

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350° Fahrenheit. Spread marrow bones out on a cooking sheet. Roast 20 minutes. Carefully turn bones over, then roast another 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.

2. Transfer roasted bones to Instant Pot. Pour a little water on the cooking sheet. Use a spatula or whisk to loosen browned bits leftover from bones, then pour water, fat, and browned bits into the Instant Pot.

3. If using apple cider vinegar, add necks and feet to the pot and pour vinegar over. Let sit for 30 minutes then proceed with recipe.

4. Place necks, feet, carrot, celery, garlic, a few peppercorns, fresh herbs, and plenty of sea salt in the Instant Pot. Pour filtered water until 2/3 full, then secure lid with valve in Sealing position.

5. Cook on Manual Low Pressure for 180 minutes, then natural release. Let cool to touch.

6. Place a mesh strainer over a large bowl and gently pour broth over strainer. Discard bones and veggies. Pour broth into glass jars with tight fitting lids, or into plastic freezer bags.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 8 ounces
Calories: 96
Total Fat: 8g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 41mg
Sodium: 84mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 6g

Photos

Instant Pot Bread

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.idonthavetimeforthat.com/instant-pot-bread/
Serving size: 1 loaf
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

1 cup warm water

1 1/4 teaspoons yeast

1/2 Tablespoon salt

2 1/4 cups all purpose flour

Directions

1. Line and grease a 6-8" cake pan that can fit easily inside your instant pot.

2. Place the trivet in your Instant Pot and add 1 cup water.

3. In a large bowl, combine the water, yeast and salt. Let the yeast proof for about 3 minutes, then start adding in the flour.

4. This is a no-knead recipe, so just mix the dough by hand until no dry patches appear.

5. Fold the dough out into the prepared cake pan.

6. Place the cake pan in the IP and place the lid on top (do not need to secure).

7. Select the "keep warm setting" and let the dough rise for 2 hours.

8. After the dough has doubled, you can refrigerate or continue baking.

9. Secure the Instant Pot lid and select manual (or pressure cook for newer models) for 45 minutes.

10. When timer is up, allow for a full natural release.

11. If desired, toast the bread under the broiler of your oven for 5 minutes to achieve a nice browned look.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 g
Calories: 1073
Total Fat: 4g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 3514mg
Total Carbohydrate: 221g
Dietary Fiber: 12g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 35g

Photos

Instant Pot Brown Rice

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 08 🌾
Collections:
Source: https://kristineskitchenblog.com/instant-pot-brown-rice/
Serving size: 5 cups
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 22 mins

Ingredients

2 cups long grain brown rice

2 cups water

Directions

1. Place rice in a fine-mesh strainer and rinse under cold water. Drain well.

2. Pour the rice into your Instant Pot. Add the water and stir to combine. Make sure that all of the rice is in the water and that no grains of rice are on the sides of the Instant Pot.

3. Close the Instant Pot lid and turn the steam valve to the sealing position.

4. Set the Instant Pot to pressure cook (manual) at high pressure for 22 minutes.

5. When it beeps to let you know that the cook time has finished, allow the pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes (just leave the Instant Pot alone).

6. After the 10 minute natural release, carefully turn the steam valve to the venting position. I like to use the handle of a long spoon to do this. Wait while the rest of the steam escapes. Once the pin has dropped down, carefully open the Instant Pot lid.

7. Fluff rice and serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 /2 cup
Calories: 136
Total Fat: 1g
Sodium: 2mg
Total Carbohydrate: 28g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Instant Pot Brown Rice +3 Flavors to Try!

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.onelovelylife.com/instant-pot-brown-rice/
Serving size: 2 cups cooked rice (4 1/2 cup servings)
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 37 mins

Ingredients

1 cup brown rice, rinsed

1 1/4 cup water or low-sodium broth

1/4 tsp. salt

Directions

1. If you haven’t already, rinse the rice in a fine-mesh sieve (this will remove excess starch and prevent your rice from being sticky). Rinse for at least 30-60 seconds, or until the water runs clear.

2. Pour rinsed rice into your Instant Pot.

3. Pour water over the rice, being sure to cover it.

4. Add the salt and cover with the lid.

5. Secure the lid of the Instant Pot and double-check that the pressure valve is set to “SEALING” not “VENTING.”

6. Press “PRESSURE COOK” button and set timer for 22 minutes. Cook rice on manual pressure for 22 minutes. (It will take 5-8 minutes to come to pressure).

7. Naturally release the pressure 10 minutes.

8. Quick-release any remaining steam.

9. Press CANCEL to turn off the heat. Open the lid and fluff the rice with a fork.

FOR CILANTRO-LIME BROWN RICE: When the rice is finished cooking, stir in 1/4-1/2 cup minced cilantro and squeeze the juice of 1/2 lime and a pinch of salt. Taste and add additional lime juice, if desired.

FLAVOR 2: GARLIC HERB BROWN RICE

To make Instant Pot garlic herb brown rice, I melt a little butter or ghee (you can use olive oil for a vegan version!) in a small pan on the stovetop and add 1 clove minced garlic, 1 Tbsp fresh parsley (or 1-2 tsp. freeze-dried parsley), 1/4 tsp. salt, 1/4 tsp. pepper, and 1/4 tsp. red pepper flakes and stir to infuse the butter. When the rice is done, just stir the melted herb butter into the rice!

Photos

Instant Pot Brown Rice and Sausage Stuffing (21 Day Fix)

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://confessionsofafitfoodie.com/instant-pot-brown-rice-sausage-stuffing-21-day-fix/
Serving size: 6-12 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

2 cups brown rice

2 cups organic chicken stock or broth

1 lb raw sweet Italian chicken or turkey sausage, casing removed

4 tsp olive oil, divided

6 celery stalks, chopped

1 large onion, chopped

1 container sliced fresh mushrooms (I used baby bellas)

salt and fresh cracked pepper to taste

Directions

1. Set Instant Pot to saute and add 2 tsp of olive olive to the bottom of the inner liner. Add chicken sausage to pan to brown. Once cooked through, remove from pan and set aside.

2. Add remaining 2 tsp of olive oil to pot and add onions and celery. Season with some salt and pepper and saute for 2-3 minutes or until onions start to turn translucent. Add in mushrooms and season again. Saute for an additional 2-4 minutes or until the mushrooms begin to brown.

3. Add sausage back to the pot and stir in the rice and broth. Cover pot and set to 22 minutes on manual, high pressure. When cook time is up, do a ten minute natural release before switching over to quick release.

4. Adjust seasonings to taste and enjoy!

Photos

Instant Pot Brown Rice Stuffing

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://confessionsofafitfoodie.com/instant-pot-brown-rice-sausage-stuffing-21-day-fix/
Serving size: 6-12 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 cups brown rice

1 cups organic turkey stock or broth

4 tsp clarified poultry herb infused, divided

3 celery stalks, chopped

1/2 large onion, chopped

1 container sliced fresh mushrooms

Sea salt

Directions

1. Set Instant Pot to saute and add 2 tsp of olive olive to the bottom of the inner liner. Add chicken sausage to pan to brown. Once cooked through, remove from pan and set aside.

2. Add remaining 2 tsp of olive oil to pot and add onions and celery. Season with some salt and pepper and saute for 2-3 minutes or until onions start to turn translucent. Add in mushrooms and season again. Saute for an additional 2-4 minutes or until the mushrooms begin to brown.

3. Add sausage back to the pot and stir in the rice and broth. Cover pot and set to 22 minutes on manual, high pressure. When cook time is up, do a ten minute natural release before switching over to quick release.

4. Adjust seasonings to taste and enjoy!

Instant Pot Candied Nuts

Courses: Snack
Categories: 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.sparklestosprinkles.com/instant-pot-candied-nuts/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

4 cups plain & unsalted nuts (cashews, pecans, walnuts, almonds etc)

2/3 cup pure maple syrup

1/2 tbsp vanilla extract

1/2 tbsp cinnamon

1/2 tsp nutmeg

1/4 tsp Cayenne Pepper (optional for some kick)

1/2 tsp salt

1/2 cup water

SUGAR COATING

1/2 cup brown sugar

1/2 cup sugar

1 tsp Cinnamon

Directions

1. Turn Instant Pot onto saute. Add nuts, syrup, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. Saute for about 5-10 minutes. Stir constantly to prevent burning.

2. Turn saute off. Add 1/2 cup of water. Close the lid, make sure itâs in the sealing position.

3. Press Pressure (it should automatically set to HIGH pressure). Set time to 10 minutes. Hit START.

4. While nuts are cooking, preheat oven to 350Â° F.

5. When timer is up, do a quick release. Give the nuts a good stir. Pour onto a non stick baking sheet and arrange in a single layer. Bake in preheated oven for 5 minutes then take out and flip. Place nuts back in the oven for another 5-10 minutes. 

6. When the timer is up, take nuts out and allow them to cool completely. Enjoy!

7. While nuts are pressure cooking, add sugars and cinnamon to a gallon size plastic bag. Shake up to mix.

8. Take nuts out of the oven and cool about 5-10 minutes.

9. Pour nuts into plastic bag.

10. Coat the nuts in two batches if you can not fit them all in at once.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 12
Calories: 387
Total Fat: 24g
Saturated Fat: 4g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 224mg
Total Carbohydrate: 38g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 29g
Protein: 9g

Photos

Instant Pot Carrots

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 07 🧈, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://realandvibrant.com/instant-pot-carrots/
Serving size: 2-3 servings
Preparation time: 3 mins
Cooking time: 12 mins

Ingredients

1 lb carrots

1 cup water

1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil

Salt and pepper, to taste

Optional: fresh herbs (parsley, chives, cilantro)

Buttery Herbed Carrots: for a buttery flavor, replace the olive oil with melted grass-fed butter. Add fresh herbs and toss. Pro-tip: it’s best to melt the butter before adding it to the carrots.

Honey Cinnamon Carrots: replace the fresh herbs and pepper with 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1 teaspoon of honey, to taste. Add a pinch of salt.

Honey Herb Carrots: replace the olive oil with melted grass-fed butter and 1 teaspoon of honey, to taste. Omit the pepper.

Garlicky Lemon Carrots: combine the olive oil (or butter), salt, and pepper with minced or crushed garlic cloves and lemon juice for a delicious garlicky lemon flavor.

Directions

1. Rinse and peel the carrots. Slice off the ends and slice diagonally.

2. Add water to the Instant Pot and arrange carrots.

3. Close the Instant Pot lid, set the valve on "sealing", and cook on high pressure for 2 minutes. Once completed carefully quick release the steam, remove the lid, and drain the carrots.

4. In a separate bowl, toss the carrots with extra-virgin olive oil, salt, pepper, and fresh herbs (if using). Serve and enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 154
Total Fat: 7.6g
Saturated Fat: 1.1g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 235.1mg
Total Carbohydrate: 21.8g
Dietary Fiber: 6.4g
Sugars: 10.8g
Protein: 2.2g

Photos

Instant Pot Cauliflower Potato Salad

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 10 🍒, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.inthekidskitchen.com/healthy-food/instant-pot-cauliflower-potato-salad/
Serving size:
Preparation time: 7 mins
Cooking time: 13 mins

Ingredients

1 head cauliflower

1 cup water

4 hard-boiled eggs

1-1/2 cups mayo or greek yogurt

1 tbsp. lemon juice

1 tbsp. yellow mustard

1 tsp. salt

2 stalks celery

1/2 onion

Directions

1. Hard boil your eggs either in a saucepan or the instant pot. (To prepare in the instant pot, see note.)

2. Chop the cauliflower florets into 1" pieces.

3. Place the cauliflower in the IP along with 1 cup of water.

4. Place the lid on the IP and seal. Set to manual for 5 minutes. Quick release.

5. Drain the cauliflower using a colander and then place in a medium-sized bowl.

6. Chop up the eggs and stir into the cauliflower.

7. Chop the celery and onion and add in to the cauliflower-egg mixture, then the remaining ingredients and mash together using a fork or an electric mixer until you achieve the texture that you prefer.

8. Place 1 cup of water and in your instant pot and carefully add in the eggs.

9. Select manual setting and reduce time to 8 minutes. Quick release.

10. Place the eggs in the fridge until cool slightly for easiest shell removal.

Photos

Instant Pot Cauliflower Soup

Courses: Entree
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source: https://mountainmamacooks.com/instant-pot-cauliflower-soup/
Serving size: 8 servings
Preparation time: 20 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

3 tablespoons butter

1 small onion, diced

1 carrot, diced

1 large or 2 small heads of cauliflower broken into small florets (about 8 cups)

4 cups vegetable stock

1 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese

1/2 cup heavy cream

1 teaspoon kosher salt

1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper

5 slices whole wheat sandwich bread, cubed (about 2 cups)

2 tablespoons butter, melted

kosher salt

garlic powder

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 325F degrees.

2. Turn the Instant Pot on to sauté mode and add the butter. Once melted, add the diced onion, carrot and a pinch of kosher salt and cook 2-3 minutes, just until the onion is softened. Add the cauliflower florets and vegetable stock to the pot. Lock the Instant Pot lid into place. Using the manual setting, cook the soup on high pressure for 5 minutes. Quick release the pressure.

3. While the soup cooks, make the croutons. Add the cubed bread to a large rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle the melted butter evenly over the bread and then sprinkle with a large pinch of kosher salt and medium pinch of garlic powder; toss to combine. Bake the croutons in a preheated oven for 12-15 minutes until golden and starting to brown at the edges. Remove from oven and let cool.

4. Remove Instant pot lid. Carefully, use an immersion blender or high powered blender to puree the soup. I used my Vitamix and pureed the soup in 2 batches though an immersion blender would be easier so you can keep the soup in the Instant Pot! If using a blender, put soup back into Instant Pot.

5. Turn the Instant Pot to the warm setting. Add the grated cheese, cream, salt and pepper. Stir for 2-3 minutes to melt the cheese and warm the soup through. Adjust seasoning if needed.

6. Ladle soup into bowls and top with a handful of croutons and a pinch of fresh parsley if desired.

Photos

Instant Pot Chicken and Yellow Rice

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 07 🧈, 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.loveandzest.com/instant-pot-chicken-yellow-rice/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 35 mins

Ingredients

1 teaspoon olive oil

1 yellow onion, small diced (1 cup chopped or 160g)

2 cups brown basmati rice (363g)

1 3/4 cup 33% reduced sodium chicken broth

1 cup thinly sliced fresh carrots (150g)

1 cup frozen peas (146g)

2 teaspoons ground turmeric

1/4 tsp saffron

1 teaspoon packed fresh oregano leaves

1 bay leaf

1/2 teaspoon thick crystal kosher or sea salt (divided)

1.25 pounds raw chicken breast

Directions

1. Using 6 qt Instant Pot, turn on to SAUTE mode on NORMAL heat. Heat olive oil and sauté onions until translucent, 3 minutes. Press CANCEL to turn off Instant Pot.

2. Add broth and brown rice to the pot and mix with onions. Stir in carrots, frozen peas, frozen corn, turmeric, saffron, oregano, bay leaf and season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. IMPORTANT: Stir the rice and veggies to make sure to fully incorporate vegetables with the rice.

3. Arrange chicken breasts on top of rice mixture; season with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.

4. IMPORTANT: Push chicken down into the rice with some veggies on top of the chicken.

5. Secure lid on Instant Pot, and turn nozzle to SEALING. Cook on MANUAL setting with HIGH PRESSURE for 25 minutes.

6. IMPORTANT NOTE: It takes 15 minutes for this dish to reach pressure!! Don't worry, it will get there.

7. Once time is up, allow pressure to go into KEEP WARM mode for 10 minutes to allow the pressure to release some naturally. Then press CANCEL on the Instant Pot and twist the steam release handle on the lid to the VENTING position.

8. Once steam has released and fully depressurized, open Instant Pot lid to shred the chicken and gently fluff into the rice mixture with a fork. Be sure not to "overmix" chicken and rice mixture. Carefully remove the inner pot to prevent the rice from sticking to the bottom. Serve warm.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1/6 recipe
Calories: 424
Total Fat: 4g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 55mg
Sodium: 533mg
Total Carbohydrate: 66g
Dietary Fiber: 5g
Sugars: 9g
Protein: 34g

Photos

Instant Pot Chicken Bone Broth

Courses:
Categories: 02 🐔, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.wenthere8this.com/chicken-bone-broth/
Serving size: 16 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 2 hours

Ingredients

1 chicken carcass and/or 2 lbs. total chicken bones ((see notes))

1 large onion, (quartered)

2 carrots, (cut in half)

2 stalk celery, (cut in half)

1 tsp. White peppercorns

1 bay leaf

Directions

1. Combine all the ingredients in the Instant Pot. Add water to cover the bones, plus 2-3" if room in the Instant Pot. Cook on high pressure for 120 minutes. Let pressure release naturally for 10 minutes, then use the manual release.

2. Use in recipes or drink by itself. If drinking, add salt to taste.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 0.5 cups
Calories: 7
Sodium: 9mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g

Photos

Instant Pot Chicken Mole

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 09 🥕, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://pressureluckcooking.com/recipe/instant-pot-chicken-mole/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2-4 pounds of skinless chicken thighs (bone-in or out is fine and you can use breasts too, but I love thighs for this)

Kosher salt, for seasoning the chicken (a few shakes)

Black pepper, for seasoning the chicken (a few shakes)

2 tbsp (1/4 stick) of salted butter

2 tbsp of vegetable oil

1 medium Spanish or yellow onion, diced

1 tbsp of crushed garlic

1/2 tbsp of chili powder

1/2 tbsp of ground cumin

1/2 tsp of ground cinnamon

1/2 tsp of oregano

1/2 cup chicken broth (1/2 cup of water + 1/2 tsp of Chicken Better Than Bouillon)

8 oz can of tomato sauce

10 oz can of Ro-Tel

1/2 cup of semisweet chocolate chips/morsels

1 tbsp of smooth peanut butter (I used natural, but regular is fine too)

1 tbsp cornstarch + 1 tbsp of water, to form a slurry

Sesame seeds, for topping (optional)

Cotija cheese, for topping (optional)

Directions

1. Lightly season the chicken with the salt & pepper

2. Add the vegetable oil to the Instant Pot, hit “Sauté” and adjust so it’s on the “More” or “High” setting. Allow the oil to heat up for 3 minutes

3. Next, add the chicken to the hot oil in the pot and sear on each side for 30-60 seconds max on each side (the chicken may want to stick to the pot when the flip it over, but just use some light force with the tongs to flip them). Remove the chicken in a bowl and set aside

4. Then, add the butter to the pot and deglaze (scrape) the bottom of the pot as it melts with a wooden spoon/spatula, trying to get up any chicken remnants that may have stuck from the searing process. Once the butter’s melted, add in the onion and cook for about 3 minutes until softened and lightly browned, continuing to deglaze the bottom every so often

5. Add in the garlic and chili powder, cumin, oregano and cinnamon and stir into the onions for another minute and stir constantly so the spices don’t stick to the bottom of the pot.

6. Now, add in broth and really deglaze the bottom of the pot immediately. Everything will come up easily and nothing should be stuck to it. Add in the Ro-tel and tomato sauce, stir well so everything is blended.

7. Add the chicken back to the pot (it doesn’t need to be totally submerged in the sauce if some is above it). Secure the lid and hi “Keep Warm/Cancel” and then hit “Manual” or “Pressure Cook” High Pressure for 8 minutes. Follow with a quick release when done

8. When done, remove chicken with tongs and place in serving dish so the sauce is still left in the pot. Stir the chocolate chips and peanut butter into the sauce until totally melded. Hit “Keep Warm/Cancel” then “Sauté” and adjust so it’s on the “More” or “High” setting and bring it to a bubble. Add in the cornstarch slurry, allow it to bubble for a minute and then turn the pot off. The mole sauce will thicken up perfectly

9. Pour the mole sauce over the chicken, top with some sesame seeds and crumbled Cotija cheese if using and serve as is or over rice and/or vegetables

10. Enjoy!

Photos

Instant Pot Chicken Thighs Recipe

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.crunchycreamysweet.com/instant-pot-chicken-thighs/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 12 mins

Ingredients

4 bone-in skin-on chicken thighs

1 tablespoon olive oil

1 tablespoon butter

1 teaspoon minced garlic

1 teaspoon salt

1 teaspoon dried oregano

1 cup water

1 tablespoon arrowroot

Directions

1. Trim excess skin and fat from chicken thighs.

2. Season with salt on the skin side.

3. Make sure the stainless steel insert is in your Instant Pot.

4. Press the "saute" function. Wait for 2 to 3 minutes and add oil and butter to the insert. 

5. When the ghee is melted and sizzling, add garlic and stir in. Add chicken thighs to IP skin side down.

6. Brown for 2 to 3 minutes. The longer you let it brown and make brown bits on the bottom of the pot, the more flavor the chicken and gravy will have. Just make sure the chicken doesn't burn!

7. Flip the chicken onto the other side and cook for 1 minutes.

8. Press "cancel/off" button.

9. Remove chicken onto a plate and set aside.

10. Add water to Instant Pot and use wooden spoon to scrape the brown bits from the bottom of the insert.

11. Place trivet in the IP and arrange the chicken thighs on top.

12. Close lid, set the valve to "sealing" position and press "manual" button. Set the timer to 12 minutes. The IP will beep and start coming to pressure. Since it is already hot, it won't take long.

13. Once the IP is done cooking, press "cancel/off" button. Do not release the pressure but let it release naturally. If you are in a hurry, let it release naturally for at least 5 minutes.

14. When done, carefully open the lid away from your face. Place chicken on a plate and let rest.

15. Remove trivet from the IP.

16. In a small bowl, whisk cornstarch with 1/4 cup of water. Make sure there are no clumps. Add to liquid at the bottom of the IP. Stir until thickened. You can press the "saute" function to simmer it for a few minutes to help thicken the gravy.Serve chicken with gravy. You can also keep the liquid without thickening it and use for soups.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 384
Total Fat: 30g
Saturated Fat: 8g
Cholesterol: 149mg
Sodium: 721mg
Total Carbohydrate: 3g
Protein: 23g

Photos

Instant Pot Chicken Tortilla Soup

Courses: Entree
Categories: 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://thefoodieeats.com/instant-pot-chicken-tortilla-soup/
Serving size: 12
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

4 cups chicken broth

15 oz. whole kernel canned corn (drained)

30 oz. canned black beans (drained)

19 oz. Green taco sauce

1 tsp. sea salt

2 tsp. ground cumin

1 tsp. chili powder

1 tsp. garlic powder

1 tsp. onion powder

1 Tbsp. lime juice

5 lb. rotisserie chicken (cooked)

Directions

1. Add all ingredients (except chicken) to pot and give a good mix. I also like to include the juice in the bottom of the rotisserie chicken tray. Lock lid and cook for 4 minutes at high pressure.

2. Meanwhile – remove all chicken meat from bones. Reserve the carcass (bones and skin) to make broth later. Shred the chicken into bite-size pieces.

3. Once cook time is complete, quick-release pressure. Then remove lid, add the shredded chicken to the pot, and mix well. Allow the chicken to sit in the soup for a few minutes (the longer the better) to absorb the flavor. 

4. Serve topped with any combination of tortilla chips, avocado, cheese, and cilantro.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 137
Total Fat: 1g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 907mg
Total Carbohydrate: 24g
Dietary Fiber: 6g
Sugars: 4g
Protein: 8g

Photos

Instant Pot Chipotle’s Cilantro Lime Rice

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 08 🌾, 10 🍒, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.sparklestosprinkles.com/instant-pot-chipotles-cilantro-lime-rice/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cups long grain white rice

2 cups water

½ cup fresh cilantro, chopped

Zest from 1 lime

2 Tbsp fresh squeezed lime juice

Directions

Pour Rice into the instant pot.

Select Low Pressure or Rice Button.

Cook for 12 minutes on low pressure.

Do a quick release.

Fluff rice, add in lime juice, zest, & cilantro. Give rice good stir.

Photos

Instant Pot Corn on the Cob

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 08 🌾
Collections:
Source: https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-corn-on-the-cob/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 1 min
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

4 ears corn on the cob (, husks and silk removed)

Directions

1. Pressure Cook the Corn on the Cob: Pour 1 cup of cold water in the pressure cooker. Place a trivet in the Instant Pot, then place 4 ears of corn on the cob on the trivet. Close the lid and cook at High Pressure for 1 - 2 minutes. Turn off the heat and Quick Release. Open the lid carefully.

2. Serve: Serve immediately with butter, your favorite sauce or topping.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 4 g
Calories: 77
Total Fat: 1g
Sodium: 13mg
Total Carbohydrate: 16g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 5g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Instant Pot Cornbread

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.shugarysweets.com/instant-pot-cornbread/
Serving size: 12 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 55 mins

Ingredients

1 egg

1 cup buttermilk

1/3 cup vegetable oil

1 cup all-purpose flour

1 cup yellow cornmeal

2/3 cup granulated sugar

1 Tbsp baking powder

1 tsp kosher salt

1 cup water (for the Instant Pot)

Directions

1. First, you’ll need a 7×3-inch cake pan. I use the Fat Daddio Push Pan (which is also perfect for Instant Pot Cheesecake!). Spray with baking spray and set aside.

2. In a bowl, whisk egg until fluffy (about 15 seconds). Add milk and oil. Add flour, cornmeal, sugar, kosher salt, and baking powder.

3. Pour batter into prepared pan. Wrap top in foil, then take a second piece of foil and wrap the bottom too.

4. Pour 1 cup of water into the bottom of the Instant Pot.

5. Place foil wrapped pan on a sling (or trivet) and lower into the pressure cooker.

6. Lock the lid and make sure the valve is set to “SEALING.”

7. Select HIGH PRESSURE and a cook time of 55 minutes.

8. When the cook time ends, allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes, then do a quick release of the valve.

9. Wipe off the excess moisture from the top of the foil and remove foil completely.

10. Slice and enjoy warm.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1
Calories: 186
Total Fat: 7g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 16mg
Sodium: 365mg
Total Carbohydrate: 28g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 12g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Instant Pot Cornish Hens (From Fresh Or Frozen)

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.melaniecooks.com/instant-pot-cornish-hens/17766/
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 cornish hens

1 cup water

Sea Salt

Directions

1. Rub cornish hens with salt.

2. Pour water in the Instant Pot and add cornish hens.

3. Close the lid of the Instant Pot and turn the valve to a Sealing position.

4. Press the "Pressure Cook" or "Manual" button and set the time to 20 minutes on High pressure for fresh cornish hens (or for 50 minutes for frozen).

5. When it's done cooking, quick release (QR) the steam.

6. Carefully remove cornish hens from the Instant Pot and brown/crisp up in NuWave Oven on Copper Crisper Pan.

Photos

Instant Pot Crack Chicken

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://diethood.com/instant-pot-crack-chicken-recipe/
Serving size: 4 serves
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

4 slices thick cut bacon, (diced)

1 tablespoon olive oil

1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts

1/2 teaspoon paprika

1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

salt and fresh ground pepper, (to taste)

8 ounces cream cheese, (room temperature)

1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

1/2 teaspoon onion powder

1/2 teaspoon dried dill weed

1/2 teaspoon dried chives

salt and fresh ground pepper, to taste

1 cup low sodium chicken broth

chopped fresh parsley

sliced green scallions

Directions

1. Press the "Sauté" button on the Instant Pot and wait for it to heat up.

2. Add the diced bacon and cook for a minute or two, or to a desired crispness. Remove from the Instant Pot and set aside.

3. Heat olive oil in the Instant Pot.

4. Season chicken with paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

5. Once olive oil is hot, add the chicken breasts and brown on both sides; about 2 minutes per side.

6. In the meantime, place cream cheese in a mixing bowl and season with garlic powder, onion powder, dried dill weed, dried chives, salt and pepper; mix to combine.

7. On the Instant Pot press "Cancel" to stop sautéing.

8. Add cream cheese mixture to the Instant Pot.

9. Pour in the chicken broth.

10. Turn the pot on Manual High Pressure for 12 minutes; then do a quick release.

11. Remove lid and transfer chicken to a cutting board to shred it.

12. Stir the shredded chicken back into the Instant Pot; place the lid back on the Instant Pot (powered off) and let stand for 5 minutes to thicken the sauce.

13. Top with previously prepared bacon, fresh parsley, and scallions.

14. Serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 471
Total Fat: 35g
Saturated Fat: 14g
Cholesterol: 143mg
Sodium: 525mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 32g

Photos

Instant Pot Creamy Italian Chicken Pasta

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://cookingwithkarli.com/instant-pot-dump-and-start-creamy-italian-chicken-pasta/
Serving size: 8 servings
Preparation time: 27 mins
Cooking time: 3 mins

Ingredients

4 cups chicken broth

1 cup water

1 lb rotini pasta, uncooked

2 cans cream of chicken soup

2 pkg Italian Dressing Mix

1 lb chicken tenders (thawed), approx 6-7 tenders

2 cups frozen peas and carrots

1 8 oz block cream cheese

Directions

1. Add the chicken broth, water and pasta to the Instant Pot's liner.

2. Pour the cream of chicken soup on top of the pasta.

3. Sprinkle the dressing mix packets into the Instant Pot.

4. Place the chicken tenders on top.

HIGH 3 NPR 6 QR

5. Secure the lid and cook on Manual (or pressure cook) HIGH for 3 minutes. Allow for a 6 minute NPR before releasing the pressure manually.

6. Remove the cooked chicken and set aside.

7. Stir in the frozen peas and carrots.

8. Cut the cream cheese block into chunks and set onto of the pasta in the Instant Pot. Return the lid and let the Instant Pot sit on warm for 5 minutes.

9. Shred the chicken while the Instant Pot is sitting on warm.

10. Stir the cream cheese into the pasta until completely combined.

11. Stir in the shredded chicken. Serve hot!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1
Calories: 562
Total Fat: 31g
Saturated Fat: 10g
Cholesterol: 78mg
Sodium: 1864mg
Total Carbohydrate: 47g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 5g
Protein: 26g

Photos

Instant Pot Curry Meatballs

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://stuffmattycooks.com/instant-pot-meatballs-chicken-curry/
Serving size: 2
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 Pound Ground turkey

1/2 Cup Plain rice crumbs

1 Egg

2 Tbsp. Curry Powder

1 tsp. Salt

2 tsp. Garlic Powder

1 tsp. Ground Coriander

1 tsp. Minced Ginger

2 Cloves Minced Garlic

1 Cup Chicken Broth

2 Tbsp. Olive Oil (or eqivelant)

3 Scallions cut into 1 inch pieces

2 Tbsp. Chopped Cilantro

1 Tbsp. Chopped Scallions for garnish

3 Tbsp. Water

2 Tbsp. Arrowroot

Directions

1. Add ground turkey, ricecrumbs, egg, and garlic powder to mixture. Mix well with your hands to make sure everything is incorporated well. DO NOT ADD CURRY POWDER TO MEAT MIXTURE. Keep reading for when to add curry powder.Use a spoon to scoop enough meatball mixture to make meatballs about the size of a golf ball or so. This is about 2 tablespoons. Do not pack the meatballs to tight. Place meatballs on a plate. Should make around 12 meatballs. Once meatballs are made let them sit about 15 minutes for the rice crumbs to soak up some of the moisture.How to Cook MeatballsOpen Instant Pot and Push Saute Button until it is on the “MORE” setting. When display reads “HOT” you are ready to begin.Add Olive Oil to Instant Pot to coat bottom of liner. Add meatballs to Instant Pot and brown 2 minutes per side. You may have to do this in 2 batches. Once meatballs are browned remove meatballs from Instant Pot back to plate.Deglaze Instant Pot by pouring in chicken broth and scraping loose bits on bottom of Instant Pot. Then add curry powder and stir to mix. Add ginger, garlic and scallions that you cut into pieces to the bottom of Instant Pot.Return Meatballs to Instant Pot being careful not to squish the meatballs. Put lid on Instant Pot and turn valve to SEAL. Press CANCEL on the Instant Pot and Then Press POULTRY button. Set Timer for 7 MINUTES.When cooking time is complete let Instant Pot Natural Pressure Release for 10 MINUTES then RELEASE PRESSURE. Remove lid from Instant Pot.Mix together Water and arrowroot to make SLURRY. Add slurry to instant pot and stir carefully.Press CANCEL on Instant Pot and then press SAUTE again and wait for sauce to come to boil and thicken for about 2 minutes. Once sauce is thickened press CANCEL on Instant Pot than the KEEP WARM button.Serve over Rice or item of your choice.Enjoy.Makes 2 to 3 Servings

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 100

Photos

Instant Pot Dulce De Leche

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 05 🐄, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-dulce-de-leche/#wprm-recipe-container-23944
Serving size:
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour 10 mins

Ingredients

1 14oz can (396g) sweetened condensed milk

1 cup (250ml) cold water

½ teaspoon (3g) baking soda

3 tablespoons (45ml) warm water

Directions

1. Create Baking Soda Mixture: In a small mixing bowl, combine ½ tsp (3g) baking soda with 3 tbsp (45ml) warm water. Mix very well until all the baking soda has dissolved.

2. Combine Ingredients: Pour 1 14oz can (414ml) sweetened condensed milk in a stainless steel bowl (we used a 7” bowl for our 6 quart Instant Pot). Add in the baking soda mixture and combine. Mix well.

3. Pressure Cook Dulce De Leche: Add 1 cup (250ml) cold water in the Instant Pot. Place the stainless bowl of condensed milk mixture directly in the water. Close lid and pressure cook at High Pressure for 40 - 90 minutes (Please see notes), then Full Natural Release.

4. Create Instant Pot Dulce de Leche: Open the lid carefully. Remove the stainless steel bowl from the pressure cooker. Mix & inspect the dulce de leche with a fork. If it is not caramelized to desired color, simply place it back into the Instant Pot and pressure cook it for another 20 - 30 minutes. The mixture will be lumpy, use an immersion blender or blender to smooth out the lumps.

5. Serve: The dulce de leche will thicken up as it cools and thin out as it warms up.

Photos

Instant Pot Easter Eggs

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.bhg.com/holidays/easter/eggs/instant-pot-easter-eggs/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

White vinegar

Liquid food coloring

Raw eggs

Directions

Before you put the jars into your Instant Pot, fill each jar with the dye mixture, eggs, and water. Add 2 tablespoons of white vinegar and at least 10-12 drops of liquid food coloring to each jar, then fill each jar with raw eggs. (You should be able to fit 2–3 eggs into each jar.) Top off each jar with enough water to cover the eggs.

Cook Eggs

Place a short rack in the bottom of your Instant Pot (to keep the jars from sitting directly on the pot's bottom surface) and add one cup of water. Place your pint jars on the rack, close the lid, and set it to natural release. Cook on high pressure for 6 minutes, then let the steam naturally release for 6 minutes.

Photos

Instant Pot Easy Chili Mac

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://recipeteacher.com/instant-pot-easy-chili-mac/
Serving size: 4-6 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 4 mins

Ingredients

3 lb. ground turkey (85% lean)

5 cups brown rice macaroni

32 oz Mild Tomatillo Salsa Verde

1 pack nomato sauce

2 tablespoons chili powder

1/2 tablespoon cumin

1 teaspoon salt, divided

3 1/2 cups water

Directions

1. Set Instant Pot to saute mode and add ground beef and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Stir often until all the beef is browned. Should take about 5 minutes. Press cancel and drain fat.

2. Sprinkle chili powder, cumin and 1/2 teaspoon salt on top of the browned meat. Then add macaroni on top (don’t stir). Add 3 1/2 cups water and make sure all macaroni is submerged. Add cans of tomato sauce and diced tomatoes right on top in the center. Do not stir!

3. Secure lid, make sure vent is set to sealing and pressure cook (“manual” on some Instant Pots) on high for 4 minutes. When timer is complete, quick release the pressure.

4. Remove lid and stir contents well. Everything will begin to thicken. Add 1 cup of shredded colby jack cheese and stir it in so it melts into the sauce.

5. Serve with additional shredded cheese on top and enjoy!

Photos

Instant Pot Egg Bites {Whole30, Paleo, Dairy-Free}

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚, 10 🍒, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.sustainablecooks.com/egg-bites/
Serving size: 7
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 8 mins

Ingredients

4 eggs

1/3 cup Nutpods original (or milk of choice)

1/4 tsp dried dill

1/8 tsp lemon granulated

1/8 tsp white pepper

1/8 tsp garlic salt

1/4 cup spinach

1/4 cup finely chopped broccoli

2 strips turkey bacon (cooked and diced)

Directions

1. Thoroughly grease the muffin mold with coconut oil, ghee, or cooking spray.

2. Chop and cook the bacon over medium heat until cooked through. Remove to a paper towel. 

3. Add eggs and milk to a blender or food processor. Blend for a minute. The add the broccoli and spices and pulse the blender a few times to break up the veg without fully blending.

4. Add spinach, any other veggies, and bacon to the egg molds. Pour the egg/milk mixture up to the top of each mold.

5. Pour 1 cup of water into the Instant Pot. Carefully place the mold on top of the trivet and lower it into the Instant Pot. Secure the lid, and make sure the nozzle is set to "sealing". Press steam>8 minutes.

6. Once the Instant Pot shuts off, allow it to vent naturally for 10 minutes and then do a quick release to let out any pressure that may remain.

7. Carefully remove the trivet and let the eggs cool for a few minutes in the mold before removing.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 g
Calories: 70
Total Fat: 5g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 98mg
Sodium: 75mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Protein: 4g

Photos

Instant Pot Eggs en Cocotte (French Baked Eggs)

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄
Collections:
Source: https://thefoodieeats.com/instant-pot-eggs-en-cocotte/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1 Tbsp. butter (softened)

6 tsp. heavy cream

6 large eggs

6 Tbsp. Parmesan cheese (grated)

Directions

1. Grease ramekins with softened butter.

2. Pour in 1 teaspoon of heavy cream to each ramekin and swirl around to coat the bottom.

3. Crack one egg into each ramekin.

4. Then top each egg with 1 tablespoon of grated Parmesan cheese.

5. Finally, crack some black pepper on top of cheese. As much or as little as you prefer.

6. Add trivet to pot, along with 2 cups of water.

7. Place 3 ramekins on trivet, followed by second layer of 3 ramekins. Stack them in an alternating pattern, not directly on top of ramekins below. Lock lid and cook for 2 minutes at low pressure for runny yolks, 3 minutes for hard yolks.

8. Once cook time is complete, quick-release pressure. Remove lid and transfer ramekins to a rack to cool. Serve immediately.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 155
Total Fat: 11g
Saturated Fat: 6g
Cholesterol: 185mg
Sodium: 318mg
Protein: 10g

Photos

Instant Pot Fish

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://temeculablogs.com/instant-pot-fish/
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 28 mins

Ingredients

1 pcs fish (3/8 of a lb. or so, skinned and deboned)

2 tablespoons olive oil

1/8 teaspoon seasoned salt

1/8 teaspoon basil (or other herb of choice)

1/2 zucchini (cut into dials)

1/2 yellow squash zucchini (cut into dials)

1/2 carrot (thin dials)

1/4 onion (cut into strips)

Directions

1. Put parchment paper inside the bottom larger piece of your stacked pans and pour all vegetables inside.

2. Pour 2 tbsp of oil oil on top and sprinkle half of your seasoned salt and basil on top.

3. Place smaller stacked pan on top of that and put a piece of parchment paper inside of that pan.

4. Lay pieces of fish inside, pour remainder of olive oil on top of fish with remainder of spices.

5. Put lid on and close fastener so pans are securely closed together.

6. Pour 1.5 c. water inside your Instant Pot and lower stacked pans down inside.

7. Close lid and steam valve and set to high pressure for 28 minutes. Do a quick release.

8. Check to ensure fish and vegetables are desired tenderness, if not recover and add 2 minutes or so.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 4 oz
Calories: 307
Total Fat: 28g
Saturated Fat: 3g
Sodium: 324mg
Total Carbohydrate: 12g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 7g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Instant Pot Fried Rice

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.paintthekitchenred.com/easy-chinese-style-instant-pot-fried-rice/
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 35 mins

Ingredients

1/2 cup brown basmati rice

1 1/4 teaspoons ghee (divided)

2 3/4 tablespoons onions (finely chopped)

3/4 teaspoon ginger (finely minced)

1/4 tablespoon garlic (finely minced)

1 tablespoon tamari

1/4 teaspoon sesame oil

1/2 cup frozen peas and carrots

1/2 cup water

1 eggs (beaten)

1 tablespoon chopped green onions

Directions

1. Select the Saute function and allow the Instant Pot to heat up.

2. Rinse and drain rice; set aside.

3. Add 1 Tbsp vegetable oil to the Instant Pot inner pot.

4. Saute onions till translucent, about 2 minutes, stirring often.

5. Press Cancel.  This will allow the Instant Pot to cool down while you do the next steps.

6. Saute ginger and garlic for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.

7. Stir in rinsed Jasmine rice until coated with onion mixture.

8. Deglaze inner pot with a tablespoon or two of water if there’s anything stuck to the bottom.

9. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, black pepper, frozen vegetables, and water.

10. Stir to mix.

11. Close the lid and pressure cook for 22 minutes.

12. Let the pressure release naturally (NPR) for 10 minutes and then release any remaining pressure using the Quick Release (QR) method.

13. Open the lid and let the Instant Pot Fried Rice rest for a few minutes.

14. Heat a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat on the stove.

15. Coat the frying pan with remaining vegetable oil and pour in the eggs.

16. Scramble the eggs by gently breaking up the eggs and flipping until eggs are set.

17. Add eggs to the rice.

18. Add green onions and stir the rice gently to mix together all ingredients.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 187
Total Fat: 10g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Cholesterol: 93mg
Sodium: 915mg
Total Carbohydrate: 19g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 6g

Photos

Instant Pot Frittata with Sausage, Mushrooms & Feta

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 02 🐔, 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://thefoodieeats.com/instant-pot-frittata/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

4 oz. ground turkey sausage

12 large eggs

1 tsp. sea salt

1/2 cup whole milk

4 oz. mushrooms (sliced)

1/2 cup red bell peppers (diced)

5 oz. baby spinach

4 oz. feta cheese (crumbled or small cubes)

Directions

1. Using sauté setting… Add sausage to pot and begin browning – breaking up sausage as much as possible and scraping up bits from bottom.

2. Meanwhile – Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl. Add salt to eggs. Then, using a whisk, mix until yolks are broken up and fully incorporated. Add milk and whisk again, until eggs are light and airy.

3. Once sausage is fully browned, add mushrooms and peppers to pot and cook for 3-4 minutes. You want mushrooms to release their liquid and then most of that liquid evaporate. Turn off power to pot, then add spinach. Mix continuously until all spinach is wilted.

4. Spray 7-inch pan with nonstick cooking spray. Add sausage/vegetable mixture to pan. Pour eggs over top of sausage/vegetable mixture. Using a fork… gently “mix” in eggs. You’re not really mixing, just making sure the eggs reach the bottom of the pan. Add feta on top of egg mixture. Cover pan with aluminum foil.

5. Add 1 1/2 cups water to pot, along with 3-inch trivet. Place pan on top of trivet and lock lid. Cook for 45 minutes at high pressure.

6. Once cook time is complete, quick-release pressure. Remove lid and aluminum foil, then let cool for a few minutes. Slice and serve warm.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 259
Total Fat: 18g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 359mg
Sodium: 803mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Sugars: 3g
Protein: 18g

Photos

Instant Pot Garlic Butter Rice

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.sustainablecooks.com/parmesan-rice/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 6 mins

Ingredients

2 tablespoons butter

1 cup brown rice

1 ¼ cups broth or water

2 cloves garlic ((minced))

1/2 teaspoon parsley ((dried))

1 1/4 tablespoons Parmesan cheese ((grated))

Directions

1. Set Instant Pot to "saute" to melt the butter (it will take about 1-2 minutes). Once melted, turn the Instant Pot to "off/keep warm".
