2. Add the rice, broth, garlic, and dried parsley. Stir.

3. Lock the lid into place and set the steam release handle (valve on top) to “Sealing”. Press Manual>High Pressure>6 minutes. It will take 2-4 minutes to get up to pressure.

4. When the rice has finished cooking, the Instant Pot will beep and switch to ”keep warm". Then use a kitchen towel and flip the switch to "venting". It will take about 2-4 minutes to depressurize.

5. Carefully open the lid and add the parmesan and stir.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 0.5 cup
Calories: 212.94
Total Fat: 6.39g
Saturated Fat: 3.94g
Cholesterol: 16.18mg
Sodium: 392.33mg
Total Carbohydrate: 34.43g
Dietary Fiber: 0.54g
Sugars: 0.75g
Protein: 3.68g

Photos

Instant Pot Garlic Mashed Potatoes (Pressure Cooker Recipe)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://myfoodstory.com/instant-pot-garlic-mashed-potatoes-recipe/
Serving size: 4 Portions
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

2 pounds 3 1/4 ounces Potatoes (peeled and cut into even 1 inch pieces)

6 Garlic Cloves (peeled and smashed)

2/3 cup Water (or Chicken Stock with no added salt)

3/4 teaspoon Salt

3 tablespoons Butter (divided)

1/4 cup Sour Cream

1/4 cup Cream Cheese

1/4 cup Hot Milk

More butter and chopped chives for topping

Directions

1. In an Instant Pot add potatoes, garlic, water, salt and one and a half tablespoons butter. Put the lid on, turn the valve to sealing and cook on manual high pressure for 8 minutes. (My Instant Pot took 10 minutes to come to pressure, so the total time taken was 18 minutes). Release pressure immediately by turning the knob to 'vent', and open the lid once the pressure is released.

2. Using a potato masher, mash the potatoes in the Instant Pot for really creamy potatoes. For fluffier mashed potatoes, you can drain the water and then mash the potatoes. Once the potatoes are mashed, mix in the remaining butter, sour cream and cream cheese. Mix well while the potatoes are still steaming hot. Taste and add more salt if required. Top with more butter and chives and serve.

3. Pour in 1/4 cup hot milk. Don't worry if it looks like too much - the potatoes will just soak it up. Mix well again - taste and add more salt if required. Top with more butter and chives and serve.

4. This is an optional step - if you see lumps in your mashed potatoes, you can run them through a sieve for really smooth and creamy mashed potatoes

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 454
Total Fat: 18g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 31mg
Sodium: 681mg
Total Carbohydrate: 65g
Dietary Fiber: 7g
Sugars: 4g
Protein: 12g

Photos

Instant Pot Garlic Parmesan Chicken

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.365daysofcrockpot.com/instant-pot-garlic-parmesan-chicken/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 6 mins

Ingredients

2 Tbsp ghee

1 small yellow onion, diced

4 large garlic cloves, minced

1/2 cup chicken broth

1/2 tsp garlic powder

1/4 tsp white pepper

1/2 tsp salt

8 oz sliced mushrooms (optional)

1 1/2 lbs boneless skinless chicken breasts sliced into 1/2 inch filets

1 cup heavy almond milk

2 Tbsp brown rice flour

1/2 cup parmesan cheese

3 oz coarsely chopped spinach

Salt and freshly ground white pepper

10 ounces uncooked edamame fettuccine noodles

3 cups water

Directions

1. Turn your Instant Pot to the saute setting (more). When the display reads HOT add in the butter. Once the butter is melted add in the onions and saute for about 3-4 minutes. Add in the garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Add in the chicken broth, garlic powder, pepper and salt. Stir. Add in the mushrooms (if using) and chicken.

2. Optional: If you want to cook pasta at the same time and in the same pot you can. Just get a pan that will fit inside your Instant Pot and fill it with 3 cups or water and then break 10 ounces of fettuccine or linguine noodles to fit inside the pan (see my note below). Carefully place the pan on top of the chicken. I use a homemade silicone sling that I cut from a silicone baking mat to lower my pan down onto the chicken. You can also make a foil sling.

3. Cover the pot and secure the lid. Make sure valve is set to sealing. Set the manual/pressure cook button to 6 minutes (this is the cooking time for the 1/2 inch pieces of chicken breast, if they are thicker than that you may need more time). Let the pressure release naturally for 10 minutes and then move the valve to "venting."

4. Remove the lid. If you are cooking pasta, carefully remove the pan of pasta and set aside. Use tongs to place the chicken on a platter. Loosely cover with foil. Turn the Instant Pot to the saute setting. Warm the half and half up in a pyrex measuring cup for 45 seconds in the microwave. Whisk the flour into the half and half until it's smooth. Whisk the mixture into the Instant Pot. This will thicken up the sauce in a few minutes. Add in the parmesan cheese. Add in the spinach. Salt and pepper to taste. If using pasta, drain any water off of the pasta and stir into the pot.

5. Serve sauce (and optional pasta) with the chicken.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1/6 of recipe (just chicken and sauce, not pasta)
Calories: 265
Total Fat: 12g
Sodium: 292mg
Total Carbohydrate: 7g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 31g

Photos

Instant Pot Ghee

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source: https://thefoodieeats.com/instant-pot-ghee/
Serving size: 60 tablespoons
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

32 oz. unsalted butter (high quality)

Directions

1. Place butter in pot and turn on “keep warm” setting. Gently stir butter while it melts completely. With refrigerator cold butter, it will take about 10 minutes.

2. Once butter is melted completely, switch to sauté setting. After butter begins to boil, stir well every minute or two.

3. When stirring, you want to be sure to scrape the bottom of the pot so that all the milk solids that settle will cook even. You will begin to feel them the longer the butter cooks. You also want to watch the color of the surface - the "foam" (which are the proteins). The goal is to get that to a light golden color, NOT BROWN. If you see brown, you've probably burned the milk solids and charred the taste of the ghee.

4. Once you see the light golden color (after about 12-13 minutes), turn off the power and allow to continue cooking with the residual heat.

5. After 10 minutes with the power off, the ghee is ready. The milk solids at the bottom of the pot should be a medium brown color, not too dark.

6. Place a fine mesh strainer over a mixing bowl, then line the strainer with cheesecloth. Pour the ghee through the cheesecloth. 

7. Then transfer the ghee to an airtight container. Allow to cool completely uncovered. Then cover and store away from sunlight or heat. I recommend just putting it in the fridge and it will last for up to 6 months. Some people store at room temperature, but I don't. Just because I don't want to lose it.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 108
Total Fat: 12g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 32mg
Sodium: 1mg

Photos

Instant Pot Greek Chicken

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.365daysofcrockpot.com/instant-pot-greek-chicken-and-potatoes/
Serving size: 5-6 servings
Preparation time: 20 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

⅓ cup olive oil

⅓ cup lemon juice

1 tsp lemon zest

2 tsp kosher salt

1 Tbsp minced garlic

2 tsp dried oregano

1 tsp dried parsley

½ cup chicken broth

8-12 bone-in chicken thighs

Lemon wedges, for garnish

Directions

1. In a bowl whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, salt, pepper, garlic, oregano and parsley. 

2. Cut your potatoes into quarters. My potatoes were not small and not large. The quarters were fairly big. This is important if you don't want mushy potatoes. If they are too small they'll get overdone.

3. Pour the chicken broth into the Instant Pot. Place chicken thighs into the pot, I arranged mine to fit into almost one single layer. Pour half of the lemon juice mixture over the chicken. 

4. Layer the potatoes on top of the chicken. Pour the other half of the lemon juice mixture over the potatoes. 

5. Cover the Instant Pot and secure the lid. Make sure the valve is set to sealing. Set the manual/pressure cook button to 15 minutes. 

6. When the time is up let the pot sit for 10 minutes. Then move the valve to venting. Remove the lid.

7. Option 1: Use your CrispLid to brown the chicken skin in batches. Unplug your Instant Pot. Place the fryer basket on top of the tall trivet and place into the Instant Pot. Place your CrispLid on top of the Instant Pot. Brown the chicken in batches. I did 4 pieces of chicken at a time. I set the temperature to 500 for about 4 minutes. 

8. Opton 2: Use your oven's broiler to brown the chicken skin. Place the chicken on a sheet pan and place under the broiler for a few minutes until the skin crisps up. Watch it closely as it browns fairly fast. 

9. Serve the chicken and potatoes. Drizzle some of the reserved juices over the potatoes and chicken for extra flavor. Garnish with lemon wedges.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 672
Total Fat: 44.4g
Saturated Fat: 11.5g
Cholesterol: 257.9mg
Sodium: 1239.1mg
Total Carbohydrate: 22.1g
Dietary Fiber: 2.9g
Sugars: 1.4g
Protein: 47.8g

Photos

Instant Pot Green Beans

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-green-beans/
Serving size: 2
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 8 mins

Ingredients

½ pound (227g) green beans

½ cup (125ml) cold water

1 tablespoon (15ml) peanut oil or olive oil

4 (16g) garlic cloves (, minced)

Season with Salt & Fish sauce (Optional)

Directions

1. Pressure Cook Green Beans: Pour in ½ cup (125ml) cold water. Place steamer rack in Instant Pot. Place green beans on steamer rack. Pressure cook at Low Pressure for 0 - 2 minutes (0 minute for crunchy texture; 2 minutes for softer texture). Then, Quick Release.

2. Serve: Green beans are ready to serve. If you are serving at this step, simply season with salt and black pepper.

3. Optional Stir-Frying

4. *Note: If you are proceeding with this optional stir-frying step, avoid seasoning at this step, drain water and set aside green beans to air dry.

5. Prepare Instant Pot Pressure Cooker: Remove the hot water and towel dry the inner pot. Heat up your pressure cooker (Instant Pot: press Sauté button, then Adjust button to Sauté More function). Ensure your pot is as hot as it can be when you add in garlic (Instant Pot: indicator says HOT).

6. Sauté Garlic & Green Beans: Add 1 tbsp (15ml) peanut oil or olive oil in the pot. Ensure to coat the oil over the whole bottom of the pot. Add in minced garlic, sauté for roughly 30 seconds. Do not let the garlic burn. Pour in air-dried green beans and saute for 30 seconds. Season with fish sauce (~1.5 - 2 tsp) and fine sea salt to taste. Saute for another 30 seconds. The garlic should be golden brown at this point and super flavorful.

7. Serve Instant Pot Green Beans: Serve the flavorful crunchy garlic green beans immediately!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 108
Total Fat: 7g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 8mg
Total Carbohydrate: 10g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 3g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Instant Pot Hard Boiled Egg Loaf

Courses:
Categories: 04 🥚
Collections:
Source: https://domesticsuperhero.com/instant-pot-hard-boiled-egg-loaf/
Serving size: 2 cups chopped eggs
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

non stick spray

8-12 large eggs

Directions

1. Using an oven safe small bowl or baking dish sprayed with nonstick spray, crack the eggs into the bowl.

2. Place 1 cup of water into the instant pot. Place steam rack into the bottom of the instant pot, and place the bowl on top of the steam rack.

3. Close the instant pot and make sure the pressure release is in the sealed position. Cook on manual or high pressure for 5 minutes. 

4. When the time is up, allow the instant pot hard boiled egg loaf to natural release the pressure for 5 more minutes, then flip the switch to release the remaining pressure.

5. Carefully remove the bowl from the instant pot (this is why a removable steam rack with handles comes in handy), and slide the eggs onto a cutting board.

6. Chop up the hard boiled eggs. Use as needed.

Photos

Instant Pot Hibachi Fried Rice

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 08 🌾, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://pressureluckcooking.com/recipe/instant-pot-hibachi-fried-rice/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cups of Jasmine rice, rinsed well and drained

2 cups of water

2 tbsp of sesame oil

2 tbsp of tamari

1 tbsp of ghee

3 eggs (you can use 6 eggs if you want it EXTRA eggy!)

Half of 1 large white onion, chopped

10oz box of frozen peas & carrots mixed

Sesame seeds, for sprinkling

Directions

1. Using a strainer, rinse the Jasmine rice thoroughly for about 90 seconds until the water draining from it is no longer cloudy, but clear (NOTE: Do NOT skip this step. If you do, your rice will likely cook very mushy and too sticky)

2. Add the rinsed and drained rice to the Instant Pot and then add the 2 cups of water and give it a stir

3. Secure the lid and hit “Manual” or “Pressure Cook” High Pressure for 3 minutes. When done, allow a natural release for 10 minutes followed by a quick release. Fluff the rice with a fork when done, transfer to a serving bowl and set aside. (Note: If you want to use brown rice, follow my brown rice recipe instead!)

4. Go back to the Instant Pot (you don’t need to clean the liner pot where the rice cooked), hit “Keep Warm/Cancel,” add the sesame oil and hit “Sauté” and “Adjust” so it’s on the “Normal” or “Medium” setting

5. Once the oil begins to sizzle, deglaze (scrape) the bottom of the pan with a wooden spatula and add the onion. Let it cook for about a minute and then add the peas and carrots. Add the ghee and cook together for about another 2 minutes

6. Move the veggies to one side of the pot and add the eggs to the other side and constantly stir as they begin to scramble and cook (NOTE: It’s important you constantly stir the egg so it doesn’t stick to the bottom of the pot). Once the egg begins to cook, mix it in with the veggies for a few moments until done

7. Hit “Keep Warm/Cancel,” add the rice back in, add the soy sauce, shake in a generous amount of sesame seeds and mix together with all the other veggies and egg

8. Transfer back to the serving bowl and top with additional sesame seeds. Serve in individual bowls and add desired sauce (see the “Jeffrey Sez” section for three AMAZING Japanese sauce options: Mustard, Ginger & Yum Yum). GOES GREAT with my Shrimp with Lobster Sauce, Moo Shu Pork, Black Pepper Beef, Polynesian Pineapple Chicken, Soup Dumplings, Hot & Sour Soup, Egg Drop Soup, and Wonton Soup!!

9. Enjoy!

Photos

Instant Pot Italian Ricotta Cheesecake

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.dadcooksdinner.com/instant-pot-italian-ricotta-cheesecake/
Serving size: 8 pieces of cheesecake
Preparation time: 1 hour 30 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

8 ounces ricotta stained 30 minutes and processed in blender

15 ounces whole-milk ricotta cheese, drained

1 cup sugar

1 teaspoon arrowroot

⅛ teaspoon sea salt (a pinch)

1 teaspoon vanilla extract (or ½ tsp vanilla + ½ tsp amaretto liqueur)

Zest of 1 lemon or orange

2 large eggs

Powdered sugar Seedless raspberry jam, whisked until smooth

Directions

1. Drain the ricotta and soften the cream cheese for 1 hour: Drain the ricotta in a fine mesh strainer, and soften the cream cheese by leaving it out at room temperature; do both for at least 1 hour.

2. Prepare the pan: Spray a 7-inch cheesecake pan with nonstick cooking spray.

3. Make the cheesecake filling: Beat the cream cheese, ricotta, sugar, cornstarch, and salt in an electric mixer on medium speed until the sugar is completely blended, about 3 minutes. Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides. Add the vanilla and lemon zest, and beat on medium speed until mixed, about 1 minute. Add the eggs one at a time, beating each on low speed until just blended. (Don’t over-beat the eggs.) Pour the filling into the prepared cheesecake pan.

4. Lower the cheesecake into the Instant Pot: Put 2 cups of water in the Instant Pot (or pressure cooker). If your steaming rack has handles, set the cheesecake on the rack and slowly lower it into the pot. (If your rack does not have handles, set the rack in the pot, then make an aluminum foil sling for the cheesecake: fold a 2-foot long piece of aluminum foil over a few times until it is a long strip about 4 inches wide. Center the cheesecake pan on the sling and carefully lower it into the pot, setting it on the rack.)

5. Pressure cook the cheesecake for 20 minutes with a natural pressure release: Lock the lid on the cooker and pressure cook on high for 20 minutes in an Instant Pot (use Manual or Pressure Cook mode) or other electric PC. Or, pressure cook for 20 minutes in a stovetop PC. Let the pressure come down naturally, about 15 minutes more. (If you’re in a hurry, you can quick release any pressure left in the pot after 15 minutes.)

6. Cool the cheesecake, top with powdered sugar and raspberry jam, and serve: Lift the cheesecake out of the pressure cooker. Loosen the cheesecake by running a paring knife around the edge of the pan. Cool the pan at room temperature for an hour, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight, to set the center. Just before serving, dust the top of the cheesecake generously with powdered sugar, top with the whisked raspberry jam, and serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 slice
Calories: 320
Total Fat: 17.9g
Saturated Fat: 10.5g
Cholesterol: 102.3mg
Sodium: 189.1mg
Total Carbohydrate: 31.4g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Sugars: 28.5g
Protein: 9.3g

Photos

Instant Pot Jeera Rice

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://pipingpotcurry.com/cumin-rice-pressure-cooker/
Serving size: 12
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

3 cups Basmati Rice

3 3/4 cups Water

3 teaspoons Salt (adjust to taste)

3 tablespoons EVOO

1 1/4 tablespoons Cumin seeds (Jeera)

15 Cloves (Laung)

6 Bay leaf (Tej Patta)

9 Green Cardamom (Elaichi)

5 inches Cinnamon (Dalchini)

Directions

1. Wash and drain the rice until the water runs clear.

2. Heat the instant pot in sauté mode and add ghee or oil to it.  Then add the whole spices and cumin seeds.  

3. When the cumin seeds start to splutter, add rice and stir them with the whole spices for about 30 seconds. Then add water, salt and stir again. Press cancel and close lid with vent in sealing position.

4. Change the instant pot setting to manual / pressure cook mode for 4 minutes, at high pressure with vent in sealing position.  

5. When the instant pot beeps, do a 5 minute natural pressure release, which means manually release the pressure 5 minutes after the instant pot beeps.  

6. Fluff the rice with a fork and let it rest for another 5 minutes. You can take the steel insert out of the instant pot, so the bottom layer of rice does not overcook. 

7. Cumin Rice is ready to be enjoyed with any curry or lentil.

Notes

Freeze flat in ziplock bags

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 209.97
Total Fat: 4.29g
Saturated Fat: 2.43g
Cholesterol: 9.6mg
Sodium: 589.53mg
Total Carbohydrate: 38.71g
Dietary Fiber: 1.24g
Sugars: 0.08g
Protein: 3.6g

Photos

Instant Pot Keto Green Bean Casserole

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://yellowglassdish.com/green-bean-casserole/
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

5 cups Green beans in bite-sized pieces (2 frozen 10oz bags)

1 tbsp ghee

1 tbsp olive oil

½ cup Onions (Thinly sliced)

1 cup Chopped Mushrooms (fresh or frozen)

4 Cloves Garlic (Minced)

4 oz quark

½ c Broth (chicken, or vegetable)

1/3 cup heavy almond cream)

Salt to taste

Directions

1. Steam the Green Beans

2. Steam green beans in the Instant Pot in a steamer basket with 1 cup of water for 1 minute. Manually release the pressure when it is done.

3. Drain and rinse the green beans with cold water to stop cooking. The total time to get to pressure and release for frozen green beans was 18 minutes in an 8qt Instant Pot.

4. Empty water from the Instant Pot Pan.

5. Prepare the Casserole sauce

6. Turn the Instant Pot to Saute mode. Heat the butter and oil in the pan then add thinly sliced onions. Add salt. Saute onions until they are golden brown and starting to crisp. Remove the onions from the Instant Pot pan and set aside.

7. Add mushrooms to the remaining oil and cook through then add garlic and stir it for about one minute or until aromatic. Add softened cream cheese, broth, and cream to the pan. Stir into a sauce. Add salt and pepper. Return green beans and combine thoroughly. Add ½ of the cheese and mix it in.

8. Place green bean casserole in a casserole dish, then top with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese and the fried onions.

9. Broil the casserole for 3-4 minutes. (If you don't have access to an oven, simply make sure all of the cheese melts on the green bean casserole. It wont be browned and bubbly on top but it will still taste amazing!)

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 143

Photos

Instant Pot Key Lime Cheesecake

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 08 🌾, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.skiptomylou.org/instant-pot-key-lime-cheesecake/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

1 c graham cracker crumbs

3 T butter (melted)

16 oz Cream Cheese (softened to room temperature)

2 t Flour

½ c Sugar

2 t Vanilla

Zest of 1 Lime

2 Eggs

1 Egg Yolk

2 T Heavy Whipping Cream

3 T Key Lime Juice

¾ c Heavy Whipping Cream

2 T Sugar

Zest of 1 Lime

10 Thin Lime Slice Halves

Directions

1. For Crust:

2. Spray a 6” springform pan with non-stick spray and set aside.  In a small bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter and stir together with a fork. Press firmly into the bottom of the sprayed springform pan, then set aside.

3. For Cheesecake filling:

4. With an electric mixer beat together: cream cheese, flour, sugar, vanilla and zest of one lime. Scraping sides and bottom to ensure all ingredients are mixed together well (to avoid any lumps). Add eggs one at a time and then egg yolk. Beat until just combined. Mix in Key Lime Juice (if you can’t find Key Lime Juice, you can substitute lime juice) and Whipping Cream until just combined. Pour over crust. Tap pan gently on the countertop a few times to get rid of any large air bubbles.

5. Cooking:

6. Add 1.5 cups water to pressure cooker insert. Then place the trivet in bottom of the insert. Lay a paper towel over the top of the springform pan (dry paper towel) and then wrap tightly with aluminum foil. Place pan in the pressure cooker using a sling. Lock lid in place and cook at high pressure for 37 minutes. Once cooking is completed let pressure release naturally for 18 minutes.

7. Carefully remove from the pressure cooker and remove foil and paper towel. Set on wire rack and cool for 10 minutes. Then carefully run a sharp paring knife around the perimeter (between cheesecake and pan edge). Let cool for 20-30 minutes and then release the springform pan edge. Cover lightly and refrigerate overnight.

8. Topping:

9. Using a large spatula, remove springform pan bottom from cheesecake and place cheesecake on serving platter. Place whipping cream and sugar in a mixing bowl and then whip until stiff. Fold in the zest of ½ of a lime (keep remaining ½ of lime to zest over the top for a lovely presentation).

10. Place whipping cream in a piping bag with a large open star tip and pipe onto top of the Instant Pot cheesecake, then zest remaining half of lime over the top of the whipped cream and center of cheesecake. Place lime slice halves around the perimeter of cheesecake equidistance apart by sliding gently into whipped cream. 

11. Refrigerate (covered) until ready to serve. Enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 611
Total Fat: 48g
Saturated Fat: 27g
Cholesterol: 233mg
Sodium: 421mg
Total Carbohydrate: 38g
Sugars: 26g
Protein: 8g

Photos

Instant Pot Korean Turkey Bowls

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://thisoldgal.com/instant-pot-korean-beef-bowls/
Serving size: 1 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 4 mins

Ingredients

1/4 teaspoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil

4 ounces Ground turkey

1/8 large Onion

1 cloves Fresh Garlic

1.5 inches Fresh Ginger Root

1/2 tablespoon Light Brown Sugar

1/4 teaspoon Sea Salt

1/8 teaspoon Ground White Pepper

1/8 small Asian Pear (grated (or 1/2 cup applesauce))

3/4 tablespoon tamari

1/4 teaspoon Pure Sesame Oil

2 ounces Calrose Rice (rinsed well)

2 ounces Fresh Water

3/8 TBL ghee

Carrots

Radish

Scallions

Fried Egg

Stainless Steel Long Legged Trivet

Ekovana Stainless Steel Insert Pan

Directions

1. Select Saute on Instant Pot and allow to fully heat.

2. Add olive oil, ground beef and onion and saute just enough to break up the beef.

3. Add garlic, ginger, sugar, salt, white pepper, Sambal Oelek (or pepper flakes) and mix through.

4. Mix in grated Asian pear (or applesauce) and pour in soy sauce.

5. Drizzle in sesame oil and then hit cancel.

6. Place trivet into cooking pot over meat.

7. Add pan with the rinsed rice and water onto trivet.  Add 2 ounces of butter. Place top (the one with the holes) onto pan.

8. Lock on lid and close pressure valve. Cook at high pressure for 4 minutes. When beep is heard, wait 10 minutes and then release the rest of the pressure.

9. Remove lid and carefully remove pan of rice.  Remove lid from rice and fluff rice.

10. Place rice into each bowl and ladle on beef. 

11. Garnish with chopped scallions, sliced cucumber, sliced radish and shredded carrots. Add a fried egg on top for a delicious flavor combination. Trust me, it tastes better with a sunny side up fried egg, than without.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 607
Total Fat: 29g
Saturated Fat: 11g
Cholesterol: 91mg
Sodium: 1053mg
Total Carbohydrate: 59g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 9g
Protein: 25g

Photos

Instant Pot Lemon Chicken

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-lemon-chicken/?epik=dj0yJnU9MHg3RGhjU3l1VVhmbVd3clBmX3AtQy1YSVVVbzBMelgmbj1fVVdvSnVfVVZwa3oyM0dRRDFHTmpnJm09MyZ0PUFBQUFBRjFfZ004#wprm-recipe-container-22644
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

4 - 8 (1 1/3 - 2 2/3 lbs, 600g - 1200g) skin on chicken thighs (, bone-in or boneless)

1 (120g) lemon (, slice half of the lemon & juice the other half (~1 tbsp or 15ml))

3 (10g) garlic cloves (, minced)

¾ cup (188ml) unsalted chicken stock

3 tablespoons (63g) date sugar

1 tablespoon (15ml) light tamari

1 tablespoon (15ml) olive oil

A pinch of dried rosemary

A dash of Shaoxing wine

Salt & ground white pepper to taste

2 ½ tablespoons (22.5g) arrowroot

3 tablespoons (45ml) cold water

Fresh Rosemary

Directions

1. Prepare Pressure Cooker: Heat up your pressure cooker (Instant Pot: press Sauté button and click Adjust button to Sauté More function). Make sure your pot is as hot as it can be (Instant Pot: wait until indicator says HOT).

2. Prepare Chicken Thighs: Pat dry the chicken thighs’ skin with paper towels. Season with generous amount of kosher salt and ground black pepper.

3. Brown Chicken Thighs: Pour 1 tbsp (15ml) peanut oil in pressure cooker. Ensure to coat oil over whole bottom of the pot. Place 4 chicken thighs (skin side down) in Instant Pot. Do not overcrowd. Season the meat side lightly with more kosher salt and ground black pepper. Brown the skin side (don’t touch it for 4 minutes). Flip and brown the meat side for 1 ½ minutes. Remove and set aside. *Note: If you are preparing 8 chicken thighs, repeat this step for the remaining 4 chicken thighs.

4. Sauté Garlic: Add minced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.

5. Deglaze: Add a dash of Shaoxing wine in Instant Pot and deglaze by scrubbing the flavorful brown bits off the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon.

6. Pressure Cook Lemon Chicken: Add ¾ cup (188ml) unsalted chicken stock, 1 tbsp (15ml) light soy sauce, 1 tbsp (15ml) freshly squeeze lemon juice, lemon slices, and a pinch of rosemary (rub the rosemary with your fingers to “activate” them). Give it a quick stir and place 4 - 8 browned chicken thighs on top of the lemon slices. Close lid and pressure cook at High Pressure for 5 minutes + 10 minutes Natural Release (after pressure cooker has finished cooking, wait until the floating valve drops. It should take roughly 10 minutes). Turn off the heat. Open the lid carefully.

7. Thicken Gravy: Set aside the cooked chicken thighs on a chopping board. Press Cancel button, then Sauté button to heat up the sauce. Stir in 3 tbsp (63g) honey. In a small mixing bowl, mix 2.5 tbsp (22.5g) cornstarch with 3 tbsp (45ml) cold water. Mix it in one third at a time until desired thickness. Taste the gravy and season with more honey, salt & black pepper if necessary.

8. Serve: Drizzle the lemon sauce onto the chicken thighs and garnish with optional fresh rosemary if desired.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 452
Total Fat: 30g
Saturated Fat: 8g
Cholesterol: 166mg
Sodium: 308mg
Total Carbohydrate: 15g
Sugars: 9g
Protein: 28g

Photos

Instant Pot Mashed Cauliflower with Garlic and Chives –

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://diethood.com/instant-pot-mashed-cauliflower/
Serving size: 4 serves
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 8 mins

Ingredients

1 large head cauliflower (core removed and roughly cut into florets)

1/2 tablespoon olive oil

4 cloves garlic (smashed)

1 1/2 cups chicken broth

1/2 tablespoon ghee

1 tablespoon quark

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/2 cup freshly grated parmesan cheese

1/2 teaspoon chopped fresh chives (plus more for garnish)

Directions

1. Set instant pot to sauté.

2. Add olive oil to instant pot and heat it up.

3. Stir in smashed garlic cloves; mix and stir until garlic is golden brown on all sides, about 1 minute.

4. Stir in chicken broth and cook for 1 minute.

5. Turn off the "sauté" mode and place steamer basket inside your Instant Pot.

6. Transfer prepared cauliflower to the basket inside the Instant Pot.

7. Close the lid and set the valve to sealing.

8. Set on manual setting and cook on high pressure for 3 minutes.

9. Use the quick release function to release the pressure. Open up the lid half way and let stand 3 minutes. 

10. Drain out all of the liquid and transfer the cauliflower and garlic to a food processor or blender. You can also put it in a large bowl and use a potato masher.

11. Add butter, quark, salt, and pepper to the blender; process until blended and creamy. I recommend using the pulse function because you have more control over how creamy or chunky you want your mashed cauliflower.

12. Transfer the cauliflower mixture to a mixing bowl or serving dish.

13. Stir in parmesan cheese and chives. Taste for seasonings and adjust accordingly.

14. Garnish with fresh chives and serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 113
Total Fat: 7g
Saturated Fat: 3g
Cholesterol: 16mg
Sodium: 531mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Protein: 7g

Photos

Instant Pot Mexican Inspired Healthy Crack Chicken

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://tidbits-marci.com/instant-pot-mexican-inspired-healthy-crack-chicken/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs (if breasts are especially large, cut them in half horizontally. I feel like they cook up more tender this way)

1/2 cup salsa (if it's a very thick salsa, add 1/4 cup water to the pot as well)

juice of 1 lime

2 teaspoons chili powder

1 teaspoon cumin

1 teaspoon onion powder

1 teaspoon garlic powder

1 teaspoon kosher salt

1/4 teaspoon black pepper

4 ounces 1/3 less fat cream cheese or whipped cream cheese

1 cup shredded pepper jack cheese

15 oz can black beans, drained and rinsed

cilantro to garnish

optional toppings: pico de Gallo or salsa, guacamole, quark or plain yogurt, taco shells or flour tortillas

Directions

1. Place chicken breasts in the pressure cooker pot in a single layer across the bottom, as much as possible.

2. Add salsa, lime juice, chili powder, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

3. Secure the lid and turn pressure release knob to a sealed position.  Cook at high pressure for 20 minutes.

4. While chicken is cooking, prepare pico de gallo and guacamole if using homemade.

5. When pressure cooking is complete, use a natural release.

6. Remove the chicken to a plate and shred with two forks or place it in a food processor and pulse a few times for a smaller dice, being careful not to overprocess it to the point that it turns to mush.

7. Add cream cheese and pepper jack cheese to the pot.  Select saute to melt the cheese and whisk until smooth.  Stir in the black beans and shredded chicken.

8. Use the chicken for quesadillas, taquitos, hard shell tacos, soft taco wraps, taco salad, etc.  Serve with pico de gallo, salsa, guacamole, sour cream, cilantro, or any other favorite Mexican style toppings.

9. Freezer Instructions

10. Place a freezer safe ziplock inside the pressure cooker pot.  Arrange the chicken in a single layer with the other ingredients in step 1.  Seal the bag and freeze inside pressure cooker pot until solid, then remove the bag from the pot and return to the freezer until ready to use.

11. When ready to cook, add 2-3 tablespoons of water to the pressure cooker pot.  Remove chicken and other ingredients from ziplock and place inside the pot.

12. Cook at high pressure for 30 minutes then proceed with the remaining directions above.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 cup
Calories: 353
Total Fat: 4.7g
Saturated Fat: 1.1g
Cholesterol: 129.1mg
Sodium: 740mg
Total Carbohydrate: 15.7g
Dietary Fiber: 5.8g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 46.3g

Photos

Instant Pot Mexican Street Corn (Elote)

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 08 🌾, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-mexican-street-corn/
Serving size: 4 -6
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

4 - 6 ears corn on the cob (, husks and silk removed)

⅓ cup (83g) mayonnaise

⅓ cup (83g) quark

⅓ cup (20g) finely chopped cilantro leaves

¼ teaspoon (1.4g) sugar

½ cup (120g) cotija cheese or feta cheese (, crumbled)

½ teaspoon (2g) chili powder

¼ teaspoon (1.4g) garlic powder

Juice from half a lime

Chopped cilantro leaves

Lime wedges

Directions

1. Pressure Cook Corn on the Cob: Pour 1 cup (250ml) cold water & place a steamer rack in Instant Pot. Place 4 - 6 ears of corn on the cob on the steamer rack. Close lid, then turn Venting Knob to Sealing position.Pressure cook at High Pressure for 2 minutes, then immediate Quick Release (turning Venting Knob to Venting position). Turn off the heat. Open the lid carefully.

2. Prepare Cheesy Mayo Mixture: While the corn is pressure cooking, mix the following ingredients together in a mixing bowl: ⅓ cup (83g) mayonnaise, ⅓ cup (83g) quark, ½ cup (120g) crumbled cotija cheese or feta cheese, ⅓ cup (20g) finely chopped cilantro leaves, ½ teaspoon (2g) chili powder, ¼ teaspoon (1.4g) sugar, ¼ teaspoon (1.4g) garlic powder, and juice from half a lime.

3. Apply Sauce Mixture: Brush the yummy cheesy mayo sauce mixture all over the corn on the cob with a basting brush.

4. Garnish & Serve Instant Pot Mexican Street Corn: If desired, garnish with extra crumbled cheese and chili powder. Serve immediately with lime wedges on the side. Enjoy!~ ?

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 220
Total Fat: 15g
Saturated Fat: 4g
Cholesterol: 23mg
Sodium: 289mg
Total Carbohydrate: 19g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 7g
Protein: 5g

Photos

Instant Pot Mini Hard Boiled Eggs

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 04 🥚
Collections:
Source: https://toasterovenlove.com/instant-pot-mini-hard-boiled-eggs/
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 17 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1 cup Water

6 Large Eggs

Directions

Pour the water into the inner pot of your 3 qt Instant Pot.

Place the rack that came with your pressure cooker in the bottom of the pot and arrange your eggs on top of it.

Close and lock the lid. Make sure the steam release handle is pointed toward the Sealing position.

Select the Pressure Cook or Manual button and adjust the settings to cook on LOW Pressure for 5 minutes

When the cooking time is up, manually release the pressure using a Quick Release.

Once the float valve has dropped down, carefully open the lid turning it away from you as you lift it up.

Remove the eggs and place in a bowl of ice cold water for at least 5 minutes.

Peel and enjoy right away or store in your fridge for up to one week.

Photos

Instant Pot Mini Lentil Squares

Courses:
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.simplyhappyfoodie.com/instant-pot-mini-cornbread-squares/
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 12 mins

Ingredients

1 cup Water ((for the pressure cooker))

2/3 cup ground red lentils

1 1/4 tsps Baking Powder

1/4 tsp Salt

1 Egg

1/3 cup hemp Milk

1 1/4 Tbsps ghee

Directions

1. Put 1 cup of water in the inner liner of the pressure cooker.

2. Spray a small (food/oven safe) silicone ice cube tray with four 2" square openings (or another baking container of similar configuration) with cooking spray. Set aside.

3. Sift dry ingredients together into a small mixing bowl.

4. Add the egg to a cup and use a fork to beat it.

5. Add the milk and melted butter to the egg and whisk well to combine.

6. Add the wet mixture to the dry and gently combine until the dry ingredients are just moistened (don't over mix, a few dry spots is fine).

7. Fill the silicone tray with batter in the four openings equally.

8. Cover with foil.

9. If your trivet/rack doesn't have handles, make a foil sling. 20" length of foil, folded lengthwise 3 times.

10. Use sling to get the tray into the pressure cooker, setting it on the trivet/rack and folding the ends of the sling over the tray.

11. Put the lid on the pot and lock it in place. Set the steam release knob to the Sealing position.

12. Press Pressure Cook (Manual) and then the + or - button or dial to choose 13 minutes.

13. When the cooking cycle ends, let the pot sit for 15 minutes (natural release). Then turn the steam release knob to the Venting position to release the remaining pressure/steam (there may not be any, and that's okay).

14. When the pin in the lid drops, open the lid and carefully grab the ends of the sling to lift the tray out of the pot and onto a cooling rack. Let sit for 5 minutes.

15. Remove the foil covering, turn the tray upside down, and gently press on the bottom of the squares and the muffins will fall out.

16. Slather with butter, honey, maple syrup, or whatever you like with your cornbread! These are wonderful with black beans, chili, and as a snack!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 150

Photos

Instant Pot Mini Meatloaf

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.sixsistersstuff.com/recipe/instant-pot-mini-meatloaf/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 35 mins

Ingredients

1 pound ground turkey

1 egg

1/2 onion (chopped)

2 3/4 tablespoons ketchup

salt to taste

1/2 cup Vicky's Rice crumbs

5/8 (10.75 ounce) can tomato soup (divided)

1 1/4 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce (divided)

1 1/4 tablespoons brown sugar

Directions

1. In a large bowl mix ground beef, eggs, onion, ketchup, salt, pepper, oatmeal, half of the tomato soup, and 1 Tbs Worcestershire sauce. Once it's mixed well, fill the wells of your silicone mold.

2. Cover the meatloaves with foil or a silicone food cover. Place a trivet in the bottom of your Instant Pot. If layering more than one set of molds, turn the second set so that the wells are not resting over each other.

3. Lock the lid in place and turn the knob to sealing.

4. Press the Manual or Pressure Cook button and set for 35 minutes. When done, release the pressure using the quick release method.

5. Turn the oven onto broil.

6. Remove the meatloaves and arrange them on a cooking sheet. Mix together the other half of the tomato soup, 1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce, and brown sugar. Pour the over the meatloaves.

7. You can broil the meatloaves for 3-5 minutes or just serve just like that!

8. Serve with your favorite side dishes. I like to serve it with mashed potatoes and corn.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 371
Total Fat: 24g
Saturated Fat: 9g
Cholesterol: 123mg
Sodium: 302mg
Total Carbohydrate: 21g
Sugars: 9g
Protein: 18g

Photos

Instant Pot Mongolian Turkey

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://amindfullmom.com/instant-pot-mongolian-beef/#wprm-recipe-container-13725
Serving size: 6
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 8 mins

Ingredients

1 tablespoon oil

1 pound turkey cutlets (cut into thin strips)

2 teaspoons freshly grated ginger

1 tablespoon garlic

1/3 cup tamari

2/3 cup pineapple juice

1/4 cup molasses

2 tablespoons arrowroot

Directions

1. Prepare you flank steak by slicing against the grain into very thin strips (about 1/4-1/2 inch thick).

2. If you want to sear your meat, turn your Instant Pot to saute. Once it reads "HOT," add in 1/2 -1 tablespoon oil and let heat for 1 minute. Add in beef and saute until JUST browned. About 2 minutes.

3. Mix together the soy sauce, pineapple juice, honey and seasonings and add to Instant Pot. 

4. Put lid on Instant Pot and turn vent knob to the sealed position. 

5. Hit manual (you will have to first turn the Instant Pot OFF from Saute function) and then adjust the cook time by using the plus or minus buttons to 3 minutes. 

6. After cook time has elapsed, let rest 5-10 minutes and then do a quick release. 

7. Turn Instant Pot back to saute. Make a cornstarch slurry by mixing cornstarch with 2 tablespoons water until fully combined. Add cornstarch slurry to pressure cooker and stir and boil for 2-3 minutes. 

8. Turn off instant pot and serve Mongolian Beef with rice, cauliflower rice and top with scallions or sesame seeds if desired.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 201
Total Fat: 6g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 45mg
Sodium: 519mg
Total Carbohydrate: 19g
Sugars: 14g
Protein: 17g

Photos

Instant Pot Mushroom Risotto

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 07 🧈, 08 🌾, 11 🥵, 12 ☕
Collections:
Source: https://pressureluckcooking.com/recipe/instant-pot-mushroom-risotto/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 tbsp of olive oil

4 tbsp of salted butter, divided in half

2 large shallots, diced

24 oz Baby Bella mushrooms, sliced

1 tbsp of crushed garlic

2 cups of Arborio rice

4.5 cups of mushroom broth

1/2 cup of a dry white wine

1 tsp of seasoned salt

1/2 tsp of white pepper

1/4 tsp of Italian seasoning

1/4 tsp of dried parsley

1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese

1 tbsp of white or black truffle oil

Directions

1. Add the vegetable oil and the first 2 tbsp (1/4 stick) of butter to the Instant Pot

2. Hit “Sauté” and “Adjust” so it’s on the “More” or “High” setting and wait until the butter has melted and it bubbles

3. Add the shallots and cook for about 2 minutes so it softens and just lightly browns. Then, add the garlic and sauté for another minute with the shallots. Lastly, add the mushrooms and add the other 2 tbsp (1/4 stick) of butter. Stir constantly with the shallots and garlic for another 2-3 minutes until the butter’s melted and the mushrooms brown a bit in color

4. Next, add in the white wine and once it bubbles, let it do so for another minute so the mushrooms simmer in it as you deglaze (scrape) the bottom of the pot to make sure it’s free and clear of any veggie remnants from sautéing (NOTE: If not using wine, add in 1/2 cup of the broth now)

5. Add in the rice and mix it in with everything in the pot and let sauté for 1 minute

6. Lastly, add in the broth, seasoned salt, black pepper, Italian seasoning and dried parsley. Stir well, once again deglazing the bottom of the pot so nothing’s stuck on. (NOTE: It will look like there’s way too much liquid in the pot given how much risotto is in it, but trust me. It will be magical and perfect once cooked since Arborio rice is a major liquid absorber once cooked)

7. Secure the lid, hit “Manual” or “Pressure Cook” High Pressure for 6 minutes. Quick release when done. Once the lid comes off, stir everything together and it will immediately be the right consistency

8. Add in the grated Parmesan cheese and truffle oil, stir until well combined and transfer to a serving dish

9. Enjoy!

Photos

Instant Pot My Chili Mac

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.thereciperebel.com/instant-pot-chili-mac/
Serving size: 1 3 3/4 tablespoons servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 7 mins

Ingredients

2 3/4 ounces lean ground turkey

1 TBSP dehydrated onion

1 TBSP dehydrated celery

1 TBSP dehydrated Carrot

3/4 tsp Beet powder

1/4 tsp Turmeric

1/4 tsp Garlic powder

1/4 tsp Onion powder

1/4 tsp Dried Oregano

1/4 tsp cumin

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon minced garlic

1/8 teaspoon cumin

1/2 cup chicken broth

3 TBS dehydrated black beans

1/4 cup nomato sauce

2 ounces penne

Directions

1. Using pot in pot, place all ingredients, except pasta, in covered pot. Place pasta in strainer pot on bottom.

2. Stack pots with steamer basket on bottom. Add enough water to come to nearly top of strainer basket.

3. Put the lid on, turn the valve to sealing, and select Pressure Cook or Manual for 2 minutes. 

4. When the cook time is over, do a controlled release of the pressure (slowly release the pressure by holding the valve slightly open but not all of the way).

5. Remove the lid and stir -- some macaroni may appear dry or stuck together but once you stir it will be perfect. 

6. Add drained pasta to rest of ingredients and serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 590
Total Fat: 24g
Saturated Fat: 14g
Cholesterol: 107mg
Sodium: 1375mg
Total Carbohydrate: 52g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 5g
Protein: 43g

Photos

Instant Pot Paneer

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄, 10 🍒
Collections:
Source: https://www.everynookandcranny.net/instant-pot-paneer/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 litres full fat milk ((UHT milk works a treat too))

60 ml lemon or lime juice ((or distilled white vinegar))

Your Instant Pot!

A slotted spoon

Cheesecloth or several layers of strong kitchen roll (I much prefer cheesecloth as you can twist it up tightly to press the paneer)

A small strainer* or if you're lucky, a paneer mould (A diameter of about 6 inches is just about right for this amount of paneer)

A small plate or saucer

Heavy cans to weight the paneer with

Directions

1. Unless you are planning to keep the whey, I start by giving the sink and draining board a really good scrub and clean so that I can strain my paneer straight into the sink. Move unnecessary items and cleaning products out the way too. 

2. Pour the milk and lemon juice into the Instant Pot, pop the lid on and close the valve. Set to Manual and adjust to Low Pressure then set to 4 minutes. When finished, allow a NPR. 

3. Line your strainer/tofu press with cheesecloth and pour the curds and whey through them. Go slowly as there will be a large volume of whey to strain. 

4. Gather up the cheesecloth, squeeze and press the paneer flat. Sit the press's lid on top of the cheesecloth and weight it down with some heavy cans. Sit the press on a plate and chill overnight before slicing and using. 

5. Paneer can be sealed in a tupperware box with or without water in (there are contrasting reports of whether storing underwater makes it more or less firm). It will keep unused for up to 3 days.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 265
Total Carbohydrate: 1g

Photos

Instant Pot Pasta (Regular & Gluten-Free Noodles)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://detoxinista.com/instant-pot-pasta/#wprm-recipe-container-32197
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 3 mins

Ingredients

1 pound pasta

water

salt

Directions

1. Regular or Whole Wheat Pasta:

2. If using spaghetti noodles, break them into thirds and add them to the pot in a criss-cross manner, to help prevent them from sticking together as they cook. For other types of short-cut pasta, you can just pour the noodles into the pot. Add in 5 1/2 cups of water and add a teaspoon of salt. It's okay to give the pasta a stir if you're using the short-cut pasta, but do not stir spaghetti noodles. (Spaghetti noodles might stick out a bit from the water, but that's okay because they will sink in as they soften and cook.)

3. Secure the lid and move the steam release valve to Sealing. Use the Manual or Pressure Cook button to cook at high pressure for 3 minutes. It will take roughly 15 minutes for the pot to come to pressure, so the Instant Pot will only read "On" until the floating valve in the lid pops up, signaling that the pot is pressurized.

4. When the cooking cycle is complete, let the pressure naturaly release for 10 minutes. When the screen reads LO:10, you can move the steam release valve to Venting to release the remaining pressure. (You'll know it's safe to open the lid when the floating valve in the lid drops.)

5. Give the pasta a stir and check to make sure it's tender enough, then drain and rinse the pasta to remove any excess starch. Serve warm with your favorite pasta sauce and toppings.

6. Gluten-Free Pasta

7. Follow the directions above for either spaghetti noodles or short cut pasta, but use a cook time of 0 minutes (yes, zero minutes) instead of the 3 minute cooking cycle. When the cooking cycle is complete, allow the pressure to naturally release for 8 minutes. When the screen reads LO:08 move the steam release valve to Venting to release the remaining pressure.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 210
Total Fat: 1g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 3mg
Total Carbohydrate: 42g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 7g

Photos

Instant pot pineapple jam

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://thebellyrulesthemind.net/instant-pot-pineapple-jam/
Serving size: 2 (8 oz bottle)
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

1 Pineapple (ripe)

half inch fresh ginger/ grated ( you can skip it if you don't like ginger)

1/3 cup raw honey/(use your choice of sweetener for vegan version)

1 lime juice

SUB: HONEE for Honey

Directions

1. Start by making an even-as-you-can cut across the top, to remove it. As you can see in the video

2. Place the hollow part of the pineapple corer over the core.

3. Once in place, begin turning clockwise while pushing down until you get to the bottom of the pineapple

4. Once in place, begin turning clockwise while pushing down until you get to the bottom of the pineapple

5. Grip the handle and press the black buttons (thereâs one on either side) and pull up.

6. Add the pineapple rings in the Instant pot . Add the grated ginger, lime juice and honey .

7. Close the lid and turn the valve in a Sealing position. Press the "Pressure Cook" or "Manual" button and set the time for 10 minutes on High pressure.

8. When its done , quick release the steam. Open the lid and use a high speed immersion blender to make a puree

9. Press the Saute button on the Instant Pot and let the pineapple jam cook and thicken . Keep stirring, until thickened to your desired consistency it will take about 10 minutes

Instant Pot Poached Eggs

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄
Collections:
Source: https://catsandcravings.com/2019/08/03/easy-instant-pot-poached-eggs/
Serving size: Servings: varies
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Eggs

Ghee

Directions

1. Generously grease egg bite pan(s) with cooking spray or butter.

2. Place 1 cup of water in Instant Pot pan, and add trivet.

3. Place egg bite pan on top of trivet, and place lid of instant pot in “Seal” position.

4. Cook for 8 minutes at high pressure (you may need to adjust this).

5. Release pressure quickly after Instant Pot beeps.

Instant Pot Popcorn

Courses: Snack
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source: https://dontmesswithmama.com/instant-pot-popcorn/#wprm-recipe-container-16436
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1/2 cup organic popcorn kernels

2 tbsp ghee

1/8 Himalayan salt

2 tbsp butter

Directions

1. Turn Instant Pot on to the Saute (High) setting. Wait 5 minutes to allow the temperature to get high.

2. Add coconut oil and let it melt. Tilt the Instant Pot to swirl around coconut oil to cover the bottom of the pan. Make sure the oil is sizzling hot (put a drop a water to check that it sizzles). NOTE: If you skip this step, the popcorn will stick to the bottom and burn.

3. Add popcorn kernels and use a spatula to coat the popcorn well. Stir for about 30 seconds. Cover with a clear Instant Pot lid.

4. It will take about 2 minutes for the popcorn to start popping. Do NOT take off the lid. Use the lid to see when most of the popcorn is popped (about 3/4 done or about 3-4 minutes), and then turn it off (letting the rest of the kernels pop for another 30 seconds or so).

5. Remove the lid and then take out the inner pot. Pour the popcorn into a large bowl and let it sit for about 2-3 minutes to let the coconut oil set in. This adds to the flavor. 

6. Add butter (optional) and salt to taste.

Notes

HIGH

Refined Avocado Oil Smoke Point: 520ºF (270°C)

Safflower Oil Smoke Point: 510ºF (265ºC)

Rice Bran Oil Smoke Point: 490ºF (254ºC)

Refined or Light Olive Oil Smoke Point: 465ºF (240ºC)

Soybean Oil Smoke Point: 450ºF (232ºC)

Peanut Oil Smoke Point: 450ºF (232ºC)

Ghee or Clarified Butter Smoke Point: 450ºF (232ºC)

Corn Oil Smoke Point: 450ºF (232ºC)

Peanut Oil Smoke Point: 450ºF (232ºC)

Refined Coconut Oil Smoke Point: 450ºF (232ºC)

Safflower Oil Smoke Point: 440ºF (227ºC)

Refined Sesame Oil Smoke Point: 410ºF (210ºC)

Vegetable Oil Smoke Point: 400-450ºF (204-232ºC)

Beef Tallow Smoke Point: 400ºF (204ºC)

Canola Oil Smoke Point: 400ºF (204ºC)

Not High

Grapeseed Oil Smoke Point: 390ºF (199ºC)

Unrefined or Virgin Avocado Oil Smoke Point: 375ºF (190ºC)

Pork Fat or Lard Smoke Point: 370ºF (188ºC)

Chicken Fat or Schmaltz Smoke Point: 375ºF (190ºC)

Duck Fat Smoke Point: 375ºF (190ºC)

Vegetable Shortening Smoke Point: 360ºF (182ºC)

Unrefined Sesame Oil Smoke Point: 350ºF (177ºC)

Extra Virgin or Unrefined Coconut Oil Smoke Point: 350ºF (177ºC)

Extra Virgin Olive Oil Smoke Point: 325-375ºF (163-190ºC)

Butter Smoke Point: 302ºF (150ºC)

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 186
Total Fat: 13g
Saturated Fat: 9g
Cholesterol: 15mg
Sodium: 124mg
Total Carbohydrate: 15g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Instant Pot Pumpkin Butter

Courses:
Categories: 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://tidbits-marci.com/instant-pot-pumpkin-butter/
Serving size: 4 cups
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

29 ounce canned pumpkin

1 tablespoon vanilla extract

¾ cup apple cider or apple juice

8 pitted dates or 3/4 cup brown sugar

3 cinnamon sticks or 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice

Directions

1. To a heat safe bowl, add pumpkin, vanilla, apple cider, dates or brown sugar, cinnamon sticks or ground cinnamon, and pumpkin pie spice; stir, making sure the dates are immersed in the mixture.  

2. Add 1 cup of water to the pressure cooker pot and place trivet inside.  Place bowl on the trivet.

3. Secure the lid and turn pressure release knob to a sealed position.  Cook at high pressure for 15 minutes.

4. When cooking is complete, use a quick release.

5. Carefully remove bowl.  

6. Using a fork, remove cinnamon sticks from the hot pumpkin butter.  

7. Pour mixture into a blender and puree until completely smooth.  This step can also be done directly in the bowl with an immersion blender.  The dates will be moist and soft and will puree easily. If using brown sugar instead of dates, there is no need to puree, just stir until smooth.

8. Serve hot or cold on muffins, rolls, pancakes, etc.  

9. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week.  Freezes very well

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 42
Total Fat: 0.3g
Saturated Fat: 0.2g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 6.5mg
Total Carbohydrate: 9.1g
Dietary Fiber: 3.2g
Sugars: 3.5g
Protein: 1.2g

Photos

Instant Pot Pumpkin Muffin Bites

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.sparklestosprinkles.com/instant-pot-pumpkin-muffin-bites/
Serving size:
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 35 mins

Ingredients

1 recipe Keto yellow cake

1 Can Pure Pumpkin 15 oz

Directions

1. Pour cake mix and pumpkin into a bowl.

2. Blend mixture well with a hand blender.

3. Spray egg bite molds with with olive oil. Spoon aprx. 2 tsp of the pumpkin mixture into the egg bite molds. Pour just below the edge allowing enough room so that it does not spill when cooking.

4. Place your trivet into your inner pot. Pour 1 cup of water into your pot.  Place your egg bites mold on top of your trivet.  Place two rings from mason jars to act as a spacer, so you can place another egg bite mold on top. Close your lid and set to sealing.

5. Set your pot to manual high pressure for 35 minutes. Do a natural release for 10 minutes and than release the remaining pressure.

6. Allow pumpkin muffin bites to cool before removing them from the egg bite mold. Unless you are serving warm, them remove carefully. Turn the egg bite mold over and push down in the center of each mold. Allowing for easier removal of your pumpkin muffin bites. Enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1
Calories: 62
Total Fat: 1g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 2mg
Sodium: 113mg
Total Carbohydrate: 13g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Sugars: 7g
Protein: 1g

Photos

Instant Pot Pumpkin Spiced Coffee Concentrate

Courses:
Categories: 11 🥵, 12 ☕
Collections:
Source: https://www.sparklestosprinkles.com/instant-pot-pumpkin-spiced-coffee-concentrate/
Serving size:
Preparation time: 1 min
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1 1/4 Cups Coffee Grinds *(regular or decaf)

5 1/4 TSP Ground Cinnamon

1 1/4 teaspoons ground ginger

3/4 teaspoon ground cloves

1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg

18 Cups of Water

Directions

1. In a bowl mix coffee grinds, pumpkin pie spice & ground cinnamon.

2. Pour into your pot.

3. Pour 18 cups of water into the pot.

4. Set your pot to manual high pressure for 5 minutes. Do a natural release This may take some time so be patient. Mine took about an hour for my pin to drop.

5. Strain the coffee concentrate to remove the grinds. I poured mine through a coffee filter. (as you get close to the bottom, you may want to strain twice. Most of the sludge is at the bottom and starts to require more straining)

HOW TO USE YOUR COFFEE CONCENTRATE

My favorite way is to fill a mason jar full of ice, add in coffee concentrate.  A little goes a long way.  You will want to pour about 1/3 of the way with coffee, top with milk, skim milk, heavy cream or condensed milk.

If you are not using ice, mix an equal amount of concentrate and water, than top with milk or cream.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1
Calories: 3
Total Fat: 0g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 10mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Sugars: 0g
Protein: 0g

Photos

Instant Pot Refried Beans

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 07 🧈, 09 🥕, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.wellplated.com/instant-pot-refried-beans/
Serving size: 6 cups
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour 10 mins

Ingredients

1 pound dry pinto beans (2 cups)

2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil

1 small yellow onion chopped

3 cloves garlic minced

4 cups low-sodium chicken stock or vegetable stock (divided)

3 cups water

2 bay leaves

1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt

1 teaspoon ground cumin

1 teaspoon dried oregano

Directions

1. Place the pinto beans in a large colander. Thoroughly rinse them. Pick the beans over, removing any damaged or clearly misshapen beans and discarding them. Set the rinsed beans aside.

2. Turn a 6-quart (or larger) Instant Pot to SAUTE. Add the oil. Once the oil is hot, add the onion and jalapeno. Sauté for 2 minutes, then add the garlic and let cook just until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add a few splashes of chicken stock and scrape along the bottom of the pot to remove any stuck-on bits of food (this will prevent a BURN warning). Add the remaining stock, water, bay leaves, salt, cumin, oregano, cayenne, and the rinsed and drained beans. Lightly stir to combine.

3. Seal the Instant Pot. Cook on HIGH (manual) for 45 minutes. When the 45 minutes of pressure cooking has finished, let the pressure release naturally for 25 minutes. Vent to release any remaining pressure. Carefully open the lid. The beans will be very liquidy.

4. Discard the bay leaves. Reserve 2 cups of the bean cooking liquid in a bowl or measuring cup, then drain the remainder. Return to the beans to the pot. With an immersion blender (or by hand with a potato masher), puree the beans until they reach your desired consistency, adding some of the reserved liquid as needed. (You can also scoop the beans into a blender in batches and puree them that way—be sure to let the beans cool somewhat first so that they do not splatter). Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Sprinkle with any desired toppings, serve, and enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 /2 cup
Calories: 76
Total Fat: 1g
Total Carbohydrate: 24g
Dietary Fiber: 15g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 8g

Photos

Instant Pot Rice

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 08 🌾, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://greenhealthycooking.com/instant-pot-rice/#wprm-recipe-container-5928
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

1 cup rice ((basmati white, jasmin white, basmati brown, short-grain brown, red, black, wild, wild blend, sushi) )

1 cup water

1/2 tsp sea salt

Directions

1. Add all ingredients into the Instant Pot. You can double, triple or quadruple all ingredients in same amounts.

2. Make sure sealing ring is placed properly in lid, add lid, turn shut and turn knob to sealing position.

3. Cook on high pressure for amount of minutes instructed below depending on type of rice. 

INSTANT POT WHITE RICE

3 minutes high pressure

INSTANT POT BROWN RICE

Basmati

22 minutes high pressure

Short Grain

24 minutes high pressure

INSTANT POT WILD RICE

28-30-32 minutes high pressure (unburst-some burst some unburst-burst)

INSTANT POT RED RICE

INSTANT POT BLACK RICE

30 minutes high pressure

INSTANT POT SUSHI RICE

5 minutes high pressure

INSTANT POT WILD RICE BLEND

28 minutes high pressure

4. Natural Pressure Release until pin drops (max. 18 minutes).

5. Remove all rice from pot immediately to stop from cooking. If needing to keep warm, leave rice in pot after natural pressure release without opening the lid so avoid steam being released and drying out the rice.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 168
Sodium: 296mg
Total Carbohydrate: 36g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Instant Pot Rotisserie Chicken

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://damndelicious.net/2019/01/15/instant-pot-rotisserie-chicken/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 45 mins
Cooking time: 40 mins

Ingredients

2 teaspoons sea salt

2 teaspoons dried thyme

1 teaspoon dried oregano

1 teaspoon onion powder

1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

1 whole roasting chicken

1 lemon, halved

2 tablespoons olive oil

1 cup chicken stock

Directions

1. In a small bowl, combine salt, thyme, paprika, oregano, onion powder and garlic powder.

2. Remove giblets and excess fat from the chicken cavity. Dry chicken thoroughly with paper towels. Season chicken and chicken cavity with salt mixture. Stuff cavity with lemon.

3. Set 6-qt Instant Pot® to the high saute setting. Add canola oil and chicken, breast side down, and cook until evenly golden brown, about 4-5 minutes. Using tongs, flip, and cook for an additional 4 minutes; set aside.

4. Place metal trivet into the pot and add chicken stock. Gently place chicken on top of the trivet. Select manual setting; adjust pressure to high, and set time for 28 minutes. When finished cooking, naturally release pressure according to manufacturer’s directions, about 20-30 minutes. Let rest 10-15 minutes.

5. Serve immediately.

Photos

Instant Pot Sabzi Polo

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://twosleevers.com/instant-pot-sabzi-polo/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 24 mins

Ingredients

1 cup Basmati Rice (rinsed and drained)

1/2 cup mixed dried herbs for sabzi polo

1 1/2 cups Water

1 teaspoon Kosher Salt

1 tablespoon Butter

Directions

1. Place the rinsed rice in the inner liner of your Instant Pot. Add the mixed dried herbs, water, and salt and mix well.

2. Cut up the butter into small pieces and sprinkle it over the rice.

3. Cook the rice and herbs on high pressure for 4 minutes, and then allow the pot to sit undisturbed for 10 minutes.

4. Release any remaining pressure, open the lid, and stir gently with a spatula, taking care to not break the rice.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 203
Total Fat: 3g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Total Carbohydrate: 38g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Protein: 4g

Photos

Instant Pot Salisbury Steak

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.spendwithpennies.com/instant-pot-salisbury-steak/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

5 1/4 ounces sliced mushrooms

3/8 onion (sliced)

1 cup beef broth (low sodium)

3/4 ounce package brown gravy mix (dry)

3/4 tablespoon tomato paste

3/4 tablespoon Dijon mustard

1 1/4 tablespoons fresh parsley

3/4 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce

1 1/4 tablespoons arrowroot

2 3/4 tablespoons water

1 pound 1/8 ounce lean ground turkey

5/8 egg yolk

3 1/2 tablespoons Vicky's Rice Crumbs

2 tablespoons milk

sea salt & white pepper to taste

Directions

1. Place onions and mushrooms in the bottom of the Instant Pot.

2. Combine ingredients and form 4 patties. Brown over medium high heat (about 3 minutes per side) in a skillet. *see note

3. Layer beef patties over mushrooms. Combine remaining ingredients except water and cornstarch. Pour over beef and cook high pressure, 18 minutes.

4. Quick release. Remove patties and set aside.

5. Turn IP onto sautee. Combine cold water and cornstarch. Stir into the broth and let cook a few minutes until thickened. Add beef back into the sauce to coat.

6. Serve over mashed potatoes or rice.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 302
Total Fat: 18g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 110mg
Sodium: 320mg
Total Carbohydrate: 8g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 24g

Photos

Instant Pot Shrimp Risotto

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 03 🐟, 05 🐄, 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 10 🍒, 11 🥵, 12 ☕
Collections:
Source: https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/food-network-kitchen/instant-pot-shrimp-risotto-5562235
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 shallot

2 cloves garlic

4 tablespoons unsalted butter

Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

1 1/2 cups arborio rice

3 sprigs fresh thyme

1/3 cup dry white wine

1 8-ounce bottle clam juice

1 pound peeled and deveined large shrimp

1/2 cup frozen peas

2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese

1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest, plus more for topping

Lemon wedges, for serving

Directions

1. Set an Instant Pot to sauté on the medium setting. Chop the shallot and garlic. When the pot is hot, add 2 tablespoons butter, then add the shallot, garlic and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in the rice and thyme sprigs and cook until the rice is toasted, about 3 minutes. Stir in the wine, scraping the bottom of the pot, and cook until evaporated, about 30 seconds. Turn off the sauté function.

2. Stir the clam juice and 3 cups hot water into the pot. Close the lid and turn the steam valve to the sealing position. Set the pot to cook on high pressure for 5 minutes. When the time is up, turn the valve to the venting position and release the steam completely. Carefully open the lid.

3. Season the shrimp with salt and pepper and add to the pot. Stir in the peas. With the pot still turned off, close the lid and let the shrimp cook through, about 5 minutes.

4. Add the parmesan and lemon zest to the risotto; stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons butter until melted. Add a few dashes of water to loosen, if necessary. Discard the thyme sprigs. Divide among bowls. Top with lemon zest and serve with lemon wedges.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 460
Total Fat: 13g
Saturated Fat: 8g
Cholesterol: 177mg
Sodium: 969mg
Total Carbohydrate: 61g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 22g

Photos

Instant Pot Sous Vide Egg Bites // 5 Ways (Starbucks Copycat)

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 02 🐔, 04 🥚, 05 🐄, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.platingsandpairings.com/instant-pot-sous-vide-egg-bites-starbucks-copycat/
Serving size: 7 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

4 eggs

½ cup monterey jack cheese (shredded)

½ cup cottage cheese

1 green onion (chopped)

½ roasted red pepper (chopped)

¼ cup spinach (chopped)

4 eggs

1/2 cup pepperjack cheese (shredded )

1/2 cup cottage cheese

1/4 cup diced green chilis

4 eggs

1/2 cup cheddar cheese (shredded )

1/2 cup cottage cheese

1/4 cup cooked broccoli (chopped )

4 eggs

1/2 cup gruyere cheese (shredded)

1/2 cup cottage cheese

1/4 cup cooked turkey bacon (crumbled)

4 eggs

1/2 cup swiss cheese (shredded)

1/2 cup cottage cheese

1/4 cup cooked sausage (crumbled)

1/4 cup cooked mushrooms (chopped)

1 Tablespoon green onions (chopped)

4 eggs

1/2 cup cottage cheese

1/4 cup feta cheese (crumbled)

1/4 cup diced sun dried tomatoes

1 Tablespoon chopped fresh basil (or 1 tsp. dried basil)

Directions

1. Add 1 cup water to Instant Pot and place the trivet (that came with your Instant Pot) inside.

2. Add eggs, monterey jack, and cottage cheese to a blender and process until smooth (about 30 seconds). Add green onion, red pepper and spinach and give it a quick pulse to combine.

3. Divide the egg mixture evenly between the compartments of the silicone mold, tightly cover with aluminum foil. 

4. Lower the silicone mold into the Instant Pot. It’s a bit of a tight squeeze, but with the 6-quart Instant Pot, it fit perfectly.

5. Place the lid on the Instant Pot and be sure that the vent is set to sealing. Press the STEAM button and set the timer to 10 minutes. It will take about 5 minutes for the Instant Pot to come to full pressure, then the display will show a countdown timer.

6. Once the cooking time is up, allow the pressure to release naturally for 10 minutes, and then release any remaining pressure before opening the Instant Pot.

7. Remove the silicone mold from the Instant Pot and allow the egg bites to cool for a few minutes before enjoying.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 82
Total Fat: 5g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Cholesterol: 103mg
Sodium: 170mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Protein: 6g

Photos

Instant Pot Southern Boiled Peanuts

Courses: Snack
Categories: 09 🥕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://pressureluckcooking.com/recipe/instant-pot-southern-boiled-peanuts/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 pounds of green peanuts

A “scant” 1/2 cup of salt

Directions

1. Dump the peanuts in a strainer and pluck off any long stems. Rinse thoroughly

2. Add the peanuts to the Instant Pot, and cover with all other ingredients plus enough water to cover the peanuts. When they start to rise (since they float), you have enough.

3. Use a steamer to put on top of the peanuts and gently press down to keep them in place (this step isn’t necessary but we did it)

4. Hit “Manual” or “Pressure Cook” High Pressure for 45 minutes and allow a natural release OR for 60 minutes and do a quick release. Either method is fine. IF you are using raw peanuts instead of green peanuts, make sure you soak them overnight and then cook for 80 minutes and allow a natural release

5. When done, transport to a large container with a bunch of the liquid it cooked in and refrigerate for a few hours as these taste best cold

6. Enjoy!

Photos

Instant Pot Spaghetti Squash

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 05 🐄, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://cookingwithkarli.com/instant-pot-spaghetti-squash/
Serving size: 8 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 7 mins

Ingredients

1 cup water

1 spaghetti squash (about 3 lbs)

1/4 cup ghee (softnened)

1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese

1 tsp minced garlic

1/2 tsp salt

1/4 tsp white pepper fresh ground

Directions

1. Pour the water into the Instant Pot, insert the trivet.

2. Cut the spaghetti squash in half, remove the seeds.

3. Combine all ingredients for the Garlic Parmesan Butter and spread on the inside of the spaghetti squash, if desired.

4. Place the spaghetti squash in the Instant Pot and cook on Manual (or Pressure Cook) HIGH for 7 minutes. Quick release the pressure when the cook cycle has completed.

5. Use a fork to shred the spaghetti squash.

6. Season with additional salt, pepper and parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 103
Total Fat: 7g
Saturated Fat: 4g
Cholesterol: 18mg
Sodium: 266mg
Total Carbohydrate: 9g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 3g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Instant Pot Spaghetti Squash - No Prep!

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://tidbits-marci.com/instant-pot-spaghetti-squash/
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time: 1 min
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 small to medium spaghetti squash (look for one the size and shape to fit in your pressure cooker pot, whole)

Directions

1. Pour 1 cup of water into the pressure cooker pot.  Place a low rise trivet inside and place spaghetti squash on top.  Note: there is no need to poke holes in the squash.

2. Secure the lid and turn pressure release knob to a sealed position.  Cook at high pressure for 25 minutes.

3. When cooking is complete, use a quick release.

4. Let squash cool slightly then cut in half horizontally and scoop out and discard seeds.  Use a fork to shred squash.

5. Use immediately or refrigerate.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 63
Total Fat: 1.2g
Saturated Fat: 0.2g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 34.3mg
Total Carbohydrate: 14g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 5.6g
Protein: 1.3g

Photos

Instant Pot Spinach

Courses: Side Dish
Categories: 07 🧈, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://temeculablogs.com/instant-pot-spinach/
Serving size: 5
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 4 mins

Ingredients

8 c spinach (fresh leaves)

1 tbsp garlic (minced)

1.5 c chicken broth (or vegetable broth)

1/2 tsp sea salt

1 tbsp olive oil

Directions

1. Turn your Instant Pot to saute, add 1 tbsp olive oil. Saute garlic for 4-5 minutes stirring on and off until lightly browned. Turn pot off/cancel button.

2. (deglaze your pot, link to how to do this in post) - basically you add chicken broth, scraping bottom of pan and stirring. 

3. Add spinach to the pot and then add sea salt. Turn pressure valve to sealing and set manual pressure on high for 4.

4. Do a quick release when done and serve!

Nutrition

Serving size: 3 oz
Calories: 146
Total Fat: 12g

Dietary Fiber: 1g

Instant Pot Split Pea Soup

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.wenthere8this.com/split-pea-soup/
Serving size: 3 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1/2 cups dry split peas

2 cups emu stock

onion

garlic

ginger

Thyme

Sea salt

Directions

1. Heat the ghee in the Instant Pot using the saute setting (normal). Add the onions, garlic and ginger paste and cook until soft. Then add the turkey leg, split peas, chicken stock and curry powder.

2. Set the Instant Pot to pressure cook on high for 15 minutes. Let the pressure release naturally for 10 minutes, and use the quick release to release the remaining pressure.

Instant Pot Steel Cut Oatmeal

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 08 🌾
Collections:
Source: https://amindfullmom.com/instant-pot-steel-cut-oats/
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 2 mins
Cooking time: 24 mins

Ingredients

1/4 cup steel cut oats

1 cup water for instant pot

3/4 cup water with oats w/oats

Dash of salt

Directions

1. Insert steamer rack inside inner pot of Instant Pot. Add in 1 cup of water to inner pot.

2. Inside a heat safe bowl, mix together the oats and water.

3. Place bowl on top of steaming rack and put lid on Instant pot. 

4. Set Valve to "sealed" and set Porridge and time to 24 minutes on high pressure.

5. Allow pressure to naturally release. 

6. Remove bowl carefully from pressure cooker and then serve with desired toppings or allow to cool and store in fridge to reheat as needed.

Nutrition

Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 271
Total Fat: 6g

Instant Pot Stick Of Butter Rice

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.sparklestosprinkles.com/instant-pot-stick-of-butter-rice/
Serving size:
Preparation time: 3 mins
Cooking time: 12 mins

Ingredients

10 1/2 oz can Campbell's Beef Consume

10 1/2 oz can Campbell's condensed French Onion Soup

1/2 (4 TBSP) stick butter cut into slices

Directions

1. Pour Rice into the instant pot.

2. Pour in beef consume & French Onion Soup.

3. Lay butter slices on top. Close the lid.

4. Select Low Pressure or Rice Button

5. Cook for 12 minutes on low pressure

6. Do a quick release
