Sous Vide Mahi Mahi

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Directions

Sous Vide Mahi Mahi Times and Temperatures

Slightly Warmed 104°F (40°C)

104°F for Time by Thickness (40.0ºC)

Firm Sashimi 110°F (43.3°C)

110°F for Time by Thickness (43.3ºC)

Lightly Flaky and/or Firm 120°F (48.9°C)

120°F for Time by Thickness (48.9ºC)

Very Flaky and/or Firm 132°F (55.5°C)

132°F for Time by Thickness (55.6ºC)

Chewy 140°F (60°C)

140°F for Time by Thickness (60.0ºC)

Photos

Sous Vide Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://www.savoringthegood.com/mahi-mahi-fish-tacos-recipe/
Serving size: 10 tacos
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour

Ingredients

1/4 cup cucumber, diced

2 tablespoons cilantro, finely chopped

1 lime, juiced

1 teaspoon cumin powder

Salt, to taste

3 Mahi Mahi fillets, fresh

1 tablespoon cumin

1/2 teaspoon onion powder

1/4 teaspoon salt

Directions

1. Preheat the sous vide water bath to 140.

2. Combine the cumin, onion powder, chili powder and salt in a small bowl.

3. Evenly spread the spice mixture over the Mahi Mahi fillets, pressing gently.

4. Place the Mahi Mahi fillets into a sous-vide bag.

5. Remove the air and seal with the FoodSaver.

6. Place the sous-vide bag in the water bath and cook for 1 hour.

7. Remove from the water bath.

8. Carefully remove the Mahi Mahi fillets from the sous-vide bag.

9. Pat dry with paper towels to remove any excess moisture.

10. Preheat a cast iron skillet to high and to the point of smoking.

11. Drizzle olive oil in the pan and place the Mahi Mahi flesh side down in the oil.

12. Sear for 1-2 minutes or until a lovely crust forms.

13. Remove from the pan and transfer to a cutting board.

14. Remove the skin from the filet.

15. Slice into bite size pieces.

16. Assemble your Mahi Mahi fish tacos and enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 2
Calories: 111
Total Fat: 1g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 90mg
Sodium: 231mg
Total Carbohydrate: 1g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Sugars: 0g
Protein: 23g

Photos

Sous Vide Mushrooms

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://tasteofartisan.com/sous-vide-mushrooms/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 lb mushrooms (maitake or button,, cleaned, rinsed and cut into bite-size pieces)

2 Tbsp. tamari

2 tsp fresh thyme leaves

2 Tbsp garlic infused olive oil

1/2 tsp Himalayan sea salt

Directions

1. Preheat your sous vide water bath to 80°C (176°F).

2. In a bowl, combine the mushrooms with the rest of the ingredients and toss to coat evenly. Place the mushroom mixture in the bag and seal using the water displacement method, or use a vacuum sealer.

3. Lower the bagged mushrooms into the water bath and cook for 30 minutes.

4. Remove from the water bath and serve the mushrooms immediately. Alternatively, use ice bath and freeze for future use.

Photos

Sous Vide No-Soak Beans

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://recipes.anovaculinary.com/recipe/sous-vide-no-soak-beans
Serving size: Ingredients for 4
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 cup dried pinto beans

1/2 onion, peeled

2 cloves garlic, crushed

1 teaspoon dried oregano

1 teaspoon sea salt

3 cups water

Directions

Step 1

Set the Anova Sous Vide Precision Cooker to 190ºF (87ºC).

Step 2

Combine the beans, onion, garlic, oregano, and salt in a large zipper lock bag. Carefully add the water. Seal the bag using the water immersion technique and place in the water bath. Set the timer for 6 hours.

Finishing Steps

Step 1

When the timer goes off, remove the bag from the water bath. Pour the contents of the bag through a fine-mesh strainer set over a medium bowl. Reserve the bean cooking liquid to use as vegetable broth, if desired. Discard the onion and garlic cloves.

Step 2

Transfer the beans to a serving bowl and top with sour cream and cayenne pepper, if desired. Serve.

Photos

Sous Vide Paneer Cheese

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://mountaincravings.com/sous-vide-paneer-cheese/
Serving size: 19 oz.
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 gallon whole milk

2 1-gallon resealable plastic bags

1/2 cup lemon juice

cheesecloth (about 18" x 18")

Directions

1. Divide milk evenly between the plastic bags and remove as much air as possible using the water displacement method.

2. Attach your sous vide to a large pot. Lower milk into the pot, fold the sealed tops over the edge of the pot, and secure with a clip. Fill pot to the brim with water.

3. Set your sous vide machine to 190°F / 88°C. Let it come to temperature, then continue cooking for 30 minutes.

4. Reset the sous vide machine for 170°F / 77°C to cool the milk. Alternatively, turn off the sous vide machine and use the sous vide temperature display as a guide.

5. When the milk reaches 170°F / 77°C, pour the milk into another large bowl or pot. Slowly add lemon juice, stirring constantly, until curds begin to separate from the greenish whey. Let rest for 20 minutes.

6. Line a colander with cheesecloth and set inside a large bowl or pot. Pour the curds and whey into the colander and stir to drain as much whey as possible.

7. Tie the cheesecloth around the curds to form a ball. Set a plate on top and weigh it down with a pot or gallon jug filled with water to create a cheese press. Let rest and continue draining for 15 minutes.

8. You've made paneer! Fresh paneer can be stored in the fridge, sealed tightly, for 4-7 days.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 50

Photos

Sous Vide Pasta

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 1
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

57 grams Penne Green Lentil Pasta

161 grams ice

1/4 tsp Himalayan Sea Salt

Directions

Vacuum seal and place in cold sous vide bath.

Set immersion circulator to 180° F - 12 minutes.

Place bagged and sealed frozen sauce and bagged and sealed pasta in cold bath and start sous vide.

Notes

Amount of water is just to cover. Each type of pasta is assumed to require different amount of water.

Weigh serving portion of pasta into container and carefully add water, keeping track of ounces used to cover. Quickly drain pasta and dehydrate. Weigh water in grams.

Photos

Sous Vide Pickled Shrimp

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://recipes.anovaculinary.com/recipe/sous-vide-pickled-shrimp
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Ingredients for 2

½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) yellow mustard seeds

¼ teaspoon (1.2 mL) celery seeds

½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) red pepper flakes

½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) coriander seeds

½ teaspoon (2.5 mL) fennel seeds

¾ cup (3.7 mL) olive oil

½ cup (2.5 mL) freshly squeezed lemon juice

4 tablespoons (59 mL) Champagne vinegar

¾ teaspoon (3.7 mL) kosher salt

4 bay leaves

Pinch of white pepper

1 tablespoon (15 mL) Old Bay seasoning

2 garlic cloves, sliced very thinly

1 pound of shrimp (16 to 20 count), de-veined, and shelled, but with tail end intact

½ small yellow onion, cut into very thin slices

Directions

Step 1 In a large pot of water, set the Anova to 65 degrees Celsius (149 degrees Fahrenheit).

Step 2 In a small sauté pan over medium heat, toast mustard seeds, celery seeds, red pepper flakes, coriander seeds, and fennel seeds, stirring frequently, just until they give off their aromas and the seeds begin to pop. Remove from heat and allow to cool.

Step 3 In a medium-size, clean glass canning jar (or in a large sealable plastic bag), stir together olive oil, lemon juice, Champagne vinegar, toasted spices, salt, bay leaves, white pepper, Old Bay seasoning, and garlic cloves. Layer in shrimp and onions, making sure the vinaigrette covers them. Seal the jar, making sure there is at least a quarter inch of headspace between the top and the contents. (Or use the water-displacement method to seal the bag.)

Step 4 When the water has reached the optimal temperature, carefully lower in the jar (or bag), making sure it is completely submerged. Allow to cook for 30 minutes.

Finishing Step -- Chilling

Step 0 Remove the jar or bag, let sit on the countertop for about 5 minutes to cool down. Prepare an ice-water bath in a bowl or small pot. Add the jar or bag of shrimp, and allow to cool to room temperature. Remove, and place the sealed jar or bag in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to chill before enjoying. This will serve 2 to 3 as part of a salad; or 4 as an appetizer.

Photos

Sous Vide Pineapple

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 10 🍒
Collections:
Source: https://us.sousvidetools.com/toolshed/recipes/sous-vide-pineapple/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 8 hours

Ingredients

1 pineapple

50g brown sugar

Directions

1. Preheat the water bath to a temperature of 80⁰C.

2. Remove the pineapple’s tough outer skin, making sure that absolutely none is left on the fruit.

3. Slice the skinned pineapple into quarters, then trim the pieces to remove the hard flesh from the core of the fruit.

4. Roll the pineapple chunks in the sugar.

5. Seal the sugar-coated fruit inside a vacuum pouch, place in the water bath and leave to cook for 8 hours.

Photos

Sous Vide Poached Shrimp Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.seriouseats.com/recipes/2017/01/sous-vide-poached-shrimp.html
Serving size: Serves 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 1/2 pounds large peeled shrimp (about 700g)(see note)

Kosher salt

1/2 teaspoon baking soda

Extra virgin olive oil or butter (optional)

Aromatics such as garlic, shallots, tarragon, or parsley (optional)

Directions

1. Set your sous vide water bath to desired temperature according to the chart above.

2. In a large bowl, toss shrimp with 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and the baking soda. Place shrimp in a heavy duty zipper-lock bag or a vacuum bag. If desired, add 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30ml) olive oil or butter and aromatics. Remove all air from bag using the water displacement method or a vacuum sealer. Press shrimp into a single layer.

3. Add bagged shrimp to preheated water bath and cook for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour (the texture should show very little variation within this time frame). Remove shrimp from bag to a paper towel-lined plates. Serve hot, or chill and serve cold.

Photos

Sous Vide Rack of Lamb

Courses: Entree
Categories: 12 ☕

Aromatics, such as fresh thyme or rosemary sprigs, sliced shallots, and sliced garlic (optional)

2 tablespoons / 30ml vegetable, canola, or rice bran oil

2 tablespoons / 30g unsalted butter

Directions

Sous Vide Radishes w/ Pineapple Glaze

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.foodfidelity.com/sous-vide-radishes/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

1 pound radishes (halvedâ€¨)

1 tablespoon 1 tablespoon olive oil

1 teaspoon sea salt

1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

1 cup pineapple juiceâ€¨

Directions

1. Set the Anova Sous Vide Precision Cooker to 180Â°F

2. Place radishes in a medium mixing bowl and season with olive, salt, and pepper. Add seasoned radishes with pineapple juice in a large zipper lock or vacuum seal bag. Seal the bag using the water immersion technique or a vacuum sealer on the dry setting. Place in the water bath and set the timer for 45 minutes.

3. Remove radishes and set aside on a plate. Heat reserved liquid from bag in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook until reduced by half. Consistency of reduction should be runny syrup like. Add radishes to the pan and saute quickly to get a bit a caramelization.

Photos

Sous Vide Rice and Eggs

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚, 08 🌾
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 1
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

I cup cooked brown basmati rice in Mason jar

2 cold eggs.

Directions

Using Madax Ham Maker with the spring inverted. Fill with water up to just below the top of the straw hole lid of theMason jar.

Insert thermometer.

Set sous vide to 167° F - 50 minutes.

Don't forget to use the cover to warm plate!

At 37 minutes (13 minutes remaining), add eggs to bath.

Pull the rice @ 45 minutes and plate.

Pull eggs at 50 minutes and crack over rice.

Notes

Almost all sous vide recipes call for an ice bath...I prefer not to do that. I am able to crack eggs, bare handed without that step.

Photos

Sous Vide Ricotta

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SINfhhbF-1M
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

8 cups Milk

5 TBSP White Vinegar

A little sprinkling of Sea Salt

Directions

Add half the milk and the rest of the ingredients to bag. Mix a bit. Add remaining milk.

Seal the bag. Use water displacement method with a Zip Lock Freezer bag.

Sous vide: 88° C 195° F 1 HR

Strain one hour room temp.

Sous Vide Salmon with Lemon and Dill

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://www.bonappetit.com/recipe/sous-vide-salmon-lemon-dill
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 sockeye salmon fillet

Sea salt

1/2 teaspoon coarsely chopped dill

1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest

1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil

Directions

1. Set sous vide to 125°F

2. Season salmon. Place salmon and any spices that fall off into bag and pour in oil.

3. Vacuum-seal.

4. Cook salmon, maintaining water bath at 125°, 1½ hours. Remove bag from water bath. Remove salmon from bag and serve as desired.

5. Do Ahead: Salmon can be cooked in water bath 4 days ahead. Keep sealed in bag and chill, or freeze up to 1 month. Enjoy cold or reheat with sous vide machine at 100° until warmed through, about 1 hour, before serving.

Photos

Sous Vide Soft-Poached Eggs

Courses: Breakfast
Categories: 04 🥚
Collections:
Source: https://www.splendidtable.org/recipes/sous-vide-soft-poached-eggs
Serving size: 1 to 16 eggs
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 - 16 eggs

Directions

1. Using sous vide circulator, bring 4-inches water to 167°F/75°C in 7-quart Dutch oven or Lexan container. Using slotted spoon, gently lower eggs into prepared water bath, cover, and cook for 12 minutes.

2. Meanwhile, fill large bowl halfway with ice and water. Using slotted spoon, transfer eggs to ice bath and let sit until cool enough to handle, about 1 minute. To serve, crack eggs into individual bowls and season with salt and pepper.

Photos

Sous Vide Southwestern Chicken Thighs

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.upstateramblings.com/sous-vide-chicken-thighs/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

4 boneless chicken thighs

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/2 teaspoon cumin

1 lime, sliced

1/4 cup cilantro

1 Tablespoon olive oil

Directions

1. Set sous vide to 165 F.

2. Season the chicken thighs with salt and cumin. Add a slice of lime and some coriander to the top of each thigh.

3. Vacuum seal the chicken thighs or place in zipper top bag. Keep the chicken in a single layer.

4. When the water reaches 165 F submerge the bags in the water.

5. Cook 1 1/2 - 4 hours for bone-in thighs and 45 min - 4 hours for boneless chicken thighs.

6. When you are ready to eat heat a frying pan over medium heat and add 1 Tablespoon of oil.

7. Remove the thighs from the bags, remove the herbs and pat dry. Sear for 1-2 minutes on each side, until nicely brown on top.

8. Serve with peach salsa or cool and refrigerate for later use.

Notes

For frozen boneless chicken thighs cook for 1 1/2 - 4 hours.

For frozen bone in chicken thighs cook for 2 - 4 hours.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1
Calories: 220
Total Fat: 12g
Saturated Fat: 3g
Cholesterol: 137mg
Sodium: 464mg
Total Carbohydrate: 2g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 0g
Protein: 27g

Photos

Sous Vide Split Lentil Soup with Smoked Ham Hock

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://recipes.anovaculinary.com/recipe/sous-vide-split-lentil-soup-with-smoked-ham-hock
Serving size: 2
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Ingredients for 2

2 1/2 cups chicken stock

1 cup split lentils

1 smoked turkey

1/2 cup finely diced celery

1/2 cup finely diced carrot

1/4 cup finely diced onion

1/2 teaspoon kosher salt

1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

1 bay leaf

Directions

Step 1 Set the Anova Sous Vide Precision Cooker to 180ºF (82ºC).

Step 2 Combine all ingredients in a large zipper lock bag. Seal the bag using the water immersion technique and place in the water bath. Set the timer for 2 hours.

Finishing Steps

Step 0 When the timer goes off, remove the bag from the water bath. Remove the ham hock and reserve. Discard the bay leaf.

Step 1 Transfer remaining contents of the bag to a blender and puree until smooth, about 2 minutes.

Step 2 Pull the meat off the ham hock and discard the fat and bones. Add to the pureed soup. Serve.

Photos

Sous Vide Tuna

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://recipes.anovaculinary.com/recipe/sous-vide-tuna
Serving size: Ingredients for 4
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 tuna steaks (about 1 1/2 to 2 inches thick; 10-12oz. / 280-320g each)

Kosher salt

2 tbsp / 30ml extra-virgin olive oil

--OPTIONAL--

Aromatics such as fresh thyme, dill, parsley, thinly sliced shallots, and/or citrus zest

1/2 c / 60g black or white sesame seeds (if searing)

2 tsp / 10ml vegetable oil (if searing)

Directions

Step 1

Season tuna generously with salt and pepper on all sides.

Step 2

Place tuna in a single layer in a gallon-size zipper-lock bag, or in 2 individual quart-size bags. Add olive oil to bag, or divide it between smaller bags, and turn tuna to coat. Add aromatics to bags, if using. Close bags, place in refrigerator, and let tuna rest for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.

Step 3

Set the temperature on your Anova according to the chart and allow it to preheat while the tuna rests.

Step 4

Remove all the air from the bag using the water displacement method, then add the tuna to the preheated water bath and cook for 30 to 45 minutes for one-inch filets, or 45 minutes to an hour for filets up to two inches thick.

Photos

Sous Vide Vanilla Extract

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.savoringthegood.com/sous-vide-vanilla-extract/
Serving size: 96 teaspoons
Preparation time: 3 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour

Ingredients

2 cups vodka

4 split vanilla beans

Directions

1. In a mason jar place 2 cups of your chosen alcohol and 4 split vanilla beans,

2. Secure them with clean lids and bands.

3. Heat your sous vide to 130 degrees Fahrenheit.

4. Carefully submerge the jars in the heated water, ensuring they covered by at least an inch of water.

5. Process for a minimum of 1 hour.

6. The longer you sous vide the vanilla extract, the richer and deeper the flavor will become.

7. I sous vide for 4 hours to achieve the vanilla in this photos.

8. Remove from the sous vide bath and allow to cool completely before storage.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1
Calories: 11
Total Fat: 0g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 0mg
Total Carbohydrate: 0g
Dietary Fiber: 0g
Sugars: 0g
Protein: 0g

Photos

Sous-Vide Coffee

Courses:
Categories: 12 ☕
Collections:
Source: https://www.baristainstitute.com/blog/karoliina-makela/december-2018/new-styles-brewing-coffee
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

500 g water cold water

31 g coffee (grind level: French Press)

Directions

Measure the water and the coffee to a vacuum pouch. You can also use a Minigrip plastic pouch if you don't have a vacuumizer. Get rid of all the air inside the pouch and place the pouch in 70 c Sous-Vide for 27 minutes. Filter the coffee when ready.

Photos

Sous-Vide Rib Eye Steak Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.tastingtable.com/686380/sous-vide-rib-eye-steak-recipe/
Serving size: 2 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 2 hours

Ingredients

One 16-to-18-ounce boneless rib eye steak

Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

2 thyme sprigs

1 garlic clove, smashed

One 4-inch rosemary sprig

One 3-inch piece lemon zest

2 tablespoons vegetable oil

1 tablespoon unsalted butter

Flaky sea salt, for garnish

Directions

1. Season the steak liberally with salt and pepper. Place in a vacuum-seal bag with the thyme, garlic, rosemary and lemon and vacuum seal closed. Alternatively, place the ingredients in a sealable plastic bag and dip the bag into a large bowl of water to displace the air before sealing shut.

2. Preheat a pot of water fitted with a sous-vide immersion circulator to 129° according to the manufacturer's directions. Cook the steak for 2 hours, making sure it is completely submerged in the water. Remove the bag from the pot and take the steak out of the bag, drying with paper towels.

3. In a large cast-iron skillet, heat the vegetable oil over high heat. Add the steak and cook, flipping once until seared on both sides, about 1 minute per side. Add the butter and baste the steak for 10 to 15 seconds more. Transfer to a board to rest for 5 minutes.

4. Slice the steak and garnish with flaky sea salt, then serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 0 g
Calories: 771
Total Fat: 66g
Saturated Fat: 25g
Cholesterol: 173mg
Sodium: 630mg
Total Carbohydrate: 2g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 0g
Protein: 43g

Photos

Sous-Vide Shrimp Are Almost Impossible to Mess Up

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://skillet.lifehacker.com/sous-vide-shrimp-are-almost-impossible-to-mess-up-1820925936
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

A scampi bag: This one required a bit of out-of-the bag prep. First, I sautéed five cloves of minced garlic in a tablespoon of butter and a tablespoon of olive oil. Once the garlic was soft and golden, I added half a cup of white wine and let that reduce by half. I added that to a bag with one pound of de-veined, shell-on shrimp that had been season with 1/2 a teaspoon of salt, a healthy pinch of red pepper flakes, and fresh ground pepper to taste.

An Old Bay bag: One pound of shrimp with two tablespoons of butter and one teaspoon of Old Bay is all that went into this bag.

A simple, aromatic bag with baking soda: I had read on Serious Eats that a bit of baking soda would give these little guys just a bit of that bounce I love so much, so I tossed a pound of shrimp with 1/2 a teaspoon of salt and 1/2 a teaspoon of baking soda before adding it to a bag with a couple of bay leaves, a few sprigs of tarragon and thyme, and three cloves of smashed garlic.

Directions

1. G/O Media may get a commission

2. Sunski Treelines - Premium Collection

3. Buy for $67 from Huckberry

4. All three of these bags went into a 135-degree sous-vide tub for 15-30 minutes (more on that in a bit), and all three were delicious. However, I did discover—quite by accident—that the type of bag you pack your shrimp in, and how you pack it, makes a big difference in how evenly and quickly they cook.

5. Last night, when I was preparing the first two batches of succulent sea bugs, I had had a few cocktails, which is what happens when you write in bars instead of coffee shops. (In my defense, all the coffee shops were closed.) When I returned home to start the shrimp, I was dismayed to find that my roll of Food Saver bags had run out, and I only had the weird zipper-style parcels that I couldn’t figure out how to seal in my slightly inebriated state.

6. Yes, I see the instructions on the bag; I was just too lazy to be bothered to read.

7. This means the shrimp simply sat there, in pile, tails all tangled. After about 15 minutes of cooking time, the shrimp on the outside of the pile were nice and pink, but the ones near the core of Mount Shrimpy were still a bit raw and gray. This was easy to fix—I simply had to give the bag a shake and the toss it back in the bath for another 15 minutes—but it is something to be aware of if you don’t have a vacuum sealer.

8. Of course, the next morning, when I went to prepare my last batch of shrimp, Sober Claire did what Tipsy Claire could not, and found another roll of the vacuum bags I know how to seal. There was much rejoicing.

9. This is what you want.

10. As such, I was able to arrange the last batch of curly crustaceans in a mostly-uniform layer. After about 15 minutes in the bath, all the shrimp were plump and pink. Even though the non-vacuum-sealed bags took an extra 15 minutes to cook through, I didn’t notice a difference in quality. As you can see from the below slideshow, all three batches were pretty glorious.

Photos

Southwestern Style Baked Tofu Steaks

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://pickledplum.com/southwestern-style-baked-tofu-steaks/
Serving size: 4 steaks
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 package firm tofu

1 tablespoon chili powder

1 teaspoon cumin powder

1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

1 teaspoon paprika

1/2 tablespoon dried oregano

1/2 tablespoon ground coriander

1/2 teaspoon kosher salt

3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil

2 tablespoons water

3 tablespoons fresh lime juice

3 tablespoons mayonnaise or vegenaise

2 teaspoon red wine vinegar

1 teaspoon 100% pure maple syrup

2 tablespoons cilantro (finely chopped)

1 tablespoon jalapeno, finely chopped (use less or entirely omit it if you don’t like spicy))

black beans

corn

quinoa

fresh cilantro leaves

sliced jalapenos

corn tortillas

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 400ºF.

2. Drain and wrap tofu in a tea towel or paper towel to remove excess water. Very gently (be very careful not to break to tofu block) press to let out some water and repeat 4-5 times. Slice tofu horizontally in half and in half again widthwise. You should have 4 tofu steaks.

3. Cover a small baking tray with parchment paper and lay tofu on top.

4. In a small bowl mix all the ingredients for the southwestern spice mix.

5. Using the back of a spoon, spread southwestern spice mixture on both sides of tofu steaks and set aside for 30-45 minutes to marinade.

6. Baked tofu in the oven for 15 minutes, flip the steaks and bake for another 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 185
Total Fat: 15.3g
Saturated Fat: 2.1g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 353.6mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4.3g
Dietary Fiber: 1.9g
Sugars: 0.5g
Protein: 9.3g

Photos

Spanish Rice

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://glutenfreerecipebox.com/gluten-free-spanish-rice-no-tomatoes/
Serving size: 1-2 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/4 cup taco seasoning

2 teaspoons Herdez Mild Salsa Verde

1 Tablespoon chili powder

1 teaspoon dehydrated onion flakes

1 teaspoon oregano

1/2 teaspoon cumin

1/4 teaspoon garlic powder

1/4 teaspoon sea salt

2-3/4 cups turkey stock

1-1/2 cups long grain rice

3/4 cup chopped onion, sauteed

2 large garlic cloves, minced and sauteed

Directions

1. If making homemade taco seasoning, mix all of the ingredietns together and store in an air-tight container until ready to use.

2. In a medium sized pot add water or gluten-free chicken broth, rice, seasoning, and if using, gluten-free tomato-free chipotle sauce or hot sauce; stir and bring to a boil.

3. Once rice comes to boil, cover and lower heat to low. Cook for 20 minutes. Remove rice from heat and allow to steam for an additional 20 minutes or until tender.

4. In a preheated, pre-oiled frying pan and sauté onion until translucent; set aside.

5. Once rice is cooked, toss in sautéed onion with a fork, keep covered until ready to serve.

Photos

Spiced Lentils & Rice

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: Freezer Bag Cooking by Sarah Kirkconnell
Serving size: 1

Cooking time:

Directions

Add 1/2 cup boiling water to the dry ingredients in your mug. Stir well, seal tightly and let sit for 15 minutes.

Spiced Lentils with Egg

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.thekitchn.com/recipe-spiced-lentils-baked-egg-14389
Serving size: Serves 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 cup red lentils

1 cup yellow split peas

1 tablespoon olive oil

2 large shallots or 4 small shallots, minced (about 1/2 cup)

2 cloves garlic, minced

2 teaspoons garam masala

4 cups low-sodium chicken or vegetable broth

Salt and freshly ground pepper

1 cup finely chopped cilantro leaves, from one small bunch

4 large eggs

Directions

1. Rinse the lentils and split peas thoroughly under running water. Drain and set aside.

2. Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat and add the shallots and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 minutes, or until the garlic and shallots are golden and fragrant. Add the lentils and split peas and stir in the garam masala. Stir the pot thoroughly to make sure the garam masala and shallots are fully distributed in the lentils.

3. Add the broth (or 4 cups of water) and turn the heat to high. Bring to a boil, and then reduce to a simmer and cover the pan. Cook for 30 to 35 minutes or until the yellow split peas are just tender. (The red lentils are smaller and will cook faster; the yellow lentils will stay distinct and al dente while the red lentils will cook down into a pleasantly rustic mush.) Season with salt and pepper to taste and stir in the cilantro.

4. At this point the lentils can be covered and refrigerated for up to 5 days or frozen in portions for up to 3 months (thaw in the fridge overnight before using).

5. To serve: Heat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease individual ramekins or small ovenproof baking dishes. Mound about 1 cup lentils in each then make a deep hollow in the center and crack in an egg. Sprinkle salt and pepper over the egg.

6. Bake for 18 to 25 minutes, or until white is set and yolk is cooked to your liking. Serve immediately with a green salad.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 4
Calories: 483
Total Fat: 9.5g
Saturated Fat: 2.2g
Total Carbohydrate: 71.4g
Sugars: 8.4g
Protein: 31.3g

Photos

Spiced Overnight Cold Brew Coffee

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://recipecenter.stopandshop.com/recipes/106626/spiced-overnight-cold-brew-coffee
Serving size: Serves4
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 12 hours 5 mins

Ingredients

2 cups ground coffee

2 tsp ground cardamom

1 tsp ground turmeric

2 tsp ground cinnamon

1 tsp vanilla extract

Directions

1. Stir coffee, spices, and vanilla together with 3 cups cold water in a large pitcher. For best results, leave to rest covered for 12 hours or overnight.

2. Arrange 3 sets of cheesecloth inside a fine mesh strainer and slowly strain coffee into a large jar or pitcher. Pour over ice and add equal parts water or milk.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 91
Total Fat: 0.3g
Saturated Fat: 0.1g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 9mg
Dietary Fiber: 0.2g
Sugars: 19.3g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Spicy Black Bean Soup with Thyme, Garlic and Ginger

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: http://www.urbancilantro.com/spicy-black-bean-soup-with-thyme-garlic-and-ginger/
Serving size: serves 2
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

1 x 15 oz. cans of black beans, drained and washed well [ 3 cups cooked beans ]

1 bay leaves

1/2 cup sweet onion, chopped [ 1/2 medium size ]

1 tablespoon garlic, minced [ about 2 1/2-3 cloves ]

1 teaspoon ginger, grated

1/2 tablespoon fresh thyme, finely chopped

1/2 teaspoon dry oregano

16. oz. low sodium vegetable stock

2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil

1 teaspoon Himalayan pink salt or kosher salt

chopped parsley, for garnish [ optional ]

extra olive oil, to drizzle on top [optional ]

Directions

1. In the large soup pot/stock pot heat up the olive oil over mediam heat.

2. Add bay leaves and whole black pepper corns (optional - read notes) and stir for few seconds.

3. Now add in chopped onion. Cook, stirring often, until the onion has softened and translucent, about 2 to 4 minutes.

4. Add the minced garlic and ginger. Cook until fragrant, about one minute, stirring frequently and making sure they do not burn.

5. Add chopped red bell pepper and chopped thyme, cook for another 2-4 minutes. Keep stirring so it does not burn.

6. Add in chili flakes, oregano, freshly crushed black pepper and half the amount of salt (1 teaspoon at this point) and cook for another 1-2 minutes. If the mixture sticks to the bottom of the pan then add 1 tablespoon of vegetable stock.

7. Meanwhile, reserve half cup of black beans and put the rest of the beans in a blender along with enough vegetable stock to make puree.

8. Add the black bean puree to the soup pot, add the reserved half cup of whole beans to the pot as well.

9. Add the remaining vegetable stock if any and add in 1 more teaspoon of salt ( or to taste) and stir well.

10. Bring it to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes or more if desired.

11. Give it a taste test and adjust slat and pepper if needed.

12. Serve piping hot, can be garnished with freshly chopped parsley, more freshly cracked pepper and a good drizzle of oilve oil or just serve it up right as is!

13. Enjoy.

Photos

Spicy Mexican Green Sauce (nightshade free)

Courses:

Source: https://hewontknowitspaleo.com/recipe-items/spicy-mexican-green-sauce-nightshade-free/

Directions

1. Place all ingredients in blender. Blend until creamy.

Spinach Egg "Flatbread"

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://fatflush.com/spinach-egg-flatbread/
Serving size:
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 (10 oz) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

2 large eggs

2 large egg whites

½ tsp minced garlic

¼ cup chopped onions

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 400 F.

2. In a mixing bowl, stir together all the ingredients.

3. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper; pour the mixture evenly onto the pan.

4. Bake for 15 minutes.

5. Holding the ends of the parchment paper, pick up the flatbread and lay on a cooling rack or towel.

6. Cut into sandwich or wrap-size pieces and load with your favorite toppings.

Spinach with Garlic Sauce

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.saveur.com/article/Recipes/Asian-Greens-with-Garlic-Sauce
Serving size: serves 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 1⁄2 lb. spinach

1 tbsp. olive oil

2 tbsp. coarsely chopped garlic

2 tbsp. tamari

Directions

1. Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Meanwhile, trim ends from choy sum. Blanch greens in the water until just tender, about 1 minute. Drain greens and set aside on a plate.

2. Heat oil in a wok or a skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned, 1–2 minutes. Add soy sauce and 1 tbsp. water; cook for 1 minute. Pour garlic sauce over greens.

Photos

Split Pea Hummus

Courses: Snack
Categories:
Collections:
Source: Freezer Bag Cooking by Sarah Kirkconnell
Serving size: 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 1/2 cups water

3/4 cup yellow split peas

1 tsp dried diced garlic

2 tsp dried onion

1 1/2 Tbsp lemon juice

1 1/2 Tbsp water

1 tsp ground cumin

1 tsp dill weed

1/4 tsp chili powder

Salt to taste, if desired.

Directions

Bring to a boil. Partially cover, reduce heat and simmer for about 40 minutes, till peas are tender and water is absorbed. Let cool.

In a food processor or blender, put the peas in and add remaining ingredients. Blend till smooth.

Dehydrator instructions: Spread on a parchment lined dehydrator tray, dry till crumbly dry. This takes between 3 and 7 hours, at 135*.

When dry, crumble into a powder and split evenly into four sandwich bags (about 1/3 cup dry mix in each bag). Mark each bag “add 1/2 cup of water”.

Add cool water and seal bag tightly. Knead water in gently, then let sit for a couple minutes. If desired, add a tsp or two of olive oil when rehydrating.

Serve in pita bread or on tortillas. Makes 4 bags of 1 serving each.

Photos

Split Pea Soup with Smoked Turkey Sous Vide

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.vacmasterfresh.com/fresh-bites-blog/split-pea-soup-with-ham-bones-hocks-sous-vide/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

• 1 pound split peas, picked over

• 2 tablespoons olive oil, evcp or similar

• 1 large onion white, peeled, cored and diced

• 2 large carrots, peeled and diced

• 1 large celery stalk, trimmed and diced

• sea salt

• 1 large garlic clove, peeled, cored and chopped

• 2 tablespoons thyme leaves, fresh, chopped

• 1 bay leaf

• 2 quarts’ homemade chicken stock, or your favorite brand

• 1 1/2 pounds smoked turkey necks

• 1 1/2 pounds smoked turkey

Directions

1. Preheat the VacMaster SV1to 85C/185F

2. Using the VacMaster bag filler and appropriately sized VacMaster bag(s) carefully add all of the ingredients to the bag or bags as necessary.

3. Using a VacMaster Chamber machine carefully vacuum pack the soup mix and cook for 5-6 hours or until the peas are easily smashed with your fingers.

4. Carefully remove the bag from the SV1 and gently remove the ham hocks and ham bones from the soup and set aside.

5. Working in batches if necessary puree the soup in a high speed blender or food processor until smooth and adjust seasonings as necessary with additional salt and pepper as you see fit.

6. After the meat has cooled carefully remove the meat and discard bones and unwanted sinew etc.

7. Coarsely chop the meat and reserve.

8. Serve the soup in large shallow bowls garnished with the chopped meat.

Photos

SPROUT OAT GROATS

Courses:
Categories: 08 🌾
Collections:
Source: https://www.culturesforhealth.com/learn/sprouting/how-to-sprout-oat-groats/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Directions

Rinse ½ cup oats and remove any debris or stones.

Place oats in a quart-size sprouting jar or other sprouting container.

Fill with water, cover with a sprouting screen or mesh sprouting lid. Soak up to 6 hours.

Drain all water off the oats.

Invert the jar over a bowl at an angle so that the oats will drain and still allow air to circulate.

After 8 hours of draining, rinse and drain again.

Repeat rinsing and draining 2-3 times daily.

Tiny sprouts should begin to form in 1-2 days. At this point, sprouting is complete.

Drain the sprouts well.

Keep in mind, sprouted grains do not store well, so sprout only what you can use immediately.

Notes

https://gluten.org/soaking-and-sprouting-beans-nuts-seeds-and-grains/

Photos

Sprouted Brown Rice

Courses:
Categories: 08 🌾
Collections:
Source: https://thecoconutmama.com/how-to-sprout-brown-rice-how-to-make-sprouted-brown-rice-flour-2/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Sprouted rice as desired.

Dehydrator

Grain mill or Vitamix

Directions

Sprouted Rice

Step 1: Soak rice in water for 9-12 hours.

Step 2: Strain water and leave the rice out to germinate.

Step 3: Rinse the rice every 6-8 hours for 2-3 days.

Dehydrate Sprouted Rice

1. Dehydrate sprouted rice at 105 - 115 degrees for 24 hours or until grains are completely dry.

2. Store grains in freezer until ready to use.

3. A grain mill or a vitamix will grind your grains into a fine flour for baking.

Notes

https://gluten.org/soaking-and-sprouting-beans-nuts-seeds-and-grains/

Photos

Sprouted Lentil Burgers ( grillable and vegan)

Courses: Entree
Categories: 08 🌾, 09 🥕, 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://www.feastingathome.com/grillable-vegan-sprouted-lentil-burgers/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 24 hours
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 ½ cups sprouted black, green or brown lentils ( see notes)

1 cup cooked brown rice

1 cup walnuts- lightly toasted

1 tablespoon miso paste ( or if gluten free- sub more salt to taste)

1 tablespoon olive oil

2 teaspoons whole grain mustard

2 teaspoons granulated garlic ( or onion)

½ teaspoon salt and pepper

other additions- fresh herbs, spices (cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika)

Directions

1. In the morning, place 1 cup dry whole lentils and 3-4 cups water in a large mason jar and soak all day ( 8 hours) on the counter. In the evening, drain well. Turn jar on its side letting lentils spread out a bit and let the lentils continue to sit on the counter overnight. Once you see the tiny tip of the white sprout begin to emerge, they are ready. Generally takes 24-30 hours.

2. Place 1 ½ cups of the raw sprouted lentils ( drained well) cooked rice, toasted walnuts, miso, oil, mustard, garlic, salt and pepper in the food processor and pulse repeatedly until combined well and becomes a course, sturdy dough. Taste for salt. If it tastes bland, check that the miso was properly mixed in ( give a few stirs with a spoon, pulse again).

3. Place a piece of parchment on a small sheet pan or large plate. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

4. With wet hands divide dough into four balls and form 4 burgers, about 1 inch thick. Place on the parchment and sprinkle top with sesame seeds. Place in the fridge uncovered while you heat the grill.

5. Preheat grill to medium high heat and oven to 400. F Grease the grill. When hot, sear the lentil burgers until generous grill marks appear, about 4-5 minutes on each side, then place in oven to continue warming all the way through, 10 more minutes ( or move to cooler part of the grill).

6. At this point, build your burgers, or wrap and freeze for later.

Notes

https://gluten.org/soaking-and-sprouting-beans-nuts-seeds-and-grains/

Photos

Sprouted Tofu

Courses:
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: http://gourmetvegetariankitchen.com/2017/12/30/sprouted-tofu-make-tofu-3-ingredients/
Serving size:
Preparation time:

Ingredients

Directions

Photos

Sprouted Wheat Berries in Excalibur 5-Tray Dehydrator

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://foodinjars.com/blog/sprouted-wheat-berries-excalibur-5-tray-dehydrator/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 2/3 cups wheat berries

Filtered water

Directions

Measure wheat berries and put them into a half gallon Mason jar. Fill jar with water, making sure that they’re submerged by a couple of inches. Let them soak for 8-12 hours (overnight is good).

Drain and rinse the wheat berries. Rinse and drain 2-3 times a day.

After 2-3 days of rinsing and draining, you should notice that the wheat berries are beginning to sprout (look for little white shoots). At this point, they are ready to dehydrate.

Arrange the sprouted wheat berries on several dehydrator trays. Dehydrate @ 115° F for 12-24 hours, until the berries are completely dry.

Grind into flour in a grain mill or a Vitamix dry container. Use as you would any other flour.

Photos

SPROUTED WHEAT MANNA BREAD

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.wholeheartedeats.com/2017/03/sprouted-bread/
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 2 mins
Cooking time: 3 hours

Ingredients

2 Cups Wheat Berries (or spelt or rye)

1 tsp. Sea Salt

1/2 Cup Raisins

1/2 tsp. Cinnamon

Directions

1. Add the wheat berries to a large jar and fill it with water. Let them sit in the water overnight on the counter. The next day, drain the water and cover the top of the jar with cheesecloth or a milk nut bag. If you have a spouter, you can use that too. Just note that the wheat will double in size, so make sure you have a big jar.

2. Once the jar is covered with a breathable lid, rinse the sprouts again, and leave them in upsidedown in a dish to drain (at around a 45-degree angle). Give the sprouts a rinse twice a day with fresh water. Drain the excess water off and leave them to drain fully in the dish.

3. Around the second day the wheat should have sprouted (it can take a little longer depending on temperature) and the sprouts should be as long as the kernel. This is as long as you want the sprouts to get. Any longer than this the sprouts have the risk of tasting bitter and green. Try to keep an eye on them, they grow fast.

4. As soon as your seeds are as long as the grain, you can begin making the bread. If you don’t want to make bread ASAP, the sprouts can be stored in the fridge for a couple of days. They will continue to grow in the fridge, so keep an eye on them (I’d give them a day or two in there at max).

5. Rinse the sprouts one last time and drain them well. Combine them in a food processor with the raisins, cinnamon, and salt. Puree the mixture until a coarse dough is made. I stopped pureeing as soon as the dough began to form a ball.

6. Grease your hands well and on a parchment-lined tray, mould the dough into a loaf shape – around 12 cm wide and 22 cm long (or 5 by 9 inch) and around 4 cm tall  (1 1/4- 1 1/2). If you make it thicker than this, it might not dry out correctly.

7. Bake at 120 C (250 F) for three hours. Let the bread cool before slicing. Because of the lack of preservatives, this bread is best wrapped and stored in the fridge.

Photos

Sprouting

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://homeguides.sfgate.com/making-own-sprouting-seeds-hydrogen-peroxide-88675.html
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Directions

Starters

Sterilize everything your seeds touch, whether it is a bag, jar or sprout tray. The safest way to do that is to boil them for 10 minutes. You can usually buy 3 percent hydrogen peroxide at a drugstore. You’ll need an accurate cooking thermometer to correctly treat your seeds with the peroxide. A digital model is best. You’ll also need a small mesh strainer with a handle.

Applying the Heat

Heat the hydrogen peroxide to 140 degrees Fahrenheit and maintain that temperature. If it is hotter than that, fewer seeds will germinate. Place your seeds in the strainer and lower them into the solution; keep them there for five minutes, swirling them once a minute to make sure they all have contact with the peroxide. Rinse the seeds with room-temperature water for one minute and throw away the hydrogen peroxide.

After you treat your seeds, immerse them in clean water and skim off any seeds that float on the surface. These “floaters” are more apt to harbor bacteria. You need to keep seeds moist for them to germinate, but mold and bacteria can grow in standing water. Sprout your seeds in clean water, rinsing rinse them at least twice a day, and drain them completely each time. Rinsing and draining them three or four times a day is even better.

Getting Them Ready to Eat

To get rid of seed hulls and remaining floaters, break up the sprouts with a clean fork each time you rinse them. When your sprouts are ready to harvest, rinse them one more time to remove lingering floaters. Dry your harvested sprouts with a fine mesh salad spinner or a clean paper towel and store them in a sealed container or plastic bag in the refrigerator. Young children, the elderly and those with compromised immune systems should not eat raw sprouts.

Photos

Steakhouse Mushrooms

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://frugalhausfrau.com/2016/10/02/steakhouse-mushrooms/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 tablespoons butter

1/2 onion, thinly sliced crosswise (into half moon shapes)

8 ounces sliced mushrooms

1/2 teaspoon or so crushed garlic (2 small cloves or 1 large)

1/2 teaspoon salt

Directions

1. Heat butter in a medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook for several minutes, stirring occasionally, until the edges begin to turn slightly brown.

2. Add mushrooms, cover with a lid and cook for two to four minutes, turning mushrooms over once or twice, until the mushrooms are turning golden brown and have given up a little of their juices.

3. Remove lid, add garlic and stir. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon (or to taste) of salt and a few grinds of pepper and cook for a minute or two longer, until the juices have started to evaporate and concentrate. Add Worcestershire sauce, stir and remove from heat.

Photos

Steam Blanch

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.wonderlandguides.com/backcountry-cooking/dehydrating-food/how-to-steam-blanch-vegetables
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Directions

Choose a sauce pan that comfortably fits your steaming basket with the lid on.

Place an inch or two of water in the bottom of the pan and bring to a full boil.

Add the steamer basket containing your prepared vegetables or fruit and cover the pan tightly with the lid.

Carefully time your blanching per recipe so as not to over-cook your produce. As a rule of thumb, this will be about half of the cooking time as you would normally use to fully cook the vegetables.

As soon as the food has been steamed for the recommended time, immediately remove it from the heat, and run cool water over it to stop it from cooking any further.

Photos

Steam Oven Baked Chicken and Rice

Courses:
Categories:
Collections: Sheet pan Dinners
Source: https://steamandbake.com/baked-chicken-and-rice-in-the-steam-oven/
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 35 mins

Ingredients

1.3 lb chicken thighs (600g boneless and skinless (4-6, depending on size))

1 tsp paprika (I love smoked, my kids and husband prefer sweet)

1/2 tsp dried thyme leaves

½ tsp garlic powder

¼ tsp onion powder

½ tsp black pepper

½ tsp salt

1 onion (small (or 1/2 large one), finely chopped)

1 clove garlic (minced)

2 tbs butter (olive oil if you must, but the butter is a key part of the flavoring in this dish)

2 cups long grain rice (400g I have also used Basmati with success, same liquid ratios)

3 cups chicken stock (750ml )

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C, combination steam setting. If your oven has variable steam settings, use 60%. If not, don’t worry! Just set to combi steam at the correct temperature and the oven will work out the humidity for you.

2. While the oven heats, trim any excess fat from your chicken, Mix together the paprika, thyme, garlic and onion powders, pepper and salt in a small dish. Sprinkle this mixture evenly over both sides of the chicken.

3. Once the oven is at temperature, put the onion, garlic and butter into a heatproof casserole pan or baking dish. Put the dish into the oven for 5 minutes, until the butter is melted and the onion and garlic have softened.

4. Add the rice to the pan and stir so all the grains are coated in the butter, then pour in the stock. Lay the chicken on top of the rice (it’ll look like it’s swimming, but don’t worry).

5. Return the pan to the oven (no lid) and cook for 30 minutes, by which time the chicken should be golden and tender, and the liquid should have fully absorbed into the rice.

6. Remove the chicken from the pan and fluff the rice, then return the chicken. For kids, I often slice the chicken before taking the pan to the table, to make serving and eating easier.

7. Serve hot with roasted vegetables or a green salad alongside.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 717
Total Fat: 27g
Saturated Fat: 9g
Cholesterol: 132mg
Sodium: 692mg
Total Carbohydrate: 84g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 4g
Protein: 30g

Photos

Steam Oven Roast Chicken

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://steamandbake.com/how-to-roast-chicken-in-a-steam-oven-3/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

3.5 lb whole chicken (partially deboned as per the method in post, to give a cooking weight of around 1.5kg/3.3lb)

2 whole lemons (sliced into 2.5cm (1in) rounds)

2 heads garlic (halved crosswise (no need to peel or seperate the cloves))

2-3 sprigs rosemary and thyme

3 tbs butter (very soft. Olive oil is fine if that's your preference, though butter makes for the most glorious lemony sauce)

1.5 tsp flaky salt

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 430°F/220°C, combination steam setting. If your oven has variable steam settings, choose 30% (if not, don't worry! Just choose combi steam and the oven will figure out the humidity level for you).

2. Spread the sliced lemons, garlic and herbs over the base of a baking tray (I prefer my lightweight stainless steel pans for quick heat conduction and easy clean-up).

3. Season the flesh of the chicken with just a little salt, then turn it skin side up and lay it over the seasonings in the tray. Tuck in the wing tips and make sure the drumsticks are splayed outwards (see photos).

4. Pat the skin of the chicken dry with paper towel, then dot the entire surface with the soft butter. Season well with salt.

5. Put the tray in the preheated oven until the chicken is cooked through and golden, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to rest in a warm place for 5-10 minutes before carving and serving. Discard the seasonings, but keep the precious cooking juices – you can reduce them down and thicken to make a gravy, or (my preference) just serve with the chicken as a buttery lemon-scented sauce.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 195 g
Calories: 376
Total Fat: 27g
Saturated Fat: 10g
Cholesterol: 119mg
Sodium: 738mg
Total Carbohydrate: 6g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Protein: 26g

Photos

Steamed Monkfish with Ginger & Spring Onions

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://cafecat.com.au/2013/08/steamed-monkfish-with-ginger-spring-onions/
Serving size: 2
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

350-400 grams Monkfish

2-3 tsp grated or finely chopped ginger

2 cloves garlic, finely chopped

Salt to taste

2 tsp sesame oil

1 Tbs tamari

2 spring onions, finely sliced on the diagonal

Directions

Cut fish into big chunks. Mix with the ginger and garlic and season to taste. Place on a dinner plate in one layer. Half fill a large saucepan with water and bring to the boil. Place the plate with the fish on top and cover with the saucepan lid. Steam for 7-8 minutes or until opaque and cooked through but not quite flaking. Timing will depend on how close the plate is to the boiling water – be careful not to overcook.

Meanwhile heat sesame oil and soy sauce in a saucepan or in the microwave. Arrange fish on 2 serving plates. Drizzle with the soy sauce mixture and sprinkle with the spring onions. Serve with steamed rice.

Photos

Steamed Spinach with Lemon

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.marthastewart.com/1050342/steamed-spinach-lemon
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

9 ounces baby spinach

1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil

1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, plus lemon wedges for garnish

1/8 teaspoon coarse sea salt

Directions

1. Fill a medium saucepan with 2 inches of water, and fit with a steamer insert. Bring to a boil. Add spinach. Reduce to a simmer. Cover, and steam until spinach has wilted, about 2 minutes.

2. Transfer to a serving bowl. Toss with oil, lemon juice, and salt. Garnish with lemon. Serve immediately.

Photos

Steel Cut Oats with Poached Egg

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 35 mins

Ingredients

1/4 Cup Steel Cut Oats

2/3 Cup Filtered Water

1 Egg

Himalayan Sea Salt to taste

Directions

3 QT. Instant Pot

Add 1 cup water to inner liner. Make sure trivet is in place.

In a French White Corning Ware bowl, or equivalent, add oats and filtered water. Season to taste.

Use the Porridge setting and cook. Timer should say 24 minutes...adjust if otherwise.

Sous Vide

Set temperature to 167° F

When the water bath has come to temperature, add egg and set timer for 12 minutes. Meanwhile prepare a water bath for the egg.

When the 12 minute cook time ends, transfer the egg to the ice water bath for 1 minute.

By this time, the pressure cooker should have finished it's cook time and is undergoing natural release. It is advised to wait until at least 10 minutes has passed after cooking before releasing pressure. Failure to wait may cause a mini-explosion of cooked oats. Don't worry, it will be contained but much harder to clean up had the wait time been adhered to.

I like to reheat the egg 1 minute after it's ice bath because I prefer the temperature.

Crack the egg over the oats and prepare for a party in the mouth :)

Photos

Step-by-Step Cauliflower Pizza Crust Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://ifoodreal.com/cauliflower-pizza-crust/
Serving size: 8 slices
Preparation time: 30 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

2.5 lbs medium-large (6" - 7" wide) head of cauliflower (2 lbs of store bought cauliflower rice)

1 large egg

1 tsp Italian seasoning or dried oregano/basil

1/8 tsp salt

1/4 tsp ground black pepper

1/2 cup Parmesan or Mozzarella cheese (grated/shredded)

Cooking spray (I use Misto)

Directions

1. Prep: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F and line baking sheet with unbleached parchment paper or silicone mat.

2. Make "rice": Rinse cauliflower, remove the outer leaves, separate into florets and chop into smaller pieces. Process in a food processor in 2 batches, until "rice" texture forms (skip if using store-bought "rice").

3. Cook "rice": Transfer cauliflower rice on a prepared baking sheet and bake for 15 mins. Remove cooked cauliflower rice from the oven, transfer to a large bowl lined with a double/triple layered cheesecloth or linen towel, and let cool for 10-15 minutes or until safe to touch.

4. Squeeze: Then squeeze the liquid out of the ball (cauliflower inside the cheesecloth) as hard as you can. Be patient and do this a few times until barely any liquid comes out. Muscle work.:)

5. Make dough: Increase oven temperature to 450 degrees F. In a medium mixing bowl whisk the egg with dried herbs, salt and pepper for 10 seconds. Add cheese and squeezed cauliflower; mix very well with spatula until combined.

6. Form crust: Line same baking sheet with new parchment paper or silicone mat (just make sure to scrape off any bits of cauliflower) and spray with cooking spray. Transfer cauliflower pizza dough in the middle and flatten with your hands until thin pizza crust forms. Make it thicker than in my video, I made it a bit too thin.

7. Bake crust first: Bake for 20 minutes, carefully flip with spatula and bake for a few more minutes.

8. Bake pizza with toppings: Top cauliflower pizza base with your favourite toppings and bake again until cheese on top turns golden brown.

9. Enjoy! Cut into 8 slices with a pizza cutter and finally enjoy!

10. Store: Refrigerate leftovers covered for up to 2 days.

11. Freeze: Bake, cool and wrap in plastic wrap. Or place in a resealable extra large Ziploc bag. Freeze for up to 3 months. Thaw completely before baking with toppings.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 slice
Calories: 48
Total Fat: 2g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 26mg
Sodium: 110mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 4g

Photos

Stroganoff Meatballs

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://mommyshomecooking.com/easy-instant-pot-stroganoff-meatballs/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 lb ground turkey

1/2 almond flour

1 egg

¼ cup fresh parsley

½ teaspoon thyme

1 teaspoon garlic powder

1 teaspoon onion powder

1 teaspoon sea salt

¼ teaspoon white pepper

2 tablespoons olive oil

8 ounces cremini mushrooms, (sliced)

2 garlic cloves, (minced)

1 cups stock

1/2 cup almond cream

4 teaspoons cold water

2 teaspoons arrowroot

1 bay leaf

½ cup sour cream

1 tablespoon mustard

Directions

1. In a large bowl, combine ground meat, almond flour, egg, parsley, thyme, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper until just combined. Shape into 14 – 16 1-1/2-in meatballs.

2. Heat the Instant Pot in sauté mode. Add oil and brown the meatballs, about 2 minutes per side. Add sliced mushroom and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes before stirring; cook until fragrant, about 2 more minutes.

3. Add beef stock, heavy cream and bay leave, cover and lock the lid. Cook high pressure 10 minutes.

4. Meanwhile, mix in a small bowl the cold water and cornstarch until no lumps.

5. When the cooking time is over, turn off the pot and carefully release pressure. Open the pot. Select “sauté” mode and adjust to less. Add cornstarch slurry, sour cream and mustard; mix to combine. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens.

6. Sprinkle with fresh parsley, if desired. Serve immediately with mashed potatoes, rice or noodles.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 299
Total Fat: 22g
Saturated Fat: 9g
Cholesterol: 102mg
Sodium: 616mg
Total Carbohydrate: 8g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 16g

Photos

Onion:

Medium Onion=1 cup

Large Onion=1 1/2 cup

Dehydrated: fresh = 1:4

Rehydrate 2:1 Onion: water

Directions

Mix ingredients well

Succulent Wild Alaskan Salmon & Feta Cheese Pesto Pasta Recipe

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://www.john-west.co.uk/recipe/wild-alaskan-salmon-feta-cheese-pesto-pasta
Serving size: 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

2 cans Red or Pink John West Wild Alaskan Salmon (213g)

300g penne pasta (or other pasta shapes)

1 190g jar green pesto sauce

100g frozen petit pois garden peas, thawed

150g feta cheese, crumbled

sea salt

Handful of basil leaves

Directions

1. Salmon pasta recipes don’t come any tastier than this, so if you want to do something wonderfully delicious with a couple of cans of John West Red Or Pink Wild Alaskan Salmon here’s how. This one takes a little longer to prepare than some of our super-quick suggestions, but it’s well worth the effort for a savoury delight that’s packed with taste. As salmon pasta recipes go this one has a real tongue twister of a title too, but fortunately our Wild Alaskan Salmon & Feta Cheese Pesto Pasta is far easier to eat and enjoy than it is to say.

2. To prepare our Salmon Pasta Recipe drain the canned John West Salmon, reserving 2 tablespoons of the liquid. Remove any skin and bones if wished and then break the salmon into chunks.

3. Cook the pasta in lightly salted boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes, or according to pack instructions, until tender. Drain well.

4. Return the pasta to the saucepan and add the reserved salmon liquid and the pesto sauce. Tip in the peas. Heat gently for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring often, adding the chunks of salmon for the last 30 seconds.

5. Share the pasta between four warmed bowls and add the feta cheese.

Photos

Super Easy Dairy-Free Fudge

Courses: Dessert
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://lovingitvegan.com/dairy-free-fudge/
Serving size: 28
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

1/2 cup (120ml) Soy Milk

1 and 1/4 cup (250g) White Sugar

1/4 cup (56g) Vegan Butter (Softened)

5 and 1/2 oz (155g) Vegan Chocolate or Chocolate Chips*

1 tsp Vanilla Extract

Directions

1. Line a loaf pan with parchment paper and set aside.

2. Prepare your vegan butter and break up your chocolate and have your vanilla extract on a teaspoon ready to go in. Everything must be prepared before you start as it will all happen very quickly.

3. Add the soy milk and sugar to a saucepan and heat, stirring continuously until boiling. Set a timer and once boiling let it boil, while stirring constantly, for exactly 7-minutes.

4. Remove from heat and add the vegan butter, chocolate and vanilla and stir in vigorously. Working quickly as it will start setting very fast, transfer to the parchment lined loaf pan and smooth down with the back of a spoon.

5. Place into the refrigerator to set.

6. Once set, lift out the entire block of fudge by lifting out the parchment paper, cut into squares and enjoy.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 Square (of 28)
Calories: 77
Total Fat: 3.6g
Saturated Fat: 1.8g
Sodium: 18mg
Total Carbohydrate: 10.3g
Sugars: 9.8g
Protein: 0.6g

Photos

SUPER HEALTHY TUNA SALAD

Courses: Entree
Categories: 03 🐟
Collections:
Source: https://www.epicurious.com/recipes/member/views/super-healthy-tuna-salad-52802141
Serving size: 2-4 people
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/2 cup silken tofu or 1/4 cup Vegenaise

2 teaspoons Dijon mustard

1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice

8 ounces tuna packed in olive oil, drained

4 cornichons, finely diced

1 tablespoon finely minced white onion

A pinch of ground celery seed

A big pinch of coarse sea salt

Directions

1. - Puree the tofu, mustard, and lemon juice until smooth in a powerful blender or food processor (if you're using Vegenaise, you can simply whisk together the ingredients). - Combine with the rest of the ingredients in a mixing bowl, being sure to break up the tuna. - Serve on a bed of greens or between slices of your favourite gluten-free bread.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 214
Total Fat: 14g
Saturated Fat: 2g
Cholesterol: 10mg
Sodium: 498mg
Total Carbohydrate: 2g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Protein: 18g

Photos

Sweet and Sour Chicken Meal Prep Bowls

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://sweetcsdesigns.com/instant-pot-sweet-sour-chicken-meal-prep-bowls
Serving size: 5
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 lb chicken, cut into small 1" cubes

1 cup arrowroot

2 eggs, extra large

1 cup flour

2 tbsp grapeseed oil, or sunflower

8 oz sweet and sour sauce, I prefer Far East

1 cup rice, I use basmati

2 cups water, for rice

2 cups water, for pot

sesame seeds, green onions to garnish

Directions

1. Turn instant pot on to sautee- let fully heat before adding any food for it to be truly nonstick.

2. Add cornstarch, flour, and eggs to small individual bowls.

3. Whisk eggs thoroughly.

4. Dredge chicken in cornstarch, followed by eggs, and then flour.

5. Add oil to instant pot when hot.

6. Add dredged chicken, let brown on each side about 5 minutes, until golden brown and slightly puffy.

7. Remove chicken from instant pot pan, and place in pan insert, top with sweet and sour sauce.

8. Deglaze instant pot with water, make sure there are no bits stuck to bottom.

9. Add trivet to pan.

10. Add chicken pan into instant pot.

11. Add rice and 2 cups water to second pot insert.

12. Add lid on top of rice.

13. Close and seal instant pot.

14. Set on high for 3 minutes, let naturally release for 10 minutes.

15. Remove chicken pan from instant pot, but leave rice in the instant pot with the lid firmly on (it needs to carryover cook for about 5-10 minutes to be fluffy.)

16. Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions, if desired.

17. Plate and enjoy!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 593
Saturated Fat: 5g
Cholesterol: 133mg
Sodium: 103mg
Total Carbohydrate: 72g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Protein: 24g

Photos

Mix together and dip away!

Sweetened Condensed Milk Alternative

Courses: Dessert
Categories: 11 🥵, 12 ☕, 13 🧂
Collections:
Source: https://www.godairyfree.org/recipes/instant-dairy-free-sweetened-condensed-milk
Serving size: Makes approximately 14 ounces
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 cup + 2 tablespoons dairy-free vanilla rice milk powder

¾ cup sugar (see notes)

½ cup hot water

2 tablespoons ghee, or clarified butter

Generous pinch sea salt

Directions

1. Place the rice milk powder and sugar in your blender.Whiz the ingredients for about 30 seconds, or until powdered.

2. Add the water, ghee or clarified butter, and salt to your blender and blend for 2 minutes, or until thick and creamy.

3. Use as a substitute for sweetened condensed milk in recipes!

Notes

Sweetener options: This recipe for dairy-free sweetened condensed milk really does work best with regular or organic white sugar. For a more caramel-like flavor, coconut sugar can be substituted. I do not recommend date sugar (and most likely maple sugar), which yielded a mixture that was way too thick.

Photos

Taco Pasta [Instant Pot or Stove]

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://thekitchengirl.com/taco-pasta/
Serving size: 9 1 cup servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

2 Tbsp Olive Oil (or preferred oil)

1/2 large Onion (diced)

1 lb. Lean Ground Beef

1 15 oz can Diced Tomatoes (drained) (or 1 cup salsa picante)

1 15 oz can Black Beans (or whole pinto beans) (rinsed and drained)

1 cup Corn (fresh, frozen, or canned)

8 oz Uncooked Medium Shell Pasta (225g) (or preferred pasta type)

2 Tbsp Taco Seasoning (same as 1-oz packet * See footnote)

2 1/4 cups Chicken Broth (add more for stove version (see note))

8 oz Cheddar Cheese (same as 2 cups shredded)

Sea Salt (to taste)

Directions

1. Taco Pasta (Instant Pot Method)

2. Select "Sauté" on the Instant Pot and add OIL. Allow pot to heat until it the display reads "HOT".

3. Add ONION and GROUND BEEF. Sauté until cooked through, stirring as needed. Drain excess fat as needed.

4. If any browned ingredients are stuck on the pot's surface, add a splash of broth and scrape them with a flat utensil to release them. This is called deglazing and it's "flavor gold".

5. Press "Cancel" on the pot. Add PASTA SHELLS, TOMATOES (or picante), BEANS, CORN, TACO SEASONING, and BROTH. Press all ingredients under liquid to submerge.

6. Secure lid and set pressure valve to "Sealing". Select "Manual" or "Pressure Cook" for 1 minute for thin pasta (shell pasta) or 2 minutes for thicker pasta (penne, rotini, elbow mac, etc).

7. When cook cycle ends, let the pot sit undisturbed for a 10-minute (NPR) natural pressure release. DO NOT SKIP THIS STEP ... the pasta is still cooking.

8. Carefully turn pressure release valve to "Venting" position to release remaining steam (if any). Open the lid.Note: You'll see some excess liquid at first, but it helps incorporate the cheese in the next step. Also, pasta always soaks up liquid as it rests (just like IP Mac and Cheese).

9. Stir in the CHEDDAR CHEESE and let the pasta rest in the pot for a bit to absorb excess moisture, if needed.Note: Feel free to add more cheese along with splashes of broth as needed to adjust the texture to your liking.

10. Taco Pasta (Stove Method)

11. Heat OIL in soup pot over medium-high heat. Add ONIONS and GROUND BEEF. Sauté until cooked through, stirring as needed.

12. Stir in DICED TOMATOES, BLACK BEANS, PASTA SHELLS, TACO SEASONING, and CHICKEN BROTH.Note: Add more liquid (broth or water) as needed to cover the pasta.

13. Adjust heat to HIGH and bring everything just to a boil.

14. Adjust heat to MED-LOW and simmer until pasta is cooked through (about 10 minutes). Add splashes of liquid (broth or water) as needed.

15. Just before serving, stir in CHEDDAR CHEESE. Add SALT to taste.

16. Taco Pasta Serving and Storage Instructions

17. Serve taco pasta warm with your choice of toppings: cilantro, lime, jalapeño, cheese, or sour cream.

18. Store in an airtight container up to 5 days in the refrigerator or up to 90 days in the freezer.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 cup
Calories: 316
Total Fat: 15g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 58mg
Sodium: 455mg
Total Carbohydrate: 24g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 21g

Photos

Taco Pinto Beans & Rice

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: Kirkconnell, Sarah. Freezer Bag Cooking: Adventure Ready Recipes . Bay Street Publishing. Kindle Edition.
Serving size: 1
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/2 cup instant rice

3 TBSP dehydrated pinto beans

1 Tbsp dehydrated onion

1 Tbsp dehydrated celery

1 Tbsp dehydrated carrot

1 Tbsp “Taco” flavored TVP

1 Tbsp diced dried onion

1 tsp taco seasoning mix

1/4 tsp granulated garlic

1/4 tsp chili powder

1/4 tsp dried oregano

1 Tbsp olive oil

Directions

Add 1 cup boiling water and oil to the dry ingredients in your mug. Stir well, cover tightly and let sit for 15 minutes.
