Ten Minute Vegan TVP Taco

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.thespruceeats.com/vegan-tvp-taco-recipe-3377172
Serving size: about 1 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

1/4 cup TVP

1/4 cup water

1/4 tablespoon tamari

1/4 tablespoon olive oil

1 tsp ground cumin

1/8 tsp granulated garlic

1/4 tsp granulated onion

1/2 tsp dried oregano, rubbed

1/4 tsp salt

3/4 tablespoon salsa

1 taco shells

Directions

1. First, in a large skillet, heat the water over medium heat. Once the water is hot, add the TVP, stirring well. Allow the TVP to reconstitute for 2-3 minutes until fully tender.

2. Keeping the pot over medium heat, add the olive oil or vegetable oil and soy sauce, and taco seasoning, stirring well.

3. Allow the mixture to cook for another 3-5 minutes, stirring frequently.

4. Next, mix in the salsa and remove the pan from heat.

5. Serve your quick and easy TVP taco mix wrapped up in a tortilla or hard taco shells. I like to eat this as is, but you could also add tomatoes, lettuce, beans and sour cream to your tacos.

Photos

Thai Pineapple Chicken Curry

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://cookingmadehealthy.com/thai-pineapple-chicken-curry/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

2 teaspoons canola oil

1/4 cup red curry paste (if using concentrated use 1 tablespoon)

1 cup light almond milk

3 chicken breasts (boneless skinless - sliced thinly)

3 kaffir lime leaves (optional)

1/4 cup thai basil leaves (optional)

3 tablespoons fish sauce

1 tablespoon sugar

1/2 yellow onion (sliced thinly)

1 tablespoon arrowroot (mixed with 1 tablespoon water)

2 cups pineapple chunks

Directions

1. Heat the saucepan on medium high heat and add the canola oil.

2. Add the curry paste and whisk well, cooking it for 1-2 minutes until it starts to get foamy.

3. Add in the almond milk and whisk well.

4. Add in the chicken, basil and lime leaves (if using), fish sauce, sugar and onion and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the chicken is cooked.

5. Add in the arrowroot mixture and pineapple chunks and cook until the sauce thickens, 2-3 minutes.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 /6th recipe
Calories: 169
Total Fat: 11.6g
Saturated Fat: 7.7g
Cholesterol: 55mg
Sodium: 748mg
Total Carbohydrate: 23.6g
Dietary Fiber: 1.2g
Sugars: 19.7g
Protein: 18.8g

Photos

The Best Black Bean Burgers I've Ever Had

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/best-black-bean-burgers/
Serving size: 2-2 1/4 burgers
Preparation time: 30 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 cup black beans, drained, rinsed, and patted dry

1/4 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil

1/4 cup carrot and celery

1/4 cup and 1 1/4 tablespoons finely chopped yellow onion (1/8 of a large onion)

1 garlic cloves, minced (about 1 tablespoon)

1/2 teaspoon ground cumin

1/4 teaspoon garlic powder

2 3/4 tablespoons oat flour

2 3/4 tablespoons feta cheese

5/8 large eggs

1/4 tablespoon tamari sauce

3/4 tablespoon BBQ sauce

pinch salt

Pinch white pepper

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C). Spread beans evenly onto a lined baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes until slightly dried out.

2. Meanwhile, sauté olive oil, chopped pepper, onion, and garlic over medium heat until peppers and onions are soft, about 5-6 minutes. Gently blot some of the moisture out. Place in a large bowl or in a food processor with the remaining ingredients. Stir or pulse everything together, then add the black beans. Mash with a fork or pulse the mixture, leaving some larger chunks of beans.

3. Form into patties-- about 1/3 cup of mixture in each.

4. To bake: Place patties on a parchment paper lined baking sheet and bake at 375°F (191°C) for 10 minutes on each side, 20 minutes total. To grill: Place patties on greased aluminum foil and grill 8 minutes on each side. Heat temperature is personal preference as all grills differ. Generally, black bean burgers should grill on medium-high heat about 350°F (177°C) - 400°F (204°C).

5. Serve with your favorite toppings.

Photos

The Best Cauliflower Toast (A Must-Try Paleo Bread Recipe)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://paleogrubs.com/cauliflower-bread-recipe
Serving size: 1
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 pound cauliflower florets

1 olive oil

1 egg

1 cup almond flour

salt to taste

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350ºF. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.

2. Place the cauliflower florets in a food processor and pulse until the mixture resembles rice.

3. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.

4. Add the cauliflower “rice” and cook, stirring constantly, 4 – 5 minutes.

5. In a bowl add the cauliflower “rice” and egg and mix to combine.

6. Add the almond flour and season to taste with salt.

7. Mix to combine.

8. Place the cauliflower mixture onto the baking sheet in six even portions. Form into squares, about ½ inch thick.

9. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes.

10. Remove from the oven and flip.

11. Bake for additional 12 – 15 minutes.

12. Serve with mashed avocado, sliced tomatoes, boiled eggs, cooked chicken or other toppings to your liking.

Photos

The Best Crepe Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://laurenslatest.com/better-than-paris-crepes/
Serving size: 16 crepes, depending on pan size
Preparation time: 2 hours
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

4 large eggs

2 1/4 cups almond milk

2 cups brown rice flour

1/4 cup melted clarified butter

good pinch of salt

Directions

1. Place all ingredients in order as listed in a blender and blitz until smooth, about 1 minute. Scrape the sides and blend again briefly until batter is lump-free. Refrigerate at least 1 hour, but 2 is ideal.

2. Place nonstick or cast iron skillet over medium to medium-high heat* to preheat. Melt a little butter or oil in the bottom of the pan and swirl to coat. With the hot skillet in one hand and the batter in the other, slowly and steadily pour crepe batter into the center of the pan, tilting the skillet around to spread the batter evenly across the bottom in a very thin layer. It takes some practice but after 3 or 4 times, you can get consistently even crepes.

3. After 10-15 seconds, the crepe batter shouldn't look shiny anymore, it should appear more matte and the bottom should be lightly browned. So, flip it over and cook another 10 seconds or so. Remove from pan and repeat this process until no more batter remains.

4. I like to pile my crepes into a pie plate covered with some foil throughout the cooking process to keep them all warm, a trick my Mom does. Serve immediately with whatever toppings you desire.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 127
Total Fat: 5g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Cholesterol: 44mg
Sodium: 30mg
Total Carbohydrate: 14g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 4g

Photos

The Best Gluten-Free Graham Crackers

Courses: Snack
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://glutenfreebaking.com/gluten-free-graham-crackers/
Serving size: 12 graham crackers
Preparation time: 20 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

1 1/2 cups brown rice flour (7 1/2 ounces/ 212 grams)

1/2 cup arrowroot (2 ounces/ 57 grams)

1/3 cup date sugar (2 2/3 ounces/ 75 grams)

1 teaspoon baking powder

1/2 teaspoon salt

5 tablespoons butter

6 tablespoons Almond milk

3 tablespoons molasses (1 ounces/ 30 grams)

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350°F. In the bowl of a food processor, combine brown rice flour, cornstarch, dark brown sugar, baking powder, and salt. Pulse to combine. (If you don't have a food processor, whisk dry ingredients together in a medium mixing bowl.)

2. Add the butter. Pulse until flour mixture is coarse. No large pieces of butter should remain. (Or cut cold butter into flour mixture with a pastry cutter, two knives or by rubbing the butter between your fingers.)

3. Add milk and honey. Pulse until dough forms. (Or stir using a wooden spoon.)

4. Turn dough out onto a lightly rice floured piece of 12x16 parchment paper. Pat dough into a rectangle. Dust the top of the dough lightly with rice flour.

5. Place another piece of 12-by-16-inch parchment paper on top of the dough. Roll dough out until it covers all of the paper. Dough rectangle will be about 1/8 inch thick.

6. Carefully remove top piece of parchment paper. Transfer dough, with bottom parchment paper, to a 12 x 18 baking pan.

7. Using a pizza wheel, score the dough into rectangles. (The rectangles should be 6 x 2 3/4 inches large for "standard" graham crackers and 3 by 2 3/4 for a "s'more" size graham cracker.) The graham crackers will break apart after baking. Do not worry if the dough seems to still be touching after scoring with the pizza wheel.

8. Prick dough all over with a fork.

9. Chill dough for 10 minutes. Bake for 15 minutes or until evenly brown.

10. Remove graham crackers from the pan and place on a wire rack to cool. (I slide the parchment, with the crackers, directly onto the cooling rack.) Allow crackers to cool completely. Break along scored lines.

Photos

The Best Simple Guacamole

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.bowlofdelicious.com/best-simple-guacamole/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

5-6 avocados (or 3-4 large avocados)

1/4 cup finely chopped red onion

1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro

juice of 1 lime (about 2 tablespoons)

1/2 teaspoon kosher salt

Directions

1. Halve avocados and remove pits.

2. Using a paring knife, dice the avocado while it is still in the peel by cutting the flesh in both directions into approximately 1/2 inch squares.

3. Scoop out the diced avocados from the peel with a spoon and place in a bowl with remaining ingredients.

4. Stir using a spoon until desired consistency is reached (the avocado will mash a bit, especially if you stir vigorously, but you still want some chunky texture).

5. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.

6. Serve with chips, on tacos or burritos, on top of chicken or fish, or on eggs, or anything else you love to eat with guacamole!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 271
Total Fat: 25g
Saturated Fat: 4g
Sodium: 206mg
Total Carbohydrate: 15g
Dietary Fiber: 11g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 3g

Photos

The Most Amazing Lasagna Recipe

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://thestayathomechef.com/amazing-lasagna-recipe/
Serving size: 8 Servings
Preparation time: 1 hour 30 mins
Cooking time: 50 mins

Ingredients

1 pound sweet Italian sausage

1 pound lean ground beef

1 large white onion (diced)

5 cloves garlic (minced)

1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes

2 (6 ounce) cans tomato paste

1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce

1/2 cup white wine

2 tablespoons white sugar

1/2 cup chopped fresh basil

1 teaspoon fennel seeds

1 teaspoon ground oregano

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper

1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley

1 pound lasagna noodles

30 ounces ricotta cheese

2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley

1 large egg

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg

1 pound thinly sliced mozzarella cheese (about 24 slices)

1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese

Directions

1. In a large pot over medium heat, add in ground sausage and ground beef. Use a spoon to break up the meat into small pieces. Add in onion and garlic and cook until meat is well browned, stirring constantly. Stir in sugar, fresh basil, fennel, oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup chopped parsley. Pour in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and wine*. Stir well and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and simmer 1-4 hours, stirring occasionally.

2. Meanwhile, place lasagna noodles into the bottom of a pan. Pour hot tap water directly over the noodles, making sure the pasta is completely immersed in the water. Let them soak for 30 minutes, then drain and discard water.

3. In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese with egg, remaining 2 tablespoons parsley, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and nutmeg. Refrigerate until ready to assemble lasagna.

4. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease a deep 9x13 pan.

5. To assemble, spread about 1 cup of meat sauce in the bottom of the prepared pan. Place 4 noodles on top. Spread with 1/3 of the ricotta cheese mixture. Top with 1/4 of mozzarella cheese slices. Spoon 1 1/2 cups meat sauce over mozzarella, then sprinkle with 1/4 cup parmesan cheese. Repeat layering two more times to create three complete layers. To finish, place a final layer of pasta, topped with another 1 cup of meat sauce to cover the pasta. Top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Cover loosely with aluminum foil.

6. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil, and bake an additional 25 minutes to allow cheese to brown. Serve hot.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 834
Total Fat: 39g
Saturated Fat: 19g
Cholesterol: 174mg
Sodium: 1514mg
Total Carbohydrate: 54g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 6g
Protein: 63g

Photos

The Ultimate Mexican Instant Pot Black Beans

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.joyfulhealthyeats.com/the-ultimate-mexican-instant-pot-black-beans-no-soak/
Serving size: 6 cups
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 45 mins

Ingredients

1 tablespoon grape seed oil

1 cup diced yellow onion

3 garlic cloves, minced

1/3 cup fresh cilantro

1 red pepper, diced

1 lb. dry black beans

1 1/2 tablespoons ground cumin

1 teaspoon ancho chili powder

1 teaspoon smoked paprika

1/2 teaspoon salt

4 cups water

1/2 cup salsa verde

juice of 1 lime

Directions

1. Set instant pot to Saute mode.

2. Add in grape seed oil and onions to the pot. Saute for 2-3 minutes, until onions are translucent.

3. Next add in garlic. Saute and stir for 30 seconds, until garlic is fragrant.

4. Immediately add fresh cilantro and red pepper, saute for 2 minutes.

5. Add in dried black beans, cumin, ancho chili powder, smoked paprika and salt. Saute for 1 minute, stirring the entire time to incorporate all the spices with the other ingredients.

6. Pour in the water and salsa verde.

7. Cancel the Saute mode and set to Pressure Cooker mode.

8. Cover and cook on HIGH pressure for 40 minutes.

9. Do a natural release. Add lime juice to the beans and stir. (Add more salt if needed.)

10. Serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1/3 cup
Calories: 81
Total Fat: 1g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 105mg
Total Carbohydrate: 14g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 5g

Photos

The Ultimate Sweet & Tangy Nightshade Free BBQ Sauce

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://meatified.com/sweet-tangy-nightshade-free-bbq-sauce/
Serving size: 2 cups / 480 ml
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 cup / 140 g diced yellow onion

1/2 cup / 120 ml filtered water

2 tsp citric acid

1/2 cup / 120 ml unsweetened applesauce, about one 4 oz single serving cup

1/4 cup + 2 tbsp / 90 ml tamari

1/4 cup + 2 tbsp / 90 ml Honee

1/4 cup / 60 ml balsamic vinegar substitute

1/4 cup / 60 ml pumpkin puree

2 tbsp / 30 ml unsulphured blackstrap molasses

2 cloves garlic

2 tbsp + 1 tsp / 14 g ground ginger

1 tbsp / 15 g sea salt

1 tsp / 5 ml gluten free fish sauce, optional

liquid smoke

Directions

1. BLEND: Add all ingredients to a blender and process until smooth and combined, scraping down the sides a few times as needed.

2. SIMMER: Pour the blended BBQ sauce mixture into a saucepan over medium heat, heating gently until the bbq sauce comes to a simmer.

3. THICKEN: Reduce the heat so that the BBQ sauce simmers gently but doesn't boil or splash and cook, stirring gently, until the sauce thickens and darkens to a rich, deep brown hue. Don't worry about the foam that you may see on the top of the sauce at the beginning - just keep stirring regularly and it will dissipate as the sauce cooks, reduces and thickens. If you like your BBQ sauce with a bit more tanginess, add additional citric acid, to taste, then cook for an additional 5 minutes at the end.

4. STORE: Pour the finished nightshade free BBQ sauce carefully into jars to cool. You can keep the BBQsauce in the fridge for up to 2 months. You can use it straight from the fridge as a marinade.

Photos

Toasted Nuts

Courses: Snack
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://www.culinaryhill.com/how-to-toast-walnuts/#wprm-recipe-container-34112
Serving size: 4 (1/4 cup) servings
Preparation time: 2 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

1 cup walnuts

1 tablespoon olive oil or clarified butter

Sea Salt

Directions

350F - 7 minutes - walnuts

350F - 10 minutes - peanuts

1. To toast walnuts in the 8 qt. Emeril Lagasse Pressure Air Fryer:

2. Place 1 1/2 cups raw nuts in inner liner.

3. Drizzle with olive oil or melted classified butter or ghee and sprinkle with sea salt. Give it a good stir, and spread out evenly.

4. Toast using Air Fryer - Bake as stated above. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 76

Photos

Tofu Mayonnaise (Vegan)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://40aprons.com/tofu-mayonnaise-vegan/
Serving size:
Preparation time: 2 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

12 oz . silken tofu (like Mori-nu, firm, excess water drained)

lemon juice (about one half to one lemon)

sea salt (to taste)

almond milk (splash)

Directions

1. Blend tofu in blender until smooth. Add lemon juice, to taste, and blend. Add non-dairy milk to your desired consistency. Season with salt to taste.

Tofu Sour Cream

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.thismamacooks.com/2012/09/tofu-sour-cream.html
Serving size: 2 cups
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 (14-16 ounce) package firm tofu, preferably organic

2 tablespoons canola oil

1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice

2 teaspoons natural rice vinegar

1 teaspoon agave, stevia or other sugar substitute

1/2 teaspoon sea salt

1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest

Directions

1. Place all ingredients in a food processor or blender. Process several minutes, until very creamy and smooth.

2. Firms up when chilled. Refrigerate sour cream until it is ready to be used.

Photos

Tofu Steaks with Salsa Verde - The Little Green Spoon

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://littlegreenspoon.ie/2018/08/20/tofu-steaks-with-salsa-verde-2/
Serving size: Serves 4
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

For the Tofu:

450g of Firm Tofu

Olive Oil

Sea Salt

For the Salsa Verde:

15g of Fresh Coriander

15g of Fresh Basil

Juice of 1 Lime

1/4 Cup of Olive Oil (60ml)

3 Tablespoons of Capers

Sea Salt & Pepper

Directions

1. Squeeze the tofu gently to remove any excess water and pat it dry.

2. To make the salsa verde, add all of the ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.

3. Cut the tofu into slices about 1cm thick and lay them out on a plate. Drizzle olive oil over each side and season with salt and pepper.

4. Get your grill hot, then add the tofu slices and cook for about 4 minutes each side until you have nice char lines.

5. Serve hot with the salsa verde on top and some fresh lime.

Photos

Tomatillo Pineapple Salsa

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1018058-tomatillo-pineapple-salsa
Serving size: About 3 cups
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 20 mins

Ingredients

1 pound tomatillos (about 6 medium)

6 Padrón peppers (or use shishito peppers), stems removed

1 tablespoon olive oil

1 cup diced pineapple

1 hot paper lantern pepper (or use a habanero pepper), stem removed

2 cloves garlic, smashed

1 teaspoon dried oregano

1/2 teaspoon salt, more to taste

1 cup diced onion

1/2 cup fresh cilantro, finely chopped

Juice of 1 lime

Directions

1. Remove the husks from the tomatillos and rinse well. Halve the tomatillos and Padrón peppers.

2. Set a skillet over medium-high heat and add olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the tomatillos, Padrón peppers, pineapple, paper lantern or habanero pepper, garlic, oregano and salt. Cook, stirring occasionally until everything starts to char, 5 to 7 minutes.

3. Once charred, transfer the contents of the skillet to a blender or food processor and add 1/2 cup water. Blend until almost puréed. Pour mixture into a bowl and chill for 1 hour.

4. Stir in onion, cilantro and lime juice. Season with salt to taste.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 101
Total Fat: 3g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 201mg
Total Carbohydrate: 18g
Dietary Fiber: 5g
Sugars: 10g
Protein: 3g

Photos

Tomatillo Salsa Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.vacmasterfresh.com/fresh-bites-blog/tomatillo-salsa-recipe/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/2 pound tomatillos, husked and rinsed

5 cloves garlic, peeled and cracked

1 medium white onion, peeled, cored and quartered

1-3 medium jalapeños, stemmed

1 handful cilantro, stemmed

Kosher salt, to taste

Directions

1. Preheat the SV1 to 88°C/190°F

2. Place tomatillos, garlic, onions, and jalapeños in an appropriate sized VacMaster bag and using a VacMaster suction or chambermachine vacuum pack.

3. Leave in water bath for 15-20 minutes or until the onions are slightly soft.

4. Carefully remove the bag from the SV1 and immediately plunge into ice water to thoroughly chill.

5. When the tomatillo mixture is thoroughly chilled place the contents into a bar blender or food processor. Add the cilantro, lime juice, salt and pepper to taste and purée, reserve.

6. Enjoy!

Photos

Tomatillo Salsa Verde Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://shewearsmanyhats.com/tomatillo-salsa-verde-recipe/
Serving size: 5 cups
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 15 mins

Ingredients

2 pounds tomatillos, husks removed & washed

6 jalapeños replace with horseradish

4 garlic cloves

1 medium-large onion

2/3 cup fresh cilantro leaves

2 teaspoon sea salt

Directions

1. Chop the onion in half, crush the garlic, and leave the jalapeÃ±os and tomatillos whole. Roast on a baking sheet in a 400-degrees F oven for about 15 minutes, turning all halfway over through roasting time.

2. Peel the garlic, deseed and rough chop the jalapeÃ±o, and peel and rough chop the onion.

3. In a food processor, add all roasted ingredients, plus cilantro and salt and pulse until all ingredients are chopped and desired consistency is reached.

Photos

Tomatillo Sauce

Directions

Wash tomatillos, cut in half, and place face town on tray.

APO:

Rear, 400°F 16 minutes

Water saute onions and garlic using bare minimum of water.

Blend together the roasted tomatillo, cooked onion/ garlic, plus remaining ingredients.

Traditional Manchego

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.culturesforhealth.com/learn/recipe/cheese-recipes/traditional-manchego/
Serving size: YIELD: Makes one 2-lb. wheel.
Preparation time: 12 hours 10 mins
Cooking time: 3 hours 25 mins

Ingredients

2 gallons whole cow milk

1/2 packet direct-set mesophilic starter

1/2 packet direct-set thermophilic starter

1/4 tsp. lipase powder diluted in 1/4 cup of cool, unchlorinated water and allowed to dissolve for at least 15 minutes

1/2 tsp. liquid rennet dissolved in 1/4 cup cool, unchlorinated water

Sea salt and purified water for brine

Directions

1. Heat the milk to 86°F in a water bath.

2. Combine both starters in a small plastic measuring cup and sprinkle them over the surface of the milk. Allow the starter to rehydrate on the surface of the milk for 1 full minute before stirring it in with a cheese spoon.

3. Stir in the starter using smooth, long, up-and-down strokes for 1 full minute, then cover the milk and allow it to ripen for 45 minutes, maintaining the temperature at 86°F throughout.

4. Add the diluted lipase and stir it in using the same methods as used for incorporating the starter. Add the rennet by pouring it through the cheese spoon and into the milk. Stir using up-and-down motions for 1 minute.

5. Cover the milk and let it set undisturbed for 30 minutes or until it gives a clean break.

6. Cut the curd into 1/2-inch cubes and re-cover to rest for 5 more minutes.

7. Using a clean stainless steel whisk, stir the curds to cut them into rice-sized pieces. This may take a long time, up to 30 minutes.

8. Slowly heat the curds to 104°F, bringing the temperature up by 2 degrees every 5 minutes. Stir the curds to keep them from matting while you are heating them up.

9. Once the curds have reached the correct temperature, let them sit undisturbed for 5 minutes, then pour off all the whey.

10. Line a two-lb. cheese mold with damp cheesecloth and ladle the hot curds into it. Replace the follower and press at 15 lbs. of pressure for 15 minutes.

11. Take the cheese out of the mold, unwrap it, flip it over, re-wrap it in the cheesecloth and put it back into the mold. Press again at 15 lbs. of pressure for 15 minutes.

12. Remove, undress, flip, redress, and replace the cheese. Press once more at 15 lbs. for 15 minutes.

13. Remove, undress, flip, redress, and replace the cheese. Press this time at 30 lbs. for 6 hours.

14. Make a saturated brine and chill it. Place the cheese and the brine into a plastic or other non-reactive bowl and place it, covered, into the refrigerator for 6 hours.

15. Remove the cheese from the brine, pat it dry with paper towels, and air-dry it for a few days. Age at 55°F for any length of time, depending on the desired strength. The cheese can be covered in olive oil to prevent it from becoming dried out.

Photos

Tumeric Coffee

Courses:
Categories: 11 🥵, 12 ☕

Tuna Nicoise Salad

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source: Recipe Keeper
Serving size: 4
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cooked tuna steaks or 2 cans of tuna

12 small potatoes

5oz fine French beans

4 tomatoes

1 large romaine lettuce

1 red onion, finely sliced

4 hard-boiled eggs, peeled and sliced

20 black olives

Chopped fresh parsley

8 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil

3 tablespoons red wine vinegar

2 garlic cloves, peeled and finely chopped

1 teaspoon salt

1 teaspoon ground black pepper

Directions

1. Cook the potatoes until just tender, cool in ice water and peel and quarter.

2. Top and tail the beans and boil in water for 5 minutes, cool in ice water.

3. Tear the lettuce into small pieces and arrange on a large plate.

4. Chop the tomatoes into quarters and add to the plate.

5. Cut the tuna into large chunks and add to the the plate.

6. Add the potatoes, beans, slice onion, eggs, olives and scatter over the chopped parsley.

7. In a small bowl mix the oil, vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper. Pour over the salad and serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 978
Total Fat: 40.4g
Saturated Fat: 6.9g
Cholesterol: 193mg
Sodium: 921mg
Total Carbohydrate: 118.6g
Dietary Fiber: 25.4g
Sugars: 12.6g
Protein: 41.4g

Photos

Tuna Steak Meal

Courses: Entree, Side Dish
Categories: 03 🐟, 08 🌾, 09 🥕
Collections: Meals
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Tuna

2 tablespoons lemon juice

1 tablespoon olive oil

2 garlic cloves, minced

2 teaspoons minced fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme

4 tuna steaks (6 ounces each)

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 teaspoon white pepper

Rice

2 tablespoons butter

1 cup brown rice

1 ¼ cups broth or water

2 cloves garlic ((minced))

1/2 teaspoon parsley ((dried))

1 1/4 tablespoons Parmesan cheese ((grated))

Spinach

1 lb Baby Spinach

Directions

Tuna

In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the lemon juice, oil, garlic and thyme. Add the tuna; seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for up to 30 minutes, turning occasionally.

Rice

1. Set Instant Pot to "saute" to melt the butter (it will take about 1-2 minutes). Once melted, turn the Instant Pot to "off/keep warm".

2. Add the rice, broth, garlic, and dried parsley. Stir.

3. Lock the lid into place and set the steam release handle (valve on top) to “Sealing”. Press Manual>High Pressure>22 minutes. It will take 2-4 minutes to get up to pressure.

Tuna

Place steaks on silpat lined tray. Insert probe.

Rear heat. SV 110° F 100% Steam

Probe 105° F

Approximate time: 35 minutes.

Rice

4. When the rice has finished cooking, the Instant Pot will beep and switch to ”keep warm". Then use a kitchen towel and flip the switch to "venting". It will take about 2-4 minutes to depressurize.

5. Carefully open the lid and add the parmesan and stir.

Spinach

Rear SV 212° F 100% Steam

Maybe 5 min

Tuna

Pat dry. Sear and serve.

Photos

Turkey and Pinto Bean White Chili with Lime

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔, 09 🥕

salt to taste

Directions

Brown turkey.

Add rehydrated ingredients and extra water as needed.

Adjust Seasoning to taste and add lime juice.

Add sauce and set aside.

Turkey Gravy

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.daringgourmet.com/best-brown-mushroom-gravy-from-scratch/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

Bag drippings from Sous Vide Turkey

4 tablespoons poultry herb infused clarified butter

4 tablespoons brown rice flour

2 cups strong turkey broth

1/2 teaspoon sea salt plus more to taste

Directions

1. Add bag drippings to 3 qt mini Instant Pot liner. Set pot to sauté and bring to a vigorous boil.

2. Add the butter and melt.  Add the flour, whisk to combine and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring continually.

4. Add the broth and salt.   Whisk continually until the gravy is thickened.  Cover and simmer on low, stirring occasionally, for 5-10 minutes.  Add salt to taste.  If you prefer the gravy thinner add a little more broth.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 151
Total Fat: 11g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Cholesterol: 30mg
Sodium: 530mg
Total Carbohydrate: 8g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 4g

Photos

Turkey Ham

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://barbecuebible.com/recipe/turkey-ham/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

4 quarts (1 gallon) water ¾ cup coarse salt (sea or kosher) ¾ cup packed light brown sugar 1 tablespoon pink curing salt (Prague Powder No. 1 or Insta Cure No. 1) 5 whole cloves 5 allspice berries, lightly crushed with the side of a chef’s knife or cleaver 2 bay leaves, broken into pieces 2 cinnamon sticks (3 inches each), broken into pieces 1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns 6 turkey drumsticks (1 to 1½ pounds each)

Directions

Step 1: Make the brine: Combine 2 quarts of the water, the sea salt, sugar, curing salt, cloves, allspice berries, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, and peppercorns in a large stockpot. Bring to a boil over high heat, whisking to dissolve the salt and sugar. Remove from the heat and add the remaining 2 quarts water. Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate until thoroughly chilled.

2. ShareTweetPin180 Shares

Step 2: Rinse the turkey drumsticks in a colander under cold running water.

4. ShareTweetPin180 Shares

Step 3: Add the turkey drumsticks to the brine, making sure they’re completely submerged. You can hold them down with a dinner plate or a resealable plastic bag filled with ice. Brine the drumsticks in the refrigerator for 48 hours.

6. ShareTweetPin180 Shares

Step 4: When you’re ready to smoke, drain the drumsticks and discard the brine. Pick off and discard any clinging spices. Blot the drumsticks dry with paper towels.

8. ShareTweetPin180 Shares

Step 5: Set up your smoker following the manufacturer’s instructions and preheat to 225° to 250°F. Add the wood as specified by the manufacturer.

10. ShareTweetPin180 Shares

Step 6: Place the drumsticks on the rack in the smoker. Smoke the turkey until darkly browned and very tender, 3 to 4 hours, or as needed. You’re looking for an internal temperature of 170°F on an instant-read thermometer. (Make sure the probe doesn’t touch bone, or you’ll get a false reading.)

12. ShareTweetPin180 Shares

Step 7: Do not be alarmed (on the contrary—be proud) if the meat under the skin is pinkish: That’s a chemical reaction to the cure and the smoke. Serve hot or at room temperature. In the unlikely event you have leftovers, store in the refrigerator; the drumsticks will keep for at least 3 days.

14. ShareTweetPin180 Shares

Photos

Turkey ham - A delicious pork ham alternative

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://wurstcircle.com/recipes/turkey-ham/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 kg turkey meat

Spices for the curing mixture:

1 liter of water

37.5 g salt

2.5 g Cure #1

10 g black pepper

5 g juniper berries

3 g sugar

2 g garlic granules

2 bay leaves

2 g caraway

1.5 g coriander

Directions

1. You need about 20-30% of the meat weight as brine. So if your ham is 1.5 kg -> you need a maximum of 500ml brine. You can either boil 1 liter and then use only as much as you need or scale down the recipe.

2. Equipment for making turkey ham

3. Syringe

4. In order to inject the brine into the meat (the process ensures that the meat stays juicy), you will need a roasting syringe. If you don’t have one yet, you can buy one here for around €10*.

5. Thermometer & cooking pot / Sous Vide cooker

6. There are several ways to cook your meat.

7. The easiest way is to use a sous vide cooker. With it you can gently cook the meat at a constant temperature. This reduces the risk of the meat becoming too hot and thus too dry.

8. If you don’t have a sous vide cooker and want to cook the ham in a pot, you will need a ham mold. I can recommend the following set* (which also has a thermometer included).

9. (Optional) Ham press / ham fairy

10. Personally, I make my ham in a bag and don’t care much about it being nice and round. So since I cook it sous vide, this part of the kit is optional.

11. Making turkey ham yourself – Step-By-Step Instructions

1. Put all the spices in a mortar and grind them.

2. Add the salt and cure to the spices and mix them well.

3. Put the water and all the spices in a saucepan. Bring it to a boil and let it sit for 30 minutes. Stir the brine well several times.

4. Filter the brine through a sieve and let it cool down.

5. Inject the brine into the ham with a syringe. You can stop as soon as you notice that the brine is running out more and more.

6. Put the ham together with the leftover brine into a resealable bag.

7. Squeeze as much air as possible out of the bag. Try not to squeeze the ham too much (otherwise the brine will leak out again). Close the bag once the air is out.

8. The ham must now be cured for about 3 days in the refrigerator. Important: Turn the ham once every day so that the brine can soak in from all sides and is well distributed.

9. After 3 days it is time to cook your turkey ham. Use the method that suits you best.

21. Sous Vide method: With a sous vide cooker your ham will take about 3 hours at 70 °C (158 °F). Your goal is to reach a core temperature of 67 to 70 °C (152.6 – 158 °F) maximum. Otherwise, the ham will become dry.

22. As an alternative to the sous vide cooker, you can use a pot with a ham press. To do this, transfer the ham from the bag into the device and press. Then place the ham press in a pot and bring to a boil. Then reduce the temperature to 80 °C (176 °F) and cook for about 2 hours.

23. Again your goal is also to achieve a core temperature of 67 to a maximum of 70 °C (152.6 – 158 °F).

24. Important: Measure the core and water temperature regularly. Nothing is more annoying than investing all the effort and not being able to enjoy a good product afterwards.

10. Once the ham is cooked and cooled down a bit, you can drain the liquid and put the ham in the fridge overnight.

11. The next day you can remove the leaked protein from the meat.

12. Your cooked turkey ham is ready 😄. Enjoy it.

28. What is the shelf life of turkey ham?

29. Your turkey cooked ham will keep covered in the refrigerator for about a week. The alternative is to vacuum pack the turkey cooked ham in portions. When vacuumed, it should keep in the refrigerator for 2-3 weeks. You can also freeze it. This increases the shelf life many times over.

Photos

Turkey Ham with Olives

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.madaxgroup.com/recipes
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 lb turkey breast

2 tsp sea salt

1 tsp beet powder

2 tsp basil

1/2 tsp white pepper

1 minced garlic clove

1 tsp vegan honee

1/2 cup turkey gelatin

1/2 cup green olives

Directions

1. Wash and cut turkey breast into square pieces 2. Mix seasonings with meat and water 3. Add olives and mix 4. Place into ham maker and close ham maker properly.

5. Marinate for 24-48 hours by keeping it in fridge 6. Place ham maker into a pot, pour water inside the pot. The amount of water supposed to be at the same level or higher than meat.

7. Cook for 2 hours in water temp 185 F (85 C) 8. Remove the ham maker from water, cool it in cold water and refrigerate for few hours or leave it for night.

9. Pour hot water for few second on ham maker chamber to remove meat easily.

ENJOY!!!

Photos

Turkey Meatloaf

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://recipes.anovaculinary.com/recipe/meatloaf-exp
Serving size: Ingredients for 1
Preparation time: 3 hours 15 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 T unsalted butter

Pinch of baking soda

1/2 onion, chopped fine

Salt and pepper

1 garlic clove, minced

1 t minced fresh thyme

2 T Worcestershire sauce

3 T quick Oats

2 t cornstarch

2 large egg yolks

2 T Dijon mustard

2 pounds 85% lean ground turkey

1 ounce grated Parmesan cheese

1/3 cup chopped fresh parsley

Directions

Step 1 Set your Anova Sous Vide Precision Cooker to 160.0°F / 71.1°C.

Step 2 Melt butter in a 10 inch skillet over low heat. Stir baking soda into melted butter. Add onion and 1/4 teaspoon salt

Step 3 Increase the heat to medium, and cook, stirring frequently until onion is softened and beginning to brown, 3 to 4 minutes.

Step 4

Add garlic and thyme and cook until

fragrant, about one minute.

Step 5

Stir in Worcestershire and continue to

cook until slightly reduced about one

minute longer

Step 6

Transfer onion mixture to a large bowl

and set aside.

Step 7

Combine oats, cornstarch, 3/4

teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon

pepper in a second bowl

Step 8

Stir egg yolks and mustard into the

cold onion mixture until well combined.

Step 9

Add turkey, Parmesan, parsley, and oat

mixture; using your hands, mix until

well combined.

Step 10

Transfer the turkey mixture into a bag

and shape into a cylinder. Remove air

by submerging into the water bath and

then seal the bag. Place into a second

bag with weights to keep the loaf from

floating and process for 2 1/2 hours.

Option 1

There are two options at this point:

1) use the juices and thicken it for

gravy and serve.. (it will have a buttery

mustard flavor)

2) Glaze and placed under broiler

for five or ten minutes, basting

intermittently

Option 2

Glaze recipe: mix 1 cup of ketchup, 1/4

cup of brown sugar, 2 1/2 teaspoons

of cider vinegar and a half a teaspoon

of hot sauce in a sauce pan. Whisk

and simmer over medium heat until it's

slightly thickened.

Photos

Turkey Pumpkin Chili

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://m.wholefoodsmarket.com/recipe/turkey-pumpkin-chili
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil

1 small yellow onion, chopped

1 green bell pepper, chopped

2 jalapeño peppers, seeded and finely chopped

2 cloves garlic, finely chopped

1 pound ground white or dark meat turkey

1 (14.5-ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained

1 (15-ounce) can pumpkin purée

1 tablespoon chili powder

1 teaspoon ground cumin

1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt

Ground black pepper, to taste

1 (15-ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained

Directions

1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, jalapeños and garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until tender, about 5 minutes. Add turkey and cook until browned. Add tomatoes, pumpkin, 1 cup water, chili powder, cumin, salt and pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and add beans. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes more. Ladle chili into bowls and serve.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 280
Total Fat: 13g
Saturated Fat: 2.5g
Cholesterol: 55mg
Sodium: 580mg
Total Carbohydrate: 23g
Sugars: 7g
Protein: 20g

Turkey Salami Recipe

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/44881/homemade-salami/
Serving size: 30
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour 30 mins

Ingredients

2 pounds ground turkey

1/4 teaspoon garlic powder

1/4 teaspoon onion powder

1/2 teaspoon mustard seed

2 tablespoons sugar-based curing mixture (such as Morton® Tender Quick®)

1 tablespoon coarsely ground white pepper

1 teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring

Directions

1. In a large bowl, mix together the ground turkey, garlic powder, onion powder, mustard seed, curing salt, white pepper and liquid smoke. Roll the mixture into a 2 inch diameter log, and wrap tightly in aluminum foil. Refrigerate for 24 hours.

2. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Make a few slits in the bottom of the roll to allow the fat to drain when cooking. Place roll onto a broiler pan, and fill the bottom part of the pan with about 1 inch of water to keep the salami moist.

3. Bake for 90 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from pan and cool completely before unwrapping the salami. Slice and eat as lunch meat, or serve on a tray with crackers and cheese.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 96
Total Fat: 8.2g
Cholesterol: 26mg
Sodium: 486mg
Total Carbohydrate: 0.2g
Protein: 5.1g

Photos

Turkey Sous Vide

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 Turkey, whole fresh

4 ounces poultry herbed infused clarified butter

Sea Salt, a few tbsp, as needed

1 onion

2 carrots

2 stalks of celery

Directions

THANKSGIVING EVE

Morning:

Set sous vide tool to 150 °F / 66 °C.

Make stock in Emeril Lagasse Pressure Air Fryer with vegetables and turkey parts not bagged.

Break down turkey into four pieces: two breasts (boneless breast with drumette) and two legs (thigh and drumstick together).

Bag turkey parts in four bags with 1 ounce infused clarified butter, vacuum seal and store white meat in refrigerator, begin cooking dark meat:

151 °F / 66 °C. - 6 hours

Adjust sous vide temperature to 144 °F / 55 °C. 4 hours

Add breasts to the water with the legs.

THANKSGIVING DAY

Twenty minutes before the feast:

Remove turkey from bags and pat dry.

Set oven to broil.

Make gravy from bagged juices and stock as required.

Broil turkey.

Portion, plate, and serve.

Photos

Turkey Tenderloin Sous Vide

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.letstalkbbq.com/index.php?topic=10963.0
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Turkey Tenderloin

Olive oil

Ghee

Directions

Sous Vide:

144° 4 HR

Sear

Turmeric Juice Pulp Crackers

Courses: Snack
Categories:
Collections:
Source: http://reclaimingyesterday.com/turmeric-juice-pulp-crackers-with-roasted-beet-and-sunchoke-dip/
Serving size: Makes about 50 small crackers
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1.5 cups juice pulp

2.5 tablespoons tahini

1 teaspoon ground turmeric

1 tablespoon flax seeds

1 tablespoon nutritional yeast or grated parmesan (optional)

1 clove garlic, minced

1/2 teaspoon sea salt

drizzle of olive oil

water (enough to thin the dough out)

Directions

1. Heat oven to 350.

2. Add the juice pulp to a food process and pulse until smooth.

3. Add the remaining cracker ingredients and process until smooth, adding water as needed. Taste and adjust seasoning to your preference. You should have a "dough" that you can form into a ball.

4. Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper and spread pulp mixture evenly, forming a rectangle. I like to spread it out with my hands, then cover with another sheet of parchment paper, and press down on the top with a smaller baking sheet to get an even distribution. You want the cracker to be quite thin. Make scores in cracker dough with a pizza cutter or knife.

5. Add crackers to oven and bake for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, remove the baking sheet, take the parchment paper by both ends and transfer directly to the oven rack. This allows crackers to crisp up on the bottom. Bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, checking every 5 minutes.

6. Remove crackers from oven when they begin to brown and feel cooked through. Break or cut into individual crackers and serve with your favorite dip.

Photos

Two-Ingredient Biscuits

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://ourbestbites.com/2-ingredient-biscuits/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

6 ounces (by weight) flour (1 1/2 cups)

Cream of tartar & baking soda

6 ounces (by weight) ricotta (3/4 cup)

1/4 teaspoon salt

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.

2. Place all ingredients in a bowl and gently mix with a fork until combined. If dough doesn’t combine, very slowly drizzle in just a bit of extra cream until it comes together.

3. Spoon or use a cookie scoop to drop rounds onto baking sheet, 2-3 inches apart, or alternately you can pat/roll the dough out and then use a biscuit cutter.

4. Brush the tops of biscuits lightly with cream, milk, or water.

5. Bake for about 10 minutes or until puffed and golden.

6. Yields 8-12 biscuits depending on size.

Photos

Tzatziki Dip With Quark

Courses:
Categories: 05 🐄
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

250g tub Quark

Clove of garlic

Cucumber

Directions

Step 1

Crush and chop a clove of garlic.

Step 2

Peel and half a cucumber and use a small teaspoon to remove the seeds from the middle. Grate the cucumber on a course grater. Salt the cucumber and set aside for 5 minutes and drain well.

Mix everything into quark.

Step 3

Season with salt and serve.

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 cups Greek yogurt

1 large cucumber

4 cloves garlic pressed into paste

1/2 Lemon

3 tbsp chopped dill

sea salt

Directions

Peel and grate cucumbers sprinkle of salt set aside for 5 minutes.

Remove excess moisture from cucumbers.

Add remaining ingredients. Mix well.

Unbelievably Moist Turkey Meatloaf Recipe

Courses: Entree
Categories: 02 🐔
Collections:
Source: https://www.inspiredtaste.net/21535/unbelievably-moist-turkey-meatloaf-recipe/
Serving size: Makes 6 Servings
Preparation time: 35 mins
Cooking time: 55 mins

Ingredients

8 ounces mushrooms, trimmed and very finely chopped

1 medium onion, peeled and finely chopped

2 garlic cloves, peeled and minced

1 tablespoon oil

1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt

1/2 cup ketchup

1 cup Rice crumbs

2 large eggs, lightly beaten

1 pound ground turkey (92% lean)

Directions

1. Heat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Lightly oil a rimmed baking sheet (or 9-inch by 13-inch baking pan) lined with aluminum foil.

2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened; about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the mushrooms, a 1/2-teaspoon of salt, and a 1/4-teaspoon of pepper. Cook until the mushrooms give off their liquid and it boils away; about 10 minutes.

3. Transfer the onions and mushrooms to a large bowl, and then stir in the Worcestershire sauce and 3 tablespoons of the ketchup. Set aside to cool for 5 minutes.

4. Meanwhile, combine the breadcrumbs and milk in a small bowl. Stir the breadcrumb mixture and the eggs into the mushrooms and onions. Using a fork or your hands, gently mix in the turkey, a 1/2-teaspoon of salt and a 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. The mixture will be very wet.

5. Form the meatloaf into a 9-inch by 5-inch oval in the middle of the prepared baking sheet. Spread the remaining 4 tablespoons of ketchup on top.

6. Bake the meatloaf until an instant read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meatloaf registers 170 degrees F, about 50 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before slicing.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 slice
Calories: 332
Total Fat: 17g
Saturated Fat: 4g
Cholesterol: 132mg
Total Carbohydrate: 23g
Dietary Fiber: 2g
Sugars: 8g
Protein: 23g

Photos

Un-Tomato Ketchup

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://recipeland.com/recipe/v/un-tomato-ketchup-13110

1/4 cup lemon juice

1/4 TSP onion powder

1/8 oregano

Directions

1. Blend all ingredients until smooth. Keep in the refrigerator.

Vanilla Oatmeal Ice Cream

Courses: Dessert
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.feastingonfruit.com/vanilla-oatmeal-ice-cream/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 cups light canned coconut milk (*see notes for substitution)

1 1/2 cups rolled oats (or quick oats work too)

10 pitted medjool dates

1 tsp vanilla extract

Pinch of sea salt

*You can use almond milk or other non-dairy milks, but the texture will not be as rich. 

Directions

1. Blend all the ingredients thoroughly on high until creamy and smooth (a full 45-60 seconds).

2. Pour into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions until it is a soft serve consistency. Mine took about 40 minutes.

3. Transfer to a shallow container and freeze for 1-2 hours.

4. Scoop into a bowl, add toppings if desired, and enjoy.

5. It will last a few days in the freezer, just remove from the freezer and allow to soften for approximately 15 minutes before serving.

Photos

Vegan "Turkey" Broth

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.vegankitchenmagick.com/vegan-turkey-broth/
Serving size: 12 cups
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 2 hours 30 mins

Ingredients

64 g (4 TBS) White Miso Paste

64 g (4 TBS) Tahini

45 g (3 TBS) Reduced Sodium Tamari

30 g (2 TBS) White Wine Vinegar

15 g (1 TBS) Balsamic Vinegar

7.5 g (1 1/2 tsp) Vegan Worcestershire Sauce

24 g (2 TBS) Magickal Seasoning Blend

56 g (6 TBS) Magickal Broth Powder

1.5 g (1 1/2 tsp) Poultry Seasoning

1 gallon Water

2 medium Onions

2 stalks Celery

2 medium Carrots

1 small Tomato

8 oz Mushrooms

Directions

1. Add the miso, tahini, vegan Worcestershire, balsamic vinegar, white wine vinegar, and Tamari to a large soup pot. Mix well, then add about two cups of water and mix again.

2. Add the Magickal Seasoning Blend (original or low sodium), the Magickal Broth Powder (original or low sodium), and the poultry seasoning. Mix well to combine, then stir in the rest of the water.

3. Place the pot on a burner or induction cooktop over medium-high heat.

4. Chop the vegetables and add them to the pot. Stir, then bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for two hours. Leave the pot uncovered and stir every 20 minutes or so.

5. Let the broth cool to lukewarm or chill it overnight. 

6. Place a strainer in a large bowl, line the strainer with 4 to 6 layers of cheesecloth, and tuck the edges under the strainer.

7. Use a slotted spoon to transfer half of the vegetables to the lined strainer. Gather up the edges of the cheesecloth and twist the top. Squeeze out as much broth as you can and pour it back into the pot. Remove the squeezed-out vegetables from the cheesecloth and repeat with the rest of the vegetables.

8. Discard the vegetables, then pour all of the broth into the big bowl.

9. Place the lined strainer in the pot, being sure to tuck the edges of the cheesecloth under the strainer again. Pour as much of the broth as fits easily into the lined strainer. You will need to stir it to get the broth to drain through the cheesecloth. Keep adding more broth as it fits until all the broth has been strained.

10. Get three quart-sized containers ready. Place one container on your scale and zero it. Fill all three containers equally. Place each container back on the scale and add water until there are 960 grams (4 cups) in each one. If you do not have a scale, you will have to measure instead and you want to end up with 12 cups total.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 60

Photos

Vegan Almond Butter Brownies

Courses: Dessert
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.simplyquinoa.com/easy-almond-butter-brownies/
Serving size: 16 squares
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1/4 cup ghee softened

3/4 cup creamy almond butter

3/4 cup Date sugar

2 flax eggs ((2 tbsp flaxseed meal + 5 tbsp water))

1 tablespoon almond milk

1 teaspoon vanilla extract

2/3 cup toasted quinoa flour

1/3 cup cacao powder

2 teaspoon baking powder

Pinch of sea salt

1 cup dairy-free chocolate chips

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 x 8 baking pan with parchment and set aside.

2. Beat together coconut oil and almond butter until creamy. Add sugar, vanilla, flax eggs, and almond milk, and beat until combined.

3. Whisk together dry ingredients and add to wet, mixing until incorporated. Fold in chocolate chips.

4. Transfer batter to the prepared baking pan and bake on the center rack for 22 - 25 minutes.

5. Let cool in pan completely before cutting into squares.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 212
Total Fat: 14g
Saturated Fat: 5g
Sodium: 19mg
Total Carbohydrate: 20g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 10g
Protein: 4g

Photos

Vegan Beet Burgers

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://itdoesnttastelikechicken.com/vegan-beet-burgers/
Serving size: 4 Burgers
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

2 cups grated raw peeled beets ((about 2 medium beets))

3/4 cup large flake rolled oats

1/2 cup cooked lentils ((I used canned))

1/2 cup brown rice flour

1/2 yellow onion (, finely chopped)

2 cloves garlic (, finely minced)

1 tablespoon natural peanut butter

2 teaspoons dried thyme leaves

1/2 teaspoon sea salt

1/4 teaspoon white pepper

Directions

1. If you have a grater attachment for your food processor you can use it to grate the beets directly into the processor. If not grate beets with the grater you have, then add the beets, along with all of the remaining ingredients to the food processor. Pulse, stopping to scrape the sides, until the mixture comes together.

2. Form into 4 patties. The patty mixture will be very sticky, so wet your hands in between forming each patty, to help stop the sticking.

3. To fry the patties (my fave):

4. Heat enough oil to cover the bottom of a large skillet over medium heat. When hot, add the patties. Cooking them low and slow is the key for good texture. Cook about 3 to 5 minutes per side, until they are nicely browned on both sides and hold together well. Serve hot on a bun with your favourite burger toppings.

5. To bake the patties:

6. Preheat your oven to 350F (180C). Lightly grease a baking sheet or line it with parchment paper.

7. Lay the patties out in a single layer with room around them for air to circulate. Bake 30 to 35 minutes, flipping halfway through until firmed up and lightly brown on both sides. Serve hot on a bun with your favourite burger toppings.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 burger patty (recipe makes 4)
Calories: 205
Total Fat: 3g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 365mg
Total Carbohydrate: 37g
Dietary Fiber: 6g
Sugars: 6g
Protein: 8g

Photos

Vegan Blue Cheese Dressing

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://lovingitvegan.com/vegan-blue-cheese-dressing/
Serving size: ~2 cups
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1 cup (240g) Vegan Mayonnaise

1 Tbsp Dijon Mustard

1 tsp Crushed Garlic

2 Tbsp Tahini

1 Tbsp White Vinegar

2 Tbsp Lemon Juice

1 Tbsp Maple Syrup

1/4 cup (15g) Nutritional Yeast

1 tsp Onion Powder

1/2 tsp Garlic Powder

1 tsp sea salt

1/2 tsp Dried Dill

2oz (56g) Extra Firm Tofu (Crumbled)*

Directions

1. Add the vegan mayonnaise, dijon mustard, crushed garlic, tahini, white vinegar, lemon juice, maple syrup, nutritional yeast, onion powder, garlic powder, salt and dried dill. Whisk up with a hand whisk until smooth.

2. Then crumble up the tofu with a fork and then add it in, folding it gently into the dressing.

3. Serve as a dip for raw veggies or as a salad dressing.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1/4 cup
Calories: 202
Total Fat: 19.3g
Saturated Fat: 1.5g
Sodium: 465mg
Total Carbohydrate: 3.5g
Dietary Fiber: 0.6g
Sugars: 3.5g
Protein: 2.2g

Photos

Vegan Condensed Milk

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://makeitdairyfree.com/vegan-condensed-milk/
Serving size: 16 1 tbsp servings
Preparation time:
Cooking time: 1 hour

Ingredients

1 can unsweetened full fat coconut milk ((or 2 cups any dairy free milk))

3/4 cup vegan sugar ((increase to 1 cup for non-coconut version *See post))

Directions

1. Add the sugar to a sauce pan. Shake to evenly level the sugar.

2. Add in the coconut milk (*See post for other dairy free milk alternatives)

3. Turn on the heat to medium low, stirring periodically until the sugar is dissolved.

4. Once sugar is dissolved, turn heat down to simmer. YOU DO NOT WANT ROLLING BOIL - SEE VIDEO FOR VISUAL.

5. Let cook on simmer until mixture in reduced in half, stirring every few minutes.

6. Remove any foam or sugar crystals from the top if desired.

7. Reductions takes approximately 55-75 minutes.

8. Once ready let cool completely and place in an air tight container in the fridge. Will thicken more as it cools. Stores in fridge for at least 2 weeks.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 tbsp
Calories: 78
Total Fat: 5g
Saturated Fat: 5g
Sodium: 3mg
Total Carbohydrate: 10g
Sugars: 9g
Protein: 1g

Photos

Vegan Japanese Curry

Courses: Entree
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.veganricha.com/2018/04/vegan-japanese-curry-in-instant-pot.html
Serving size: 1
Preparation time: 10 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1/2 tsp oil (divided)

1/8 onion (thinly sliced)

1 cloves of garlic (finely chopped, or 3/4 tsp minced)

3/4 tsp finely chopped ginger

3/4 tsp rice flour

3/4 tsp garam masala

1/4 tsp turmeric

1.25 cup frozen California blend and peas

1/4 tsp tamari

1/2 cup water

3/4 tsp salt

1 tbsp applesauce (or grated apple)

scallions (pickled radish, pickled ginger and rice for serving)

Directions

1. Put the Instant pot on Saute. Add oil, when the oil is hot, add onion and pinch of salt and cook until translucent.

2. Add the garlic and ginger and mix in. Cook for half a minute.

3. Move the onions to the side. Add 1 tsp more oil to the pot, add the flour and mix into the oil. Then mix with the onion, ginger, garlic and cook for half a minute stirring frequently as the flour will tend to stick and burn if left too long. Add the spices and mix them in. 

4. Add the veggies, sauces, salt and water. Mix really well to pick up the roasted flour from the bottom, so that none of the flour is sticking. Cancel Saute

5. Close the lid (sealing). Pressure Cook for 6 to 7 minutes (manual hi). (a minute longer if your veggies are chopped larger). Once the time is up. Click cancel and Let the pressure release naturally. 

6. Open the lid. Put the pot on saute, add the applesauce and peas and bring to a boil. Taste and adjust salt, spice and flavor carefully. Add more spices to taste.  Serve with rice and garnished with sesame seeds, pickled radish/ginger and scallions.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 209
Total Fat: 5g
Sodium: 592mg
Total Carbohydrate: 33g
Dietary Fiber: 9g
Sugars: 4g
Protein: 9g

Photos

Vegan Lasagna with Nooch Cheese

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.elephantasticvegan.com/lasagne-w-nooch-cheese/
Serving size: 4 people
Preparation time: 25 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour 5 mins

Ingredients

3 carrots

1 onion

3 garlic cloves

1 cup soy granule ((TVP))

1/3 cup water

1 teaspoon liquid smoke

1/4 teaspoon salt + 1 teaspoon salt

1/2 teaspoon paprika powder

1/4 teaspoon garlic powder

1 tablespoon olive oil

3 cups tomato purée*

1 tablespoon dried oregano

12 sheets oven-ready lasagna sheets

1 portion homemade nooch cheese

Directions

1. Preheat oven to 400°F/200°C.

2. Put the peeled carrots, onion and garlic cloves in a food processor and chop until small.

3. In a large pot on medium-high heat put in the soy granule and add the water. When the soy granule is soft, add the liquid smoke, 1/4 teaspoon salt, the paprika powder and garlic powder. Give it a good mix.

4. Make room in the pot, add a tablespoon of olive oil and add in the carrot-onion-garlic-mixture. When the onions are cooked through, add the tomato purée, 1 teaspoon of salt (use less if you're using pre-seasoned tomato purée) and the dried oregano. You can add more spices to taste. Let the sauce cook for about 5 minutes until hot.

5. In the meanwhile, you can prepare the vegan cheese sauce.

6. When the sauce is ready you can start by putting a layer of sauce in the baking dish, then add a layer of lasagne noodles, then the sauce again, repeat until the baking dish is full. The layer on the top should be sauce. Add the nutritional yeast cheese on top of it and spread it until the whole top is covered with cheese sauce.

7. Bake the lasagna in the oven for about 30-45 minutes, until the cheese sauce is golden/brown.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 464
Total Fat: 34g
Saturated Fat: 8g
Sodium: 251mg
Total Carbohydrate: 149g
Dietary Fiber: 38g
Sugars: 45g
Protein: 15g

Photos

Vegan Mushroom Barley Risotto in a Pressure Cooker

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://holycowvegan.net/mushroom-barley-risotto-pressure-cooker/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 25 mins

Ingredients

1 cup dried mushrooms ((like shiitake or oyster. Soaked in 2 cups boiling water for 30 minutes, then sliced. Reserve the stock))

2 cups cremini mushrooms (sliced)

1 cup pearl barley

1 1/2 tbsp vegetable oil

1 medium yellow onion (finely chopped)

2 cloves garlic (minced)

3 cups vegetable stock

1/4 cup white wine

1 tbsp thyme ((1 tsp if using dry))

1/2 tbsp rosemary ((or 1 tsp dry))

Salt and ground black pepper to taste

1/4 cup parsley ((chopped))

1/2 cup raw cashews ((blended into a smooth paste with 1/2 cup water or vegetable stock))

Directions

1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pressure cooker.

2. Add the onions and garlic, season with some salt and pepper, and cook 3-5 minutes over a medium flame until the onions start to sweat.

3. Add the thyme, rosemary, and the soaked dry mushrooms. Add the wine and saute until all of the liquid has evaporated.

4. Add the barley, stir it in, and then add the vegetable stock and the reserved mushroom stock (be sure not to add any grit that may have settled at the bottom of the mushroom stock). Season with more salt and ground black pepper.

5. Click the pressure cooker lid in place, bring the cooker to pressure over high heat, then turn the heat down to a point where it will maintain the pressure at high, and let it go for 18 more minutes.

6. While the risotto is cooking, heat the remaining 1/2 tbsp of oil and add the sliced cremini mushrooms to it. Season with salt and pepper. Saute, stirring, until all of the liquid has evaporated and the mushrooms have caramelized. Turn off heat.

7. When the pressure has released (you can do this by releasing the pressure manually per your cooker directions. I usually just prefer to wait until the pressure has released on its own), open the lid and stir in the cremini mushrooms, cashew paste and parsley. Season with more salt at this point if needed.

8. Serve hot.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 376
Total Fat: 13g
Saturated Fat: 6g
Total Carbohydrate: 57g
Dietary Fiber: 10g
Sugars: 5g
Protein: 10g

Photos

Vegan Nacho Cheese Sauce - Cheddar Style

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://thehiddenveggies.com/vegan-nacho-cheese-sauce-cheddar-style/#wprm-recipe-container-5601
Serving size: 8
Preparation time: 2 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1 tsp white miso

2 tbsp warm water

1 1/2 cup soy milk (cold) (or any other plant based milk)

1/3 cup nutritional yeast

1 tbsp arrowroot

1 tbsp tapioca starch

1 tsp salt

1 dash turmeric

Directions

1. Mix together miso with a small amount of water and set aside.

2. Add 1 ½ cups of cold plant base milk to a saucepan.

3. Put in the starches, nutritional yeast, salt, and turmeric and stir well with a whisk.

4. Turn on the heat to medium and stir constantly while heating.

5. After a few minutes (once your sauce starts to boil) it will thicken very quickly.

6. Allow it to boil for about 30 seconds and then remove from heat.

7. Pour in your miso mixture and stir until smooth.

8. Serve warm over broccoli, potatoes, or nachos!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 0.25 cup
Calories: 36
Total Fat: 1g
Sodium: 341mg
Total Carbohydrate: 4g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 2g

Photos

Vegan Queso Fresco (crumble-style cheese)

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://myquietkitchen.com/almond-queso-blanco/
Serving size: 6 servings
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 5 mins

Ingredients

1 cup raw slivered almonds (skin-free), soaked overnight or quick-soaked in hot water for 1 hour

1 Tbsp lemon juice

3/4 tsp salt

2 tsp nutritional yeast

1/2 cup water

1 tsp agar powder

Directions

1. Drain the soaked almonds. Place in a food processor with the lemon juice, salt, nutritional yeast, and water. Process until light and fluffy, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed. It's okay to maintain a small amount of almond texture. Add the agar powder to the processor and pulse several times to incorporate.

2. Transfer the mixture to a small sauce pan. Cook over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes, whisking or stirring constantly. When you see some bubbling and know the mixture has reached boiling temperature, remove from heat and pour into ramekins or a small bowl. Refrigerate until ready to use. It will be set and ready to use in about 30 minutes.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 115
Total Fat: 10g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 290mg
Total Carbohydrate: 5g
Dietary Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 1g
Protein: 5g

Photos

Vegan Raw Almond Milk Yogurt

Courses: Side Dish
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://www.culturesforhealth.com/learn/recipe/yogurt-recipes/vegan-raw-almond-milk-yogurt/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

3 1/2 - 4 cups Homemade Raw Almond Milk

2 tsp. Pomona’s pectin powder*

2 tsp. Pomona’s calcium water*, prepared according to package directions

1 package Vegan Yogurt Starter

Directions

1. Measure 1 cup of almond milk and add pectin powder. Blend in blender until well combined. Set aside.

2. In a saucepan, slowly heat the remaining almond milk, with the calcium water added, to 140ºF .

3. Add reserved almond milk/pectin mixture. Return to 140ºF. Remove from heat.

4. Cool to 110ºF. Sprinkle vegan yogurt starter over the milk and stir well.

5. Pour into a clean 1-quart glass jar and cover with a coffee filter, secured with a rubber band, or pour into yogurt maker container and follow manufacturer's instructions for covering the containers.

6. Incubate for 6-8 hours at 105º-112ºF in a yogurt maker or similar appliance. The longer the yogurt incubates, the tangier it will be.

7. Shake or stir and refrigerate. Yogurt will not thicken until after refrigeration time. Thickening may take up to 24 hours.

Photos

Vegan Rice Paper Bacon

Courses: Breakfast
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://yupitsvegan.com/vegan-rice-paper-bacon/
Serving size: 36 strips
Preparation time: 30 mins
Cooking time: 10 mins

Ingredients

rice paper ((there should be enough marinade to make 8 sheets of rice paper's worth of rice paper bacon, possibly more))

2 tablespoons neutral oil

3 tablespoons tamari

3 tablespoons nutritional yeast

1/2 teaspoon liquid smoke

1/2 tablespoon maple syrup

pinch of beet root powder

Directions

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. (See notes for microwave instructions)

2. Whisk together all of the ingredients for the marinade in a wide bowl until the nutritional yeast is incorporated well; prepare a second wide bowl filled partway with water.

3. Prepare a metal, oven-safe rack with a sheet of parchment paper. (Skip this if microwaving).

4. Cut rice paper into thick strips, or to the size that you want. Note that the strips will shrink in size a little bit when cooking. Some brands of rice paper will crack a little bit when you cut them; Use a large, very sharp knife to minimize this.

5. Take two strips and stack them. Holding them together, dip them very quickly into the water. (UPDATE: if you have kitchen scissors, try dipping 2 whole rice paper sheets stacked together into the water, then cutting them into strips instead. I don't recommend cutting wet rice paper with a knife, it's not as easy as it seems). They should then start to stick together on their own. Gently squeeze excess water from the fused pair of rice paper strips.

6. Dip the fused pair of rice paper strips into the marinade and coat it fairly generously; place it onto the parchment paper.

7. Repeat with additional rice paper/rice paper strips until the rack is filled. NB: Periodically stop to whisk the marinade again and re-emulsify it; the oil will start to separate over time.

8. Bake for about 7 to 9 minutes, or until crisp. If your oven has hot spots, rotate the tray partway through. The strips can burn easily, so keep an eye on it and take them out as soon as they're done. The end result will be mostly crispy with some slightly chewy parts. :)

9. Once fully cooled, store leftover rice paper bacon in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days. It will stay pretty crispy. But it probably won't survive 3 days without being eaten :)

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 9 strips
Calories: 114
Total Fat: 7g
Saturated Fat: 1g
Sodium: 473mg
Total Carbohydrate: 7g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 2g
Protein: 5g

Photos

Vegan Split Pea Soup with Turmeric

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source:
Serving size: Serves 1
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time: 1 hour 30 mins

Ingredients

1/2 cup yellow split peas

1/2 cup mire poix

1/3 teaspoons fine sea salt

1/4 teaspoon dried thyme

1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric

1 bay leaves

1 1/3 cups good vegetable stock or water* (start with 1 1/3 and more toward the end of cooking if you like)

Chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, for garnish, optional

Directions

1. Rinse the split peas until the water runs clear. Place all ingredients in a large pot. Bring to a boil over high heat, then cover and simmer for about an hour and a half, until split peas are tender. That's it!

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 329
Total Fat: 1.1g
Total Carbohydrate: 61.9g
Dietary Fiber: 22.4g
Protein: 20.2g

Vegan Walnut Parmesan

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source: https://thevietvegan.com/vegan-walnut-parmesan/
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

1/2 cup walnuts (raw, unsalted)

1 Tbsp (15 mL) nutritional yeast

1 tsp (5 mL) toasted sesame oil (or olive oil)

a dash of sea salt

Directions

1. In a food processor, blitz the walnuts until it's like a chunky flour. Add nutritional yeast, oil, and salt, and blitz until evenly incorporated. Sprinkle on pasta, soup, salad, or even on your popcorn!

2. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a week.

Photos

Vegan White Bean Soup

Courses: Entree
Categories: 09 🥕
Collections:
Source: https://healthiersteps.com/recipe/vegan-white-bean-soup/
Serving size: 4 servings
Preparation time: 15 mins
Cooking time: 30 mins

Ingredients

4 cups white beans cooked or 8 oz dried (use Navy, Lima, Cannellini, Great Northern)

2 cups vegetable broth or water

1 medium onion chopped

2 cloves garlic chopped

1 medium potato diced

1 medium carrot diced

1 teaspoon dried marjoram

1/2 teaspoon ground paprika

2 tablespoons almond milk

1 teaspoon dried parsley flakes or 2 teaspoon fresh leaves chopped

1/2 teaspoon dried thyme or 1 sprig of fresh

Pinch ground allspice

1 1/2 teaspoon salt or to taste

Pinch Cayenne pepper

1 bay leaf

1 tablespoon nutritional yeast flakes

Directions

1. If you are using dried beans, prepare 8 oz of dried beans by sorting and washing. Soak in water to cover for 8 hours or overnight. The following day, drain and rinse beans and cook in water until tender.

2. Place beans, water, onion, garlic, potato, carrot, marjoram, paprika, almond milk, parsley, thyme, allspice, salt, cayenne pepper, bay leaf in a large pot. Bring to a boil, and reduce to simmer for 30 minutes or until desired thickness is reached. Add yeast flakes, check seasoning and serve immediately.

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Calories: 150
Total Fat: 2g
Saturated Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 0mg
Sodium: 0mg
Total Carbohydrate: 27g
Sugars: 0g
Protein: 7g

Photos

Vegetable Broth Dry Mix Recipe

Courses:
Categories: 11 🥵
Collections:
Source: https://redandhoney.com/homemade-vegetable-broth-dry-mix/
Serving size: 1 cups
Preparation time: 5 mins
Cooking time:

Ingredients

2 2/3 TBSP dehydrated onion

2 2/3 TBSP dehydrated Carrot

2 2/3 TBSP dehydrated celery

½ cup nutritional yeast

3 tablespoons onion powder

1 tablespoon garlic powder

1 tablespoon sea salt

1 teaspoon parsley

½ teaspoon turmeric

1/8 tsp beet powder

Directions

1. Add all ingredients into a food processor, blender, or spice grinder.

2. Grind until combine.

3. Store the dry mix in a sealed jar or other container for future use.

4. To use, add 1-3 teaspoons (to your taste) of the Vegetable Broth Dry Mix per 1 cup of water.

Notes

for 1 TBSP USE:

1/2 TSP dehydrated onion

1/2 TSP dehydrated Carrot

1/2 TSP dehydrated celery

1 1/2 TSP nutritional yeast

1/2 TSP onion powder

1/4 TSP garlic powder

1/4 TSP sea salt

1/4 TSP parsley

1/8 TSP turmeric

1/8 TSP beet powder

Nutrition

Amount per serving
Serving size: 1 serving
Calories: 195
Total Fat: 1g
Sodium: 4669mg

Sugars: 8g
